  3568. The end result is such a close shave that, when I run my hand accross my face, I rarely feel any stubble which is quite common with even the most popular of electric shavers.
  3569. Overall, I am well pleased with this shaver and highly recommend it.
  3570. It is a major improvement over what I have used in the past giving me a good clean shave.
  3571. So the Pulsonic is the winner and even though this shaver is expensive, I was happy to pay the money for its superior performance to the other shavers.
  3572. That being said, the LED read out is nice, the ability to easily clean the shaver makes me do it after every use, which makes it a better shaving experience versus the other electric shavers I've had in the past.
  3573. Its recharging and cleaning dock leaves the shaver smelling fresh and feeling new.
  3574. shaving right handed, as I normally do, is a challenge for the razor.

  6623. Very little need to go over same area repeatedly, like in past with other shavers.

All Reviews

  1. I had been shaving with Norelco rotary razors for the past 10+ years and always bought the latest \\"top of line\\" model. I had been enticed by the amazing reviews for this Braun for the past 6 months and finally pulled the trigger to order it. Been using it now for the past 3 weeks and must say I regret waiting so long....even with the steep price tag! Where this razor really shines is the absolute lack of skin irritation. I have sensitive skin and with the Norelco's I would only shave mon-fri mornings before work. Never shaved on weekends or touched the 5 o'clock shadow for fear of redness and pain. However with the Braun I can now shave in morning, night, and weekends without a problem! Like others have said it can also easily handle 4-5 days growth without a problem (and I have think dark hair). In terms of shaving closeness, the Bruan provides a closer shave on the face without question. On my neck, I would rate it about the same closeness as the Norelco (but no pulling or redness!) I don't find this razor louder then the Norelco models as others have mentioned. It does have to be cleaned more frequently, but this is an acceptable compromise for the results. If you have sensitive skin, or are up in the air about this product, just buy it! You will not be sorry.
  2. Excellent shaver. My last shaver was a triple-head, that shaved it's last shave. I was just looking for the best shaving, most reliable, durable shaver. This one shaves very close, but still requires multiple passes and more multiple passes to get all the whiskers. The cleaning container is larger than I would have liked: It requires space on a counter near an outlet. At least one of the modes is has a rather loud re-occurring noise in the cleaning process, but it negates the need for manual cleaning. I'm very happy so far.
  3. It is an excellent shaver and good value for its price. I was using Panasonic 8047 before this but this a class above. Only problem is its refill cartridge which can't be shipped by air being \\"inflammable\\".
  4. I upgraded from a 9000 series and was blown away by how smooth it feels when shaving. My previous one felt pretty rough. I don't notice that it shaves any closer really, but it just feels nicer when I shave and that's good enough for me. My one gripe with it is that the flip out cutter is smaller and not as good as the 9000 series shaver. I use it a lot when I just want to trim my facial hair rather than shave it all off.
  5. I like the way this razor works on most of my face. It is also a comfortable shave. My problem is that I have a very hard time getting all the hairs on my face and especially on my neck. I actually use the Series 7 first then quickly go over my face and neck one more time with my rotary razor so I can get all the hairs I missed with the Series 7. The cleaning / charging function of the razor is great. It is loud but I start the cleaning on my way out the door so it doesn't bother me.
  6. Perfect in every way! I cannot say anything bad about this shaver! Simply perfect.
  7. I have been using Braun shavers for the past 10 years, and every time they come up with a new series, I am usually skeptical on how much improvement one would get in shaving performance for shelling out money for a new shaver. This time, however, I was pleasantly surprised. This shaver is definitely a notch above my previous 8995 version. They have re-designed the shaver head, which gives a closer shave, and the battery lasts longer as well. The only downside to Braun shavers is that they sell their proprietary cleaning solution at ridiculous margins(much like how the printer manufacturers sell you their proprietary Ink cartridges).
  8. I've been using electric shavers for nearly 20 years, and this is the best one I've ever purchased. It is very comfortable, both during and after shaving. It shaves quickly and closely without any mess. I like everything about this product so far, and would recommend it to anyone who's looking for a great electric shaver. It is pricey, but this is an example of getting what you pay for.
  9. I have the 9595 Pulsonic model for more than a year. I may have rushed too early to buy it, and the design flaws I see may have been fixed by now... I have been using Braun shavers for over 30 years, so my experience with this one is terribly disappointing. Here are the design flaws I see: * The contacts at the back do not make good contact with the charging/cleaning base. When the shaver starts the cleaning cycle, quite often the contacts separate, and both cleaning and charging stop in the middle, leaving the shaver soaked in the cleaning fluid. * The beard trimmer simply fell off after about 5 months. * There is a bad contact inside the shaver that randomly stops it in mid shave. This never manifests itself when I take it to the lab (of course...) I think that the engine is simply too powerful for the rest of the shaver and base. The shaver shaves well, but is hard to clean without the base, and the base is just plain bad design. I'm really at a loss what shaver to get now. Is this model indicative of the quality level of Braun shavers these days?
  10. I have had the old Braun Flex shaver for years and wanted to update. On a recent trip to Germany, I thought I'd get one there. NOT ! The Euro stopped that very quickly. At approx. $1.50 per Euro, and the price there being E 300 (that's about $450), I passed on that option immediately. Bought it on Amazon for $220. The only thing more satisfying than getting my Braun Pulsonic at half the price....is that it is everthing I expected and more. A smooth, close shave and a cleaning system which leaves me \\"ready to go\\" anytime I need to shave. Execellent.....
  11. This is without question the best shaver providing the best shave I have experienced. I had a top of the line Braun shaver for 10 years which just stopped working. I was somewhat skeptical of the reviews for this shaver but it has performed as the best reviews have suggested. You won't be dissappointed. Amazon was the best price found for this product...I saved over $50 off compared with our local WalMarts store.
  12. Been a electric razor user for 12 years.. I typically change shaver once in 4 years. My first one was a braun foil. Liked it. My next one was a Norelco rotary top end model..Liked it and swore would never go to foil again.. But as I was looking at upgrading to norelco aztec, i saw these piled up positive reviews on amazon for this foil razor.. Then I did my research and said i would give it a try. I must say this pulsonic shaver got converted me to foil once again.. awesome performance.. Far exceeded my expectations.. I thought that auto-cleaning stuff was unnecessary as i was used to tap cleaing. But now i am addicted to it..If i want to nitpick on one, that would be the travel case.. looks cheap. But that is not the important point here. Hey, I wanted a good shaver for the price - Braun delivered it, making my daily shaving chore a pleasure..thanks..
  13. I have had the Braun 790 for about a month now and I am extremely happy with my daily shave. No, I don't work for the company just a happy user. I have been using an electric razor for about 15 years. Norelco has been my brand of choice and have had ok results but needed to skip every couple of days or my face would be sore. So decided I would try another brand this time. Based on the reviews selected the Braun. Can't speak about the newer Norelcos they may give just as good a shave but Consumer Reports magazine and the various comments rated this one highly. What do I like? -the closest shave I have ever gotten from an electric razor -close shave every time whether I wash my face first or use the razor first as the company suggest -no sore neck or face using it daily -nice cleaning stand that does a fine job -used on a trip and running hot water on the head seemed to do fine as well -low energy use when cleaning when I checked it with my watt killer meter Any concern? -so far none to speak of -I am still working on getting the shave on my upper lip as close as I would like. But I am figuring it out -some mentioned the case not as handy as just a cap over the cutting blade for travel but I have found the case is just fine. same size as razor so no space difference I am a happy camper so if it changes I will be back with another post. This razor is well worth the price.
  14. Over the years I have used both blades and other makes of electric shavers. However, after doing my homework in researching a quality product. I found it with the Braun Series 7 - 790cc Pulsonic Shaver. It is a major improvement over what I have used in the past giving me a good clean shave. I highly recommend the product. However, keep in mind its a little pricey but worth the extra money. Emanuel Stein
  15. I have been using a Norelco electric for the last 20+ years but have always had occasional problems with ingrown hairs which have gotten worse recently. So I decided to try out a Braun to see if it would do better. At first I was having HORRIBLE problems with ingrown hairs on the Braun, I was getting a couple nasty ones every week, real nasty ones. My neck looked like a minefield. Just when I was about to give up I decided to try a different shaving technique. With my old Norelco I had to make many quick passes to get all the hairs cut so that was the way I was doing it with this one. I decided to try slowing down, and found that the vibrating head in fact made it possible to shave that way and get just as quick a shave in the end because only a couple passes were needed. To get an idea of the speed, I now take about three seconds to run up a side cheek on my face. Now as you have probably guessed already, that has completely solved my ingrown hair problem and I am now doing much better than I did with my old Norelco. I have found the self-cleaning aspect handy. I was initially concerned that I would be spending far too much money on the replacement liquid things that go in the base, but after four months of use I am still on the same one so it looks like 2-3 per year which isn't all that horrible. Scott
  16. Alrighty then. I've had Braun razors ever since I was over playing Army in Germany in the mid- 80's. At that time I bought a battery powered Braun for the field. It worked well then, and worked fine until I moved about three years ago and misplaced it. It's around here somewhere, and I've no doubt that it'll still work fine when I finally stumble across it someday. Anyway, the razor that this new 790cc replaces is the 8985 360 degree complete, which still works fine, but with which I've grown bored. I'm sending it to my little brother (he still gets my hand-me-downs, but never complains!) where it will no doubt continue to perform well. How does the 790 perform? In a word: peerlessly. It powers through my not insubstantial beard with no audible slowing (generations prior to the 8985 would bog down if I tried to shave too quickly) and without having to go over the same spot several times. It even cleans up the throat and neck area quickly and comfortably. And... I shave my head with it and it works very, very well for that too! I tried the 500 series Braun: not bad, but not as good as my three year old 8985. It went back. I tried the top-of-the-line Norelco triple head razor. Lift and cut shaving? What a crock! I'd finish with the the Norelco and go over the same area with the 8985. Smoother. The Norelco went back. So, enough screwing around! What's the top Braun? 790cc. I bought it and am very happy. Notable features and differences from previous generation Braun razors: This one can be rinsed in warm water to clean it if you don't want to use the clean and renew station. Nice, but make sure you pop off the screen / cutter block to dry, off of the razor. If you put it in the cleaning station to dry, it won't, and you'll get a cold wet razor the next time you fire it up. Yuck. The trimmer is a new design from previous razors, and I actually prefer the old style. This one works, but it's weaker than previously (it will bog if you tryto go too quickly) and is harder to be precise with. I have a long sweeping mustache and if I have to mess with it, I'll typically reach for my dedicated trimmer. The cutter block and screen have been combined into one unit. I like it actually, as it seems to better contain the shaved material. (Remember that I shave my head, too?). I read a review (complaint?) on here that it was more expensive to replace than before, but no, a little e-shopping and you'll find that it's the same as replacing the screen and cutter block. They work together, get dull together, and should be replaced at the same time. If your scissor gets dull, you don't sharpen one blade, right? Same principle. This razor is powered by a lithium polymer battery, where prevoiusly they were powered with nickel metal hydride batts. I wish they'd have stayed with the nimh, as I believe that they have a much longer lifespan. I actually think that the battery will be the longevity limiting factor with this razor. Will I grow bored with this razor and be looking for the next generation, better Braun before the battery croaks? I'm not so sure. Maybe they can re-power it a service center. The razor has an LCD display on the bottom that shows remaining battery power, and the cleanliness of the razor. Pretty nifty. Each scale (six segments in a little curved line) gets reset when the Clean and Renew station is used to clean/lubricate and charge the razor (Like having a brand new razor each time!), but not when it's rinsed in warm water. That's another complaint that people make: you have to pay for the cartridges to refill the cleaning station. Whoopie doo. They last about two months each, and they cost about ten bucks for two. A little over two bucks a month to keep it in tip top shape. Again, whoopie doo. You don't have to use the station, but why buy this razor at all if you don't plan on using the cleaning function? To finish, I would whole-heartedly recommend this razor to anyonewho wants a smooth, non irritating shave. Is it as close as a good blade? Nope. It can't be. As thin as they make the screen, it's still there, and it's between the cutter and your skin. But it's darned close, and I don't believe there's a better electric out there anywhere!
  17. I've owned two electrics razors, both Norelco's. Norelco #2, a 6-year old top of the line 8894XL, was starting to have trouble holding a charge, so I decided to buy a Braun 790cc because of its good reviews, Big mistake. The Braun is a quality razor that looks good and feels great. It did a good job on my face, but a terrible job on my neck. I was very careful to follow the instructions in the Braun user guide to make sure I wasn't the problem, but there was nothing I could do to get a decent shave on my neck. After three weeks of trying, I called the 800 number you have to call to return the razor. I thought they'd ask me why I wanted to return the razor and maybe suggest something new to try. Wrong again. I reached a recorded message that, after some of the usual voice mail exercises, spit out return instructions at something just short of the speed of light. After spitting out the message, the recording then abruptly hung up; no dial `*' option to repeat the message. The recording didn't bother to spell words that could easily be misspelled, such as Genco, Jenco, or Gen. Co. After lots of redials and some Internet detective work, I think I got the return address right. I'm not at all sure that was Braun's intention. I did eventually receive my refund within the expected timeframe Since I still needed a razor, I ordered my second choice, a Norelco 1090x. I finally got it right. This thing does a great job on both my face and neck, It's not baby smooth, but it's in the ballpark. Now my wife doesn't have to complain about the Braun cleaning thing sitting on the counter all the time (I didn't like it either) and I don't have to spend $7 a month to buy cleaning refills. The Norelco did got a little warm for a while, but that stopped after a few weeks. Other than that, it's easily the best electric razor I've owned.
  18. I always buy the top of the line shavers from different companies and they all lasted for years with no problems. The only reason I replaced them was because the battery no longer took a charge. After 2 years of light use, the trimmer broke (it no longer was able to stay open) and the cleaning fluid dissolved the cheap silver sticker behind the shaver. This shaver shaves no closer than other brands that I have used in the past. The quality of construction is very poor. I would definitely not recommend this shaver to anyone. I have been using foil shavers for 25 years and will purchase a rotary shaver for the first time in my life because I thought this was the best foil shaver.[[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]]
  19. This review is for the Braun 7-790cc electric shaver. Highly recommended. Worth every penny. The last foil shaver I tried was a really old model which my grandfather left to me, about 10 years ago. I tried it once and brutally cut up my face. Which explains why my last shaver was a high end Norelco rotary shaver (don't recall the exact model number). I had that shaver for about four or five years. Initially, it shaved pretty well, but over time, even though I replaced the cutters every year, and thoroughly cleaned the shaver from time to time (hard to do when they discontinued the cleaning solution), the shaving performance degraded. I ended up having to finish up some parts of my face with a razor. Also, the tradeoff for setting the shaver for a reasonably close shave was that my skin would often get irritated, especially since I would have to do multiple passes to try to do a somewhat reasonable job. It was time to purchase a new shaver, and I considered purchasing this model, but I was nervous, because of the expense, and because it would be my first foil shaver. I read the reviews of the Braun and decided to give it a try. I have been satisfied with the closeness of the Braun shave, and extremely satisfied with the comfortable shave and the ease of cleaning. I started off the first few weeks being very gentle and careful with the shaver, not pressing too hard. It is recommended that you stretch the skin and hold the shaver perpendicular to your face. After a few weeks, I became more comfortable with the shaver and started to press harder. I recently got my very first nick with the shaver. I had stretched the skin, but apparently pressed a little too hard, and I felt it nick me right on the end of my chin. It was just a very small nick with a little bead of blood. Not bad at all, and I'm pretty sure I can avoid it in the future just by not pressing as hard around the bony contours of my jaw. This shaver does not shave as close as a blade, but it does a fairly good job, and I believe it does the best job possible for an electric shaver. The cleaning cartridges make me a little uncomfortable, because I don't know exactly what they contain. I believe it is alcohol plus some lubricants. I'm not sure whether it qualifies as hazardous waste. Each cartridge costs about $6 and lasts about a month (of daily cleanings). You can subscribe via Amazon.com, so that you will receive a package of 2 new cartridges every 2 months, and you will get free shipping and a 15% discount by doing so. The cleaning system activates the shaver and draws the cleaning solution from the cartridge into the shaver, in order to flush it out. The noise of the cleaning system is a little bit annoying, due to a high-pitched whine, but I am fairly sensitive to those sorts of noises. It's acceptable to me (and my cat), so I don't think this would be a deal-breaker for the great majority of people. You would not want to start the cleaning cycle while your partner is trying to sleep in the next room. After cleaning, the next day there sometimes seems to be a very small amount of alcohol/lubricant residue on the shaver itself, and a little bit of odor from the cleaning system, but it's not bothersome. It is quite a luxury not to have to clean the shaver manually (although it is possible to do so while traveling and away from the cleaning center). Here are the cleaning cartridges, which are available from Amazon.com (free shipping via Amazon Prime or by subscribing to the product): [[ASIN:B000050FDY Braun Clean & Renew Refills (2 Pack)]] My particular model (7-790cc) has a fast cleaning cycle, which I doubt I will ever use. The reason is that I don't want to use the shaver immediately after it has been cleaned, because I'm concerned that the used cleaning solution may not have completely drained or evaporated from the shaver. I am hoping that by cleaning the shaver regularly and replacing the foil and cutters every 18 months, it will keep shaving this well for years to come. I'm very happy I tried out this foil shaver. I shave every day, which makes my partner happy. I look better. My face doesn't get all red and irritated. I don't have to finish up with a razor. I do have to do multiple passes on my neck, and particularly on my sideburns for some reason, in order to find the best angle to approach the hair, but this doesn't bother me, because my face doesn't get irritated. I think it takes me about 5 minutes to shave, and it's a very comfortable experience without any fear of nicks, cuts, or irritation. The shaver itself also looks very impressive.
  20. WOW - best shave ever! Pressing down against the grain gives me a smoother shave than the Gillette 5 blade razor!! Independent judge (wife) confirms smoother shave. ;-) No face burn at all. Can shave my evening shadow, without my face \\"objecting\\" with little morning white heads. Shaving now quicker, easier, and aftershave is no longer painful at all. As a design engineer I am impressed with the cleaning/lubricating system. Thank you Braun and Gillette for making a daily chore quicker and easier!
  21. I have had my new Braun Series 7 for 13 months now and absolutely love it. I am not one to rave about a shaver and was a Norelco user for the past 20 years. This was my first Braun shaver and I am very impressed! At the one year mark my razor's charger/cleaner stopped making the connection to the charging/cleaning components. It has a two year warranty so I just took it in to the local authorized dealer and it was fixed no problem. From what I understand this is a common problem but the only problem.
  22. I've been a blade shaver for more than 20 years. Years ago, I dabled with a couple of electric shavers, but never felt I really got a close shave with them. With blades becoming so expensive, I decided I'd try it again and I'm glad I did. I've had this shaver for about a week now and it seems to get a little better every day. The shave is fast, close and with no irritation. I don't think I get as close a shave as I did with a blade, but the reality is you don't need that close a shave to have a close shave. The longer I've used the Braun, the closer the shave has gotten. And, the convenience far outweighs the fact that it's not quite as close as a blade. It's certainly more than good enough. It's hard to find anything about it that I don't like. It is a bit bulky and takes up room on the counter, but that's pretty minor compared to what I'm getting out of it. The cleaning solution and cleaning cycle is straightforward though I've yet to change the cleaning solution. I'm very glad I tried the Braun and so far I'm impressed with its convenience, ease of use and the results I'm getting.
  23. even better than the old one. just suck it up and buy the fluid for changing. IT IS LOUD (I run the cleaner while taking a shower, so less chance of waking the wife)
  24. I did multiple hours worth of research before deciding on which razor to buy. Unfortunately I'm very fair skinned, and I have rarely been able to shave in the past with a razor (believe me I have tried every kind) and not get razor burn. I even went to the dermatologist and after trying different approaches, they informed me that I was just more or less out of luck. Then I stumbled across the 790. The pros to this product in my opinion: -Hardly any razor burn (rarely get and and it is usually a stubble or two) -Built well and doesn't feel cheap. -The Hygeine meter is a nice feature, plus the self cleaning is great. The cons: -The 790 seems to shave my cheeks perfectly and in no time. It really does feel like a blade went over it. However when it comes to my neck, it doesn't do as great of a job. I have tried different angles, stretching my skin, but sometimes it's like it can't quite get my neck as smoothe. It also leaves my skin red (but only for an 30 min-hour or so because of the pressure put against it from the razor trying to get all the hairs removed). -The clean and renew cartridges are fairly expensive, but as a word of advice, you don't have to clean this thing after every shave! I clean it once every 2 shaves, which for me equals out to 3 times a week. -Self cleaning can be kind of loud, so I recommend shutting the door or starting it while you are headed out of the house. Overall, if you haven't had any luck with a regular razor blade, then I would recommend this product. This has been without a doubt the closet I have been to obtaining a good shave without any irritation.
  25. I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband.He really likes it and shaves every day again for which I am thankful.He said it gives the closet shave he has ever had with an electric and does not pinch and he likes the pulsing and cleaning features. I am glad he is happy with it but I think it is a bit on the expensive side.AS he is the one using it and feels it is well worth whatever I paid I have to bow to his opinion. AS long as he is happy with it so am I.
  26. First, I should point out that I'm not an electric shaver type of guy. Every time I bought one (typically the cheap $50 kind in a Target store), it irritated my skin and didn't get a close shave, and so I would return it. I love manual razors, I can get every whisker, and I generally can do it without cuts. The problem is that it does hurt, if minimally, and I thought why not give electrics one more try. Second, I have thick facial hair. I don't let it grow more than 5 days because by then the stubble gets unbearably itchy and I don't like how I look with a beard or mustache. This may be true of most faces (what do I know), but my facial hair also grows in different directions. For instance, hair on my face is pretty simple (grows down) but hair on my neck generally grows diagonally down away from the chin (with some fun exceptions that take a few rubs of the fingertips to figure out the best angle to shave at those trouble spots). I also lift my chin to get my neck skin taught to shave, and around the jawline I sometimes like to tilt my head up or down to move my jawbone a few inches underneath my skin so I have a hard surface to shave my jawline against (makes it easier to use less pressure and thus not cut myself). Again, manual razors do the trick relatively easily (now that I know which direction to shave on different parts of my face) although I'd prefer to avoid the minimal discomfort that comes with a manual. WHICH IS TO SAY, i have no doubt that your experience with this razor may be much more positive if your don't get much facial hair. Enter the Braun Series 7 - 790cc. I decided, hey, if I'm going to really give this a shot, I should get the best, and, let's face it, everyone on the internet seems to be falling over themselves to point out how perfect this shaver is compared to its competition (generally people seem to agree that foil shavers are superior to rotary, particularly for more coarse hair, and that dry shavers are better than one's for the shower -- and this has been claimed by many to be the best dry foil shaver on the market by far). I also read up on the art of electric shaving, including the importance of a dry face (yes, I tried Lectric Shave liquid a few times, as some recommend to dry the face), the possible value of showering first and then drying your face before shaving, using the shaver well over a month to allow your face to adjust to it, doing the trouble spots first (in my case below my jawline) before the shaver head gets warm and thus more irritating to the skin, and pulling skin taught where necessary during shaving. THE GENERAL PROBLEM WITH THIS SHAVER -- for me at least, given my facial hair type -- is that it shaves my face perfectly but, starting just above the jaw line, it misses a large number of long hairs. Imagine, if you will, a nearly perfect shave (my god it does my cheeks and mustache like it got waxed or something, that was kind of awesome) on my whole face, except there are 50 or so longish hairs in random spots starting just above my jaw line and continuing down my neck. It looks absolutely ridiculous! Believe me, I ran the shaver over those bad boys in every way I could think, every angle, every pressure, multiple times. I even took a tweezer to try to pull those hairs away from my skin to see if the shaver would then have an easier time catching them, all to no avail. So ultimately every time I used that shaver I'd have to do a follow-up shave with a manual shaver. Granted, that follow-up manual shave went so smoothly, quickly, and painlessly that I could tell the electric had done most of the work, but isn't it silly to spend so much time with the electric (almost as much time as a manual), then lather up your face right afterwords and do yet another shave with a manual, thus doubling my shave time? I really REALLY wish there was a way to make the shave less close. I know that sounds completely idiotic, but, remember, in my case having a close shave on most of my face but not in random spots looks silly. I'd trade that bizarre look in easily for a less close shave that was at least even. I mean, if I could go from Day5-level stubble back to even Day2 or Day3-level stubble, I'd go for it (I'm not in a profession where I need to be cleanly shaven every morning). Funny thing is that I read online that the U.S. version of this shaver is the old version in parts of Asia (Japan I think?) where the newer version (in black) has three closeness-levels for shaving. So perhaps if that version ever hits the U.S. market, the level that will leave stubble will allow for a more even shave (if not necessarily perfectly close to the skin). Okay, on to the pluses (although if you had the experience I had, I'm sure you're regretting buying this). (1) It's a wiz on the upper part of my face (cheeks and mustache), and I literally mean as close as a manual. Why would I only shave my upper part of my face and not my neck and jawline though is beyond me. The only upside I suppose is if you prefer the look of stubble everywhere but your mustache -- in which case this is a very expensive but excellent way to get rid of just your mustache hair in a fast, painless process. (2) It's pretty! I know that sounds stupid, but I like electronics. This thing is just gorgeous (I got this one, the one with the black-ish sides and back, not the one with the grey sides and back). It feels good in your hand, beautifully designed on the exterior, and the cleaning system is fun and easy to use. IN CONCLUSION, this is probably an awesome product for SOME people, depending on your facial hair type. But I can't imagine I'm the only one who has had this problem of getting a clean shave on top and an awful shave on the neck and jaw, which is why I was surprised I couldn't find anyone else saying this in their user reviews before I bought this. Hopefully this review will at least give you a head's up that this is not a one-shaver-fits-all-faces product.
  27. I've used about every major brand of electric razor on the market over the past 30 or so years. This, by far, gives me the best shave of any. While the cleaning solution is somewhat pricey also, if you are not on a tight budget, its ease and convenience is also a real plus.
  28. I've had this shaver for about a month and it's working great. It's quiet and gives a close, very comfortable shave. My only quibble is that, like previous Braun shavers I've owned, it doesn't always grab the neck hair and I occasionaly have to pull out the straight edge. The cleaning system has been great so far, and I've usually been able to clean it every other day on the \\"economy\\" setting instead of the recommended daily cleaning, effectively doubling the life of the cleaning solution.

Having said that I must say that in terms of shaving performance there is not much difference, you still have to repeat areas to get a really close shave.   30. I have had problems with bumps and ingrown hairs since i started shaving. Have not had any since I got this shaver. I do have to use a normal Gillette to fix my goatee but my skin feels great now.
  31. I waited a few months before making my final assessment on this product. Heck, the box even says \\"wait a couple weeks to notice full results\\". As a quick background, I have a sensitive neck. My face can take a quad blade, but a single blade tears up my neck. I developed rash after every shave with a blade and I would go to work some days without shaving much to my boss' dismay. Every swipe hurt, no matter how gentle or what pace. I had enough and I decided to buy this razor. I wanted the best of the best, money's no object, go for the gold. I was not disappointed! This thing leaves my face smoother than what I felt with a blade and it doesn't hurt! I am no longer afraid to shave. My *only* gripe is that, while the quality of shave on my face is bar none, the neck isn't the same. It leaves a lot of spots and it takes many additional swipes on stretched skin and even then it leaves a lot behind. My neck comes out splotchy. But that is how it was when I used a blade, so I am happy because I get the same results with no pain, irritation, rash, or embarassment. Even though it is expensive, the build quality is amazing. So while you put a lot of money down on it now, I have no doubts it will last me many many years to come (and pays for itself). Great product! Recommended for those with overly sensitive necks.
  32. I have been using Remington shavers for years and decided to step up to a better product....so I thought. That being said this product doesn't shave as well as my old Remington and cost 3 times as much so I will be going back. The Remington is also better at cleaning up any longer growth and trimming neck lines etc. I found that the Braun was ok in flat areas like the cheek but lacked in the neck area, the ability to actually shave if you have let your hair grow for several days, and just getting a close shave.

  36. I received the 790cc as a gift 2 months ago. At first, I was impressed with the amount of thought that went into the packaging of this unit. Then I found out how much the razor cost and now know that most of the cost went into packaging. As for the razor, the weight of the unit suggests that this is a well made, precision instrument. It feels solid in your hand. After the initial charging in the clean/renew station I tried it out on my beard which was previously trimmed by my Norelco. The resulting shave was not as close as I expected for a $200+ razor compared to my old $50 Norelco. After the first shave, I set it back into the clean/renew station and that's when the real problems began. All of the LED's in the razor and the station began blinking randomly. The charger would not sense the razor and therefore would not clean or charge it. I called Braun and was informed that I could mail it back to them at my own expense or I could take it to their authorized repairman about 10 miles from my house. I chose the repairman. The repairman had the razor for one month to the day and he remarked that it was not the only Braun 790cc he received for repair recently. He told me he replaced a PC board and another part in the station when he returned the unit to me. Thankfully there was no cost but also no paperwork describing his repair work. When I returned home I found that he had given me somebody else's 790cc razor. So now, I had to return to the repairman to retrieve my razor. After returning home again, I tried the razor a second time. I was still not impressed with the closeness of the shave but am willing to give it some more time to see if it improves. I haven't thrown my Norelco away, yet. The charging/cleaning station now works but has to be encouraged at times to sense the razor and to begin cleaning. The cleaning cycle begins and will stop abrubtly. After repositioning the razor on the contacts and pushing the start cleaning button again, itwill resume cleaning and eventually complete the cycle. The clean/renew process is not a quiet process, either. Bottom line: I am disappointed with Braun and Proctor and Gamble in general. It seems to me that P&G could at least stand by their products a little better, especially with a brand name like Braun. I am also not impressed with the design of the razor's seemingly unnecessary clean/renew station. Why not just run the razor under hot water and put a couple of drops of oil on it every month? The instructions indicate that you can do just that. You really shouldn't have the extra expense of replacing cleaning cartridges on top of this overpriced shaver, either.
  37. No skin rash, no hassle with ridiculously expensive cartridge replacements, no rapid re-growth of grizzly beard the next morning after shaving and ultimately no mess! This is the one for all man's dream. If there's any complaint, it is either the unit is defective or the user didn't give the shaver enough time to adjust. I have tried the Braun series 3 because it was half the price of the series 7 but the 7 series made it to the peak. I never tried the other brand shaver because I liked the design by Braun.

  41. The best razor, electronic or otherwise, money can buy. It works, it leaves no bumps, and it is comfortable. For those who are used to wet-shaving with a razor and shaving-cream, it will take time to get used to this product. After a while, though, you will appreciate the convenience of just waking up and shaving dry with this electric razor: no beard prep, no creams, no gels, no water. And like I said, it is actually comfortable, shaves darned close (almost as good as the best razors), and leaves no bumps! The self-cleaning function in the base works fantastic, too. This electric razor is practically no-maintenance. I have to deduct a star for the terrible, cheesy sucker-punch that Braun pulled on its customers by forcing you to replace the refills every month. I have heard that there are ways to avoid this by refilling the refill boxes yourself somehow with an alternative liquid concoction, but I haven't tried it myself. I might, though, since the refills are expensive and need replacing monthly.
  42. I bought this shaver as a gift for my husband, who has very sensitive skin. He used to get razor burn and ingrown hair when he shaved using his Gillette blades. His skin has improved a lot ever since he started using this shaver. He likes the swiveling head that makes it easy to shave on his neck. Its recharging and cleaning dock leaves the shaver smelling fresh and feeling new. Highly recommended!
  43. [updated July 11, 2012]<br /><br />Returned my [[ASIN:B0020MMCB6 Braun Series 3 370 Men's Shaver]] to the manufacturer during the trial period. It had a great trimmer, but most trimmers I have used have been acceptable. Otherwise, the shave and NiMh battery were not so hot and the head does not flex. My mistake, trying to go cheap.<br /><br />My previous shaver had been an old 5 series that still worked some; I'd give that one 4 stars. I once went on a 15 day vacation on this NiCad shaver without the charger, when it was a decade old, no problem. Just had to be sure to drain the battery and then charge completely (which I eventually goofed).<br /><br />My new shaver was a [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Silver]], which gave a good shave, but shook itself to death in 26 months. It's now extremely loud, but won't drive either the current or previous head. Trimmer was marginal, but good enough. This shaver ran 79-80 db at six inches, close to ear damage volume. Who knows what the equivalent vibrations were, transmitted through my face. I decided to try something else.<br /><br />In June, 2012, I picked up a [[ASIN:B003YJB026 Braun Series 5-550cc Shaver System, Black and Silver]] on sale for one twenty at my local cost company. Initially, I liked it's relative quiet, but I soon became disappointed with the quality of the shave. Shaving more carefully and taking about 50% longer helps. I do like that the head is in two pieces (foil and cutter block), which makes shaking out the cuttings a snap. If you are fair and young (light beard like I had in college), this model will probably be fine. Older and tougher, not so hot. On this and the Series 7, I use the cleaning solution about once a week and then cap the cartridge. 72 db at 6 inches, which makes it less than half as loud as the series 7.<br /><br />Back to my cost company tonight, I snagged a [[ASIN:B0067D4RYY Philips Norelco 1255x Sensotouch 3d Electric Shaver, Black,Special Value Includes Extra Shaving Head Pack]] apparently a 1250x with the extra head, on sale for one five five with a fifteen mail in rebate. (I still have my old corded Norelco from decades ago, won't do my 'stache correctly, so I have been dubious about these shavers.) I'll be posting my 2 star review tonight; this sucker is going back. (What a relief to switch back to the Series 5, even if it is slow.) The only really good thing about the 1255x is the noise: 67 db at 6 inches is about a quarter as loud as the Series 7. (The decibel scale is logarithmic, not linear.)<br /><br />------<br />Update 8-12-2012: my interpretation of the decibel scale was incorrect. 3db (not 6db) represents a doubling of the sound pressure. I'm still using the 5-550cc, which takes at least 50% longer to produce an acceptable shave as my old Series 7. My credit card provides an extra year of warranty and credited my full Series 7 purchase price to my card, so I'm probably going to spring for a new Series 7, keep the 5 as a spare.
  44. In anticipation of receiving my Braun, I let my beard get a five day growth. In less than five minutes I was as clean shaven as with my Gillette four blade razor. This is one of those products of which you only find a handful in your lifetime. And it doesn't heat up while in use! The self cleaning feature is just too cool. If they ever manage to get the price down, everyone will start using a Braun, trust me.
  45. I've been using electric shavers for years and this is the best I've ever used. You get a really close shave. It still have some problem areas on the neck, but this is as good as I've ever had with an electric razor.
  46. OK, I've used Braun shavers for years and about 1 year ago I bought the Pulsonic. Have enjoyed it-shaves as well as promised. Then within the last month the back under the shaver head started to deterioriate. This part comes in contact with the cleaning solution. Then the trimmer apparatus won't close properly. Braun will not do anything other than allow me to mail it in so they can take a look at it for 4 to 6 weeks. Not real happy. They charge the top price in the market, and have no solution when the product fails except send it in.
  47. I've tried 1-4-blade wet razors, and rotary razors. All have aggravated an acne-like skin condition on my face. This is the only razor I have found that not only does not bother the problem, but actually shaves almost as closely as a blade. The cleaning solution does just that and keeps the shaver reasonably germ-free too. I've used the product for about a month and it is just as comfortable as Day One.
  48. I have had other Braun shavers, but none compare to this model. It is expensive, but worth every penny. It shaves very close and cleaning is very easy. I will never change to any other brand.
  49. I have used this shaver for a week now and it does a great job. I expected my skin to have some type of reaction after shaving with a blade, but there was none. As long as you pull the skin tight and shave against the grain of your beard, it is the closest electric shaver I have used. The jury is still out on the auto-cleaning device and how long the solution will last. All the posts I have read about say just to bite the bullet and purchase a new one when the old one is finished. I would recommend this product.
  50. Very quiet, and does a great job. This is my 4th Braun in maybe 25 years. The last two, this one, the 7790c Pulsonic, and the last one, had the new screen design that I think they referred to as \\"activator\\". For my face type, I tend to have hairs growing in all different directions, and this new screen design really makes the shaving go more quickly. In addition, in todays environment, where it is common to go a day or two without a shave, this new design makes that one or two day old stubble get cut down more quickly, and with less discomfort. The \\"sonic\\" part of the shaver I think does a better job than without, but I would not say that the differece in \\"night and day\\", but would say that it is an improvement. My opinion, you will not be disappointed with this shaver. I do not know of a better shaver, and if I did, I would own it.
  51. I am beyond pleased w/ this purchase. I have been a 'shave in the shower' kind of guy for years - my face gets really sensitive especially around the neck area. I have been using this shaver for just about a week now, and I'm sold. My face comes out smoother than had I used a blade. Mind you, when I shaved with a blade I always shaved w/ the grain. When I shave w/ this Braun, its like I was shaving against the grain w/ a blade. Its true, the neck is a tougher area to get all the hairs on. Every day I get a little better at it though, and I think every day my neck gets a little more used to the shaver. I believe if I give the shaver the full 3 week adjustment period, I'll be a real happy guy. I even shave on the weekend with this thing. That almost NEVER happened !!! I could care less about needing to buy the solution - conveniance has a price and I'm willing to pay it. I hope it lasts beyond the 2 year warranty - everything I'm reading indicates it should easily pass that mark. One of the better purchases I've made all year - I'm a fan.
  52. After many years, many Panasonics, Norelcos, and previous Brauns, I have found one that just works. This is the best shave from an electric I have ever experienced. I hesitated at the price...but it is value for money.
  53. Product is ok but not as great as advertised, larger screen openings can catch small skin tags on your face if you have them.
  54. This razor worked great until it broke 5 months after purchase, this is when the problems started. Pretty much Braun doesn't stand by there product and out sources their servicing to appliance service companies. Customer service pretty much doesn't care. To make a long story short, after 6 weeks of waiting and many phone calls, I was sent a razor WITH HAIR IN IT, after being told I was going to be sent a new one buy customer service. I called and after some \\"investigation\\" they claim they sent me back my razor, only problem is I had thoroughly cleaned my razor before bringing it to the service center. I was told maybe there was hair in it you didn't get or from the testing they did on the razor (meaning their service centers don't clean the testing equipment). I called up customer service and was told to take it up with the service center. Meanwhile, i have been shaving with a $60 Norleco that I purchased about 4 years ago (that broke and was replaced with no problems). FOR THE COST OF THE PRODUCT THE SERVICE WHEN IT FAILS IS HORRIBLE! BEWARE!
  55. excellent shaver! it does what it claims to do. shaver helps keep your skin feeling not to dry.i would recommend this shaver without any doubts.
  56. My Series 5 shaver broke after I dropped it a few too many times on the tile floor so I replaced it with the Series 7 shaver. The series 7 shaver is a tiny bit better at shaving my thick growth then the series 5 only b/c it takes a few minutes less time for me to shave. That leads me to the minor complaints about the Series 7...Braun took the shave timer off of this shaver, for some odd reason I really liked the timer. The new shaver has a slight flimsy feel to it compared to the old one. I also don't like the trimmer on the 7 compared to the trimmer on the 5. Braun did put an angled plug on the 7 and that's nice b/c it fits closer to the wall on my counter now...if they would fix the size/shape of the electric plug then it would be almost perfect (both the 5 and 7 have the same plug and it's really long, so it sticks out from the outlet really far...very ugly and in the way). Overall, this is still my favorite electric shaver and I've tried many over the years. I wouldn't upgrade from a working Series 5 to the Series 7 b/c the performance is very similar.
  57. I've only had this shaver for about three weeks but I wanted to submit a review in case it might be helpful to someone shopping for the holidays.<br /><br />I hadn't used an electric shaver for decades and my previous experience with electric razors has been disappointing. I had plastic surgery involving my neck relatively recently and because of the bumps and valleys left behind it's rather uncomfortable using a razor blade. I got this model because the reviews were good and I didn't want to take a chance on a personal hygiene product which wasn't highly rated. Price wasn't a concern as long as the shaver worked.<br /><br />This product has met my expectations. Let me say right off that it doesn't shave as close as a razor blade. I doubt if any electric razor would, at least with my beard. However, it gets pretty darn close, especially if I make several passes over the same area. It comfortable and I don't have irritation afterward. My wife doesn't notice any difference in the shave whether I use the electric shaver or a razor blade.<br /><br />I'm retired, so this has been very useful for routine use. The shave is plenty good enough for seeing the grandkids or going out with friends. I've used a razor blade a few times for special social events.<br /><br />Some reviewers have expressed concern regarding the self cleaning system (and the cost of the proprietary cartridges). I think the unit looks rather attractive and high tech and it operates flawlessly. One doesn't have to use the self cleaning option for every shave. Just rinse the razor under water and use the self cleaning system intermittently as desired. The cartridges contain some lubricants so I suppose it's a good idea to use it once in awhile.<br /><br />I can't comment on how well this razor compares to other brands because I haven't used any other recent models. I can say that I'm satisfied with this purchase and I doubt that I could find a competing brand with better performance.
  58. NON-RETURNABLE. Don't miss the fine print. If you are buying this as a gift, you better be sure the recipient wants it. It is loud and vibrates a lot. If you decide you don't want it, then you CANNOT return it. Buyer beware!
  59. My husband bought this for his own Xmas present and loves it. He has had a Braun 7526 for a number of years and after reading the other reviews decided to upgrade. Shaved one side of his face with the 7526 and the other with the 9595. I could definitely tell the difference especially around the neck. He said it was much quicker as well, without having to go over areas several times. His old Braun has been very reliable and is expecting similar reliability with a closer shave. Go Braun!
  60. I've owned a few of the Braun razors over the past 7 years. I started with a series 5 that finally died last year, and over the last year I used a series 1 while I decided if I wanted to buy a really expensive razor again. I will start out that this is the best razor I've ever shaved with. It consistently cleans up any trouble hairs without any input from you; unlike the previous systems you don't need to \\"grind\\" the razor into your neck to get rid of those hairs. It also manages an average day's growth in one pass; that is a welcome change from the previous iterations. The LCD is neat; more gimmicky than anything else but kindof cool. The base station is similar to all the others with the addition of a \\"quick clean\\" option. I dunno if I'll ever use that; having shaved with the alcohol leaking onto my neck before... It's not comfortable! It also comes with a travel case of hard plastic that completely covers the razor; it also has the cleaning brush built into the end of it. The razor itself is well-made. The finish is good and it has some heft to the device. It doesn't feel like if you hold it wrong you're going to break it. The razor head looks very complicated when you take it off too. This is a remarkable piece of engineering. The only downside to it is cost. It's an expensive razor! I thought good and hard before purchasing it. I think what finally sold me was the conclusion, offered helpfully from my wife, that I shave every day and deserve a good, clean shave. I really had come to dread shaving every day with my series 1 and needed a good replacement. I liked my series 5, but it wasn't \\"perfect\\" in that I still received razor burn from it. I decided this was the razor to get and bought it. I was not disappointed and I don't think you will be either.
  61. I can't imagine why this razor gets the high reviews it does. It takes me 10-15 minutes to shave with it. I have normal hair and have never had a problem with shaving. OK, it cleans...great. As far as a razor is concerned, it's only adequate.
  62. I just want to start out saying that I have very sensitive skin; especially on the neck. I tried each of these shavers for 1 month. This was ultimately a journey in trying to find the best electric shaver. Thank God for money back guarantees or I would have gone broke in this process. Ultimately I felt that the Braun Pulsonic was the best of these shavers and the one I continue to use. Philips Norelco 8240xl -Really not a bad shaver. It is very quiet and the shave was fairly comfortable and quick. Also, it's not that expensive and is a good value for the price. Pros: -gives a decent shaver overall -quick shave -fairly comfortable -very easy to clean Cons: -had trouble getting all my neck hairs (had to keep going over neck) -any more than a days worth of stubble and this thing will tug on your facial hair (hurts a little bit) Panasonic 8243a wet/dry shaver -not at all worth the money in my case -I know alot of people like this shaver and I really wanted to but the actual performance of it led me to decide otherwise Pros: -ability to use shaving cream with this shaver reduces irritation -does a decent job on the face -shaves fairly close Cons: -used the shaver for one month and I always got ingrown hairs on my neck and jaw line after shaving with it -frequently nicked my neck and jawline, drawing blood -pretty loud Philips Norelco Arcitec -really not worth the money and overall gave a mediocre shave -the 8240xl was a better shaver for my face Pros: -decent shave on the face -shave was quick -easy to clean Cons: -doesn't shave that close for such a high end shaver -very poor job on the neck (irritated my neck, always missed many neck hairs in spite of repeated passes) -way to much money when the performance is not even as good as the 8240xl (looks like Philips paid too much attention to design and not enough on performance for this one) Braun Pulsonic -The hands down winner and best electric shaver Ihave used to date. Before I used the other shavers I bought this one first about 6 months ago and used it for a month. I initially felt that this did a very good job of shaving my face but wondered if I could find a better shaver for a cheaper price, so I sent the shaver back to Braun after a month. After having used the other shavers, I purchased the Braun Pulsonic again and continue to be happy with its shaving performance Pros: -very good shave for an electric shaver (if I take the time, can get almost as close as a blade) -does not irritate my skin (even with repeated passes, that includes the neck) -shave is very smooth and comfortable -once your face adjusts to the shaver, the shave is fairly quick -cleaning station is very convenient -say what you will, it might seem unnecssary but it really is convenient, it lubricates the shaving head for a smooth shave, and it leaves the shaver head smelling nice and lemony Cons: -would be nicer if this shaver was cheaper -this thing is loud, too loud -the shaver head gets warm and quickly (tip: if head gets to hot, hold it in front of a fan for 10 seconds, cools right down) -when I shave when the shaver head gets really warm it irritates my skin unless I let the shaver cool down So the Pulsonic is the winner and even though this shaver is expensive, I was happy to pay the money for its superior performance to the other shavers. I also want to point out that the only difference between the Pulsonic 790cc and 760cc is that the 790cc has an lcd screen that shows power level and hygiene level and the 760cc has an led screen where led lights simply light up to indicate battery life. To me, the hygiene level on the 790cc is pointless; I mean, does someone really need to be reminded to clean their shaver.
  63. At first this shaver worked well. However, the blades dulled quickly, the battery died, and the trimmer broke off the shaver. A Braun authorized repair company fixed the trimmer but claimed the battery was fine - notwithstanding the fact that the battery dies mid-shave unless I plug the shaver into an outlet. Given the price, the quality control is unacceptable. I would never buy this shaver again.
  64. I had been using a Norelco and was a bit cautious at first. However after shaving with this razor I was amazed at the speed and closeness of the shave. If there is one down side to it, it is the pop-up trimmer. It's placement puts it where you have trouble seeing it and makes it harder to use for trimming.

His only complaint, if we had to list one, is that he wished the compartment that holds the alcohol for the self cleaning was bigger so that he didn't have to replace it as often. Personally, I like that it's smaller because you're 'forced' to replace the dirty alcohol more frequently.   67. I haven't tried an electric shaver in many years, remembering how poorly they worked. The Braun 790cc is--in a word--amazing!   72. I've wet shaved all my life except when I was a teenager, and I've always envied those who just grab an electric shaver, whisk it over their faces, and hit the door, so thought I'd try it. The Braun scored highest in quality and satisfaction, so I got this shaver, the top of the line, and gave it a go. I decided to keep at it for several weeks, since it takes time for the beard to become used to a new way of shaving, but by the time my 30 days in which I could get a full refund were up, I sent it back. As another user noted, I had to shave every which way to get at all close, and my skin felt hot afterward. Finally I pulled out my old Gillette Trac III razor and shaving cream and did a comparison test. The Braun couldn't hold a candle to the closeness and comfort afterward of a wet razor shave. So if you're into electric shavers, this is probably the best on the market, but if you're thinking of switching from wet shaving you might want to think again. The proof is in the feel of your face afterward, and there was really no comparison. I'm back to blades for good.
  73. I bought the new Philips Norelco 1050cc Arcitec Shaving System, returned it for a refund after 30 days, and then purchased a the new Braun Pulsonic 9595 Shaving System. Since I've had experience with both now, I thought my experience might be of value to others. I've had 3 Norelco shavers over the past 20 years. The 9595 is my first Braun shaver.<br /><br />Shaving Closeness - The Braun definitely gives a closer shave and in less time, although the Norelco is acceptable. One reviewer commented about getting nicks from the Braun but I have not had that problem at all, even around the chin.<br /><br />Comfort - The Braun feels heavier (I didn't actually weigh them) but I found the Braun more comfortable to hold.<br /><br />Noise - The Braun is noisier, especially during the cleaning cycle.<br /><br />Status Indicators on the Shaver - The indicators are better on the Braun; however, I've since learned that's mostly because I had the 1050 model. I now see that the 1060 or the 1090 models would have been better and probably would equal the Braun.<br /><br />Charging/Cleaning Stand - The Braun is more convenient to replace the cleaning fluid but about the same cost (about $1.00 per week). Both seem to clean equally well. The charge and cleaning status lights on the Braun are easier to see and give better status information. But the big difference here is the way the charging system works. With the Braun, you simply place your used razor in the stand, push a button, and the cleaning & charging are taken care of. However, with the Norelco, there are a number of warnings in the book to unplug the unit after it completes its cycle. This is a major inconvenience if you have to hang around and remember to unplug the unit. Also, the lack of an on/off switch seems a poor and cheap design.<br /><br />Trimmer - To even off my sideburns, I found the Norelco somewhat difficult to use because the trimmer did not stick out far enough beyond the shaving head. This was not a problem withthe Braun.<br /><br />Cost - The Braun cost about $20 more.<br /><br />Return Policy - 60 day money back with Norelco; only 30 days with Braun.<br /><br />Bottom-Line - I started with a bias toward the Norelco because of my past experiences but in my opinion, this new Braun definitely surpasses the Norelco in terms of shaving closeness and convenience. Braun is clearly worth the extra $20, although the Norelco is a decent product.
  74. I have been using electric shavers for 50years and this by far the best, it gives a very smooth and comfortable shave.
  75. Like many people, I made the move to an eletric shaver from razors, mainly for convinience. I must say that this shaver has let me make the move and never turn back. It's as close as you can get with eletric, and the self cleaning feature is great. I would highly recommend to those looking to make the move.

  78. From all the positive reviews here, I had high hopes that this razor would be my salvation from the hell that is shaving. Sadly, after two uses, it's as disappointing as all electric shavers have always been on my beard. It missed everything; I had to go over each area multiple times to get any palpable reduction in beard growth; it took 3 times longer than a blade would have, and when all was said and done, my face still is not entirely smooth. Now, I realize that it takes a few weeks for ones face to get used to a new electric razor, but if the reviews here are to be trusted, I was meant to be blown away on the first use. To say I was underwhelmed is putting it mildly. I will give it 3 weeks to see if my experience changes, and if it does, I will certainly update this review, but as of right now, I am soooooo saddened by the failure of this product to live up to its promise. Granted I have the most awful beard from hell, but others here who gave this product a glowing review also claimed to have a permanent shadow before the Pulsonic came into their lives, so I was optimistic in my case as well. I hate, hate HATE shaving, and using a blade is torture (I can't even handle the chore every day -- I have to skip a day inbetween); however, blades work. Electrics, sadly, don't. I feel duped! The design and engineering on this system are amazing, hence the \\"two stars\\", but given that it is giving me such a poor shave, that's actually too generous. Sigh...
  79. Have used this shaver for a couple of weeks now, bought it on Amazon for a good price (although Walmart carries it at about the same price, you save on taxes in most states on Amazon). Its a lot better than Philips shavers I have been using for the last 5-6 years, gives me a closer shave with lesser irritation. The shaver did leave some rashes though, I guess its perhaps a case of me getting used to the kind of pressure it needs for a good shave. Great product, highly recommended. Update 2/4/2008: I have been cleaning the shaver every alternate day, or when the LCD only has two lights, whichever happens earlier, and its only after 2 months of use that the cleaning fluid is showing 'low' level. Pretty happy with the cost of cleaning this shaver as well.
  80. [[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Pulsonic System 9595 with LCD Screen]] The package as received was covered with a medium weight smooth plastic cover with no obvious beginning or end. I sat at the table for a while trying to determine how to get a handhold to get it off. Finally, after a while I attacked it with a scissors. What was left was a box with no obvious way to get it open. There did not seem to be a pull-out flap. I discovered, after time, that it opened like a book with two halves. Inside each half was a part of the product that in some cases had to be wrestled out. No instructions on or in the box that made much sense. After all this time, I needed a shave. Reading the instruction book and trying to figure out what some of the icons meant I assembled the two parts, cleaner and shaver, finally forced open the container containing the cleaning fluid and inserted it into the cleaner container. Then charged the battery with the oversized charger (the plug juts about five inches out of the wall.) I waited about 1/2 hour and proceeded to shave. The shave I would rate as very good, once you get used to the excessive vibration. It did all parts of my sorry face without much effort. The cleaner worked well, but P&G devised a very nice cash cow for themselves. The cleaner cartridge, they say should last 30 days at which time buy another one at $3-$4. I find this trend among manufacturers obnoxious. There must be a better way to make the original price the final price. Check other reviews. Consumers are beginning to use their heads.I remove the cartridge during the day and cover it to prevent evaporation and remove the shaver head after shaving to blow out the dust and replace it before putting it in the cleaner. Finally, in summation, the product is grossly over packaged, very over priced, but does a good job shaving. It is not that portable because you can't carry the cleaner with you. You can use water to clean, but then it does not get lubricated by the company's cleaner. The plug-charger does not fit into the carrying case provided. Before committing to the \\"Braun\\" check out other shavers and see if they would do a good job for you.
  81. I'm 27 and I've been using Braun electric shavers almost daily since I started shaving my face, probably about 12 years ago. I tried Philips/Norelco wet shaving system once (Cool Skin) but I had to return it because my (apparently very sensitive) face was destroyed after just one use. My face can't stand razors either. I wanted to replace my four years old Braun Synchro, not because it was bad, but because I was fooled by advertising, and this shaver looked promising. Yes, the device looks nice, weighs less than my old Synchro, the movable foils seem a good thing at first, and the cleaning system looks much better (it's still quite big, though). But I was hugely disappointed after the first use: my old (and much cheaper) Synchro shaves noticeably closer than this Pulsonic, even though its foil blade should have been replaced by now. The (few) hairs on my neck the Synchro is unable to cut, arent't cut by the Pulsonic either. And it gets worse: my skin was much more irritated, especially on my neck, where a lot of red bumps appeared soon after shaving (I used Gillette after shave, as usually). And it happened something that has never happened to me before using an electric razor: the middle foil made a cut in my lower lip (I can't do that with my Synchro even if I try to). Yesterday I gave it another shot but the results were no better than the first time. The redness and irritation might go away as soon as my face gets used to this shaver, but I doubt it will shave my face any closer in future uses. I couldn't care less about the looks of the shaver, its weight (as long as it's reasonable), its battery life (I always use the power cord) or the cleaning system (I use the one that came with my Synchro very few times a year). I just want the closest shave possible without leaving my face tomato-red. And my old Synchro definately does a better job at that than this Pulsonic, so I think I'll stick with it. I really wanted to like this shaver, but I can't recommend it. I understand that there are many different types of skin and beard out there, and some guys might get fantastic results with this shaver, as some others do with Philips/Norelco. But check that you can return it if you are going to buy this.
  82. This Pulsonic 9595 really is the best shaver out there, hands down. All the other reviews cover it pretty well, but it really is the best. Solid, sturdy construction, easy on the face, pretty much eliminates problems of ingrown hairs cuz the shave is so good. Close shave all over, no pulling, easy on the skin. And the cleaning system works great. The trimmer is pretty functional too for a razor's trimmer. I wouldn't buy any other razor - this is awesome and it looks cool.
  83. My friend had an older model Braun and he seemed to like it, so I thought I would give one a try. First of all, this is a great deal compared with the series 5 that is going for $200 at Target. The packaging is great. The cleaner/charger base and razor has a nice clean fit and finish. I have pretty dense facial hair so I wasn't so sure about this, but it seems to do the job. It does take me about 5-10 minutes to complete the shave because I usually let my hair grow out a few days. It gets nearly as close as a razor. The only area that seems to create a problem is my neck area. I just can't seem to get it as close as I can with the other areas. Despite the claims on the box I can't get my neck area close and it occasionally snags or pulls my hairs. I think I'm learning better technique though, as it seems to not do it as much. I think my neck area just has too many hairs going in different directions. The majority of other people reviewing don't seem to have these two problems though. I'm not so sure about the pulsonic technology and it's capability to increase the performance though. Overall though I enjoy the convenience of the use of it. The cleaning system is great and is super easy and leaves the razor spotless and smelling great. No more messy gels/creams, cuts or cleanup for me. The main reason I bought the shaver is since I began shaving I was plagued with razor burn/bumps which made it look like my skin was breaking out. I hated it and no matter what technique or product I used it would not go away. This product seems to have solved the problem and that was my main priority. If you are speculated about buying go ahead and try it as it has a 30 day money back guarantee.
  84. I ordered this Braun Pulsonic electric razor and had delivered to an address in the US, since I was outside the country. Upon visiting I used this razor for 6 weeks before returning home. I concluded that it is way overpriced. It took just as long to shave with it than any other Braun or Norelco. The only difference I found is that it is a bit heavier, a stronger motor, and has metal parts instead of 100% plastic, thus making it appear to be worth more. I still found it insufficient in cutting hairs on the neck and around the adam's apple. Instead of paying $200 USD I could just as well paid $50+ less for something equivalent. I fell for some very slick marketing for sure.
  85. I read all the hype and decided to go for the \\"best\\" electric out there. I have an average beard and get a quick and excellent shave with this razor, but not $200 better than the Norelco I was using. My criticism is that Braun has added lots of lights, \\"bells and whistles\\" to the razor, and especially to the included cleaning console, which jazz up the items and the price but which are functionally insignificant or unnecessary. I can't believe that the average guy, in a hurry to get off to the job, is going to pay any attention to things like status LEDs that give information that no one needs. And who wants to spend $10 a month for $1 worth of cleaning alcohol and the hassle of recharging the console when hot tap water cleans effectively? Braun should offer what is a fine razor for half the price and without the cleaning and charging console, or ridiculously overdone packaging, for the man who values true function and doesn't need or want the fanciful trappings. Then I would recommend it to you or my friends. For now, your money is better spent elsewhere.
  86. While it worked, it provided an acceptable shave. It could never match my 10 year old Norelco for sideburn trimming. BUT IT BROKE IN LESS THAN 3 MONTHS. I'll nver waste my money on a product from this company again.
  87. The razer was a Christmas present for my husband who has really sensative skin and would break out every time he shaved with a coventional razer. I knew he would never buy this on his own because of the price but I thought because Christmas was coming up (and the razer was on sale) I would get it for him. It took a little over a week for his face to get used to the electric razer but the results are above and beyond his expectations. Electric razers in the past pulled his facial hair and irritated his face and neck but this one doesn't do that. The shave is not as close as a traditional razer but it's pretty darn close. Yes it is a little pricey but it is well worth the money. Shoot. . . If I had known it worked as well as it claimed I would have paid full price for it!
  88. I have tried every electric razor on the market, including all of the Brauns. This Pulsonic system is the BEST shave of all of them; by far! Great job P&G / Braun!
  89. Both my father and I received the Braun 9595 Shaving System as gifts just recently. Neither of us have ever experienced a shave as good as the Braun 9595 with the exception of a hot lather razor shave. The Braun shaver provides a shave that is close to that of a razor shave. After shaving, I rinse the shaver head at the faucet and return the shaver to the cleaning system for the final cleaning. This works great for both my dad & I. We always have a clean shaver ready for the next shave. Thank you Braun.
  90. Many years ago I had tried an electric shaver, which did not shave very well and left me with razer burn. At that time I switched back to a razor blade. I recently started shaving my head and had been cutting myself alot lately so I decided I would try the electric shaver again. After seeing a pulsonic commercial and reading the reviews here I bought one.<br /><br />This does work pretty well, not as good as a razer blade. I do find that the hairs on my chin seem to be very difficult to trim. This shaver works very well on my head, although towards the end, the foil does feel much warmer. Since I have changed I have not cut myself shaving. The shave is not as close as the 3 blade razer, but it cuts close enough to keep me presentable. If someone was looking for an electric shaver I would reccomend this one, but it does still fall short with compared to using a blade.
  91. A little over priced. But if you are willing to spend the money then this is a great product for you. Very close easy shave. Excellent shaver.
  92. I bought this product as a gift for my husband and he seems to like it very much.The only complaint he has is that he needs to stretch his skin to get a closer shave. He is happy with the time he saves compared with blade shaving.
  93. I bought the Braun 9595 electric shaver with hopes that it would give my husband a close shave and not irritate his neck.   94. Best men's electric razor I've ever tried, and I've tried 'em all! Closest shave with no discomfort.
  95. Shaving with ultrasonic power is fantastic - a close, smooth shave with almost no skin irritation. The cleaning mode is a bit noisy and consumes the cleaning solution faster than probably necessary - but overall the system works really well.
  96. Surely the best electric razor I have used. I have used electric razors for over 30 years and this product performs unlike anything else I have tried. With a quick growing stubble and often formed ingrown hairs, this razor is my savior. The price is the largest hurdle to address, but for me I am glad I made the purchase. The only other drawback I see is the system uses an internal 'usage' meter. Even if you clean the razor by hand or rinse it out, the meter will only 'reset' if you use the razors own internal cleaning system (and thus use up the disposable cleaning cartridge). But all in all, yes - to date - the best.
  97. once you get passed the inital stage of grooming your hairs from a regular razor to an electric razor it is a great shave. i recommend anyone looking for a good razor to purchase this one.
  98. I have a very tough beard. If I shave(razor) at 5AM I have a shadow by 6AM. The Braun 9595 is the best electric razor I've used so far. The shave gives me a very smooth shave that lasts most of the day. If I choose not to use my safety razor (for the closest shave I can get) I will shave with the Braun twice in a day. The pop-up trimmer allows me to get to some difficult spots and trims very easily. Braun has made the cleaning and charging a snap. Plug the shaver in, charge, clean afterwards and get one of the best shaves possible!
  99. I am 54 years old... travel constantly... in hotels, etc... so far this shaver has held its charge for almost a week at a time... it is QUIET...nice, does not wake my wife in the morning!
