Jury still out on how long it will be until i have to buy a new blade attachment... have not had it but a month...
  100. I bought this shaver 6 months ago based on the great reviews in Amazon. My experience has not been that great. The shaver has trouble picking up longer hair, and I find myself going over rough spots in the evening.   101. Well, I admit that I am a girl and have never shaved my face once. I am pretty much an all wax girl with very light hair color, so an electric shaver is not really on my radar screen. BUT....I do have a brother in law and he dose have birthdays. I purchased one of these for his last birthday and believe it or not, he loves the things. It is the first gift I have ever bought him that he even vaguely thanked me for.<br /><br />My brother in law has a very heavy beard. Actually at times I wonder if my sister did not marry out of her species. We are talking a big and hairy dude who is not all that on the bright side. After using this shaver, he actually looks like a human..sort of. I questioned him about the shaver and he stated he had no problems figuring out how it worked (guys, if he can figure out technique then trust me, you can too), and he felt that it shaved him as close as his razor. We were all thrilled about this as it always sort of worries the family when he handles sharp instruments.<br /><br />My sister is happy, which if you know her, is almost an almost impossibility as she has never been happy with anything a day in her life, and this is a big plus for me.<br /><br />I paid quite a bit more for this shaver than they are asking on Amazon so for the money I think you are getting a pretty good deal here.<br /><br />I do not know about actually using this thing, but I do know it was a great gift.
  102. I just purchased a Series 7-790 cc shaver to replace my Series 5-8995 one. The Series 7 is ergonomically superior and feels great in your hand. It will take me a while to get used to the side cutter as it is narrower than on the Series 5 but the quality of the shave is a definite improvement. I find it to be significantly closer than the Series 5. This is Braun's best shaver yet.
  103. feels like a race car in your hand strong powerful motor clean smooth shave best electric i've ever used
  104. I have owned at least 10 different electric razors in my time, including 5 different Braun models. While the Pulsonic system does have some advantages over previous \\"technology\\" it still doesn't out-shave my other Braun shavers as much as I expected and hoped for considering the marketing hype and, of course, the high price. My last Braun also had the self-cleaning system...was top of the line when I bought it a few years ago...and it works about 90% as well.<br />I would have rated it 4 stars, but I factored in the value (high price) as well as the quality. If you have the type of beard I do...grows in all different directions depending on what part of my face/neck...and also grows almost flat to my skin (as oppposed to sticking straight out) which can create ingrown hairs and difficulty getting a really close shave...you may do what I do...and that's use more than one type of shaver at the same time. A rotary shaver works on my neck best. And to get a truly close shave...sometimes I even have to use a third shaver (an inexpensive braun) that happens to work particularly well on my lip and chin. I had great hopes for the Pulsonic...that it was truly as revolutionary as the marketing hype and I could retire all my other razors...but, it's not all that.<br />The Pulsonic also takes me much longer to shave...having to go over areas several times to get a close shave. However, I do have to say that it does shave with an easy and softer (therefore less irritating) glide over the skin...and for those whom have good success with other electric razors...this one is definitely better than previously available razors!
  105. I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband, so he's only been using it about 3 months, but it's been great. He says it gives a good shave and the cleaning system is almost fun.   108. I upgraded my old Braun 7500 series to the new Braun Pulsonic System 9595 recently, and I must say that this new shaver has given me the best shave I ever had to date with an electric razor. The power and smoothness is awesome. No razor burn nor any problems tackling whiskers regardless of which way they grow. The cleaning system (which uses the same cleaning cartridges as older models) regulates how much cleaning is needed between shaves, saving the need to replace the cleaner too often. If you like using an electric razor this is the unit to get. Well worth it.
  109. I've used Braun shavers exclusively for about 25 years. And, until now, was very happy with them. This one just doesn't shave very well for me. I've used it now for a few months hoping it would improve but it hasn't. Even if I make a concerted effort to get a close shave I can feel, and see, stubble - mostly around my lips. I can remove that leftover stubble easily with my older Braun Contour 5790 shaver. I had an even older model Braun with a dead battery but I plugged that in to see and it can also easily remove the stubble left behind by the Pulsonic. I talked to a service rep thinking mine must be faulty but they said that was very unlikely. It seems the Pulsonic (and its predecessor) have a completely redesigned cutting system and it just doesn't work well for my whiskers. I don't think they're unusual but I guess so - perhaps they lay flatter than most - I have no idea. It does a great job on my thinner neck hairs which the previous shavers didn't do great on. And, I love the feel of the Pulsonic, the sound, and the cleaning system. But, when my five o'clock shadow appears at noon I really miss my old shaver. I've given this one plenty of time - I'll be looking to purchase something else soon.

  114. The Braun 9595 is expensive, but is worth it. I've now been using it for about a month to shave my face and head. It is the closest shave I've ever had from an electric (previous experience with Norelco and Remington). With a little work it is virtually as close as a shave with a blade. A few nits. The screen can get a little hot when you are using it. Also, the only way to have the razor's display show it as being clean is to use the stand. If you use it away from the stand, it will show that it is dirty no matter what you do to try and clean it, but it does not affect its performance any. Otherwise it is 100%.
  115. I've been shaving for 35 years now, the first 10 with blade shavers. My first electric was a Remington which worked but didn't shave nearly as close as I liked. I then bought a Norelco triple head (forget the model) and really liked it. Close shave and not too bad to clean up using the little brush supplied with it. That one lasted quite a while but eventually quit. The new Norelco that replaced it was just plain aweful. It didn't shave close and the power brick was a pain to use if you had to pack it for travel. Worse yet is that the thing only lasted a couple of years and then wouldn't hold a charge. I reluctantly bought the latest model Remington and achieved similar results. I was considering going back to a blade shaver. Fortunately I read about the Pulsonic and bought one. I'm glad I did! This thing shaves closer than any electric or blade I have ever used. It's as fast or faster than the Norelco, and gets in the tough to reach areas much better. Even the trimmer works far better than any of the others! The cleaning system is phenominal and leaves the razor with a clean lemon scent. I have used the original cartridge for over 3 weeks now and it is still working. I signed up here at Amazon for the subscription service that sends 2 cartridges automatically every 3 months for a LOT less than the local stores. All in all, I would recommend this shaver to anyone looking for the best shave in an electric.
  116. I've owned this product for almost a year, and before that I used another Braun with my brother (the alcohol cleaning let me not worry about sharing). Before coming into the electric razors, I used to use typical straight blades. I had noticed that after a week, maybe a little more, the blade was useless. In addition, my skin is sensitive and I had a tendency to get a lot of ingrown hairs. The way I'd get the closest shave is to shave against the grain which needless to say, caused more ingrain hairs than I wanted. I became an expert with tweezers as a man to get rid of these, and I really felt there must be a better way. The first electric I used was about a year and a half ago, and since my brother moved he took it with him and I replaced it with the Pulsonic. And regardless of whether it be the Pulsonic, or the older Braun Syncro (using the same cleaning system as the Pulsonic), I found a world of change in shaving. My hair is thick and grows back reasonably fast. I shave every other day still, because I can get away with it. But coming from a regular razor, it took me about two weeks to get used to the electric. I forced myself to do it initially -- I was tired of paying for the replacement blades for my Mach3. It was getting pretty expensive. However with the Bed Bath and Beyond 20% coupons, I got the refills for the shaver pretty cheap -- and they lasted quite a while as well. I have never enjoyed shaving, and even with the electric I don't. It takes a little more effort to get the hair that grows on your neck, since they grow in awkward directions (at least for me). I have to make several passes before I get them all. Additionally, I use my hand to make sure that the surface I've used the razor on is smooth, because often the razor can miss some hairs, and you need to go back over it. But despite those minor inconveniences, I am ecstatic about shaving with this over a regular blade. The only way I get a shave as close as the electric, is if I go against the grain with a regular blade. Yes folks -- shaving with the electric gives me as close a shave as a normal razor. I don't suffer any longer from red spots on my face, no more cuts, no more ingrown hairs. I wash my face after I shave with a gentle wash, and moisturize with a light moisturizer. My skin feels great. My family tells me it is soft to the touch. And this coming from a guy who was known to have a brillo pad for a face most of the time. I'm very happy with the purchase. Over the Braun Syncro (older model), I'd say the Pulsonic is better but not amazingly better. It does a better job, gets less hot, and I like that I can plug it in directly as well if I need to. The cartridges are cheap on Amazon (get the 3 packs!), and if you want to make them last a little longer -- clean the blade and shaver under some hot water and tap it out on your sink. It will work for two shaves without a problem. I took it on vacation for a week and just rinsed it -- it worked fine throughout, though the \\"Hygiene\\" indicator dipped low. Came back home, threw it into the base and it went through an exhaustive cleaning process -- and it was smelling fresh and new. I'm very, very pleased with it. And for those trying to make the switch from conventional blades and don't like them -- do it! This is a product worth buying.
  117. Braun, a company built on design to solve customer problems, appears to have lost their way with the Pulsonic systems. Until now, I've aways been a fan of their \\"function-dictates-form\\" method, however in this product things went sub-par.<br /><br />It's an okay shave. As with any electric shaver, you have to repeat areas, to get that \\"closer than a blade,\\" look. What gets me is, for $200+, I expect something significantly better from my Braun 5775 and it's not. I spend no less time when using the 9595, but there are spots on my face (e.g. under the lower lip, below the cheekbones) that the 5775 seems to pick up faster. While \\"Pulsonic Technology\\" (i.e. faster oscillations) works slightly better in most areas, there are a few areas where it significantly underperforms.<br /><br />The shaving cartridge now combines the foil and the cutter, which you can't easily clean due to the design. Thus, you need the cleaning system provided by the 9595's base. However, you still want to clean the cartridge as the hair, etc. lands in the cleaning fluid. Over time, the pretty blue cleaning fluid becomes a disgusting gray, creating a gooey mass. Is it safe to dump fluid? (I wish Braun had said if it was.) It's possible that the faster oscillations required the integration of the cutter and foil, but it's also possible Braun wanted to sell an expensive base and the cleaning solution cartridges - now there selling two kinds of \\"blades\\" for their \\"razor.\\"<br /><br />The base looks nice, however, Braun opted to use the same power plug system they have been using for years. It's a black cord with the AC to DC transformer connected to the wall-plug. You've just paid $200+ dollars for a pretty white shaving system and then you have this ugly black cord with a huge transformer sticking out of the wall. For $200+, there could have been a transformer in the base of the 9595 system. On the plus side, when I have to get the spots that my 9595 missed with 5775, I can use the same power cord.<br /><br />Being a gadget geek, my office with its computers and electronic gear, looks like a swarm of fireflies when I turn off the lights. Personally, I'd rather it just be dark. I wish electronics vendors would dump the gratuitous LEDs. I am not going to be using the 9595 in the dark, and I do not need a blue LED (on the shaver) and two green LEDs (on the base). The shaver have an LCD display in the base, why have mutiple informational interfaces?<br /><br />Finally, why, after paying a ransom, does this shaver not have a replaceable battery? Lithium-ion batteries will wear out after a few years. The marketing copy on the cartridges which claims the system is like new when you replace the cleaning cartridge is overlooking the expensive cutter/foil $36, the cleaning cartridges 2 for $10 and, finally, the battery.<br /><br />Adding insult to injury, after a year without replacing the cartridge, the base would no longer do the brief \\"econo clean.\\" It was as if the system was passively aggressively insisting I replace the cartridge. And, after replacing the cartridge, the system again would do the \\"econo clean.\\" That's not a feature, that's a nuisance.<br /><br />Since my 5775 was a quarter the cost of the 9595 and that the Braun brand is a strong one, I expected more. It's a good shaver, but the value this shaver gives is not worth the cost. I fear I fell into the hype of \\"Pulsonic Technology.\\"y office with its computers and electronic gear, looks like a swarm of fireflies when I turn off the lights. Personally, I'd rather it just be dark. I wish electronics vendors would dump the gratuitous LEDs. I am not going to be using the 9595 in the dark, and I do not need a blue LED (on the shaver) and two green LEDs (on the base). The shaver have an LCD display in the base, why have mutiple informational interfaces? Finally, why, after paying a ransom, does this shaver not have a replaceable battery? Lithium-ion batteries will wear out after a few years. The marketing copy on the cartridges which claims the system is like new when you replace the cleaning cartridge is overlooking the expensive cutter/foil $36, the cleaning cartridges 2 for $10 and, finally, the battery. Adding insult to injury, after a year without replacing the cartridge, the base would no longer do the brief \\"econo clean.\\" It was as if the system was passively aggressively insisting I replace the cartridge. And, after replacing the cartridge, the system again would do the \\"econo clean.\\" That's not a feature, that's a nuisance. Since my 5775 was a quarter the cost of the 9595 and that the Braun brand is a strong one, I expected more. It's a good shaver, but the value this shaver gives is not worth the cost. I fear I fell into the hype of \\"Pulsonic Technology.\\"

  123. I've owned a lot of shavers and like other reviewers, was looking for a better solution. Bought the expensive 9595 as soon as it was available. It does shave closely/well...which is the primary objective. However, there are some downsides I've found in the year+ of ownership: 1) Very loud cleaning cycle! I have to do it early evening, because if I do it at night or in the morning, it keeps my wife awake (even with the door closed) and the dog also paces/whines. 2) Expensive Clean/Renew cartridges. You go through one about every month-6 weeks and at $6+/each, ... 3) Lately, the shaver just shuts off mid-shave after about 5 minutes, despite a full charge, fresh clean/renew cycle and a new cutter/foil head. Very frustrating. 4) Some of the silver paint near the shaver head has been flaking off. Wonder if it's from the clean/renew formulation. 5) The pop out clipper head (as of 2 days ago) doesn't pop back in and refuses to seat back into the shaver body, so I have to hold it closed while I shave.
  124. I bought this something like a month ago. It was bought sight unseen. I like to keep my razors for more than a couple of years and my old Braun razor was old enough that replacement blades were hard to come by. The Braun 9595 was a huge step up. I used Norelcos rotary shavers years ago, hated them. Then switched to Remmington razors but they were tough to buy replacement blades for after a year or two. I was overseas long term and my remington razor died. I picked up a Braun at the suggestion of a friend of mine and it worked so well I'd never think of switching to another brand. But time wore on as did replacement blades and they became tough to buy so I upped the money and bought a Braun 4000 or 7000 series, I think. Well it still works but blades are tough to buy. I bough the latest and greatest and most expensive Braun out there. the 9595. I have trouble shaving my neck, the hairs tend to grow sideways. It's misey to shave even with my old Braun. But this new one just shaves the hairs right off my face, no razor burn, nothing! I turn it on and chean it after about 3 shaves. It's a bit noisy on intensive clean, however I'm usually taking a shower so I don't care and it really cleans the razor very well. I did buy a replacement blade and will probably buy a couple more for when I go overseas again. I love the way this razor shaves. I'd buy another one in a minute. It's the best shaver I've ever owned. I don't think it shaves a lot closer than my old Braun but it doesn't give me any razor burn either and that alone is worth it. If you are thinking about buying one of these it's worth it. It just shaves so smoothly and easily and I have to shave every single day, so comfort is very high on my list and the hair doesn't grow back as fast for some reason. I usually have stubble by 3pm if I shave at 8am. Not with this razor, so that's another plus. I also bought a pack of cleaning solution. My biggest concern is will I be able to pack the solution in my luggage,since they don't sell this in the country I work in. I never thought I'd spend this much on a razor but I'm glad i bought it. I hope this review helps someone out.
  125. Nice shaving results- best I ever had in my last 20 years of machine shaving. nice design. Disadvantages: Can't shave under shower (although can be rinsed in water) fairly big
  126. Smooth operation, BUT you need space to plug this razor in for cleanibg---NOT near water in bathroom or near sink
  127. My husband has used braun for years and likes the fact that you can clean the razor in hygienic fluid after shaving.
  128. I had a Braun Series 5 for about 5 years and it did a great job, so when it quit working I \\"upgraded\\" to the Series 7. What a mistake. This things does nothing very well and costs much more. It pulls hair, doesn't shave close and the postion of the trimmer makes it very difficult to see what you are doing. Avoid this shaver.

Use this shaver and you are unlikely to consider any other brand again. Smooth, clean shave. Easy to maintain. Only wish the pop-up trimmer had a straight and not curved cutting edge.
  133. Update: After 10 months of ownership I can conclude that the Braun is an exceptionally good \\"dry shaving\\" razor -- with one problem. I have had to replace the blades at about every 2.5 months. At a cost of about 40 bucks per replacement this is adding up. I have a heavy (but not thick) beard. I also have sensitive skin. So if I do not keep sharp blades, the shaver will cause razor bumps. I am actually considering switching back to Panasonic Dry/Wet Shaver given (1) the cost, (2) I can get three to four months use from their blades. Well I've now owned this shaver for three months. Previous to owning this shaver I was a completely dedicated Panasonic Dry/Wet Shaver user. While I loved the close shave the Panasonic provided, I was tied to the shower. As a dry shaver, the Braun 7 series has now cut my dependency on wet shaving. My beard is tough but my skin is sensitive - the Braun 7 to date has provided me an exceptionally close shave, but more importantly has not left me with damaged skin. However, even though the manufacturer recommends replacing the blade yearly, I can already sense that I will need to replace the blade after three months of use -- of course I had to just about do the same with the Panasonic. The good: close shave, long lasting charge, easy to clean. The bad: THE PRICE, the flip up trimmer is flimsy and the blade lockout for shaving above the lip is worthless.
  134. The Braun shaver has performed far better than I had hoped. I read other reviews and followed some of their advice for better performance. I have been a blade user all my life but the Braun has changed my mind.
  135. The new Braun shaver is superior in every aspect!! Quiet and shaves CLOSE !!
  136. I really wanted to like this shaver, especially given the price. Unfortunately, it is the worst shaver I have ever used. It simply does not shave close at all. I should have stuck with my Braun 7680 and just replaced the cutter and foil block.
  137. I am a new user of the Braun series Pulsonic shaver and am very satisfied with its performance. It is much easier to cover large areas of my face, especially squaring off my sideburns, and I have tried many brands of electric shavers. Furthermore, the pressure is minimal with good cutting action. Though I am nearly 90 years of age, retired with plenty of time on my hands, I still like the speed with which I can accomplish this necessary daily task. Also, the cleaning feature is slick!
  138. This Braun shaver series seven, matches the claims made for its effectiveness. Having tried electric shavers in the past, this is the only one that cuts my beard with hairs growing in at a variety of angles in a smooth consistent way. Always before, I had to revert to my wet shave razor blade technology, but not this time. I needed an electric shaver due to broken bones in my right shoulder preventing me from using my right hand, and I am right handed. I could use this shaver with my left hand while my bones were healing, and much to my surprise I got a very close shave, with a minimum of razor burn. I plan to make this my permanent shaver and can eliminate the wet shave altogether except in an electrical blackout/emergency lasting several days.

  140. I have owned Braun shavers for the last 15 years and the Series 7 is the best shaver yet! It is a fast shave and it is as close to a blade that you will find. Highly recommended.
  141. The pressure facing health and beauty grooming appliances is tough... they have to constantly think of new and better ways to improve their products, EVEN THOUGH they may have already reached a technological ceiling. It's because of the competitive nature of the business. They could make subtle improvements in an existing shaver and price it less, but people won't buy it because there isn't some compelling difference. So, companies keep trying to invent catch phrases and ambiguous functionality, in order to keep prices up (with the illusion that you're getting more if you pay more).<br /><br />How much better can a foil shaver get? Braun reached a major pinnacle with the 7000 series. The Syncro line was the first introducing a head cleaning system, as well as a faster motor with side-to-side vibration. You take a shave with a 7000 series and this new 7 series, and guess what? You won't feel a noticeable difference. A few other reviewers have noticed this as well.<br /><br />Having been a Braun shaver owner for over 15 years, my latest model is the 8595 Activator. It is the equivalent to the 9595, only being from the previous generation. It has almost everything the 9595 has, except for the new casing design and the indicator that tells you when to change the shaving head cassette.<br /><br />I happened to have a friend who bought one of these and managed to get him to loan it to me for a week (we traded shavers). Guess what? After a week, we compared notes and discovered that we BOTH found the shaving performance identical between the 8595 Activator and the 790cc Pulsonic (9595).<br /><br />Braun lauds its \\"new\\" Pulsonic technology, but in essence it is the same technology they've had since the 7000 series. Quite frankly, I don't think it's worth spending an extra $100 to get the Series 7 model. Instead, I'd buy a new old stock 8595 or 8995 model for about $100 cheaper. Also, you'll save quite a bit of money of the long haul on head replacements. The 9595 (790) uses a \\"cassette\\", which is essentially the foil and cutter block combined into one unit. You cannot buy them separately. You damage the foil? The whole thing requires replacing. Why did Braun do this? Well... to close a loop hole. On the earlier models, you can replace just the cutter block and keep the your current foil. After all, if the foil is undamaged, it is still doing its job. From a shaving outlet, you can buy the 8000 series cutter block for just $10. The 9595 cassette costs $50! You do the math...lly the foil and cutter block combined into one unit. You cannot buy them separately. You damage the foil? The whole thing requires replacing. Why did Braun do this? Well... to close a loop hole. On the earlier models, you can replace just the cutter block and keep the your current foil. After all, if the foil is undamaged, it is still doing its job. From a shaving outlet, you can buy the 8000 series cutter block for just $10. The 9595 cassette costs $50! You do the math...
  142. My results with the Pulsonic are not baby's butt smooth across my bread. However, I've tried everything available except a straight razor, and nothing gets there. There are always areas where rubbing against the grain will detect minute stubble. Even with an aggressive razor (Merkur Slant Bar with Feather blades) and aggressive techniques (blade buffing and j-hooking), that stubble can not be removed without cuts or razor burn. The Pulsonic is a significant improvement over previous Braun shavers. I can get the same results in 2 minutes with the Pulsonic compared to 15 minutes with a wet shave. That wins my vote.
  143. I've been using Braun eletric razors for years now. This one, by far, is the absolute best that Braun has come out with. If you haven't used an electric razor in a while, you already know that it may take a few weeks for your facial hair to adjust to the electric razor from regular razors. Use Lectric Shave or something of the like. My razor began to cut as close as a blade within only 4 uses! I love this model! Better quality parts, the LED display on the bottom is great, and the new foil on the head is fantastic! This is the electric razor to get above all others.

I could not find the receipt so I called Braun CS again and was told it was still in warranty according to the Serial Number. I sent the shaver to the repair shop and yesterday I received a brand new system with the series 7, model 790cc shaver for free. THANK YOU Braun!

After 13 months (still within 2 year warranty), the motor would stop dead in mid-shave, especially when there are 3-4 bars in the charge indicator. It seemed to increase in speed before quitting. Would re-start immediately at full speed, but then die again within 10-20 seconds. Also, the slide-up trimmer spring mechanism is jamming - not allowing the door to close flush with the shaver body. You have to hold down the door with your thumb while shaving. Brought to Braun authorized repair store, they have had it for 3 weeks so far. For $300+ initial purchase price, they probably could have afforded to completely replace the dropped one (and think about redesigning).. I cant prove it, but I have a nagging feeling I cant shake, that I have been screwed for $300+ for this shaver. The shave seemed great at first.. But it did seem the razor foil needed to be snapped down (something after you initially snap it into place).. before the shave became great.. Unfortunately, the great shave feel didnt last..   150. I bought the Braun 790cc thinking it was the best on the market. You see, I've used blades for years but hate the amount of time it adds to my morning grooming. So my search for the best electric razor began. After getting the braun home I was in love with its build quality. You would think this was made by Apple it is so sturdy. Unfortunately, after my first shave with my new shiny razor I wasn't too impressed. The cheeks and mandible was acceptable but my neck was really not good at all. After a week of shaving I had got better with controlling the razor but shaving took quite a while and I would need to make several passes to get all the stubble, and still there was some left on my neck that I would quickly clean up with my fusion proglide. Just for kicks I went out and bought the Norelco sensotouch 3d to compare and the results are interesting. First, the sensotouch is much easier to shave with since it conforms to your face as you move it from one part to the next and it takes fewer passes through the same area to get a clean shave thus greatly reducing the amount of time it takes to shave. (Quite honestly, I spend at most 1/2 the time shaving with the sensotouch as with the series 7) It doesn't shave as comfortably as the series 7 but I would hardly say it was uncomfortable and I experienced no irritation or redness. I really wanted to love the series 7, thats why I bought it first; but in the end, for the money, the Norelco sensotouch 3d does win out. The shave was just as close if not closer, easier, quieter, and faster. Sorry Braun, but you got beat!
  151. I expected an outstanding shave with this \\"top of the line\\" razor. As it turns out, my 7 year old Remington MS3-4700, which has 4 year old cutting blades, shaves closer than this Braun did out of the box. I will give it points for giving an extremely comfortable shave, but that becomes meaningless when you have a shadow 2 hours after shaving. With all the outstanding reviews this model has gotten, perhaps my beard just doesn't go well with this razor - who knows. My Braun foil shaver I had before my Remington (about 10 years ago) gave a much closer shave, for sure.

  153. I've been shaving with an electric for around eleven months. I've tried the Norelco Arcitec 1090cc and the Panasonic Arc IV ES8243. I couldn't get a very close shave with the Arcitec. The Panasonic shaves me as close as the 790cc but if I'm not careful it can be a bit irritating, and the 790cc shaves me faster. I can honestly say that I'm completely satisfied with a shaver at last. I thought an adjustment period was not necessary coming from another foil shaver. I was wrong. After two months the shaves have improved greatly. Maybe it takes three weeks to adapt to a new shaver, but it takes longer to master it. I do get better shaves than with a manual razor because, in my case, if I shave with a manual razor against the grain I get ingrown hairs and irritation, so I can only shave with the grain. With the 790cc I can get a very close shave that lasts for 12 hours, in 5 minutes. This shaver is very forgiving and cuts my coarse, thick beard like a hot knife through butter. It's a pleasure to use. It's my first shaver with a cleaning module, and although I don't mind rinsing a shaver under the faucet, automatic cleaning is very convenient, and you get a shaver that looks and smells like new every time. I wasn´t very impressed with the design at first, but it has grown on me. When you hold and shave with this shaver it feels very natural. I get closer shaves if I shave every other day, with this, or any other shaver. It's not the perfect shaver, but it's darn close.
  154. This is my second electric shave I've purchased, the first one being a Braun Activator 8595 from about 5 or 6 years ago. I had originally purchased that razor, as I am very fair skinned, and as such have very sensitive skin as well. While I loved the smoothness of a Mach3, it destroyed my face. I would break out after shaving, and my face would be extremely irritated. No combo of different shaving gels/aftershave lotions mattered. So, I researched the Braun Activator 8595, and purchased it. This gave me just as smooth of a shave as the mach3, but with some exceptions. Certain parts of my face, I couldn't get as smooth as the rest. That being, the sides of my neck, the chin, my cheeks under the eyes, and right below the ear lobe under the jaw. My shave took 10 minutes,and I didn't have any irritation/breakout problems. The mach3 shave would keep me smooth for almost 2 days (I do not have to shave everyday, more like every 2-3), where the Braun would last almost a day. Recently, I went ahead and gave my Braun to a family member, as he was interested in it, vs. his old rotary norelco, and this gave me a good excuse to upgrade to the latest electric shaver on the market. After some research, Braun gets my money again. How does this shaver compare to the old champion? Smoothness wise, I'd give a slight edge to the 790. But, where the shave truly shines now is the ease of getting that smoothness. The razor does the job in half the time, and there is no where on my face that is a problem anymore. Before if I'd let my facial hair go, the 8595 would pull hair. This thing just mows right through, with nary a pull. Braun was able to fix any issues I had with the old version, and make a razor that is better in everyway. It fits in your hand better, its faster, quieter, adjusts to your face better, and one of my biggest issues, is I can force a clean whenever I want. The horrible slider power button is gone, so no more accidentally turning it off while using it. I even like the way the head locks better, as now its a small flick of the thumb, vs. the old slider method. I only wish they made the LCD display illuminate, but its no big deal. It not like you really need the readout, as there is no reason not to clean it every time, and it'll get charged in the process. This is truly the ultimate in electric razors, as any of the normal complaints you would hear about them, do not exist on this razor. There is no reason to want to use a mach80 or whatever they're up to now, and pay $15+ for 5 blades, that last maybe 2 weeks each, and remove 10 layers of skin. While the price is high on this, remember, that the blades last 18 months, and solution lasts alittle over a month, and is relatively cheap if you buy the bulk packages online. Manual shaves spread the cost out over time with there cheap entry fee and steep replacement blades. With this, its cheaper, but all up front. You will not be disappointed in this product.
  155. I shave both my face and head so there's a lot of area to cover! I used to use Norelco shavers which were \\"OK\\" but not entirely satisfied. I heard how Braun shavers give closer shave and took a chance on buying this \\"Cadillac\\" model. I've been using it for about a week now. Shaving time cut in half. I'm getting closer shaves. In fact first few shaves I caused some bleeding as I was pressing it down hard like with rotary shavers. At first I was worried that maybe I made the wrong decision. But after getting used to it, I love it. The self cleaning method is great and easy. I shave with a \\"new\\" electric razor every day. You can save on the solution if you take the shaving head off and gently tapping the bottom to remove the hair, and rinsing it in hot water, and dry it with a hair dryer ( I finally have some use for my old hair dryer since I'm a \\"smooth head\\" now! ). It always cleans in \\"eco\\" mode if you do that. For people who make their own solution because of the expense of the cartilages, I say spending $7 a month is a bargain! I was spending more just to buy a month worth of \\"lectric shave\\" when I used to use a rotary razor. If you can afford this razor, you can afford $7 a month on a replacement cartilage. I bought a dozen on Amazon for $67.94. Also I don't know why, but this razor shaves better if you don't wash your face before you use it. I made a mistake the first time I used it, I took a shower and applied \\"lectric shave\\" like I would with a rotary, and my face was bloody mess! Natural oil on your skin makes it for a better shave on this exellent shaver.<br /><br />Great shaver. I'm a Braun user for life.

I looked long and hard at all the reviews before I decided to spend this kind of money for a shaver. The thing that interested me most was the cleaning system. I have used many shavers that were just a royal pain to clean. Put this one back in the stand and presto, it's clean! I have been using it for just over a month and I love it. Not only is it easy to clean but it really does shave like a blade. Well almost but you won't cut yourself trying. One trouble spot I have is long hairs that used to appear from nowhere. What a pain it was to get rid of them. Well this shaver says it will take them off and sure enough, it does! The long hair trimmer is why I did not give this shaver a five star rating. (Not what I was speaking about above) I have gotten used to having one on my other shavers and use it to trim sideburns and ear hair. The trimmer on this shaver is positioned so that when you pop it open it is below the shaver head. This makes it very hard to see what you are doing, and it feels awkward using it. It works fine, it's just hard. I travel a lot and was concerned about the liquid making a mess. Don't throw away the cap for the cleaning fluid. Just take the container out of the base and seal it up. No problem. For short trips I don't even take the base. The power cord is all you need and just rinse the shaver per the instructions. I would not hesitate to recommend this shaver to anyone.

  165. I'm deployed in Afghanistan right now, and I brought my Braun 5 series with me. It worked for about 2 weeks after I got here and then started to die on me in the middle of shaving. I could squeeze it and have it pick back up in speed, but then it would die again. So I ended up wrapping rubber bands around it to keep it going. That too eventually stopped working after 2 weeks. So I decided, that since I enjoyed my last Braun I should look into a new one. When I saw this one, I remembered commercials I saw on TV when I was back home and thought, Yeah that's the one I want. Then I saw the price tag. It was steep. I'm pretty low on the pay scale and $300 is a lot of money. So, I was like ok, that's too much and I went to using the pack of disposable razors I had with me. You always have to be prepared in the military. After 2 days of absolute misery with these disposables, I caved in. I dropped the 300 dollars and ordered it. Then it said it would arrive between the middle of February and March! I was irritated but I need a good razor, so I went ahead and ordered it. So 4 days later I get a package and low and behold it was the razor. I still had stubble from earlier in the morning when I had attempted to shave. So when I got off shift, the first thing I did was to open the box and get the razor charged. I read a little in the manual while I waited for it to clean and charge, and then it was time! When I finally had the opportunity to use it, it was like a stubble eraser! It didn't even feel like I was shaving! No rough anything rubbing across my skin, no pulling, not even the sensation of cutting. NOTHING! It was like my hair was magically disappearing with the pass of the magic wand called the 7 series! I even popped up the trimmer to clean up my side burns and hair line around my ears. It cut off the hair without me even noticing. I didn't even realize I had gotten any hair until I saw the clump on the ground. And even with the trimmer up, it was quieter than my last Braun was when just shaving. This thing is extremely quiet for an electric razor and so nice that I was actually spending more time than necessary to shave in the morning. I found myself just rubbing the thing across my face because I couldn't believe how smooth it was. I was actually having fun shaving. Something I learned to dread in the military. Any chance I could get away without doing it, I would! After using this product I might just pretend like I have to shave just so I can take it out of its nice hard plastic case that came with it. Thank you Braun for making such an incredible product.Braun was when just shaving. This thing is extremely quiet for an electric razor and so nice that I was actually spending more time than necessary to shave in the morning. I found myself just rubbing the thing across my face because I couldn't believe how smooth it was. I was actually having fun shaving. Something I learned to dread in the military. Any chance I could get away without doing it, I would! After using this product I might just pretend like I have to shave just so I can take it out of its nice hard plastic case that came with it. Thank you Braun for making such an incredible product.
  166. My Braun 7526 model, after 8 years, is starting to die down on me. So I came here to read reviews on other models, and was pretty hyped up about all the positive reviews of the pulsonic model. It left quite a lot of stubble and long hairs on my face. I thought, well, maybe I need an adjustment period, but day after day the same thing. Finally, I decided to use my old braun after shaving with the pulsonic and I couldn't believe how much hair my older model started clearing off my face. I could hear the blades cutting all the hair the newer model had left behind! Well, needless to say, I have returned the product back to Braun for a refund. I am still using my older model and have decided to just order the same one again. Very big disappointment on what was supposed to be this great new technology.
  167. This product rocks the hair right off my face! I've also tried it on my head and it works almost as good. Great product Braun!! The only downfall I might see (and its only minor) is the cleaning solution. You can shave with it several times before you need to clean.
  168. I bought this for my boy-friend for Christmas (2009). He had been using razors all his life and they have caused skin irritations. He really likes this shaver. Of course it does not shave as closely as the razors but it creates a smooth surface that does not scratch my facial skin. Have not dealt with cleaning yet I heard it can be expensive and a hassle so I am cautious and gave a 4-star.
  169. I waited about 2 years longer than I wanted to purchase a new electric razor because I wasn't thrilled with the products available. When I saw this electric razor, I decided it was time to upgrade. I have had it for a few months now and I have been generally disappointed. It's not that this isn't a great product, I was just expecting more from it. My old electric razor was the Braun 7526 and it was pretty awesome. I used it regularly for about 5 years before upgrading to the 790cc. The things that bother me most about the 790cc are its sideburn trimmer and similarity in shave to the 7526. The sideburn trimmer is much weaker than the 7526 and considering that the upgrade cost a few hundred dollars, I expected the shaving experience to be better, not comparable. If you're getting into electric razors for the first time, then this is definitely a great product. However, if you are satisfied with the one you have and are just looking for an upgrade, then I would holdout a little longer. I find myself using the 7526 over the 790cc most days and that's annoying.
  170. Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver<br /><br />I had been a faithful user of Norelco shavers ever since I started shaving in my teen years and they worked really well for me. As I am now in my mid 40's I have more than my fair share of grey whiskers. These whiskers are much thicker than the dark brown whiskers they replaced. My Norelco was not able to cut these whiskers any longer. I called Phillips Norelco and asked them if they made a shaver that would handle my problem and after some discussion it was clear that I was going to have to find a new shaver. After months of research and reading literally 100's of user reviews from several different sources, I decided to try the Braun Series 7. I am very impressed with this shaver. Not only does it tackle my grey beard with ease, it gives me the closest shave I have ever had. The Charging / Cleaning base is very nice but is a bit bulky. It will not fit on small vanity's therfore I have mine sitting in my home office next to my printer. It has a nice travel case with a brush in the end for cleaning the shaver while away from home.<br /><br />A word for perspective buyers. Read and follow the directions carefully. Shave before washing your face or showering. Shave against the direction that the whiskers are laying. Return the shaver to it's Charging/Cleaning cradle after use and clean the shaver after every use to achieve the best results. It will take 2 - 3 weeks for your face to get used to this new shaver so there might be a slight discomfort after shaving at first. Using an aftershave lotion or balm is highly recommended.<br /><br />As a last note. My wife Loves to feel my freshly shaved face now. She say's that my skin is so smooth since I started using this shaver.
  171. I replaced my 9 year old Braun shaver with this new one as I droped the cleaning station from my older model and broke it. I still use the old shaver for a spare and traveling...still going strong! This model shaves very close and cleans & charges itself automatically. This product is high quality and made to last. I was so impressed with my last Braun shaver I didn't consider another brand this time. This model is excellent!
  172. First I been buying Braun Electric Shavers for over 10 years and never had a problem till now.   173. I've been using the Braun Syncro for 6+ years and have really enjoyed the shaver and the self-cleaning. I recently upgraded to the Series 7 790cc and couldn't be happier. The shave is closer, quieter and quicker than the Syncro. Besides a cheaper price tag, I couldn't ask for anything more. I actually found a pretty good deal at Bedbathbeyond. It was on sale for $250 and I had a 20% off coupon for a total price of $200. I couldn't be happier. Several Pulsonic owners have mentioned the short life of the cleaning solution and/or having to manually oil the razor because they were hand washing the razor in water every day. Whats up with that? Why handwash a shaver that cleans itself? You just bought an expesive razor, but can't afford 6 bucks a month for cleaning solution? I have a tip for both scenarios. There is no need to clean these shavers every day. I only charge and clean mine once a week and it functions perfectly. I did the same with my Syncro. I get two months out of my cleaning solution.
  174. If you're looking for a shave as smooth as possible, razor blades are the answer. However, if you want to use an electric shaver that is the next best thing, the Braun Series 7 is it. Over the years I tried different electric products that came up well short. They did not shave as close as I thought and some irritated my face so bad that it was impossible to continue using them. From the first day, the Braun was gentle to my skin yet gave me that close shave I was accoustmed to. And the clean & renew system makes the shaver like new every day.
  175. The best shave you will ever have from a non blade razor. I have had and used a Braun shaver for many years and it finally died so I purchased the Pulsonic shaver even though I thought it was over priced. The shaver is so good I think it was a good purchase even at the price I paid.
  176. I have used Braun shavers for years, and figured I'd buy the top of the line in hopes of better performance. Here's what I found. BUILD This is the nicest Braun I have used in terms of build. It feels solid and well made. The on/off button is better than the slide up/down switch on my old Braun 8995. SHAVE I have been using it for several weeks, and I can safely say it shaves no better (nor worse) than my Braun 8995 (which, if you do some digging, can be found for $140). No complaints, I just was hoping for some noticeable difference in performance. If you are used to using an electric razor, you will find this to be a solid performer. The shave is as close as you are going to get with an electric. (A word of advice for those who haven't shave with an electric...if you switch, despite the wet shave option, it is best to shave when your face is completely dry - like 30 minutes after a shower. The closeness of the shave increases dramatically over shaving before showering or immediately after). DISPLAY I think the display is quite a bit worse than the older models. There are two semi-circle bar meters on the bottom of the shaver - one for battery, and one for hygiene (or how badly it needs a cleaning). They are not bright or easy to read. This is pretty primitive compared to the earlier model which had a small display which showed you remaining shaving time, and level of cleaning required. The old one also would tell you when it was time to change the foil and blade (every 18 months). This is a step back that I don't understand. SUMMARY This is a good razor, but I am not sure I would bother spending all the extra $$$ on the top model. The older models get the job done, and I presume, the lower cost newer models do as well.
  177. I recently purchased this shaver to replace my Braun 8995. No complaints on the 8995 other than the hairs that would always fall out while shaving. This unit is a definite improvement over that model. It does shave a bit closer than that the 8995. My only issue at this point, it the \\"Hygiene\\" indicator seems a bit too sensitive and will be at empty after about 2-3 shave. I still get a little bit of droppings out of it but nothing like the 8995.
  178. I've gone through the gamut of electric razors - Braun, Panasonic, Norelco, etc. I have had several Braun razors through the years, and decided to give this one a go. It worked great for the first few months. Then, the issues began. In a nutshell, the cleaning mechanism did not work. The razor wouldn't seat correctly, and the cleaning either wouldn't start or it stopped mid-cycle. I called Braun customer service, and got a major run around. I mailed it in to an authorized repair shop to determine the issues and get them fixed. They mailed it back, stating it was repaired and that there were issues with the connectors. It worked fine for about 2 weeks, and the same issues happened over and over again. Essentially, razor doesn't register when inserted into the cleaning chamber. It won't run a complete cleaning cycle. I searched around to buy a replacement charging/cleaning stand - and they're sold out or back-ordered everywhere. Which leads me to believe this is a known issue with this razor, and everyone is trying to replace the charging stands. Sad to say, I had this razor too long for a return to Amazon, and of course, the cleaning cartridges can't be returned at any point. For its price point, I expected so much more. I wouldn't recommend this one. I'm sticking with Panasonic.
  179. I've been extremely happy w/ my prior Braun shavers so decided to spend a bit more to get a new, top of the line (at the time) model. Unfortunately this shaver is a big step back from my prior models in a number of ways. A quick summary of my experiences:<br />Good:<br />- shaves a bit quicker than my prior model<br />- shave might be a bit closer<br />- battery life is reasonable<br />Bad:<br />- pop-up clipper broke w/in the first month of use<br />- didn't have this problem initially, but shaver will lose contact w/ charging base now during charge/clean cycle. This happens consistently and takes me three or more tries to get it to clean (if I'm lucky)<br />- PULLS HAIRS. If I go more than a day w/ this razor (even 1.5 days), the unit yanks some hairs instead of shaving, which is quite painful. Originally I thought it was though the foil, but I think it's actually that hairs get caught between the side of the foil and the shaver body. Either way, it hurts. My prior shaver I could go twice as long between shaves and never had this problem.<br /><br />Overall this purchase was a bust. Not sure I'll go to another brand, but I will definitely be looking at alternatives next time around. I gave it 2 stars because although it does a decent job shaving on most days, the issues are significant and unacceptable at this price point.
  180. The unit I received was faulty (would not clean), however Amazon would not accept returns of the product (even for exchange). Presumably because of the container of cleaning fluid that is shipped with it. Since it is a complex piece of machinery, I cannot recommend buying it with Amazon.
  181. Received the razor as advertised. I purchased my first Braun about 6 years ago and other than changing foils, it still works pretty good. I decided to get this one and use the other for travel. My new Braun works very well and cuts very close. Its not shaving with a blade, but the next best thing without the nicks and cuts.
  182. I like foil shavers over rotary ones. And I think Braun makes the best foil shavers out there. My wife gave me a Series 7 when my older Braun shaver started to fall apart after 10+ years of service (the power switch broke off). You can go crazy sifting through all the buzzwords used to describe shavers. But it boils down to the question, \\"Will this shaver offer me a close and comfortable shave?\\" This is a nice shaver that cuts closer than any shaver I've used before. It even gets that stubborn neck hair which I've always had to use a standard razor in the past to clean up. The razor has a different sensation when it is going over your skin than other ones. The best I can use to describe it is a \\"cool burn.\\" It's not painful or discomforting, just different. Perhaps that is the pulse technology at work. One thing I don't like about it is that the traveling case does not have any room for the charger. The case is a hard, plastic shell that is the exact form of the shaver. With other cases, I knew to remember the charger because the case left a little pocket or section for it. I just know that one day I'm going to forget the charger when I leave for a trip. Before having one, I always thought that the cleaning base was a little gimmicky and just a way for the company to make a little more money by selling refill packs. But I have to admit that it is nice having a fresh, clean razor. I've found that I can clean the razor every other day without noticing much difference in performance and extend the life of the cleaning pack. I've had my razor for about two months and I'm just now getting to the the point where I need to replace the cleaning pack. You will have to find room in your bathroom for the base station. It is yet another gadget that people used to be able to just throw in a drawer that now needs its own \\"parking spot.\\" Keep that in mind if you are short on bathroom counter space.
  183. I started using this shaver on January 1, 2009. It's my fourth or fifth generation Braun shaver. I've been using them for many years. This one is the best so far. I get the smoothest shave with the least skin irritation of any electric I've tried. As the manual suggests, you do get a closer shave if you shave before showering. I love the self cleaning feature, but I only use it once a week so the cartridge will last longer. The rest of the time I just open the screen and empty the clippings out manually. I definitely recommend this product.
  184. Is this shaver everything it is cracked up to be? No, It's not perfect. But it is the best electric shaver I have used. I have been a Norelco user for many years. Last year, I purchased a Philips Norelco Arcitec and was very disappointed. Very expensive and the shave was terrible. It took longer to shave and it still didn't get those pesky neck hairs. In fact, my older Norelco did a better job. Now for the Braun, it does shave very close. In fact, it does the chin area very well and shaves as close as a blade. It still requires several passes on the neck. You have to get used to this as you can nick you skin if you use too much pressure. The cleaning system works very well and is very convenient. I found my solution lasts well over a month. It still takes over 5 minutes to shave and the neck takes a great deal of patience time and skin stretching. If you use an electric shaver now, you will like this one and find it to be the closest thing to shaving with a blade. If you plan to purchase this, I suggest buying on Amazon.com. My first one broke and their return policy is outstanding and the best on the internet. Within 48 hours I had a new one.
  185. I went to an electric after 30 years of blade shaving. Years ago I tried a Norelco but realized I would never get a shave as close as blades. This Braun Series 7- 790cc though does a very acceptable job. It is not blade shaving nor is it supposed to be. It does seem to get better with each shave. I am very satisfied. It is a time saver and it sure is nice not dealing with cuts, nicks, and expensive blades. I used to skip shaving on weekends just to give my face a break, but it is so quick and easy to use this Braun that I don't mind shaving 7 days a week. Your face does need to get used to it though. You can irritate your face if you press too hard and go over an area too many times, so I suppose there is a learning curve and some conditioning required. But all-in-all I would recommend this shaver to anyone considering electric shavers. The cleaning system is a great idea, works well and overall the cartridges are not that expensive. My only real complaint was mentioned in an earlier review that only a few days after I purchsed this product, Amazon went and lowered the price. A bit underhanded if you ask me.
  186. Gives a very close shave, and does not irritate my skin. Most razors I have used before makes my neck break out.   190. My Norelco rotary never did a very good job on my neck without working it hard and causing irritation. I just switched to the Braun and it does a much better job overall with no irritation. The shaver can be used with the cord and also quick charges if needed. The negatives- Expensive, noisier than the Norelco, you have to buy cleaning cartridges once a month and the charger/cleaner is cheaply constructed. Also be careful with the cleaning cartridges as they spill easily when you pry the cover off. All in all a premium shaving system at a premium price.
  191. This is a great shaver. I love the shelf cleaning. It does a great job. But... It's to expensive.

  196. I have used Braun shavers for many years and have seen improvements with each new shaver. I thought my last one (8995)was great and better than the several others that come before it. However, my new Pulsonic is much improved. It shave closer, is quieter and is very easier to use. I would reccomend it to friends and would buy another one in a minute.It's definately 5 stars.   197. This is the best shaver I've ever used. Expensive, but worth every penny. I had given up on electrics, using every razor made, and was still not satisfied.   198. My husband raves about this Braun Pulsonic Shaver! Gives a smooth, close shave without ever burning or irritation.
  199. Great product. Smoothest shave ever from an electric razor. I have sensitive skin and this bugs me the least.
  200. Got this about three weeks ago and it works great. I had a Braun shaver similar to this one before this but it was a few years old. This one definitely gets the job done better. I had to take a star off, however, because every time I shave three or four times in the process I will get a sharp pain where I am shaving like someone hit me in the face with a rubber band. It doesn't cause any nicks or irritation or anything like that, so I'm not sure why it feels that way. Kind of like the shaver is ripping the hair out instead of cutting it. Overall though, HIGHLY recommended if you want an electric shaver. My face is smoother than ever in a shorter amount of time.
  201. I am 35, and have been using a Philips (Norelco) Speed XL for the last 5 or 6 years on a daily basis. This shaver gave me a decent shave. When three months ago the battery died on my Philips, I decided to buy the latest from Philips, the Arcitec. Little did I know that was one of the biggest mistakes in my shaving life. It is very, very cool, with a beautiful finish, cleaning station, etc. BUT, it left big unshaved patches on my neck. For a month I struggled with this shaver with no better results. I had to finish my neck using a manual blade.<br /><br />So, I decided to research for another electric razor. And I found out that the Braun Series 7 is one of the best reviewed electric razors. I am currently in Europe, and here I found that the latest Braun Series 7 is the 795, a slightly better model than the 790. So I bought it. It has three settings, intensive, normal and sensitive. It gives the CLOSEST shave an electric razor is going to give you. My face is almost baby smooth now. My neck is not so close as my face, but far closer than with the Arcitec, and no hairy patches. I never could have thought an electric razor could be so close, but it really is.<br /><br />The cleaning station is, simply, perfect. It cleans, lubricates the razor and it leaves an excellent lemony scent. I use the fast clean feature on a daily basis (it takes just 25 seconds), and a more intensive cleaning once a week.<br /><br />So, if you are looking for a close daily shave, with absolute no irritation (and I know about irritation, with a fairly sensitive skin) I honestly recommend this product.<br /><br />PD: Forgive me if I have made any mistakes when writing in English. (My native language is Spanish)
  202. I've stepped to electric razors a couple years ago. Previously I used both the leading Gillette Fusion and Shick Quattro razors. I stepped to electric razors as an attempt to reduce cutting irritation and provide a quicker, less fuss shave. My first step was to a Braun Series 1 as a trial. It had good reviews as a budget razor. Initial impressions were mediocre. The big issue was I don't shave daily all the time, and once the hairs get long, foil razors stop being efficient. Shave time goes way up. I basically said screw it and went towards the high end. I wanted to see if the best available could give me what I wanted. I first started with Norelco's SmartTouch XL razor because the rotary type razors function better with longer hairs. I got it just before the Arcitec came out and represented the best Norelco product available at the time. I was also considering the Braun Pulsonic as an option, but the price difference wasn't worth it at the time. The SmartTouch is an excellent razor. The 3 layer cutting and circular design works outstanding for getting most of the hairs quickly and easily. The rotary type razors are quiet and fast working on even very long hairs. The relatively slow rpm does limit overall cutting rate on really long and thick hair. Pull is minimum, but you can tell there's a little wait time if you try and cut fast. The only real downside of this type of razor is that it doesn't cut as close to the skin as a foil type razor. It ends up taking a significant amount of pressure against the skin to get the razor to cut really close like a razor. To do so, you will need some sort of lubricant, but soap and water does work fine. There's just a bit of friction from the shaver. Really close shaves can rash the skin a little bit if you try too hard. I stepped to the Braun Pulsonic as a trial to see if I could do better than the Norelco product. I found one for a good price eventually and grabbed it. The big thing I liked about the Pulsonic that made it different from other foil razors was that it had the center long hair cutter. This was a big deal because long hairs is the greatest enemy of foil type cutters. It's great to see Braun also adding this to lower level razors now because it works great. There are several things I like about the Braun razor over the Norelco. First, it cuts faster. You can not shave for a week and even though it's a foil shaver, it will cut off a lot of it very quickly due to that center long hair cutter. Once a lot of the long hairs are cut down, the foil cutters work the rest down quickly. Shave speed gains might be around 20%. Plus the shave gets closer than the Norelco with less pressure. It's much easier to get a razor close shave with the Pulsonic. The razor also glides over the skin quite easily. Even if you put a bit of pressure against the skin, the Braun glides over the skin well. The braun doesn't really rash the skin much even with pressed moderately to the skin. The Braun can chop a little bit at the skin though (not painful/deep, but little one layer cuts here and there). Now there are some traits I do not like. The Braun razor is significantly louder, just a lot more noisy. Rotary razors are just really quiet. Foil razors have the loud buzz you common think of and the Pulsonic is no exception. The foil type razor is also sensitive to cutting direction. With the areas where the hairs like to lay down, the Braun has trouble grabbing and cutting these hairs. You have to make sure you go against the lay and you typically have to brush your hand against the lay to raise them up before you go over them with the razor. Wipe across the stubborn hairs with a hand, and zip over them with the razor. This works slick and pretty easily counters the troublesome hairs. Since rotary razors like the Norelco cut in all directions and that you typically use them in a circular manner, they tend to get those stubborn hairs a little easier. Some notes on long term wear. I used each for a little over a year. The Norelco experienced little to no wear. I never replaced the cutters and I got the unit used. It worked as good as new the day I stopped using it. The unit was sold to me at a pretty cheap price due to the cleaning base being broken. It wasn't actually broken, just stuck and was oddly jammed. I quickly popped it free, and it worked great. The Norelco showed no wear after a year of use and looks and functions just like new. A roommate of mine is now using it and enjoys it. I got the Braun shaver used as well, used for a few months I believe. I got some fresh cleaner for the base but never touched the cutter during my use. The Braun has functioned well for the year, but a couple little problems have popped up. First, there is some flaking of the painted surface near the cutter. I assumed the cleaning solution does slightly break down the paint over time. It doesn't seem to wear at all by handling though, so the paint is durable to the hand. It just seems to be the cleaning solution doing it. Second, the charging base has two spring loaded tabs that the charging pins on the razor sit against to charge. These tabs are a painted plastic, and the paint is conductive enough to transfer electricity. Well, one of the tabs now has the paint flaking off, so now the razor has trouble charging or cleaning. This needs to be fixed using some sort of conductive paint or something. The razor can be plugged in directly to the cord, but it sort of makes the cleaning base useless. The cleaning base does function and last well otherwise. The cleaning solution even lasts quite a long time as you don't use it all the time. Clean it once a week or two and wash after normal use, the solution easily lasts a year which was surprising. I am finally replacing the cutter head on the braunt. The 18 month suggestion seems decently accurate for wear. It starts to cut a little slower (not much) and starts to pull just a little bit. Connection points within the razor are plastic, so I assume there is some wear over time too that may limit vibration intensity. There really isn't visual wear, so design and materials seem proper. Other than some minor wear issues, the razor has held up well. So, is the Braun Pulsonic the best razor I've used? Yes. I can say that I do consider it a better razor. It shaves faster and shaves closer than the Norelco product. Its use however is a little more tricky. It takes a little more skill and understanding to shave your face quickly and to get all the stubborn hairs. The Norelco is a better no fuss razor. You just go around your face until everything's cut. It's just as quick or as close without significant skin pressure (requiring some lubrication to do). What about hand razors again? Well, going back, I do find both the Fusion and Quattro both harsher on the skin. The Fusion is great about getting a really close shave and go through long, thick hair without clogging, but it pulls a lot. The cut is just very sharp. The Quattro is much smoother in its cutting, and I tended to prefer it. It does clog easily though when going through a lot of hair and deep hair. Both wear very slowly. The titanium bladed Quattro takes forever to wear down. I still use a hand razor for some minor trimming here and there, but have pretty much exclusively used electric razors for the last couple years. Time wise, hand razors can be quicker in some cases, but both approaches do take a similar amount of time. Electric can be faster if you don't care about the random stubborn hairs or don't care about a razor close shave. If you use an electric maybe twice a day, you could zip through the process in a minute. If you don't shave for several days, and want a no hair, razor close shave, it could take about 5-6 minutes.
  203. This shaver does a great job. It is clean, efficient, overall I give the shaver itself a 5 star. However, once you use the shaver, you have to put it back into a plastic cleaning dock that cleans the shaving heads and recharges the battery. The fit of the shaver into the dock is so inadequate that the blue led on the shaver (the one that shows it is charging) sometimes flashes intermittently. (the dock does fantastic light shows while this happens...) You start the cleaning cycle and the shaver vibrates away from the charging contacts. So the cleaning cycle stops. The only reliable way I can get it to clean is to hold the shaver into the dock for 19 minutes. Doesn't that defeat the purpose of the electric shaver? Shaver is great. Cleaning system sucks.
  204. This shaver is the best one to own.The claims of this shaver are on the money.I have owned Braun shavers and they are the best brand for closeness and dependability.
  205. The product met with my needs for shaving. I had looked for a good shaving head system. This one will take care of my aging face and clean without using so much that I get burns on my face. I like the cleaning holder system. I have found that I keep the shaving head clean and always ready for shaving. I have a soft pouch for caring as I travel. The hard case sure makes the item bulky in the overnighter. The motor noise is no more noiser than the other shavers. I am sure that I will use this Braun as my major razor cutter. Try to keep this series on the market so the replacements and cleaning parts are kept on the shelve. I see they are in most the major stores like Walmart, Walgreens and others.
