  209. After having used a Remington MS-1700 foil shaver for about the last 10 years, I realized that every time I used it, my face would burn and feel raw. Rarely could I use that two days in a row, having to let my face heal every other day between uses, and I would have to use a disposable razor on the off days. I ordered this Braun razor after having seen it on one of those 'How it's made' shows, and having done quite a bit of research online, comparing to other models and brands. I haven't had any issues with the cleaning system (although if I clean the razor after every shave like they recommend for the best performance, I'll have to buy a new cleaning cartridge every 30 days, which I think is a bit excessive) and I absolutely love the fact that I can plug the cord directly into the razor and shave in cord-mode, or cordless if the unit is properly charged. So I was able to shave right out of the box. After having 3 or 4 days of beard growth, I used this with no pre-shave gel or anything like that, and it left my face smoother than any foil razor ever has. Even the tough spots (where the longer hairs tend to lie flat) were no match for this one. It was worth every penny, and I'll probably never buy another brand of razor for the rest of my life. Great product Braun! Update: About 6 months after I started using this razor, I noticed it started to pinch my skin, and I was sorely disappointed. Silly me, even with regular cleaning cycles, I had neglected to realize that the foil and blades needed replaced. Once I did so, the razor again worked like the day I got it, and I've never had a cleaner shave. I couldn't be more happy with this razor! Update: Four years later (Oct/2014) I'm still using this razor. I replace the foils and blades about every 6-8 months, and it still leaves me with as clean of a shave. I've taken this on several trips (some of them a week long or more) and I never need to take my charging cable. (Although I still do), and even after a week of shaving on vacation, the battery charge never dropped below around 60%. I still couldn't be happier with this shaver, and will definitely continue to use Braun if I have to purchase another one in the future.
  210. Great product, best shave I ever had. Worthy of it's high ratings and worth the money. Love the cleaning system
  211. I needed a new shaver and was really disappointed in my second Philips Norelco rotary model, so I decided to spend some money and try out this foil model. My problem with the Norelco was that it wasn't getting very close, and it pulled more hair that it cut even after a new set of blades. After getting the new unit, I plugged it in and did my usual shave. Usually new shavers are rough on my face for the first two weeks(I'm been using a mach 3 for a few months after getting fed up with my rotary), pulling hairs and giving me razor burn. After mentally preparing for the beat down I expected to my face, I started out and started the shaver up and went to town. I was surprised to find that shaving with this unit is much less painful than my old rotary models, and does a much better/closer job with much less pain. I skipped the aftershave and 3/4 of the way through the day my skin feels fine.<br /><br />The pros I see:<br />Close shave, w/minimal burn<br />A very nice travel case included, which it didn't mention on the box.<br /><br />The cons I see:<br />You need to replace the cleaning fluid every month. It's fairly cheap, but none the less you have to do it.<br />The included AC Adapter makes a very faint high pitch noise.<br />The cleaning cycle is fairly loud.<br /><br />All in all probably the best shaving experience I've had. I would highly recommend this shaver. Considering that it is a tool that you will use every day, it is well worth the money in my opinion.
  212. I almost never review products on Amazon, however, given that I relied on the reviews to buy this product I felt the need to comment in this instance. I have been using a Braun electric razor for many years, probably 3 or four models over time, and was in the market to replace my 8985 which was getting on in years. I figured rather than replace the blades for the third time on the 8985 I might as well upgrade to the \\"latest and greatest\\". Big mistake. I have been shaving with the 7-790cc for about a month or so now and within 8 hours of shaving it feels as if I never shaved. I waited over a month to write this review to give my face / skin a chance to adjust to the new razor as suggested, however, I am going to go back to my old 8985 since the shave was much closer. I would have expected a major improvement when spending over $200, however, unfortunately this shaver was a step backwards.
  213. I bought this razor because I like how quick and efficient electric razors are, but I have very sensitive skin, and the braun website said this razor was good for sensitive skin. I've tried norelco rotary razors and I don't like them at all. They miss a lot of hairs which means I have to go over the same areas over and over which means wicked bad razor burn. I've also tried traditional razors with sensitive skin shave cream. I even used the gilette fusion since I was told nicer blades get a closer shave with less irritation. I did get a close shave but not a whole lot less irritation. I'd never tried a foil razor before but my roommate has one and he loves his, so I figured if I'm going to get one I might as well go for the best; a good choice on my part.<br /><br />The braun pulsonic is great, it gets a really close shave and hardly any irritation if any at all, and it's quick and gets almost all the hairs the first time. Now I must admit, it does not get as close as a traditional blade, but it is pretty darn close, the closest you will find from any electric razor. Also if you don't shave for a few days and your facial hair gets a little long this razor does tend to pull a little, but I've found that if you shave with the hair growth first and then go back over against the growth it works really well. As for my sensitive skin, this razor is awesome. I used to only shave every three or four days because my skin is so sensitive, now I shave every other day no problem. The only area I get any irritation now is on the neck, and if I do get any (emphasis on \\"if\\") it is very minimal. Also since it is an electric razor I don't have to mess with shaving cream and constantly washing the blade off, so it is much faster and efficient, which I need being a college student.<br /><br />The self-cleaning station is great too. Once I'm done shaving I just stick the razor back in the stand, it automatically assesses what cleaning cycle to run, and I just push the big \\"clean\\" button and away it goes. Oh, and it charges at the same time. The only down side is you have to buy their special cleaner refill cartridges, but you can get them pretty cheap online. Each one lasts about a month, but I think that is assuming you shave and run the cleaning cycle every day. There is an indicator on the stand that tells you how full the cleaning fluid is and when you need to change it, so as long as you have spares on hand they are very simple to switch out. Also the cleaning cycle is a little loud so if you have a spouse or anyone who wakes up later then you you may want to run the cleaning cycle later. Also some of the other reviews are complaining that the razor is too loud and shakes too much due to the pulsonic technology. That's crap, it's not any louder than any other electric razor, and the shaking is the same as that gilette fusion power razor that does the same thing, it's not enough to make shaving difficult or anything.<br /><br />Some people may be skeptical of their instructions that say to shave against the hair growth and to shave before you take a shower. Everyone knows that typically shaving against the hair growth causes irritation, but despite this belief shaving against the growth with the pulsonic works, do it. Just don't let your beard get too intense or as I stated earlier it will pull a little. As far as shaving before or after a shower I've tried both ways and I didn't really notice a difference, try it out for yourself and do whichever you like.<br /><br />All-in-all I love this razor, one of the best buys I've ever made. It's definitely the best shave you will get out of an electric razor, and if you've got sensitive skin like me this razor will be your best friend.es. Oh, and it charges at the same time. The only down side is you have to buy their special cleaner refill cartridges, but you can get them pretty cheap online. Each one lasts about a month, but I think that is assuming you shave and run the cleaning cycle every day. There is an indicator on the stand that tells you how full the cleaning fluid is and when you need to change it, so as long as you have spares on hand they are very simple to switch out. Also the cleaning cycle is a little loud so if you have a spouse or anyone who wakes up later then you you may want to run the cleaning cycle later. Also some of the other reviews are complaining that the razor is too loud and shakes too much due to the pulsonic technology. That's crap, it's not any louder than any other electric razor, and the shaking is the same as that gilette fusion power razor that does the same thing, it's not enough to make shaving difficult or anything. Some people may be skeptical of their instructions that say to shave against the hair growth and to shave before you take a shower. Everyone knows that typically shaving against the hair growth causes irritation, but despite this belief shaving against the growth with the pulsonic works, do it. Just don't let your beard get too intense or as I stated earlier it will pull a little. As far as shaving before or after a shower I've tried both ways and I didn't really notice a difference, try it out for yourself and do whichever you like. All-in-all I love this razor, one of the best buys I've ever made. It's definitely the best shave you will get out of an electric razor, and if you've got sensitive skin like me this razor will be your best friend.

  217. For fifty years I have been a confirmed steel blade shaver. Over the years I have had several electric shavers but always found them to provide inferior shaving results compared to steel blade shaving. Recently I watched an online documentary of the Braun 360 Series 7 Pulsonic manufacture and testing. I was impressed and decided to review my dislike for electric shavers via Consumers [...] and elsewhere. What I found was Braun's product was indeed well reviewed albeit more expensive that everyone else's product. Nonetheless, I bought one and started to use it daily. At first the shaver was having trouble clearing whiskers under my chin and on my neck but gave really steel blade like results on the rest of my face. I read thast it takesd a while for your face/whiskers to adjust to an electric shaver. That turned out to be the case. I now get really superb shaves all over at least for that day: I have to shave again the next morning which I was able to skip when using my old four-blade steel razor. The product has a very clever cleaning system with good electronic displays but a downside consideration thereof is the cleaning solution cartridges which you will have to purchase for the life of your razon. They are not too expensive but they do add to the cost forever. I am looking into developing a cleaning solution substitute which I could load a cartridge: probably some alchole and water would do; I am still exploring. Despite this short-coming, I heartily recommend the product.
  218. I have had a Braun Activator since about 2004 and have loved shaving with it, after many years of using blades... Only had one problem with it, the base unit died after 18 months. But, Braun replaced the base and charger under warranty, no sweat.. Lately, I started reading about what's new and thought I'd try the newer Pulsonic 790. I think my old Activator may be built better, at least it feels more solid and hefty.. But, the new 790cc does a better job of shaving with fewer strokes.. The 790cc is also MUCH quieter, so I can watch (and hear) the morning news as I shave. There are some on-line reviews that indicate some issues with the finish peeling off and the trimmer breaking.. I never had those issues with my Activator, after 6 years of daily use. And I hope that I don't have those issues with my new Pulsonic either!! Time will tell.. Meanwhile, it provides a close, comfortable shave and clean up is easy !!!

  224. Choosing a new electric shaver may be one of the worst experiences of your life if you read all of the reviews like I did. For each good review there is a bad one. I read them all and finally couldn't take it anymore and bought the top of the line Braun because it won the awards from Consumer Reports and Men's Health.<br /><br />My Norelco rotary shaver finally gave out so I decided to try something new. I didn't think I wanted a shaver with a self cleaning system but once I tried it I was amazed by how cool it is. The shaver comes out clean and with a lemony sent. How great is that? I look forward to shaving now. I'm not regretting the change.<br /><br />Pros:<br />Close shave, as close as you want it. Spend enough time on it and you will have a baby smooth shave.<br />Auto-clean with lemon scent.<br />No more opening the top and shaking it over the toilet or garbage can to dump clippings.<br />Rock solid construction. It's metal and heavy with a rubber back for grip. Very well made by samurais in germany.<br /><br />Cons:<br />Expensive.<br />You need to go over neck areas against the grain of your beard a lot to get a close shave there, much more so than my last rotary shaver. But once achieved, the closeness is better than a rotary provides.<br />Louder than a rotary. Bzzzzzzzz.<br />Buying replacement cleaning solution.<br /><br />I see the price went way up after I bought it. I bought it for $189, looks like it is for sale on Amazon for $250+ now following the same link I purchased it from. What's that all about? Not sure I would pay that. For under $200, buy it. Every other good electric shaver is $140 and up anyway. Good luck.<br /><br />Edit 2012: Some of the silver coating on the back of the razor near the head piece has bubbled and peeled away and it is black underneath. This was most likely caused by the cleaning solution. Apparently it is coated with a paint that reacts to the cleaning solution. I peeled it away with my fingernail.The razor is less attractive now, but still functions very well. The total area of the peeling is about 1/8th of an inch tall and across the entire back.<br /><br />Edit 2014: My old Braun continues to function flawlessly. I have had no new paint loss after the initial problem and the cleaning station looks and functions as good as the day it was new. Not sure what the Braun company is making now (obviously not the model I bought), but if they still make the same quality products they made when I bought mine, then buy with confidence. I have had no battery issues or performance issues. It charges and cleans like new after all these years. I replaced the foil once a while ago and that was the only maintenance. Money very well spent.

  238. In nearly every review one reads about shavers and razors, people tell you that you should try the product for at least 30 days to let your skin and hairs adjust. And that your shave will improve. I have an especially thick and heavy beard and always go for the best my money can buy--so after my Panasonic failed, I tried this one, the Braun 790cc. Initially, the shave was awful. After 45 days, not only was the shave still awful, but the shaver stopped communicating with the charging/cleaning base so neither function was possible anymore. So, deciding I gave this product a very fair trial period, and giving up on electric shavers in general, I ordered a safety razor (and supplies). Then, I contacted Amazon only to find that because the cleaning solution is a hazadarous material, it is impossible for the shaver to be returned. And 45 days is past the typical 30 day maximum return period anyways. Of note, a paid quite a lot for this now-gimped shaver (that I'm now stuck with), however the price has DOUBLED since I bought it less than 2 months ago! So buyer beware. You cannot simply \\"try\\" this shaver. Once you've bought it, it's yours. If it doesn't shave well, you're stuck with it. Enjoy. Pros: The battery life is great! ...
  239. I own two shavers, One Norelco \\"Quadra Action\\" and this \\"Braun Pulsonic series 7\\", which I purchased in October 2009. I had lots of time to evaluate this item and compare it with my Norelco. I regret to say that Norelco shavers are presently, by far, the best shavers available in the markets. I purchased the Pulsonic at the time my Norelco was in need of new Ni-Cad batteries. Big mistakes of my part, I trusted the four-stars rating +given and decided to try this new model to have as a spare shaver. First, I received the shaver in an elaborate packaging (most likely expensive) accompanied with a bulky contraption that Braun calls \\"The Clean &Renew System\\". This unit serves as a combination to clean and recharge the shaver when needed and it does require a cleaning cartridge filled with a special cleaning fluid. That's another costly item that must be purchased periodically. If you are traveling forget about that cleaning gadget... Leave it home! The shaver can recharged with the cord provided and also cleaned under the faucet in your bathroom. Second, the shaver does not give a shave any closer that my Norelco, the head has straight lateral cutters and the friction of the cutters in motion creates heath giving a burning sensation to the skin... not very pleasant! The fact that the head has straight cutters, it doesn't espouses the contours of the face very well; unlike my Norelco which has three individual round cutters that gimbals separately on their own axis, a very useful feature, especially on the neck around the jawbones. Third, the trimmer is useless if you have to trim a mustache, it's only good for sideburns. The trimmer is hidden from view, while looking in a mirror if you are trying to groom a mustache or trim hairs from the nose. The trimmer is lower than the head of the shaver and is hidden from view while looking at the mirror making it impossible to see what you are trimming. With the Norelco shavers there are no problems with the trimmer. I do not recommend the Braun \\"Pulsonic\\" series 7 shaver, it is overpriced and over rated, it only deserve a HALF STAR. M. J.
  240. Just as with all new electric shavers my face took a little while to get \\"broke in\\" to the new razor. I hadn't shaved for about 6 weeks (trimmed only) after my other Braun (of 10 years duration) finally broke down. So the first time I used this new razor it got quite a workout. I wasn't too happy with the results of that shave of the next 2 or 3 but then I remembered (it had been 10 years ok?) that it took a while for my face and \\"beard\\" to get used to using an electric razor. After that initial break-in period it works great! Its a bit lighter than the previous Braun model but rests very easy in the hand, its not overweight and seems to be balanced well. The way the \\"foils\\" and head all move independently makes shaving a quite easy task. The cleaning \\"station\\" worked well once I figured it out. Also it uses the same cleaning fluid refills as my older model (I had like 6 of those reills still around). All in all I would recommend this to a friend for sure.
  241. I pulled the trigger on the $200 razor because I thought it would be much better than my last $80 razor. It is better, I'm just not sure its $120 better. I'm disappointed in it's tendency to miss a few longer whiskers after, say, not shaving over the weekend, and the trimmer location makes it hard to be accurate around the edge of my beard. The razor's \\"hygiene\\" indicator telling me the shaver needs \\"intensive cleaning\\" after 3 shaves strikes me as a shameless effort to sell cleaning fluid refills (of course nothing requires you to give it the intensive cleaning at that point). On the up side, I do think the razor does give a closer shave overall to any electric I've used in the past. Just not the stark improvement I expected for the price.
  242. About once every 15 years, I buy an electric shaver hoping that their performance has improved to a point where they are competitive with blade razors. After four months of using this Braun Series 7, I think that time has not yet arrived.<br /><br />For comparison purposes, I previously, and now once again, shave with a Schick Mach 3 razor, which gives me an objectively superior, closer, more comfortable shave, with less skin irritation, in less time. The Braun takes forever to get a close shave, and even then, leaves single, isolated whiskers uncut, seemingly at random. While the Braun doesn't cause the occasional nick to my face that the blade razor sometimes does, I find that it actually results in more skin irritation than the blade.<br /><br />In short, this Braun is expensive, requires regular investments in cleaning cartridges, and takes up valuable bathroom shelf space, all of which would be okay if it worked well, but it doesn't, at least on my face. Save your money and buy a good blade instead.

It must be a design flaw in the long hair trimmer? That's the only thing I can think of that is cutting my lip. They already replace the head and that obviously didn't help. Therefore I don't recommend this shaver. Also, you should note that the cleaning system in these new shavers are not like the old days where you can just open it, brush or blow it out and keep going. You need to use their solution and station or rinse it in water, but if using water it won't dry out unless you remove the head and set it off to the side (basically it's a pain and those cleaning kits are expensive).
  251. Have used Norelcos for 35 years and enjoyed the replacements every 7 years or so as they constantly improved. Got the Arcitec over a year ago expecting the same experience. It never shaved well. I didn't return it in the 30 day window figuring with the new head design I had to learn how best to use it. Well, 12 months later I got tired of looking like a mendicant and rubbing my face raw to try to get a clean shave. Purchased this based on it's strong review in Consumer Reports. It performs tremendously well. I even like the cleaning unit; while I'll have to replace the cartridges I'm hopeful it'll keep the razor performing well since it lubricates as well. I recommend this razor for having exceeded my expectations.

  255. This razor feels powerful and strong right out of the box. You will not be disappointed with this pricey investment guys. It shaves closer and more important, more comfortably then all the other foil razors I've owned. It also comes with a nice plastic case that has a cleaning brush and brush holder built into the case. My concern was the cleaning system. I hate getting strapped in to spending money on previously unnecessary items for razor care. But the cleaning feature is a nice feature that works relatively well. The instructions indicate you can run the razor under tap water to clean it if you don't want to use the cleaning system. It says to use razor oil on foils after tap cleaning. I don't do this because I found out the cleaning system is resealable, so if you don't use up all the cleanser the 1st time and it's not dirty you can reuse it again without spending tons of money on cleaning product. The trimmer also works great. This razor does a excellent job at comfortably shaving the neck area comparing to my old foil shavers that always pulled hairs in that area instead of cut them. The only cons are the built in battery/hygiene indicator on bottom of the razor has some issues. When the hygiene is low your razor will automatically cut off. This seems like a unnecessary feature that doesn't work right. I had just cleaned my razor and the hygiene indicator ran out quickly and the razor cut off. This has only happened once though, and I was able to get it to start again by removing my foil cover and putting it back on. This may have just been a fluke. My other issue is that the razor was indeed extremely quiet when first purchased, but over the past few months it has grown louder then it originally was. Again minor, but these are reasons why it shouldn't get a perfect score. Would I buy it again? YES Is it a great foil razor? YES Is it worth all that money? YES (with proper care it will last you a long time guys)
  256. This Braun shaver is the best. It is like my Gillette Fusion razor. It gets close to the skin without the irritation
  257. This razor caught my eyes quite a while back, but due the fact that I had a perfectly good aging Norelco, I strayed away from it. During my last deployment though, my Norelco's battery finally failed. After 10 months of shaving with a blade, I realized it was time to purchase an electric razor again. My first electric was a Braun 4525 which I made the mistake of leaving out for someone else to take and remembering how much I loved that razor, decided it was time for another Braun. Now I know everybody has different adjustment periods and Braun claims that it can take up to 3 weeks for your face to adjust, but for me it was instantaneous. Part of this might be due to military requirements that have me shave everyday or some other unknown reason, but either way my face adapted immediately to this razor. Now for the part that sets this razor above my Norelco. On weekends, I have never been one to bother with the razor as I get enough of it Monday through Friday and everyday during deployments, so I enjoy letting my beard go. This has always meant that on my first day back to work, that I would have to break out the shaving cream and blade for a first day of the week back shave. To my surprise though after a four day weekend I grabbed my Braun and to my amazement had the most comfortable shave ever!!! This feat was only tried once with my previous electric and after the rash and pain went away chalked up as a never try this again lesson. As far as some of the complaints I have read, is it louder than a whisper? Yes, it's an electric razor. Will it wake your significant other in the morning while you are shaving with the door closes? No and neither will the cleaning cycle. Speaking of the cleaning cycle, my Norelco would have whiskers fall out and pepper my sink area, but this is another issue resolved by the base unit. Is the cleaning solution too expensive? Even a frugal person such as myself can afford to buy a years supply for around $56 and not losesleep over it. As for those who complain about the hygiene meter not reseting to full after washing under water, try reading the manufacturers instructions. The bottom line here is this is an exceptional razor and if you are required to shave every Monday through Friday and like to let the beard go when you can, than this is the razor for you, stop looking and buy it. Military personnel you have found your closest inspection ready shave to date, buy this razor!!!
  258. Experiment Failed One day, after using a regular \\"old-fashion\\" razor-blade shaving, I decided to try Braun shaver. Well, it is not like I never tried electrical shavers before. I've had Phillips rotating-cutter shavers. Knowing for sure that none of tese electrical shavers could beat a razor blade (meaning that I did not even try to compare razor with electrics), I was still quite disappointed with Braun product in comparison with other types of electrical shavers. Here are the problems: The foil seems to be having holes that are too small, so the hair (especially on under the chin, neck area) does not get caught into the foil, so the vibrating blade has nothing to cut. After shaving with Braun, I get many places on my face with this single uncaught hairs sticking here and there. It looks weird. The shaving takes forever and it requires many passes over the same area. I have to shave twice (!) a day, otherwise my face looks like if I did not bother shaving at all. I should say, if I ever use electric shavers again, I will get a rotary-type. It will not be as smooth as a razor blade shaving, but at least, I would not have uncaught and uncut hairs on my face).

  260. This is the second Braun razor I have owned and it is superior to the first. It is a solid, perhaps a bit heavy, machine that does a great job. It is not a one-pass device, I need to run it over and over the same areas to get a good shave, and I need to work the neck/chin area with extra attention, but when I'm through it is the closest shave I've had yet, and it certainly doesnt take any longer than previous shavers I've owned. I bought a Norelco in between my Braun's (because I wanted to buy American) but it was terrible and felt cheaply made. Cons: the wall plug is too long before the cord bends down, so that it unseats from being plugged into the wall by its own weight, the cleaner stand is cheap plastic looking in comparison to the high-end look of the shaver, and its real noisy when cleaning. Pros: I have researched online several folks who have reused the cleaner cartridge and made their own cleaner solutions which is what I will do, great shaver, worth the expensive price.
  261. I received this as a christmas gift from my girlfriend 2 years ago and have been thoroughly enjoying using it the entire time. This Braun gives nearly as close a shave as a genuine razor even after 2 years of use. I still have not replaced the head, even though it says that you should every 18 months. The cleaning system works surprisingly well. I'm still not sure how it sucks the hair out of there but it does. You can find the replacement cartridges on amazon in bulk by the way, which, ends up being quite a lot cheaper than buying them in the store. The flip up trimmer works great as well. Can't say enough how great a razor this is. It's pricy but worth it if you don't mind electric.
  262. Finally after 30 years of shaving, comes the Holy Grail in electric shavers. During my shaving years I have used a combination of blade and electric shaver during the week. Usually on a Monday morning I would use the blade to get the close shave I desire. I would then use an electric shaver for the other 6 days. My skin is rather soft and sensitive, so use of blade everyday was not possible without immense irritation. Over the years, I have used an array of different rotary shavers made by Norelco. These shavers got me by, but they NEVER gave me the close shave as the \\"Monday\\" blade did. I could always feel whiskers and by 5:00pm, there was the shadow. Cleaning of the shaver was messy and the awful Ni-Cad batteries had to be run from top charge to bottom charge in order to get the longest life out of them. Now after so much searching and years of patiently waiting along comes the Braun 790cc. I read every review I could find on this unit to be absolutely sure that this one was going to be the answer to my dreams for a easy, quick, close shave. Well, after a week of hemming and hawing, I bought it. It was here in 3 days and I charged her up. The next morning, I gave the Braun 790 a spin for the first time. I did it as recommended, prior to washing face and showering. I tried that once with the Norelco and I ended up having to shower and shave again, just to make it look as if I shaved that morning. For me this 790 gave me the closest shave I have ever experienced using an electric razor in all of my shaving years. When I was finished, my face felt like \\"Monday morning blade smooth\\". No irritation at all, and SUPER close. I have been using the Braun 790 for close to 4 weeks now and have never gone back to blade. There is no need to. The Braun removed that pain from my life! Bye-bye shaving cream. I love the automatic cleaning process. Just set the shaver in the base. The base chooses the correct cleaning cycle based on use and then the next morning I have clean, lemony fresh and oiled shaver ready to go. Always out of box clean. And the lithium battery, of which I have always wished for has no memory, so I do not have to run the razor from top to bottom charge anymore. Just charge it everyday while it is cleaning. NO problem! Thank you Braun. I have never spent over $200 for an electric razor, but it is comforting to know that Braun has created the electric razor that I will use for the rest of my living years. WORTH EVERY PENNEY! Including the future purchases for cleaning solution. WORTH EVERY PENNY! This is the razor that my father had always dreamed of having. I only wish he could have experienced what I am experiencing these last 4 weeks and for the rest of my life.

  264. I have been using the Braun Series 5 8985 (http://www.amazon.com/Braun-Series-5-Mens-Shaver/dp/B000G1EQ1W/dp/B000G1785S) with the Clean and Renew system for over 2 years now. I have purchased new blades as well as a new foil cap within the past year for the razor. I received the Braun Series 7 790cc as a gift this past week. The difference between the two is VERY noticeable. The series 5 is a great razor, but always has difficulty in getting the longer hairs on and around the neck. It would take me about 6-8 minutes to shave with the series 5. It takes me about 2-3 minutes for a closer and more comfortable shave with the new series 7. The \\"Fast Clean\\" feature is outstanding. The razor gets clean within a minute. The full clean is MUCH quieter than the previous generation. Charging seems to take quite a bit less time as well.<br /><br />It is a bit expensive, but is worth every penny to get the upgrade. If I had known how big of a difference this razor would make, I would have upgraded sooner. I wish I could give this product a sixth star.

  267. This is a fantastic product. I have only used three different electric razors, this being the fourth. Bar none, the best shave I have ever had with an electric razor!! I do not understand the few bad reviews this product has received. It is very expensive and thus maybe some individuals are expecting some sort of shaving miracle. I don't know. However, if you are looking for a new electric razor, or ready to make the switch from traditional blades, this is the product you should buy. I have never had a shave as close as this product can achieve without some sort of irritation or bumps. There is zero irritation associated with this shaver. If you are frugal, but still pull the trigger on buying this, you do not have to use the clean and renew system every time. It is an option. You could opt to remove the foil and brush clean it, or hold it under running water. Bottom line--If you want a fantastic electric razor that shaves as close as a blade as possible without using a blade, this is the one to buy!!
  268. I've been using the Norelco 1050 for almost 2 years. Wasn't impressed with it at all in the beginning and I'm still not now. It made poor shaves, I would have to go over the same spot too many times and it would STILL not shave it clean. It made my shaving time longer and it irritated my skin a lot, but I kept it and used it because it was a good alternative to not get cuts with a regular razor. Well it recently stopped working so I went ahead and got this shaver, I thought, no more from Norelco, with it's poor design that doesn't let you keep a straight goatee. I got the Braun 790cc and let me tell you that I was quite impressed with it. First of all the design is a lot better because it's able to shave more part of your face. You can keep your sideburns or goatee straight. It doesn't feel like it's made of cheap parts like the Norelco did. I liked that it also didn't feel plasticy and that it didn't feel like a kids toy unlike the Norelco. The trimmer is a lot better too, you can see it better and it makes it easier to keep your sideburns nice and straight. It cuts a lot better too. It has a battery and hygiene meter. The battery one comes in handy but the hygiene I feel is either inaccurate or fake. For example, if you clean the inside of your hair and debris with warm water, the hygiene meter will remain the same as if you haven't cleaned it at all. It only changes if you put it in the cleaner and let the cleaner do the work, but I think it has something to do with the charger/cleaner that changes the hygiene meter. Everything works great. The shaver itself shaves very closely. Gives you a clean shave and fast. It doesn't irritate the skin and you'll always be satisfied with the shave. Although, still doesn't give a close shave on the neck at all. I still end up using a razor for the neck. Oh well no big deal, I didn't expect it to do a great job on the neck but with your face, it is just as close as a razor. It's probably the best shaver on the market and I feel it is worth the money if you abandon the normal razor for fear of always getting cut. This shaver doesn't give you any cuts so you won't need to worry about shaving it too hard. I have sensitive skin so I would know about the problems with shaving. Anyway, I recommend it if you have the money to spend.
  269. I was a bit skeptical when I received this Braun shaver as a gift but realized soon after how great this shaver is. The shaver cuts relatively close (you'll never get a shave closer than using a blade) but overall an excellent shave. The key to this shaver is the cleaning system which keeps the shaver in brand new condition at all times. The base unit will always inform you how clean or dirty the shaver it and will light up when you need to put it through the Braun cleaning process. You do have to replace the cleaning fluid every 3 months but this is pretty inexpensive (if you buy through Amazon). I used to use a wet dry shaver from Norelco for years (to get the closest shave possible and other dry shavers used to irritate my skin). Now I can't live without my Braun. B/c of the cleaning system, I don't even use aftershave anymore....which is a great tradeoff.

  273. Not sure what else i can add to the title. Simply put, this shaver does indeed rule. I can't speak to you guys with the brawny man type beards. But, for a guy like myself who needs to shave every other day it is simply fantastic. As mentioned I don't have a really thick beard but, I have a mole underneath my lower lip which prohibits me using a manual razor in that area. Previously I was using a manual for a good portion of my face and a Panasonic foil in the mole area. This was a HUGE hassle but, no electric I had used to this point allowed me to do away with the manual razors. They always chewed up my flesh and and left hairs behind and the shave wasn't that close. Hey, I may not have to shave every day but, I do want a close shave. Hence the reason i had to use both... Enter the 790cc. It has changed everything. No more manual razors. No more shaving creams and gels. Shaves me great every time and shaves close. I have a hard time telling the difference between this Braun and a manual and cream. As far as cost- yes it is a bit expensive but, you get what you pay for I suppose and it wasn't that much more than the Panasonic I have now collecting dust. I love the clean and renew feature and can understand why some may feel it expensive but, in reality- it is worth it. From my experience there wasn't really much of an \\"adaptation\\" period. This may be due to the fact that I had already had experience with a foil though. Again- shaves me close, love the cleaning system, gets all the little hairs on my particular neck, does NOT chew up my face like a cheese grater. I have found that Braun's instructions regarding shaving before you shower to be spot on. ------------------UPDATE-------------------------- Ok after having had the shaver a little longer now I just wanted to do a quick update. I still feel it's an incredible razor and for those that aren't happy with it I'm not sure what the issue is? Maybe some have brawny man beards and are expecting this to cut through their face fros like a straight razor? Or maybe they are not used to it yet. not sure and no offense to anyone we're all different but, anyhow. So here are my observations: I listed above that Braun's instructions about shaving before a shower to be spot on and they are - for most people. I found after awhile that shaving first and then getting into a hot shower sort of irritated my skin a bit personally- kind of burned a bit. This may vary depending on the individual and their skin type. So I decided to do a little experiment- Shower first and let my face fully dry while I got dressed/ made coffee/ whatever then shave. I found this to be the best method for me. It still shaves as well and possibly even better than the pre-shower method and I get absolutely no irritation. My skin is a bit oily naturally so I have no issues with \\"natural lube\\". At first I found myself mashing the shaver against my flesh for whatever reason. Must have been because of the Panasonic I had before and the fact that I could only get decent results by mashing it hard against my skin. I now have learned to let it glide across my flesh and get even better and faster results. In regards to the cleaning solution. As I've already mentioned- I only need to shave once every other day and that is the regiment that I follow. I do use the cleaning base after every shave. It has now been roughly 6 weeks since I've owned the shaver and my read out on the display base still shows my fluid level at \\"HIGH\\". So, again this may be dependent on the person and how much stubble thye've collected. One thing I do after every other shave is just remove the foil and tap out the stubble into the sink. Not sure if this has any effect but, that's what I do. When I pop the shaver into the base after each shave and allow it to auto select the cleaning that the razor needs it has always selected \\"ECO\\" mode. As another experiment on one occassion I did not clean it until after 2 shaves. When I popped it into the base auto select went to \\"NORMAL\\" mode. So i beleive it is all working correctly. On a side note to that- you can get the cleaning cartridges here on Amazon in either 2 or 3 packs. Pay close attention to the pricing on them. Sometimes it is only a dollar or 2 more to get 2- 2 packs (total of 4 cartridges) then it is to get 1- 3 pack. And other times it's cheaper to get 1- 3 pack vs. 2-2 packs.

I tried contacting Braun customer service on April or May 2009 so that I could send my shaver for repair or replacement. However, it was extremely hard to get a hold of them. They finally answered one of my emails yesterday, which was September 22nd, 2010. I DON'T RECOMMEND anyone to purchase Braun products. I'm surprised Amazon is selling Braun products since Braun has such horrible service.
  284. I bought this new Pulsonic Series 7790cc because my previous model Razor from Braun Series 8 had problems with two of them within a year. this model shaves close and comfortable and had no pull on the longer hairs. this model is also easier to clean. expensive, yes but there are NO free lunches out there. Fast shipping from Amazon.com
  285. I have had this shaver for almost four years now, after previously using a Norelco, a Remington, a Panasonic, and a different Braun over the preceding 20 years. It costs more than most razors, but the price difference is more than worth it. It gives a closer shave, in about 2/3 the time, with less discomfort. If it lasts me 8 years (which would be my guess since it's still going strong), and I use it ~300 times per year, that's 2400 shaves. If it costs $100 more than the alternative shaver, that's an extra 4 cents per shave.
  286. This is everything I wanted in a shaver. The Braun Series 7 looks sleek, and gives an amazingly close shave. Easy to carry in it's case. Charges very quickly, and easy to hand wash. However, I don't clean it with the solution every time the hygene bars go down, I find it to be pricey to buy it that frequently.
  287. I was disappointed when my husband found out that this is NOT a wet-dry shaver, when he reads the instructions. I thought this is a wet-dry model since the reviews say it is the best on the market. Maybe in the product description should mention this is not a wet-dry model. Anyway, luckily the seller is great that they gave us the full refund of the product (we did not use it). Five star for the seller, three star for the product.
  288. I've never been more disappointed in a big brand item! My husband had used it about 6 times when it started to rattle and shake like a #10 on the Richter Scale. We thought perhaps the head was broken because it ran fine with the head off. So. . . we put out more big bucks and bought a new head for the already new razor. Same thing. I could find no one who could fix it. I finally sent it to a manufacturer who promptly returned it without even looking. Finally I found an address for the \\"big cheese\\" mother company and sent it there. After hearing nothing for nearly 8 months, I got a letter saying that they were sorry and if I sent a mailing address (not po box as was on return label) they would send me a new razor. Haven't heard from them again!!!!!!!! It's been well over 6 months. A lesson well learned about Braun products. . . don't buy any more!
  289. All I have to say is if you have a baby face you will love this thing! If you have a very thick beard like myself this thing could be your worst nightmare. It takes a while to get used to and you cannot switch between blade and electric. If also takes a while to shave and if you have a very think beard it will not be as close as a blade and will leave hairs behind. So if you have a very thick beard then this shaver is not for you!
  290. I have tried lots of different shaving systems. This is not one of the greatest. It is not uncommon for this shaver to irritate my skin. The shave is not all that close. And it is not the huge time saver I thought it would be. I would not buy it again.
  291. I have used this razor for over a year. It is my third Braun. It shaves ok, about a good as any other Braun, but when they redesigned their shavers from the previous generation, they relocated the pop out trimmer. Every now and then, I trim the back of my neck using a hand held mirror. The way they positioned the trimmer, you can't see where you are trimming because the body of the razor blocks the view of the trimmer head. It may sound like a trivial thing, but it is actually a huge pain. I had to buy a separate trimmer as a result. Bad design on a pretty good, but pricy shaver.
  292. I bought it because of all of the good things I read here and I am in agreement: Good investment. My old Braun was still running strong but I was pretty much \\"sanding\\" off my beard, it seemed. My only tip concerns the cleaning fluid: I stuff a plastic bag in the opening in the cleaner's top between cleanings. I expect that will solve the evaporation issue. Use cleaner once a week, not daily, but I did pop for the replacement 3-pak. Hope it lasts a year.
  293. While the shave is very good, and I like the cleaning system, Beware that this is a very noisy unit both while shaving and while cleaning.
  294. Over the last 30 years I have owned three Braun Electric Shavers. I run them into the ground, and have replaced motors and batteries to keep the last one going beyond its natural life. This Braun is the best so far. It is ergonomic beyond the older models. I would match it with a custom shave from a very good barber, complete swith hot towels! Shop around, or let Amazon shop around for you. You might find some better deals, but grey market products are out there. If I had to replace this razor for some immediate reason (Like lost with luggage) I would buy another, If I were buying a razor for someone I really liked, this would be the one. I have very bad advanced arthritis - typing is difficult and my right wrist is frozen with a pin inside, so shaving right handed, as I normally do, is a challenge for the razor. The Braun does this fine. I cannot speak to the long term mechanical reliability, but if it is at all like my two other Brauns I will use it a long time. I am retired, and I do not have a lot of disposable income. A purchase like this one is a decision that gets a lot of thought and planning. But I have no regrets or buyers remorse. Anyone who is buying a shaver as a gift, who can afford this upscale model, cannot miss with this one![[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]]
  295. Picked this up locally last night since I knew there was a chance I wouldn't like it and returning it would be easier that way. Had about 3 days of facial hair growth at the time. I tend to shave about every three days with my Gillette Fusion Power razor to prevent looking like I got in a fight with 6 wolverines in a paper bag, so this was a fairly apples-to-apples comparison. My goal was to find a shaving tool that would allow me to shave EVERY day. I figured it wouldn't be AS close as a razor, but it had to at least cut all the hairs and not let it look like I needed a shave when done. I followed the directions to the letter and was suprised how quickly I had a full charge. So, no washing of the face before, as instructed in the manual. I started shaving near my jawline by the sideburns and ear. Then I realized that I had some electric shaver pre-shave stuff and slapped some of that on. That did it's usual job of lubricating my face and making the whiskers stand up from my face. I found that I had to go over every part of my face between 5-10 times to do a reasonable job and still had more than just a couple hairs that were still not cut. I tried using the \\"LOCK\\" button and shaving at an angle and it didn't help at all. So, I'd say the performance was \\"passable\\" at the cheeks and jawline. That being said, the performance on the neck was abysmal. Even running over the same area at multiple angles left tons of hairs no matter what I did. I shaved against the grain, as instructed... which didn't help. Needless to say, this sucker is going back and I will stick with my Fusion Power and shaving every three days for now. It's a shame that I got a similar shaving experience with my Braun foil shaver in 1990 as I got with this ~$300 tool in 2009. Your mileage may vary.
  296. He upgraded from a 3 Series and despite a little skepticism is now converted. I'm still surprised. Beware it's not a small contraption.
  297. I have been shaving with electric shavers ever since I started to shave. Over the years I have owned Remington shavers, Norelco shavers, and various Braun shavers. This is by far the best shaver I have ever used. I purchased it on Amazon on 8-21-09 and have used it almost every day since it arrived, and I have gotten the closest, most comfortable shaves with it. I would highly recommend it!
  298. I like this shaver. It works great, very smooth, delicate, and friendly to skin. I can now shave above my throat smoothly. My skin is sensitive and used to get red after shaving, but with this Braun I just feel comfortable. I like it very much. Finally don't forget to buy it only on Amazon, 'cause it has an incredibly amazing customer service, as well as reasonable prices. I received it pretty fast too. Thanks Braun for the good product & thanks Amazon for the perfect service!!
  299. I purchased this shaver several months ago, and decided to provide my review after using it almost daily during that period. This is a lengthy review. History I've been a manual razor user since I began shaving, but I did dabble in various electric razors. I received an expensive rotary electric razor as a gift but found it missed too many hairs, eventually returning to a manual razor. During my Army days, I purchased a cheap (under twenty dollars) foil razor, which worked surprisingly well during those field training exercises when I didn't bring my usual manual razor. I learned that the foil razors shaved my face better than the rotary version; this experience influenced my decision to later buy this foil razor. So, many years went by, but I still favored my manual (multi-blade) razor with grocery store shaving cream. I developed an interest in wet shaving using the old-fashioned double-edge (DE) safety razors, with a high-quality shaving cream and badger brush. Although it's more time consuming, DE shaving is my favorite; it provides me with the absolute closest shave possible. Unfortunately, I developed a skin condition on my face called rosacea, which is basically a red, painful swelling, which can be aggravated by daily shaving with a blade. I visited my physician, who not only prescribed a gel called Metrogel but also recommended I switch to an electric razor. He warned me that many guys accustomed to shaving with a manual razor, may be disappointed with electric razors since they don't shave as close as a blade. Experience I know I want a foil (versus rotary) shaver because of my prior experience. Since the new shaver would become my primary tool, I want a high quality item that provides the closest shave an electric razor can provide. After a much searching, I settled on the Braun brand, and after more research, settled on their top-of-line model, 790cc. Here's what I like, in no particular order: 1. Heavy (but not too heavy). It feels good in the hand. 2. Powerful. It cuts through whiskers (even several days' worth of growth) without hesitation. 3. No pinching. I find that cheaper razors can cause razor burn or painful pinching. 4. Cleaning options. Basically, there are a couple of ways to do this. One is to use the included base station. Drop the unit in, and press the button. It cleans and recharges the razor and comes out smelling \\"lemony\\" afterwards. Some reviewers feel this is a scam by Braun to generate more revenue by selling refills for the base station. My experience is that refills are required about every 5 weeks or so with daily use. Replacements are about six dollars, and I don't mind paying for the convenience. However, the directions state that the razor can be cleaned by running under water and periodically putting a little machine oil on the cutting block. 5. Travels well. I use this on short trips (< 5 days). Fully charged, the unit lasts approximately for 5 days. If necessary, the power cord can be detached from the base station and taken for longer trips. If the unit is no longer charged, it can be used with the power cord plugged in. The travel case is sturdy and holds up fine in my carry on (by the way, I've had no trouble taking this unit through airport security check points (just to be clear, I never take the base station with me, but leave that at home). 6. It doesn't heat up. Cheaper razors tend to get quite warm after being on for a while. This doesn't do that. 7. Side-burn trimmer. OK, this is not great, but it's pretty good. Sometime I'll whip out my DE razor to get a perfect side-burn trim. 8. Battery/Hygiene indicator. The battery indicator is nice to have, especially when traveling. The hygiene indicator is interesting, but I just drop the unit the base station after each use and clean it, so I don't pay much attention to that piece of it. 9. Shave quality. I saved this for last. The shave quality is phenomenal, but it doesn't start off that way. It takes time (a couple of weeks) for the face to become accustomed to the razor. The shave will improve as (1) your face adjusts, and (2) your technique improves. Technique is really a function of the way you adjust to the many directions of whisker growth. Be sure to shave against the grain. Also, if you're moving from a manual razor to this one, do not alternate during this transition period. You'll just prolong the adjustment period. This razor it not designed to be use on a wet face. Face should be clean and dry. I usually wash my face, dry it throughly, and apply an electric pre-shave solution. Although an electric pre-shave solution is not required, I find that it helps immensely in getting a really close shave (virtually as close as a manual razor). Although this is a little off topic, I will emphasize that a pre-shave solution helps tremendously. My favorite is Lab Series (unscented), while my second favorite is Anthony (lightly scented). I've used Williams Lectric Shave, and although it works great, the smell is too strong for me. A couple more points 1. Some people recommend refilling the cleaning solution holder with rubbing alcohol, in an attempt to save money. These aren't designed to be refilled. More importantly, the cleaning solution appears to contain some sort of lubricant (in addition to alcohol and a lemon scent). This is obvious if you dip your finger in the solution and rub your fingers together. If you're going to spend two hundred or more dollars on this razor, follow the directions and either (1) use the base station with appropriate cleaning solution refills, or (2) don't use the base station and instead rinse the unit per the instructions. 2. As your face adjusts and your technique improves, you'll notice your shaves improving to a point where they're almost as close as a manual razor. It took me several months to realize the importance of using a good electric pre-shave solution. Summary Although it's expensive, it's a wonderful product. My rosacea is under control, my shaves are close (almost as close as a blade), and it takes me significantly less time to shave in the morning. My shaves are close enough that I don't need to do any touch-up shaving later in the day. I highly recommend.
  300. This is my third shaver and by far the best for my sensitive skin. It took me a year to decide on a shaver of this price and it has proved to be well worth it.
  301. Really wondered how a shave could be worth that much money more than my Norelco triple head rotary. Now I understand that it is. Shaves better than a blade on me and my face was already plenty tough enough from the Norelco. Only takes about a third as long to do a job properly, while cheaper razor left uncut stubble here and there, especially on neck.
  302. I've never written a review but this razor deserves one. I've always used the Norelco's (top of the line models) because I just didn't see that a foil razor could do a better job than a rotary one. Well, I was dead wrong. The Series 7 shaves so much closer than my Norelco it isn't even close. I'm 47 years old and have used Norelco's for about 25 years but I will never go back after using the Braun. It is louder than my Norelco but it just performs better and the cleaning station works great. And it is very fast, pretty much one or two passes and you're done. I'm glad I spent the money; yes it is expensive but totally worth it in my opinion.
  303. I had the braun activator, which did ok. This is in a whole new league. I have very sensitive skin and recommend this product to anyone who has issues with shaving. For those who can't use cheap razors, this is a must-buy!
  304. Like many others I'm sure, I read many reviews here before deciding whether to order. I've used a Philips/Norelco rotary shaver primarily for at least a decade. But I always use a safety razor (quattro or similar) when I need a really close shave because I never got it with the rotary. When a hotel cleaning staff walked off with my previous rotary shaver, I had no choice but to buy new. I'm very glad I did. I am a skeptic by nature and I expected some level of disappointment given my previous experience with electric shavers. But following the recommendations to shave before I wash my face and by going over areas a couple of times, I have gotten a very close shave. When I run my hand over my face against the beard growth following shaving with my new Braun, it's very close to how it is after I shave with a safety razor. I never got this close with the rotary even when the rotary cutters are brand new and clean. I'm a convert.
  305. the one-button quick cleaning is awesome, totally hassle-free even you always forget to clean after each shave
  306. I have used electric shavers on and off throughout my life and I was always disappointed in my purchases after a few weeks so, ultimately, I found the Fusion blade and was exceptionally happy using it for shaving. However, I decided to go bald recently and did not enjoy the constant razor burn I got from shaving my head with a razor. Along comes the Braun Series 7 Pulsonic miracle and I am happy to say that I can keep my head as close shaved as a new born baby's behind without great effort. The closeness of the shave on my face and my head is unbelievable! I have never gotten this close a shave from any electric shaver or any razor. I recommend this shaver despite the price tag because, after all, aren't we worth it?
  307. YOU CANNOT RETURN THIS SHAVER TO AMAZON FOR ANY REASON! Braun Series 7 Shaver.   309. I am 84 years of age and taking blood thinners. As a result of this, I could no longer shave with a bladed razor. I had purchased a Norelco three headed razor and was not at all satisfied with its ability to shave me down closely to my skin. After a lot of searching on line, I purchased the Braun Series 7-790cc Pulsonic Razor and found that gave me a very good shave with a minimum of going back over my cheeks and chin to get a good shave. In short, I am pleased with the performance of the razor. However, I suddenly realized that the cleaning aspect involved the use of a flammable alcohol type cleaning fluid and I did not have a place to put the cleaning dock where it was in a spark free or gas stove free area. As a result, I am now using only the razor portion of the system and cleaning it by removing the head and running water through the head and the gear area of the razor. I have also purchased a replacement head to use if and when the present head needs replacement. I am keeping the razor, find the cleaning aspect cumbersome and, possibly, dangerous as I live alone and am deaf when not using my hearing apparatus. A really good buy if can use safely.
  310. I had an older model of the Clean & Renew system, which I loved. Eventually, the power button broke and the unit would not turn off. My girlfriend got me this new one for Christmas at my behest, and I thought I'd love it. Everything is fine with it except the most important part: The blades are very weak. It takes me over 2x longer to shave than it did with my old unit. The new blade system just doesn't cut it. I have to shave daily no matter what, and I want something that's going to cut quickly and efficiently. I must go over the same areas multiple times, and sometimes press hard to get it to cut like a $200 shaver should cut. That said, I suppose if you have a light beard or thin hair, it might work for you. As far as I'm concerned, it's not worth the money and I'd like mine (or hers) back. These blades are just plain awful.
  311. My husband loves the shaver! He says that it took a couple of days for his beard to get used to the \\"pulsation\\" action of the shaver, that raises the hair more on its end, so to speak. But now it shaves wonderfully close!
  312. I bought the Braun Series 7-790cc shaver with some reservations. Over the years I tried various other electric shavers with very disappointing results. Not so with the Braun 7. It shaves close, it does not miss hairs, it works better than I could of hoped. Bottom line is that everyone's face (and hair) is different, but if you are considering an electric razor then you owe it to yourself to try this one out.
  313. i switched from the Norelco Arcitec and there is no comparison. The Braun Series 7 shaves quicker and closer and is simply the best electric razor on the market.
  314. Recently the shaver began to stop running while shaving. By troubleshooting it I came to the conclusion that it would only run with a virtually fully charged battery, as indicated on the integrated battery meter. At or below the 80% charge level it would cut out. It's still under warranty, so I sent it in for service with a complete and detailed explanation of the problem. Braun's service center has just sent me an email stating that they found nothing wrong with it and are returning it to me without repair. Buyer's be aware that at least in my experience Braun does not honor the warranty. It doesn't take a rocket scientist to tell when something fails. And, I went to the time and expense to ship it to them. So, I guess their two possible excuses for calling it OK are either I'm an idiot and can't tell when something quits working, or that I'm a liar. Even if they turned it on and it worked for a moment, there is no doubt that the \\"symptoms\\" I reported indicate a problem. A company with integrity would know what was most likely wrong and replace the likely defect part.
  315. I bought this shaver because it was recommended to my by some friends. This is my first real dive into an electric shaver. I am glad that I don't need to use a blade razor anymore. I would recommend this shaver to someone looking for an electric shaver..

  318. I got this for my husband - it looked great and I know he was not happy with the shaver he had - the blades seemed to dull so fast - He does NOT like it.
