  319. After shaving for more than 40 years with a series of Norelco triple headed electric razors I decided to scan the Amazon reviews before purchasing my next electric razor, and noticed that most reviewers raved about the Braun series 7 (790cc). I had been happy with my Norelco razors, but since I have a heavy beard, and shave at least once per day, I decided to try the Braun series 7 (790cc) to see if I got a closer shave. I didn't. I get a close shave from the Braun, but no better than the Norelco I used before it needed replacing. After using the Braun for about one month I've decided the Norelco and Braun provide equally close shaves. However, there are several features of the Braun that I dislike, and several features of the Norelco that I prefer. 1) The Norelco side-burn trimmer is easier to use than the Braun, which has an awkward, extended trimmer that seems poorly designed. The Norelco trimmer is compact and has a larger cutting edge. 2) The Norelco indicates the battery remaining with an LED on the razor. The Braun has to be placed in it's cradle to see the charge remaining. 3) The Braun indicates whether the razor needs cleaning - which takes place by pressing the Clean cycle on the razor stand. However, when I clean the razor under running water, dry it, and replace it in the stand, it still indicates it requires cleaning. The indicator measures how \\"often\\" I shave, but not the actual \\"need\\" for cleaning. If you want the razor to clean itself, and if you don't mind purchasing a new cleaning cartridge every few months (or more, depending on how often you use the self-cleaner) the feature is worthwhile, but I don't mind rinsing the razor every few days. I also don't like the smell of the cleaning solution - another reason to rinse with water. 4) The price of the Braun was more than the top of the line Norelco, primarily due to it's self-cleaning capability that I won't be using. Since both razors provide close shaves, I recommend the Norelcoover the Braun.
  320. This was my first electric shaver, before I had always used the razor, but my skin is very sensitive and shaving every day was often an isssue. This shaver solved my problem! However, the shave is not as deep as the one achieved with a razor, but it can get very close if one has time to catch the hair in the most difficult areas. I would definitely buy it again (or ask it as a gift as i did!)
  321. I've used this shaver for about six months now. Overall, I'm rather unsatisfied if the price and consumable costs are ignored, and very unsatisfied with the unit once these costs are considered. I'm willing to spend money if the unit works, but this one just doesn't work as well as shavers at half the cost. The shave quality - Fair at best. It shaves most whiskers pretty well, but those random thicker hairs just seem to avoid this shaver entirely. I can go over the same section of my face five times trying to get a single hair and this shaver just can't get it. Why? It's strange that the majority of my face feels clean shaven, but there are those stray whiskers that just refuse to allow this shaver to take them down. I REGULARLY break out my older (and much cheaper) shaver to clean up what this expensive shaver just can't get. Why does my 4 year old shaver (also a Braun) with a one year old cutter work MUCH better than this relatively new unit? The cleanup - The cleaning unit is a mixed bag. It's nice to just drop it in and press a button, but it just seems stupid. It alwasy feels and smells clean and fresh, but those cartridges will cost you about $6 each and they only last for a month or two. After using it for a while, you may realize how silly it is and wish you had gotten a cheaper and more reasonable shaver. Cleaning an electric razor is almost a non-issue, so having this giant cleaning unit that consumes disposable cartriges is just stupid. What is the environmental cost of every man using this shaver and throwing away those used cartridges every 40-60 days? Build quality - Pretty good. The shaver itself feels sturdy. The pop-up trimmer is awkward to use because of the angle it comes out at. The head shows significant wear already on the plastic areas because the cleaning fluid is eating away at it. How could they build a cleaning system that seems to slowly destroy the shaver itself? My advice - look at other shavers. Braun makes some good products but this isn't one of them.
  322. By far the best Braun to date! I have been a Braun shaver user for close to 25 years, and this is by far the best shaver they have produced. The closeness of the shave and the ease of cleaning and maintaining the optimal performance is first class. Given the cost of replacement foil cassettes, using the system and cleaning will extend the usefulness and effectiveness of the shaver. Highly recommended to anyone wanting a great shave.
  323. Absolutely the best electric shaver I've ever had. A clean, easy, quick shave. I've used various brands over the last 40 years and this was an eye opener. A little expensive compared to other brands but well worth it. It's false economy to scrimp on a product you use nearly every day of a man's life.
  324. Like most reviewers, I did a lot of research before spending the money on a razor like this one. To be honest, I was really hesitant to shell out this kind of money. In the past, I've purchased your typical \\"cheap\\" electric razor. So...after the research and not finding a razor with better feedback, I broke down and purchased the Braun Series 7-790cc. When I first used it, although it left a very close shave (not as close as a razor but better than any other electric razor) I was getting razor burn or at least that's what I thought it was. After reading the manual, it states that it can take up to 3 weeks before your skin adjusts to the new razor. I toughed it out and boy am I glad I did! About a week and a half after using my new razor the burns went away. I'm extrememely happy I made this purchase and definitely suggest this razor to anyone looking to upgrade. One helpful tip...the replacement cartridge for the cleaning fluid runs about $15 for 3 units. To combat this cost, I only clean the razor every 3 days. Days 1 & 2 simply clean it with running water. This make the cleaning cartridge last approx. 3 months. Hope this helps!
  325. I recently graduated from college and began shaving every morning for work for the first time in my life. Ive always had good but sensitive skin but shaving every morning took its toll and i started to develop acne around my jaw line. I bought this guy and within two weeks my skin is almost clear again. i dont understand how people complain about this thing. Skin feels great, shave is close, and there isnt any razor burn or issues at all. BUY IT
  326. Just got this in the mail and really pleased. I have not purchased a shaver in over 15yrs and did a lot of research before buying again. Glad I got this one!! Shave is extremely close and I would recommend to others who are looking for a new shaver. The only thing I do not care to much for is having to purchase the cleaning fluid modules but I guess it is worth it since I do not have to clean it myself. I work and live in Germany and will be going on vacation to Rome for 10 days next month. I will see how well it operates away from the main unit.
  327. This is my 3rd Braun shaver. I have also used Norelco shavers. This is the best shaver I have used thus far. It is worth the extra cost. One note - the instructions indicate to get a good shave to do so before washing one's face. I disagree. I have found it best to shower first and then apply a solution of Williams pre electric shave. Much better.
  328. There are only three reasons to buy an electric razor: save on blades, save time from buying blades or to avoid getting cut while shaving. Other than that blades, or manual shaving are superior--no one would argue that you can get as close as shave with an electric. The only thing they might say is \\"it is close to a blade.\\" With that said, I ordered the Braun 790. The thing has a whole lot of items to it and things you must buy to keep it going. Unlike the Braun of old when it actually was a German company which specialized in practicality and didn't try to milk customers into buying unnecessary things, Proctor & Gamble (the maker of Tide and Crest) bought them out and changed the game. Now you need to have this nasty alcohol solution cleaner--which must be repurchased every thirty days--in order to use your shaver. In the past Braun was designed to be cleaned with water and a brush. Furthermore, you need to replace the cutting block every year and a half for about forty bucks. So any money you might have saved by not having to buy blades is eaten up by Proctor & Gamble's desire to milk as much money as it can from you! Within a year and a half you will have spent nearly $400 to buy and maintain this razor--which will never shave as close as a blade and takes twice as long to shave as a blade. And unlike Panasonic which allows for shaving under water, Braun must be used dry which reduces lubrication and the closeness of the shave. All in all a raw deal, and therefore I am returning my Braun and realize the only thing this razor will help you get rid of is a lot of your money!
  329. Until they make a newer model (oops, too late), this is the best you can get. I would assume this is all true for the slightly update model as well. Reasons you want this: 1. Cleaning: It really does clean itself that well and I don't think the premium of cartridges is that bad. For less than $10 a month, you spend less time cleaning and your face gets fewer blemishes from all those friendly bacteria that would otherwise nest on the razor between uses. 2. Shave quality: If you use it every day, expect the the best. I don't use a regular razor, not ever, so I'm not comparing. But I've owned several electric razors and even after months of use, this thing beats out all my past razors by a long shot. 3. Shave speed: I didn't expect to notice a change, but the speed claims are actually true. I take about half as long to shave now. Issues: 1. Long hair = pain: If you wait a couple days to shave, I've found that this model is a bit unforgiving. It takes forever to get done and as you shave, it occasionally grabs a hair, painfully. It doesn't yank it out, it just catches it rather strongly. So I've resolved to shave every day and if I go on vacation, I first use the little side trimmer to chop things down before I use the main blade. 2. Cartridge confusion?: I had different experiences than others with the cleaning cartridges (which you don't *have* to use). For me, it didn't want to change the cartridge after 6 weeks of daily usage. I felt that it wasn't getting as clean as it should and then the 'replace soon' light came on. I decided to change the cartridge 'early' and after the next cleaning I noticed a bit difference. Maybe the replacement light is based on the level of the solution. This is obviously easy to fix - I'll just replace the cartridge every month regardless of the little lights. Minor note: For traveling purposes, I found the case to be a little annoying - it doesn't want to close unless you get it in there just right and it's hard to tell where just right is. However, the case does work right and tends to stay closed and keep the unit safe, so that's fine. A minor issue as well if you travel for long periods - the cord for the cleaning unit is the same one you'd use to charge it without the cleaning unit, so you'll have to unplug it and pack it separate or purchase another separately. For me, I manage to get by on a single charge while I'm gone for a week or two. Last words: Although the price was a bit much to get me to buy, I was very happy with it. It's one of those things that when I use it each morning I'm glad that I convinced myself that it was a 'necessary' purchase :)
  330. I have used Braun shavers for about 20 years now. I began primarily to reduce skin irritation, which it does. My new Braun shaver is a replacement for my 5 series (lasted about 4 1/2 years of daily use), so my experience can only be to compare to other older Braun's. The Shave is the closest is have ever had from an electric shaver. Very little need to go over same area repeatedly, like in past with other shavers. I can pick up the razor in in about 1 1/2 minutes get a shave good enough for the professional work environment. The clean up continues to be exceptionally easy with use of the cleaning base. My previous two shavers had this base, and it alone could be used to justify the use of and electric shaver. About once a month, I open the shaving head to brush extra debris from the head of the shaver (just like in previous models). It is a little more difficult with this model due to the complexity of the shaving head. This is by far the most expensive shaver that I have ever bought. Although, it gives the best shave that i have ever had, with the exception of hot lather and straight razor from a barber. However, I have had poor customer service in the past from Braun (with another model) and given that it only has a 1 year warranty, it this reason that i give it 4 stars. If it gives me trouble free service for the next 4 years, it would then easily justify 5 stars.
  331. Shaves good except the fact that in some areas to have a very clean shave I would still use razor blades. Nevertheless it is the best shaver I've ever owned. I used to use razor blades exclusively because I just could't find a good electrical shaver
  332. I have been using Braun shavers for over 7 years now. The last one was terrific and gave me a close shave every time. The cleaning station left the shaver feeling like new every time. This one lacks in comparison. The shaver took some getting used to, like all shavers do, but I still feel like the other one got me a closer shave and less irritated. My biggest gripe is the new cleaning station. Yeah, it looks cool, but it does not do it's job. After a clean, when you pull out the shaver, you'll notice the dock is covered with hair gunk/residue. It's like its not properly draining into the cleaner cartridge. Braun needs to go back to selling their older models, the new ones are terrible. I think it's time for me to find a new brand of shavers.
  333. It isn't cheap, but this foil shaver will get you very close to a traditional blade shave without the cuts and burns. It absolutely leaves other mechanical shavers in the dust. The included trimmer and cleaning system is icing on the cake. In addition to the close shave, what I really like about the shaver is it does not get hot to the touch when extended shaving on difficult beards like mine. This helps reduce both irritation and in-grown hairs. What is surprising about this shaver is that is also gives a great shave on your scalp too. If you are bald and like to a have a smooth look on top, this shaver is simply amazing in it's closeness and ease - and no skin irritation there either. So far, in the several months I've owned mine, it has been very reliable.

  336. It's been a month and so far I am quite satisfied with this shaver. That one is about 8 years old and still in good working condition. As a customer I just don't appreciate the expensive replacement cost of the head, the cutters or the liquid cleaning solution.   337. I have used electric razors for virtually all my adult life. I change razors every one to two years. However, despite the nice looks and OK shave, I think the Panasonic was better. Braun's Pulsonic doesn't seem as close.
  338. I purchased the Braun Pulsonic specifically to own a high end electric shaver. I have owned both rotary and foil shavers. I prefer the closer shave of the foil shaver over the rotary. I ordered the Pulsonic based on the reviews of others stating that it was the best. I was not disappointed when I received the shaver. It shaves closer and with fewer passes than any other electric shaver I have used. It also glides over my skin more smoothly than any other shaver I have used. It certainly lives up to the old adage, \\"You get what you pay for.\\" My only concern with the shaver is a problem that I have had with all other shavers. My beard is very tough, and I will need to replace the cutting heads before the recommended service interval.

  340. My husband has been using this shaver for 2 years. He has tried other electric razors, along with shaving with a disposable razor. We spent a little more on this Braun, knowing it would be good quality (usually we go the cheap route and deal with what we get!). He has only replaced the blade once. The automatic washing feature has been very handy.<br /><br />We have found that when it is fully charged, it will last through several uses, so he can take it on a business trip without worrying about bringing the whole charging station. The cleaning solution also lasts through several washes. He can shave every day without irritation, or he can shave a couple of times a week and get the same results. He likes that it is easy to use and easy to clean. He gets a clean, close shave in a short amount of time.<br /><br />It is a little loud, especially when it's being cleaned in the cleaning station, but that's not enough to make us want a different brand!
  341. This is the best shaver on the market period. This is the first foil shaver that I`ve ever had good luck with. I tried the arcitec by Norelco and it was a good shaver but it is not as good as the Braun. I get no razor burn with the Braun, even on the neck. I do use Williams lectric shave though.
  342. I almost never write reviews about products I buy, typically because I am so friggin busy that its not a priority. I bought the Braun Pulsonic a few weeks ago and I was so impressed with the quality that I had to finally breakdown and share my impressions. I have been using an electric razor for 10 years. I switched because I was tired of nicks and and all the hassles of blade shaving. While the convenience has been great, I have never been completely satisfied with the closeness of my shaves with the various Norelco units I have used over the years. I had been eyeing Braun for a while because of the cleaning system but I only recently bought one when I was intrigued by the Pulsonic and it's claims to shake up deep resting hairs which typically turn into ingrown hairs no matter how much effort you put in trying to get rid of them. First, I'll say that the product is prohibitively expensive for a lot of people which is an unfortunate mark against it and Braun should really have lowered the introductory price to make it more affordable. That is the down side - now for the praise. The Braun Pulsonic took about three days to adjust to my skin type and face - most other razors I have used usually take a few weeks to break in and for the irritation to subside. While it is a bit noisy, the pulsing action lives up to the hype. I have never gotten such a close shave in my life. It even requires less passes than a blade razor which I thought was amazing. My morning shave takes about 5 minutes versus the 10 - 15 it took with my Norelcos. The end result is such a close shave that, when I run my hand accross my face, I rarely feel any stubble which is quite common with even the most popular of electric shavers. My skin is less irritated and the texture of my skin surface seems more even since I started using it (I have uneven, sensitive skin which is prone to minor breakouts and redness). I think the pulsing effect actually gets the blood flow moving in your face and helps to tone (my perception, not scientifically proven). If you can get over the astronomical price and you can deal with the slightly louder noise, this will be an investment in grooming that you will thank yourself for for years to come. I read some of the negative reviews and I have come to the conclusion that some of them are just people who complain about everything and will never be satisfied. Again, I never write these things and I am extremely picky, so this review is as honest as it gets. This product stands up and even exceeds its marketing hype. I hope you are as satisfied as I am.[[ASIN:B000IWFU3W Braun 9595 Pulsonic Shaving System]]

  346. This is a matchless razor - absolutely remarkable. Like many men, and particularly black men, I get ingrown hairs, razor bumps and all kinds of irritation. I've tried everything to fight what seemed to be a losing battle - from the gillette fusion & mach 3, to electric shavers and even straight razors. So after reading the glowing reviews on this site, I decided to take the plunge and try this Braun Pulsonic. I had experimented with a Norelco a few years back but ditched it after a couple of months. This Braun thing, however, is in a league of its own. It's by far the smoothest, quickest, most hassle-free razor I've ever used. Obviously, it's not going to give the kind of perfectly smooth shave that you'd expect from a gillette or straight razor - but it does come pretty close. If you're looking for something that's going to keep razor bumps in check, then this is a definite winner. I'm thoroughly impressed by this superb razor. I realize it's quite expensive (i'm a student) but if you can afford it, give it a try. I doubt you'll regret it.
  347. Summary: Braun promises the closest and most comfortable shave. They've clearly delivered the second, but failed on the first promise (at least for my skin/hair type). Longer review: About my razor usage: I don't usually shave every day, so I don't care much how clean each shave is. But I do care about ease of shave, and skin comfort. I've used Braun 4-series and 5-series before. My hair is rather strong, and grows non-perpendicular, so it was hard to shave, and required pressing the razor against the skin, sometimes causing irritations. The new Braun shaves without pressing the razor at all, much better and more comfortable that the 5-series. It is now a pleasure to shave, suddenly I don't mind doing it every day. But if you care about how close it shaves, I do not see any improvements at all - actually it is worse than 5-series, even when pressed agains the skin. It always leaves me about half of the \\"5 o'clock shadow\\" - which is surprising giving the reviews and ads. But this works for me anyway - I care more about the comform rather than how clean it shaves. About the feel of the rasor - it is very comfortable to hold, the construction feels good. My only concern is flip-out trimmer - it looks flimsy. The trimmer of my 4-series Braun had similar construction and broke down pretty quick. The sliding trimmer of 5-series was more solid and is still working without any problem.
  348. I previously owned 2 different Norelco rotary shavers and found them to be just \\"fair\\" in closeness....good for a six hour shave, used when I wanted to avoid the blade. Although I was achieving an excellent shave with a blade I found that my skin became too dry in the winter despite using post shave moisturizers. I decided to try the Pulsonic and have been very pleased. It takes about 2-3 weeks of daily use to achieve a close shave from this shaver. It is comfortable to use, and it is the best dry shave I have every experienced. I have used it daily for a month, and while a blade is still the best for closeness, this is an excellent alternative. A few times I have done a touch up shave in the evening before going out. I am new to the self cleaning device, it works well and I tend to use it every other day to extend the life of the cleaning cartridge as recommended in other reviews. I traveled with the Pulsonic over the holidays and although I brought the charger, I did not need to use it; after 12 days there was still battery life left. My only criticism is that the shaver is louder than the rotary shavers, not painfully loud, just that a quieter experience would be more welcome in the morning when I am trying to clear my head for the day ahead. Overall, the Pulsonic is an excellent shaver, appears well made, and has allowed me to avoid a wet/blade shave.
  349. This razor was much better and gave a closer shave than previous razors I have had.   350. The reviews for this Braun shaver have impressed me. However, why does Braun think that it is necessary to make shavers that are rechargeable? I would bet that if there was a poll taken to see if men would prefer a simple corded shaver, there would be an overwhelming majority for that type of shaver. I myself, and am sure other men don't need the hassle of having the additional cumbersome charger & gimmicky cleaner. Braun should go back a take a look at the model 5422 that they made some time ago. That was the epitome of a great electric shaver! Because of the void they created when they discontinued that model, it prompted a small company to try to reintroduce a prototype of the Braun 5422. Despite the good intention of the company, and I'm sure they have sold many of them, the shaver falls short of the Braun 5422 in performance & design. Braun would make many men happy if they would bring back the 5422!

  353. I really like the shave this Braun gives. It is closer than the last two Braun's I have owned - in fact, it is the closest shave I have had outside of a straight razor. And the best part is, I don't have to 'press' on my face or go back and forth several times to get it - which was a procedure I used to do with the previous Braun's - regardless of how new the blade was. Consequently, you can really use a 'light touch' when using this razor - which mean less irritation - and for me, less bumps - while still getting a close shave! I can't say how long the battery lasts between charges, but I know it lasts at least a week - and if the previous two Braun's I have owned are any indication, you should be able to get two weeks between charges. As far as I am concerned, they hit a home run with this one. One minor thing - this Braun is fairly noisy - not twice as noisy as the last two Braun's I have owned - but noisy enough - you couldn't use it with a baby sleeping in the next room, for sure! Just an FYI.
  354. Buyer beware! I purchased a Braun Activator 8595 Razor less than 2 years ago. I spent $170.00 on it in that course of time, I always use a pre-shave solution. Braun says they recommend not to use it, however all other brand razors have no issues with it. This razor is supposed to be stainless steel, apparently it isn't as this razor has been rusting. The service center without seeing it has doubted my claim, that it is virtually impossible, they say it may be discolored but not rust. As you know when something is rusty it is bumpy, not smooth. I have pictures to prove it, but mysteriously, Braun does not have an e-mail address that I can forward the pictues to. When I first spoke to Braun around 2/20/08, they gave me this authorized service center name and number. I called it and the announcement said that the center was closed as the owner had an emergency appendectomy and would return calls when he returned, needless to say I called him on 2/28/08, he never returned my call. He told me that I had to get an authorization number from Braun, he wouldn't be able to do anything for me as long as the razor worked also Braun does not give out authorization numbers. I guess they do not consider rusting a factor as part of their warranty. Between Braun and the \\"authorized service center\\", they kept me going around in circles with phone calls. They told me that if it was covered under the warranty I would be all set, but if not...then I am responsible for the repair charges. Since when is rust a cosmetic part of the razor that would not be covered by their warranty. I told them that I was never so disappointed with their customer service that I was trashing their razor and switching to Norelco. A reputable company would not allow a customer to feel this way and work with them on resolving the issue at hand. If you buy a Braun, you are making a big mistake!

  356. I've used electric shavers for over 40 years and must have used almost every one out there. I was intrigued by the irregular shaped holes in the shaving screen. I expected that they would capture stray hairs better than a round hole in everyone else's screen. CONS It doesn't shave any better than my 10 yr old Panasonic that has a metal frame (not cheap plastic) and a metal shaving head that holds the shaving screen. A very quality feel to the Panasonic--not the Braun. The Braun feels like cheap plastic which is not what is expected in the most expensive shaver on the market. Unfortunately Panasonic now only uses plastic too otherwise I would buy it again. The large, liquid cleaning system seems to be a gimmick...it takes a lot of room in the bathroom, requires refills of the cleaning goop and cleaning shavers have never been a problem to be solved. It's inconceivable that they do not include a small plastic cover to go over the delicate shaving screen when traveling. Included is a moulded plastic container into which the shaver fits for traveling but it doesn't fit in my shaving kit. All I want is a plastic cap to protect the screen and I put it in my shaving kit for traveling. I don't think the product development people use electric shavers. It's unfortunately not unique

  363. The Braun Pulsonic 9595 changed the way I view electric razors. Years ago I started with an electric razor, but could not get a close smooth shave.   369. I have been a Norelco man since I started saving. I figured I'd give another high end electric razor a try. Ultimately, I don't think one is necessarily better or worse, but there are trade offs to each. This razor gives a slightly closer shave than a high end Norelco. It's a little more bearable to skip a day between shaves if I need to. The downside to that, though, is that it is a little more irritating to the skin. When I'm done, it feels more like I shaved with a real razor and I want to use a little lotion or aftershave. One other difference...I think the shape of the head gets the shave done in less passes and does a pretty good job with the area under my jaw line, but the trade off is that it's a little worse at shaving smaller areas such as the area under my nose or finessing around my sideburns. It's nice having a clean razor each time I us it (though I usually clean it every other shave), but I don't know that it's anything that special, especially as you have to continue to purchase the cleaning cartridges. All in all, I like it enough to keep it.
  370. I ordered this razor from Amazon based on a lot of research and reading highly rated reviews. I've never spent this much on an electric razor. I wanted very badly to be perfectly happy with it. It looks awesome, is well-balanced in the hand, quieter than my old razor and the battery life is ridiculously long. I shaved 4 times (no just 2 minute shaves either) and only one bar out of 6 is gone from the battery meter (leading me to believe it may last as much as a month on one charge). Add the cleaning base to keep it fresh and what more could you ask for? But, I found myself doing a lot of \\"re-shaving\\" (following all shaving suggestions in the manual) and even with that...I was still able to go back with my old razor (Remington 2810, Microscreen Intercept w/ 3 year-old cutters and screens) and cut some spots left behind by the Pulsonic. Don't get me wrong, the Pulsonic's shave looked fine, but I go by feel. If I still feel rough spots, I shave them again. Unfortunately, I'll be going back to the old razor.
  371. So I paid some 200+ dollars for this shaver and my mistake was I expected some amazing results. Don't get me wrong the shaver gives a pretty close shave after you go over the same areas quite a few times. I think any shaver would give a close shave if you went over the same areas over and over again. Took me about 20mins to shave a days stubble. My old shaver, a Remington took lesser time but didn't give quite the close shave as the Braun. So it looks great, and has the pricey look and feel to it and does an OK job at shaving. Price difference between my old shaver and the Braun was about $140. Bottom line, is it worth the $200+.... No its not. There are other foil electric shavers in the market that would cost less and give you the same results. Also other shavers have similar features like self cleaning, cleaning under running water and replaceable cleaning cartridges. (This Braun does come with a pretty sleek looking carry case. I really like that.) You will not be disappointed when you buy this, however don't expect miracles just because this probably costs at least a $100 more than you average electric shaver.
  372. my boyfriend has really sensitive skin so, every time he shaved, he would be left with a lot of irritation and bleeding at times. the hair on his face and neck also grow in different directions so he has to go over the same area more than once, increasing the irritaion. i love it when he is clean-shaven, but i wouldn't push him to shave because i know it's painful for him so... i began to look for an answer to those horrible razors he's been using and i came across this product. after reading that it won \\"best razor\\" of the year in multiple men's magazines, i bought it and HE LOVES IT! he shaves everyday because it doesn't hurt him at all. he's been using it for about 3 weeks now and, just last night, he was touching his face saying, \\"i can't believe how smooth it is. it's like i'm naked!\\" the only gripe i have with this product is that it's going to be virtually impossible to top such an amazing gift for his next birthday!
  373. I've used an electric shaver for about 60 years. I am very pleased with this one; it is by far the best one I've ever owned.
  374. My old 8000 series Braun got left in a hotel room, so I figured I'd upgrade. However, this model does not shave my beard as well as the older model. My beard hairs grown in all directions and lay very flat. The Pulsonic had a tendency to yank them out, and it took pass after pass to get an area shaved clean. I finally gave it to my Dad (he's got a more normal beard and it works fine for him) and just bought a 8985 model, which works great.<br />So, be forewarned--this shaver might not work well for you, and it's NON-RETURNABLE.<br />However, it's very well made and seems to work great for my father, so I feel I need to give it four stars.
  375. Do not buy this item!!! I got it as a gift for someone and then realized he only uses straight razors.   376. I returned to Braun and decided to plunk down the extra cash for this machine. I am very happy I decided to come back to Braun as it was kind to my sensitive skin as well as giving me a very smooth shave according to my wife. The cleaning set up of the shaver is fantastic and practically painless. I reccommend you open the cleaning head to rid the excess hairs before doing the cleaning. If you want a clean trouble free shave get this one.
  377. If your wondering if this shaver head mechanically does what it should, never fear, it conforms to your face exactly, like no other. Way to go German engineers!!!!
  378. This is a terrific shaver. I was one of these guys who said never to an electric shaver. I thought that wow if this little piece could give me a decent shave the Braun had to be terrific.   379. In the past I had used a rotary razor for 5 years, previously I had been a bic shaver with gel/foam for 40 years. It does not irritate my face as did the bic or rotary shavers. The shave is closer (better) than the others and my face feels very smooth after shaving. My wife even complimented that my face was much smoother with the Braun as she noticed the difference immediately. The fact that it vibrates gives your face a massage as you are shaving. The cleaning bath works well and gives the shaver a fresh clean feel and smell. I am glad I SWITCHED and love my new electric razor. The only fault is the weight which I can live with. Try it for yourself it comes with a money back guarantee. You won't be disappointed.

The 10000 rpm motor cuts down my shaving time, and shaves more consistently than my previous one. I considered the Panasonic Vortex, but I thought I would try the Braun first since it did have a 60 day money back guarantee. I am completely satisfied, so this one will not be going back.
  383. What a great shaver! This is the closest shave I've ever gotten. The product is well made and comes with good accessories as well. The cleaning/charging base is sturdy and well made and does a great job of cleaning, drying and charging the shaver. My only complaint is that you may need to buy new cleaning fluid every month or so. This can add up, as these cost about six dollars a piece.
  384. I recently purchased this razor as an upgrade from my previous Braun shaver (360 Complete 8985) and the Pulsonic is a definite upgrade. I get a significantly closer shave and in far less time. One thing I will say, however, is that I've seen a few people/websites claim that they just need one pass with this razor when shaving - that isn't the case for me, and I find that hard to believe with any electric razor. It does require multiple passes, but still far less than any electric I've ever used, and it irritates my skin far less. Some reviewers have cited the pop-up trimmer as being a bit awkward - I would agree to a certain extent, but I've still been able to use it to trim my sideburns fairly easily. Also, while the cost may scare away some, Braun electrics are very well made - I've owned Braun razors for 5+ years in some instances. If you keep this for a few years, and use the clean and renew less liberally than Braun wants you to (I use it once a week or so) this razor is far more cost effective than it would appear on the surface. Overall, a 5 star product. Far and away the best electric I've ever owned, and I look forward to owning it for years to come.

  389. I am very happy with this shaver. Not only will it take away 2 day stubble with ease and no pulling, but I haven't got even the slightest razor burn.   390. This review is based entirely upon my initial impressions as I have only used the razor a few times. I will update the review as needed with further use of the product. For readability, i've broken the review into several sections: Design - of course the design matters, it's the first thing that you see and determines how the razor will interact with your face. With a blue and silver exterior, the razor sure looks fancy. To match its external prowess, the razor utilizes a tilting head to completely shave your face - this works great. This model also comes with a handy locking mechanism for the head to reach hard to get areas on your face - also works great. Overall design: A+ Comfort - the comfort of the shave is great, no burning, no pulling, and a very minimal amount of irritation. Overall comfort: A+ Noise/Heat - This is my biggest complaint with the razor so far - it's fairly loud (at least compared to Norelco rotary razors i've used in the past). Also, there seems to be a fair amount of heat radiated (not uncomfortable at all though) by the foil unit - this is only noticeable when using the lock on the tilting function. Overall noise: B Performance - This is of course the most important part of the shaver - will it at the end of day adequately shave your face? With no reservations, I can say that this razor does a fabulous job of shaving one's face. It misses very little hair and thus requires a minimal amount of rehasing on your face. Much better over Norelco rotaries (esp the wet shave system) and comparable (but not quite as good) to an \\"old fashioned\\" blade. Performance: A+ Cleaning and Charging System: The razor seems to charge fairly quickly, with the ability for a quick charge or to plug the AC adapter directly into the razor. The cleaning system seems adequate - Braun suggests to clean the razor after every use, I don't think this is necessary and will probably only clean every several uses as the Clean and Renew solution is an added cost (~ $4 a cartridge). You can also clean the razor the old fashion way with water and remove the cartridge head - but the clean and renew system seems so much better. The only downside is the engineering of the clean and renew cartridges - you open them and they almost immediately spill a little. I would like to have seen an elevated spout for opening to avoid this problem. Overall cleaning and charging: A Overall comments - If your sick of the lack of quality from comparably priced rotary shavers and/or don't like the cuts, roughness, and cost of a shave from a blade, then this razor is certainly a good candidate for you. As far as cost is concerned, it doesn't seem too bad, though there is a large initial investment in the razor (NOTE: amazon often offers 50 dollars off a future order with a purchase of at least $139 in products from Braun/Oral-B). In addition, there is a small amount of maintenance costs in the form of replacing the cartridge/foil unit (about $30 - Braun recommends this be done once a year) and refilling the clean and renew system (about $4/ea from amazon in the 3 pack) where the latter is highly dependent on how much you personally clean the razor and your use of water instead of the clean and renew system. Overall, this is the best razor i've ever used and don't regret the purchase at all! Overall grade - A P.S. - For those of that are still worried about Amazon's no-return policy on this item, Braun offers a 60 day money back gurantee in the US.
  391. I purchased this shaver 1 year ago for myself and found it to be the best electric shaver I had ever used. I still use a multibladed razor also and feel that using both the bladed and electric works for me. The electric seems to shave me better around the mouth and chin area and the bladed seems to shave the neck better. A year later I purchased another Braun 9595 for a Christmas present to my son-in-law. He did not like it and I returned it. I gave it a 4 because of the individual opinion issue. The quality of the product really is 5 star though. If you are inclined to like the electric shaver this one is the best!
  392. I have just a few words for this shaver - it works. And it works great! And then cleans itself and after itself. And then it tells you all about itself - how clean it is, and how charged it is. What else do you need from a shaver - to cook? Get back to earth. Seriously now, I am very impressed on how it shaves, and how well it works with 2-3 day old growth: no pain, no pulling. I used to dread those shaves when you miss a day or two of shaving - those rotary shavers would make you suffer for your neglect for long-long minutes. With this shaver it does not take really longer and the feelings are the same. Bottom line - if you still have another shaver - get this one. It is great and you will love it!
  393. Read some mixed reviews on this product prior to purchasing. I've owned a lot of electric shavers in my time, but this one is superior. Ready to go the next time around. Also gives the closest shave I've ever had from an electric shaver. Good buy.
  394. First off I didn't start shaving with electric razor until I was 50. I had tried 2-3 Norelco razors and they would burn your face after a few minutes of going over and over and I would still have a pretty good beard. I bought my first Braun about 12 years ago and I just bought this 4th razor from Braun. It takes a few days to see if you can really get a decent shave with an electric. Every guy I know who has shaved with an electric has a little different story. I think it's as difficult to get a 100% close shave with an electric as it is to get a 100% close shave with a safety razor and shaving cream without nicking yourself a couple of times. I used the Braum and it shaved me better than any electric I had ever used....bar none. This is my 4th Braun. I like the ease of cleaning it with the automatic cleaner and you can stretch the cleaning fluid two months if you don't try to clean daily. I tried that and found that cleaning the head about once or twice weekly is sufficient. Braun is the best electric I have used and I'll buy another. This new one has the best feel holding it and shaving with it as any I have owned. If you can use an electric you will love this one. It shaves me about 90% as close as I can get in a regular shave. My beard grows every direction. I have a friend or two who just don't like an electric razor but they never tried an electric over a few times before giving up.
  395. Shaves close. Has maintained itself with the Braun system. You can buy cheaper razors, be disappointed in short order, and begin looking again to spend more money. Get it out of the way once and for all and buy the Braun 7 if you're convinced you want an electric razor.

  397. I find that the Pop-out trimmer mechanism is a bit awkward compared to previous models and the head lock switch is poorly placed. However, the actual shave result appears to be better; closer and less irritating.
  398. The charging base of the first unit that I received was broken. That was when I learned that this product cannot be RMA'ed due to the fact that it contains a small cartridge of cleaning fluid. How come it is okay for Amazon to ship this product to us, but not okay for us to ship it back to them? After much ado with Amazon's customer service, they finally agreed to send a replacement. The replacement unit works fine. I have been using it for about three weeks now. I clean the shaver after every use or every other use, but never more than two uses. However, I still do not experience that \\"amazing\\" close shave that everyone has been raving about. Prior to this shaver, I had been using the Gillette M3Power razor. A fresh M3Power blade gives a closer shave than the Braun, but the problem is that it loses its sharpness very quickly (like after two uses). In the pursue of the ultimate shave and having read all the positive reviews here, I decided to give this a try. I am sorry to report that it is not better. I had hoped that it would be, but it is not. Oh, the long term cost of the cleaning fluid is comparable to that of changing razor blades (about $6 per month). I am giving it a 3 star for (1) poor quality control for letting a defective unit out the door, and (2) a less than stellar shaving performance. At this price point, nothing less than perfection is acceptable.
  399. There's a very old-world, made in Germany feel to the shaver. Sure there's plastic, but not the flimsy \\"I'll have to replace it in a year\\" feel to most Chinese made consumer electronics. Simply stated, I like it enough to have bought a year's supply of cleaning solution after 2 weeks--look around, you can find it less expensively than Amazon.
  400. This is the best shaver I've found. Doesn't mean it's perfect though. The base tends to get clogged up and you have to figure out a way to clean it.   401. I owned the previous version of this shaver and was very happy with it. I've had Braun shavers for 20 years. I find their shavers give the closest and smoothest shave of all other brands on the market. This latest model isn't cheap, but it's well worth the additional expense. It cleans itself with the push of a button. I can take two or even three shaves before having to clean it which saves on cleaning cartridge costs. It also will tell you when you need to change the cartridge or change the cutting head (which now comes in one piece). It has a head angle lock for shaving under the nose and of course a trimmer for neck and side burns. All I can say is \\"try it, you'll love it\\".
  402. **EDIT** After a month of shaving the shave times have gotten longer, the shaves are less close, and my skin is getting to the point that after going over and over the same spot I can't shave again for at least a day or so because of the irritation... So, I changed my cleaning fluid, bought a new head, and am giving it a shot. But, even if it does get back to the perfect shaves it gave me on day one, spending $50 for a new head and cleaner every month and a half is not my idea of a great product. If that's gong to be the case, I can't see giving this shaver any more than 3 stars down the road. **Original Review** In short, I expected a lot from this shaver after reading the reviews but I didn't expect it to be this fantastic. The long of it goes a little bit like this: I haven't shaved with a razor in something ridiculous, like 9 years, as my face can never take it. Even once my face gets used to the razor again, just stopping for a few days makes me break out like a teenager if I try to shave again. So, with no hope of a baby faced shave, I moved on to beard trimmers and simply lived with a close 5 o'clock shadow, letting people assume my middle eastern heritage gave me wolfman like features by mid-day. Every now and then I'd venture back to an electric shaver only to discover they pulled the hair out, left my face irritated, didn't reach those \\"hard to reach places\\" (go figure), or left a massive mess in the sink, etc. And again, I'd slink back to my beard trimmer, my girlfriend left only to assume that she wouldn't see me with a clean face again until the day we got married and it really mattered. But, being in my late 20's and consistently being in front of clients finally pushed me to do something about it (and only 9 years in...). So, after reading the reviews I bought the Braun Series 7 and jumped in with both feet. Much to my suprise, my first shave was as close as I've ever gotten with a razor, twice as fast, and left no irritation,no in grown hairs, no break outs, and no redness. Not only that, but the miniscule amount of hair in the sink makes my girfriend think I take the time to clean up after every shave even when I'm in a hurry! I can't say enough about this razor, and while I don't have much to compare it to, simply knowing it has done its job for a month straight with no issues, and hasn't seemed to dull at all, astounds me. I can't think of the last thing I bought that was this useful, and that I'm as appreciative for each time I use it. Can I say more than I would shave MAYBE once a year with a razor and since the day I bought it I've shaved every morning with the Braun?! Granted, it still won't get every hair on your neck, but it does an amazingly good job of skimming over any ingrown hairs so you can pluck them out later, and not grabbing or yanking hairs that are slightly longer than the rest. Nothing but 5 stars from me.
  403. I have tried all kinds of shavers - none have worked well for me except this one. There is no irritation (after the initial couple weeks of getting accustomed to it) which is unavoidable for me when using a blade. It also shaves very well everywhere on my face - including my neck. I have never used an electric shaver that even comes close in this regard. If you are even thinking about dropping the cash for this, I would go ahead and give it a try - it's well worth the extra money.

  407. I have used a couple of different electric razors and this one is the best I have used so far. My most recent razor was a Norelco lotion dispensing unit. It wasn't bad razor till the I tried to shave with it without any lotion. Without the lotion you would get the razor burn. I have yet to get that with this razor. You do have to shave with it for a couple of weeks for your skin to get used to it, but after your skin gets used to it, you won't ever get the razor burn effect. I was a bit skeptical about the self cleaning on this razor, but it does work. I took the cutting head off after a cleaning and didn't see any stubble. The shave quality is great for an electric razor. The hair on my neck likes to pose a challenge for all razors. This razor does a great job of cutting them back. As long as you go against the grain and take your time, you will have a great close shave. The razor is also capable of being charged away from the base and comes with a great hard carry case that protects your investment well when you are on the road. The final great thing about this razor is that the only thing made in China is the smart plug. The razor is made in Germany. This is a very expensive razor, but it is well worth the money. I would highly recommend it.
  408. I have owned this shaver for almost 2 years now. Love how close it shaves! I thought I'd be let down, but I honestly can't believe how well it shaves, especially compared to previous shavers I've had. However, the directions tell you to go against the practice that all other shavers use, which is to NOT wash your face (or shower) before using, since your natural oils should do the trick. I found it to be very rough this way, and not to shave well. In addition, I was a little frustrated that on top of spending a lot of money for this shaver, that I would have to continually get refills for the cleaning solution. So, I put down the for a couple of months and went back to blades. Then, I decided to go against what the directions say, and shower first, use a pre-shave solution (Lectric Shave), and then shave. Wow, what a difference. I recommend everyone throw away the directions for this shaver!! In addition, to get around having to buy refills, I simply replaced the solution in the refill with rubbing alcohol and a few splashes of pre-shave solution (Lectric Shave). It works GREAT, and saves a lot of money!! I think Braun just wants users to not use any other products other than their own. This is the only reason I'm giving this 4 stars rather than 5 stars. I only wish Braun would come up with a pre-electric shave solution.
  409. Good razor and works well, but long hair trimmer is a bit tough to use.
  410. It's been 4 weeks since I bought it, I've just replaced the first cleaning cartridge, so I thought it would be nice to write about my experience. For last several years I shaved every day with Wilkinson Quattro and even tried Gillette Fusion (BTW, WQ is better). They were okay, but I often had cuts and red patches that wouldn't go away for hours. WQ cartridge would last for max 4-5 shaves, as I have thick beard hear, but that was ok. The problem I could not tolerate any more was ingrown hair, sometimes painful, sometimes just small red bumps on my neck. So I did a research and found how and why these occur and that I should be able to get rid of them if I switch to an electric shaver. Since I never used one before, I listed all the latest and found Braun 790cc to be probably the best one out there. It was 450 $AU, but I definitely decided to give it a try. So I did. And wow, I am so happy I did! :) It takes 2-3 weeks to get used to it, probably the time for which hair changes direction of growth and sharp ends caused by (manual) razors are removed, then it shaves as closely as WQ/GF. But, there are no more cuts, no red patches (skin irritation) and no more ingrown hair, and I mean none! :) Woohoo! Also, it takes me approx 10 mins to shave, which is almost half the time I used to shave with WQ/GF. Another cool thing with this shaver is that it comes with a box which is its charger/cleaner. Cleaning liquid is a mixture of alcohol and lubricant, so not only does it clean the machine, it also lubricates it. So I simply use it, put it back into its box, power it on and press the button for cleaning. I highly recommend it for anyone troubled with skin irritation and ingrown hair. Give it a try, you won't regret. And yet another cool thing, it came with 60 days trial offer. You don't like, simply return it and it will be refunded with no questions asked! Thank you Braun, but I will keep it! :)
  411. Although I've only had it a few days, I've been very pleased with the Braun 790cc. I have owned an older model with the same sort of cleaning unit for about eight years and it was beginning to show it's age. The new shaver seems to shave much closer but with less irritation.   412. I have been using Braun electric shavers for over 15 years and this is the best one yet. It provides an extremely close shave with minimal use of pressure on the face. It may take a little longer than a razor but the skin feels better and never a nick.   413. I've had this for a year and a half now. I was splurging on Christmas gift cards and thought expensive would mean good. When I first got it I was amazed. I'm sure that's why there's so many great reviews. However over time I've been very unhappy in the durability. The foil/blades wore out after 6 months. You can't find replacements in stores from what I found. I had to order a replacement online and have it overnighted while I was shaving with tape over the hole to protect my face. Keep your old razor guys for a back up. About one year into it the cleaning base doesn't work well. The razor doesn't contact it right and so doesn't charge and clean. I've tried everything to clean the contacts but it just wont sit in there right anymore. In order to use the base now I have to place it in until I find the sweet spot, then tape it in with some surgical tape. I do this about once every week or so. So much for all these liquid refills I've got. These days it takes about as long to shave as it did with my old Norelco (which lasted three times as long and I replaced the blades only once). So I guess the Braun's blades are only good for about a year. The battery is not as good now. I get about 3 shaves out of a charge. It never ever did a very good job on the occasional long hair or 3 days growth. Now I think for the money it should've been a much better experience. I can see now that the price is less than it was, but still too much if you ask me. I now think it's gimmicky and over priced. Perhaps I just need new blades/foil now. But I'm thru with it, and much wiser. I think I'll try a Panasonic next.
  414. I thought that by purchasing the Braun 790cc shaver, I was taking a step up from my old Norelco. Ok. Forget the heavy vibration of the Braun motor. Forget the major effort to shave the side of my neck. Forget that shaved hairs fall out of the side of the razor head. Forget these things? I think not. Amazon does not accept returns of this type of product, so I guess it's the trash for this baby. It's not pretty enough for a paperweight. AND, to add insult to injury, Amazon dropped the price, so I actually overpaid for this. I feel better having written this but I would still have preferred my $200 back.[[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]]
  415. An excellent product that works well. Being a Soldier for 23 years, I only tried one electric shaver over 10 years ago. It was a poor experience so I never believed an electric shaver could give one a shave good enough for a Soldier to stand in a military formation. I recently retired and figured I'd give an electric shaver one more try as I didn't have to worry if it didn't shave well. I purchased this Braun and received it on 5 Feb 10 (now 13 Mar 10). I have used it nearly every day, maybe not on one or two days, and was greatly surprised with the results. Everyone told me to wait four to six weeks for my skin to adjust and I would get a better shave, which I have, though the shaves in the beginning were good enough for any Soldier to stand formation. If I had known about this razor, or another earlier version of Braun, I could have saved many nicks from cold morning water bottle shaves when deployed. Nothing will be as close as a razor to the skin, but this is the next best thing. You can't feel a whisker when rubbing with the growth, and feel a slight roughness when rubbing against the growth. I guess that's the best way I could describe the shave. As for maintenance, the Braun 7 is great. I shave, put it in the cradle, push the 'clean' button, and walk away. I replaced the cleaning solution on 11 Mar 10, so I had about 41 days on the first cartridge. The 'low' light was on, but I didn't want to wait for the empty light. The trimmer works well, even for trimming up my haircut on the back of my neck and around my ears. I have never used more than two squares of the battery charge per shave - even a long one when I first used it - so I couldn't imaging this thing draining a charge unless I didn't plug it in for a week straight. If you want to try an electric razor for the first time, or if you want to replace an existing one, I HIGHLY recommend this Braun. It turned me into a believer in electric razors.
  416. My Panasonic Razor's head broke so I decided to research and find a razor I liked. Before the Panasonic, I had a Braun. The cleaning unit stopped working after two years. The Panasonic was a good razor--shaved close--hardly ever nicked, but the cleaning unit was extremely loud and lasted forever (3 hours). So I first looked at several of the Norelcos. Never had one. I read all the reviews and it seems the Braun kept coming up as better. So I read the reviews of several of the Brauns. I spent several days looking and thinking that this Braun was a lot of money. I'll tell you what. I am sooo glad I got this razor. It is a smooth, close, comfortable shave. Not quite as close as a manual razor, but pretty close to it. No nicks or scrapes even the first use. It is quieter running than the Panasonic and the cleaning unit is at least a third quieter, but lasts no more than 45 minutes. However, this model examines the razor to see how dirty it is and how low on battery. It then has several options it automatically chooses depending on its need. So, most days it does a very fast \\"eco\\" clean. I'll tell you, this has got to be the best electric razor yet invented. I highly recommend it. I should also mention that Amazon.com is the best. It arrived quickly and undamaged. And prices are usually less than most other places.
  417. For over 30 years, I've been hopelessly loyal to Norelco; however, when I purchased their latest iteration I was sadly disappointed. So I started shopping. After reading tons of mostly positive reviews, I decided to take a gamble and purchase the Braun Series 7-790cc, it's relatively high price nothwithstanding. Glad I did! Adios Norelco.
  418. This shaver is very disappointing in its performance. One has to go over and over to get a decent shaving. Its performance is quite poor in the neck area as the surface is not leveled.   420. I've used several electric shavers over the years and they all were disappointing in some way. Poor quality shaves, pinched, pain to clean, something. Not this unit. Great shave, very comfortable. Feels good in my hand, great control.
  421. Razor consistently pulls the whiskers rather than cutting them cleanly. Very disappointed with the performance of the razor. Would not buy again.
  422. Whatever happened to planned obsolescence? I bought this shaver almost seven years ago and it still performs beautifully, just as it did the day I took it out of its box back in April 2009. Yes, I've kept it clean, running it in its base almost every time I use it, and yes, I've replaced the head once (Braun says every three years but I've gone four, I think). In return, it has continued to give me fast, clean, comfortable shaves. This is one of the best, most reliable products I've ever owned -- one of those products that's a pleasure to use and own. Even the battery is great -- I used it on a three-week trip to Europe a little while ago and never needed to recharge it! Thanks, Braun, for a truly great product. Not cheap -- but worth every dollar!
  423. Absolutely the best shaver I have ever used. I can not believe how close close of a shave I get. Also, it tells you how much shave cleaner you have left aand when it is empty. It is not cheap, but WORTH EVERY PENNY.
  424. I was skeptical reading all the promotional material for this new shaver. I'm 54 years old and have been using a razor all my life. About a year ago, the razor started irritating my skin so I was forced to begin using a Norelco rotary electric shaver that I kept under the counter. The results were far from satisfactory but at least it didn't cause a rash on my face. I figured that was just the nature of electric shavers and was convinced that I would be living with a scratchy, stubbly beard the rest of my life. Then I read a review on this new Pulsonic shaver in the August 2007 issue of Popular Mechanics magazine. It sparked my interest so I researched it more on the internet. I finally decided to take a chance and purchase the highly acclaimed but expensive shaver. I've been using it now for one month and am convinced that it is not possible for an electric shaver to work better than this one. I't leaves the Norelco rotary in the dust. I would say it shaves about 97% as close as a regular lather & razor shave. It does not leave stubbles and it isn't necessary to shave more than once a day. Yes, it takes a small investment to purchase this shaver but it is a quality item that you can live with for life. The self-cleaning charger/holder requires replacement cleaning fluid cartriges periodically. The information I read says that a cartrige is good for about a month. However, the razor head can also be cleaned by rinsing it under hot water...which is what I do for two days and then run it through the complete cleaning cycle every third day. After a month doing this the original cartrige still says \\"FULL\\". I have purchased three more cartriges for $16. I think those will last me for a very long time. I have nothing bad to say about this shaver after having recovered from the shock of the initial purchase price. You get what you pay for and you will certainly pay for this one. I don't regret spending the money for this shaver at all.
  425. I have had this shaver for about 2 weeks. I previously used the Braun 8995 and used Brauns for many years previous to that. This is the best one yet. It provides as close to a real blade shave as you can get. It's appearance could hardly be improved upon. The trimmer is different than previous models in that it pops out at a 90 degree angle to the razor. It takes a while to get used to that but it will seem natural after a while. The head when pulled off looks complex compared to previous models and I guess that is because it cuts in two directions. I have no idea what a replacement will cost but I assume from looking at it that it want be cheap. The head/cutter assembly according to the manual should last 18 months. One thing missing from this shaver is a plastic head cover which I would like to have. I could not find it as an accessory and I do not know why they no longer provide one. On this shaver you press a button to turn on and off which has a continuous blue light. When not in use you can store it in the charger/cleaner which is an off white color and provides you with a lot of information. The shaver has an LCD that provides you with how much charge is left and how dirty your shaving head is so you know when to clean it. I do not clean mine every day but do blow it out with the head off. I usually clean it at least once a week. They have changed the formula for the cleaning fluid but your old container of cleaning fluid still fits the new cleaner. The shaver head is washable. You will also receive a small container of oil for the head if you ever feel the desire to oil it. The shaver can be run with the cord only. You can also do a \\"quick\\" clean on your cleaner/charger. This razor feels comfortable in your hand and the head follows the contours of you neck and face very nicely. You can lock the head in one position but I never have found the need. It is not cheap. I found no discounts on this shaver. I like it!
  426. I have a thick, dark beard... even when I shave with a blade you can see the outline of where my beard will be when it grows in. I tend to look like I haven't shaved even when I have. I have gone through several electric razors that did ok. Generally, I would use the electrics every other day. If I tried to go more than 2 days in a row they usually just couldn't handle it. When my last one died I decided to try to buy a \\"good\\" electric and see if it really was better than the average ones I'd been using. I chose wisely. The braun is the first electric razor that I can use every day. Is it as close as a blade... with me no. It's not, but it's awfully close. It handles the curve from my chin to my neck and does a very good job. I have never been disappointed with it in terms of shaving performance. The fluid you buy to use the self-cleaning \\"dock\\" is fairly expensive and it goes through it pretty quickly. I kind of wish you could just buy the stuff to refill the cartridges. (If I knew what it was you probably could.) On the whole though, this razor performs. I've used a blade once in the two years or so that I've owned it.
  427. I wanted to wait until i had this for a few months before reviewing it. Let me just say before i get started.... basics... you can't use an electric shaver one time and say it is no good, that is not how electric shavers work. You have to use it for a week or two and your beard will get used to how it is being cut. Only then can you make an educated evaluation. Ok that is off my chest.... I had been using a refurbed Braun Syncro 755 for the last 7 years and it has performed admirably, but it was loud and the battery started only holding a charge for 1 shave (this is after 7yrs and with a refurb!). So naturally i wanted to get another Braun.... it took me some time to finally spend the money on this one but I'm so glad i did. It is unbelievable..... I can't wait to shave in the morning.... I'm not kidding, it is quiet and the cleaning,charging station is really, really nice. I have a fresh shaver everytime i use it. It shaves me very close. It is so smooth... I also recently took it on vacation and i used it every day for 8 days and even though i brought my charger with me, i never needed it. I didnt' take the charging/cleaning station (obviously), but the shaver comes with a hard plastic case with a small brush that fits in the end to help you clean it. You can also run water over the end i guess, to clean it if you want, but i won't be doing that. All i can say is if you have used an electric shaver before and are looking to get another one.... don't hesitate to buy this one. I think it is well worth the money. Jan 4th, 2012... I have owned this shaver for almost 2 years now and I must say I still think it is the best electric shaver I have ever used.....

Overall I recommend this shaver, but have to admit that it is pricey.

All other Braun razor's can't come close to this unit, the 360, etc. The blade system on this thing is amazing.   440. I've been using a Remington Titanium razor for the last 5 years (give or take a year), and before that a Norelco rotary razor. Both of those were gifts. I was never satisfied with the Norelco, as the heads seemed to wear quite fast and when they got dull, it really pulled. The Remington I've had for a while. It's battery is starting to go. So why didn't I buy another Remington? Well, the razors inside the head needed replacing every 6 months, though, sometimes I could get 9 months out of them (and this last one has lasted for over a year, but then again, I haven't been shaving as much--more on that in this review). Also, this razor is messy! Hair gets all over the place; my wife hates it ;). And it's very loud; it actually sounds like a mulch machine/branch chipper! Another frustrating thing about the two other razors I've used: the Norelco was not cordless; the Remington was cordless, but if the battery died, you couldn't plug it into the wall and use it. If you turned on the razor while it was plugged in, it would stop charging, and hence, would not power the razor. With the Remington, I found that I needed to buy that special face powder to make the shaving go better, but that also was ever more messy (now you've got hair AND powder everywhere). I just got the Braun yesterday. It seems to solve all my problems: a close shave (a bit closer than the Remington), it can be plugged in and used if the battery dies, it's very clean (doesn't leak much hair during shaving and has a self-cleaning system), and, contrary to another review, is MUCH quieter than the Remington. Today, it did pull at my beard a bit, BUT, I haven't shaved in four days AND I just got it--it's quite possible my beard needs to get used to it yet. Should I continue to have any problems, I'll update this review. A couple of other things to note: the shaving head won't need replacing for approx. 18 months! WOW! I used to spend $35 every 6. Now I'll spend $40 - $45 every 18! That's a savings of $60-$65/year. Of course, there are the cleaning cartridges, which are $19 ea. (or a [[ASIN:B001S2J5DW 12-pack]] for $60 here on Amazon.com). Now, most people say that they last longer than 30 shaves, and if you only shave every other day, you may even stretch them to last 60 days or more--so it really depends. So far, this thing is great. I love it, and better yet, my wife loves it, too.

  442. OK I wanted this to be a success, I had just spent $200 on a shaver....it had better be good. This is the first review I have written on anything! Razor came yesterday, looked very neat, but they should coordinate the colors more, charged it up, very quick, couple of hours and it was done, switched it on, much quieter than the older ones I had tried, did one side of face, actually liked the slight vibration....wow, it felt smooth, did rest of face, head followed contours of chin and neck really well....I was very impressed, as was my wife who was VERY dubious. Only issue I have is that overnight the stubble grew back quicker, so it is obiously not as close as a wet shave....but for the conveience, it is pretty dam good.....oh! and it cleans itself....but that seems a little noisey, so if you have a master bath as we do, dont set it to clean just before you go to bed to sleep!!!

  444. I had the previous braun model and since it did not shave \\"as close as a blade\\" I decided to try the pulsonic. It does shave as well as a blade, BUT it takes some practice. Positioning of the head (angle to the face) is crucial and you must move slowly -- give it time to vibrate the hairs and cut them. In this regard, it takes a little longer to shave, but the end result is better. It is very comfortable. The cleaning system is excellent and highly recommended. It seems to hold the charge longer and this with the ability to rinse under water makes it far better for travel. Nice travel case as well. Recommend.

  446.   448. I love the razor, best I have ever had (previously used various Norelco's). But Braun customer service is incredibly bad (is P&G in the US), and even worse considering the price of the razor. After about a year of use the cleaning mechanism stopped working. Called Braun, they said send into a repair place. Repair place said they needed my razor. So three weeks with a crappy battery razor I bought ($30). Then in Jan the cleaning mechanism stopped working again. Called Braun, they said send back to repair place, I told them they were kidding. As a great favor they said they would send me a new cleaning unit. Two months and many phone calls later, nothing. (They gave me a Fedex tracking number for an address in another state). After telling me that normally I would have to deal with Fedex, they said as a special favor I could buy a new cleaning unit (which I did in Feb.) and they would reimburse me. Many more phone calls, check is in the mail. So In May I called and told them I was going to write a very bad review unless I got a check within a week. Four days later a check showed up. Now in early August the new cleaning mechanism stops working. Pretty bad. I have not the energy to fight with Braun again, and would love to keep using the Braun which I like, but alas my apt. plumbing cannot deal with cleaning out the hair in the sink. So if you think you are buying a premium product with premium service from Braun, think again. The razor has been great, but would not go near anything where customer service is P&G again. I will now have to search for an inferior razor.<br /><br />Update March 2012 - the locking mechanism to hold the head in place broke. Alas, I need this for any longish hairs. Hard to shave with one hand holding the head in place. So finally bye bye to the Braun, which lasted just about 4 years (possibly not horrible in today's world, but hardly what I expected for the price of the razor). I am hoping the new Phillips is better.
  449. The Braun 9595 is without peer in the electric shaver market. I have used electrics for years because blades just tear though my sensitive face. Granted, it took about two weeks of use before my face adjusted to the closeness of the shave the 9595 gave, but now it is a dream to use. Using my old electrics, it would take me at least 5 minutes to get an acceptable shave. With the 9595, I'm now usually done in less than two minutes and the shave quality is far better than I ever got with any shaver I used before. The 9595 works incredibly well for me given I have whiskers growing in many directions on my face. The head of the unit easily maneuvers around my chin line and cheeks, it is comfortable in my hand and the pop-up hair trimmer is handy for touchups to my moustache and goatee. One word of warning on this razor. The cut on it is so close, I drew blood on my adams apple the first few times I used it. There is a learning curve with this razor. However, I now know to gently brush over my adams apple and I haven't had this issue ever since. Final verdict - the absolute best of all electrics at this time!
  450. I have used a Braun shaver for several years now and have liked it much better than any other electric shaver I have tried. I recently got the new Braun Pulsonic for Xmas. It is absolutely the best shaver ever. It gives me the smoothest/closest shave with zero razor burn. It shaves faster and quieter than even my older Braun.
