  451. I've had this razor since Sept. 2007. I do not receive a shave that is equal to the $200.00+ that I paid. Areas along the jaw-line and on my neck require many passes and it still may leave hairs. The repeated passes can cause skin irritation which is also unacceptable. On top of this if I get too close to my sideburns it has a tendency to rip 1 or 2 out. I thought the \\"little fingers\\" were supposed to raise close lying hairs so the cutters could cut them. This doesn't happen for me. I've tried \\"electric shave\\" and Remington's shaving stick to reduce the irritation but neither has eleminated the problem. I do like the fact that you can rinse the razor, but this doesn't count as a cleaning so you still have to use the cleaning unit. I also think the charge doesn't last as long as other shavers I've owned. In my opinion the razor is made from cheap material. An example is when pushing the button to release the head mine clicks really hard like its breaking. I've noticed that only one side releases unless my finger is centered precisely on the button. Shouldn't be happening with something this expensive. Second example is my lock button broke last week. I can no longer lock the head. It wasn't comforting to hear the guy at the Service Center say \\"Wow, haven't heard of that happening before, I'm not sure how to fix it, guess I'll have to order a head from the company.\\" Then he asked \\"do you have another razor? It'll take 10-15 days to get the part from the company.\\" I'm heading overseas in a couple of weeks, I don't think this razor is making the trip. Its pretty though, anyone that uses my bathroom usually comes out saying \\"dang man that razor is awesome.\\" If they only knew.
  452. After 50 years of trying every model of Norelco made, I finally found a shaver that does what I want it to. This is the finest electric shaver ever built. Highly recommended to others. The self-cleaning feature works perfectly. The shave is the closest I've ever had.
  453. This shaver works well, but not so well that it justifies the hefty price tag that goes along with it. I was using a Braun Synchro electric razor before and that worked just as well. This shaver does give quite a close shave, but I was hoping that you would have to go over an area just once as they claim and not many many times at different angles similar to other electric razors.
  454. I've used Norelco shavers for forty years, but based on other reviews I've read I decided to give the Pulsonic a try. The vibration takes some getting used to (one wonders if they didn't start calling the problem of high noise levels a feature), but it does shave extremely close--close enough that I get razor burn that I never had with my Norelco. Another noticeable thing is that the screens get quite warm during operation. Don't know if this will reduce as the screens and cutters wear in (I've only had mine a month) or not. I did find that I had to change my shaving pattern to a more linear one than I was used to, since the Norelco cuts equally well in any direction, but having done so, the Pulsonic's pivoting head tracks the shape of my face very well. I also found that I had to change the way I shaved around the corners of my mouth and under my nose. Norelcos cut right up to the edge of their heads, but there is a big dead zone at the ends of the Braun's heads that doesn't cut. As a result, you can't use the corner of the head to shave into the opening of your nostrils or the ends of your mouth; you have to use the middle of the head, which is less convenient. The Pulsonic cleaning system is handy, although it takes up a lot of room on the counter, and there's the extra cost of buying cleaning cartridges. It's probably worth it, however, for people who never remember to clean their shaver. Finally, this was the most over packaged product I have ever seen, with a molded plastic shell (inside a cardboard box, which was inside a cardboard sleeve, which was inside a plastic box) held together by little buttons that were so confusing they had to put an instruction sticker in the box describing how to get it open. Some German engineer got entirely too carried away with the package design, which probably contributed to the unit's high price.
  455. I have been using Electric razors ever since I started shaving (about 35 years ago I hate to say!). The Pulsonic is by far the best I have ever used. Years ago I shaved with Remingtons and then when my father told me about Panasonic I switched to their units and have been pleased for years. I was reluctant to switch to the Braun Pulsonic as until it went on sale it was very expensive, I thought the cleaning system would be a pain to use, and I was still happy with my Panasonic razor. When I saw the Pulsonic on sale and read a few reviews a few months ago I bought one. This razor shaves closer and more comfortably than any other I have tried and the cleaning system is easy to use and awesome. What I have found works best is to shower first and then use a pre-electric lotion such as Afta Pre-Electric. I clean the razor after each use--very simply by placing it back in the storage unit. This is not only convenient, but I don't clog up my sink any more by cleaning it there. The only downside to this razor is the pop-up trimmer which is not as good as Panasonic's. I still use the Panasonic for the pop up trimmer only because I still own it. Otherwise the Pulsonic's trimmer would be sufficient.
  456. This is my third Braun shaver, having just recently upgraded from a Braun Synchro (which also has the automatic cleaning function). The pulsonic gives a slightly better shave and has some neat features, but is no miracle shaver. I am happy with it, but wouldn't have spent $200 to upgrade if I knew what I know now. Instead, I would either have kept my Synchro or tried the 360 which has many of the same features as the Pulsonic (but no ultra-sonic pulses -- see the lawsuit as to whether this is worth anything). If you are switching from a blade, you will definitely not get as close a shave. If you are switching from another Braun, you will probably get a better shave, but probably not $200 better. Pros: A closer shave; cleaning base works very well; ability to wash the shaver head with plain water when necessary. The cleaning base is nice but I recommend only cleaning every few days to preserve the fluid. The new blade design (also a feature of the 360) does a better job of slicing the hair vice chopping it and causes less irritation than my synchro did. Cons: Only marginally better than my synchro and probably not much better than the 360. Shaver head and cutter block are all one piece and have to be replcaed all at once (about $40). Finally, price. A nice looking shaver but it just doesn't provide a $200 shave. Overall, a good shaver. If I didn't know the pricetag, I would be very happy with it.
  457. After just one shave with this razor I am completely sold on the Braun Pulsonic. I used to have a Braun 360 Complete but stopped using it because I was not satisfied with the results. I was a little hesitant to try again, but you get tired of using a razor, purchasing expensive blades and messy shaving cream so I took the leap once again. It is worth the extra dollars to purchase this unit over the Braun 360 Complete. Extremely close shave. I did find a much lower price from iKitchen but DO NOT DEAL WITH THEM! They sat on my order for 14 days (which it states in the fine print, but I figured that would never happen). iKitchen sat on the order because they don't stock anything and they figured they could buy it cheaper and re-sell. I waited two weeks to try and save $60. Well now their price is the same as AMAZON. I bet iKitchen could ship it now because it's the same price. iKitchen is a loser! Buy from Amazon, you won't regret it. This is an excellent shaver.

  462. Have used it for about two weeks. Shaves well but still need to go over same spot several times depending upon location. Can use it with cord when needed. Haven't used the sideburn cutter yet. Look and feel of shaver is great. THERE IS NO PLASTIC COVER to protect the foil!! Other reviewers pointed this out as well. Not too smart on Braun's part. Overall, I'd purchase it again despite no cover, but I'm reminded of the protective plastic cover issue everytime I try to find a safe place to set it down after each use (I'm in a ongoing battle for space in the bathroom!!). Also, its only been two weeks so if that foil eventually does get damaged for lack of cover, I'd say don't buy it!! My previous Braun model was top of the line from 10 years ago. Its battery is losing the ability to hold a charge so I decided to buy another top of the line from Braun. From my viewpoint, the main difference between the new and the old, is that the new one can cut closer than the old one. 10 years ago, to remedy the problem of not getting a close cut with the Braun, I also purchased the top of line for Panasonic. For 10 years I've used the Braun for the first shave, and then finished with the Panasonic for the close shave. Pansonic couldn't cut long hair well, but cut very well the short hair. It looks like I won't have to purchase the Panasonic this time since the new Braun seems to cut close enough. I gave this product 5 stars, but remember I'm rating this without consideration of longevity and the sideburn cutter. If it is working well after five years like my previous Braun, then it should get 10 stars!!
  463. My husband loves this product! A great purchase and ease of service with Amazon
  464. This is a very solid choice if you're looking for an foil electric razor. The build quality is excellent - solidly made, and feels very substantial. The cleaning base is undoubtably the best out there - it's the first cleaning base I've used that actually does the job better and faster than cleaning it yourself.<br /><br />But, you buy a razor for the shave quality, and on that mark, the Pulsonic is just a bit above average. On the plus side, it's very gentle and works quickly. The downside is that it does not give me as close as a shave as I get from a Norelco Arcitec. The pulsonic action helps out somewhat with those hard to cut neck hairs, but on my face, the Arcitec does a better job, and does it faster and quieter.<br /><br />If you've used a Braun 360 or other similar Braun shavers and have been pleased with it, then this would be a very nice upgrade. Also, if you find you get a good shave from other foil shavers, such as the Remingtons, then you'll probably like this as well. It will be a clear step up.<br /><br />However, if you favor a rotary shaver, then you probably will not be happy with the closeness of the Braun.<br /><br />The tough part is if you've never used an electric shaver before and have nothing to compare it to. In that case, I'd suggest getting the Pulsonic and the Arcitec, and seeing which works best for you. Every face is different - some beards (like mine) are better suited to a rotary; others are better suited to a foil. All razor manufacturers let you try out their products for at least 30 days (60 for Norelco). If you don't like it, you can return it to the manufacturer and get your money back. Yes, you'll be out of pocket for the postage to mail it back, but you can be assured you're getting the right razor for your face.<br /><br />I'm giving it three stars based on how well it worked for me. If you're a foil fan, this can easily be a five-star product.
  465. This shaver will not substitute for a blade shave, but does better than some previous razors on this 69 year old face. One feature missing is a trimmer. Not much difference between this screen type of shaver and a rotary shaver for closeness. The innovative recharging base offers a change with the automatic cleaning the razor by flushing a solution through the heads after each use, which will require occasional purchasing of CCR refills for the cleaner. It also may be cleaned in the normal methods as well. Overall, it does allow for a faster shave without the lathering mess of a blade, but don't expect a real close shave.

  474. This is my 3rd Braun, last one broke after a few years, head came loose and I decided not to send it in for repair. While waiting for my new 9595 I used a 5 blade vibrating disposable with shaving gel so I have some recent experience to compare too. I have owned the new razor for just over a week. Before my Brauns I used several Norelco's. My dad is still a die hard Norelco man, but he hasn't tried my new Braun yet either :) Speedwise the shave with a Braun 9595 is MUCH faster than the 7xxx series and works better when you have skipped a couple of days. On my 7xxx series if I had missed more than a couple days then I would go back to a blade. On the 9595 I have done 3 days no problem, but haven't tried longer yet. With the older Braun you either shaved or didn't, the first pass didn't come close to doing a good job vs with the new onea single pass isn't bad at all. The 9595 doesn't pull hair near as much as the old one when you have skipped a couple days. I really feel the 9595 is closer to a revolutionary upgrade than an evolutionary. Compared to a blade (after have adjusted a bit since I used one for a few weeks) To me speed is about the same and the shave is about the same. If I was in a hurry, I could get a passable shave faster with the Braun and not go over everything a 3rd time for the comparable shave. In summary, Love it!
  475. I have used Braun shavers for over 15 years and I have loved them. Until now. After 4 years of great service my 7500 series Braun broke. With a track record like that, I was definitely buying another Braun. I figured a razor is something I should spend extra on since I use it every day, so I bought the very pricey 9595. I have come to regret it. It became clear early on that this one wasn't as good as the one that it replaced. After 3 months of daily use, I'm very frustrated and rather angry. - Noise. The pulsonic razor is really noisy. Much noisier than the 7500 series. - Recharger/cleaner is very poorly designed. Rather than using a direct plug in connection, it has contacts on the razor and on the base that need to line up. This works until the razor starts cleaning, vibrating the razor. This causes it to lose connection and stop working. It normally takes four tries to get it to complete a cleaning cycle. There is no correct way to insert the shaver to guarantee it will complete cleaning cycle. - Less information is less information. The old 7500 series told me how long the shave took and how much charge in minutes were left. The 9500 series has cell phone type bars for power and hygene, no read out on time taken to shave. After using this razor for 3 months, I think they removed the time taken to shave feature for a reason. - Takes too long to get all the missed spots. It takes 50% longer to get a good shave than with the 7500 series. - Excessive packaging. Packaging has no influence on those of us who buy through the Web, but I will note the packing is excessive and wasteful. - Gimmicky. I have noticed no benefits of \\"sonic\\" over a regular electric razor. After another time consuming shave and three attempts to get the razor to clean itself, I called customer service. They weren't very nice and wanted me to ship the charger to another city. Thanks for nothing. I have gone from a loyal Braun customer to someone who will never buy another Braun (or Proctor and Gamble marketed) electronic product. Update: I still hate this razor and the shaves have gotten even worse. It takes forever to shave with this thing. It is the worst shaver I have had in 18 years of shaving. I can't believe I paid over $200 for this POS.

  477. I tried the Norelco shaver to keep my head shaved, but it did not work well. I then tried the Braun Series 7 Pulsonic Shaver, and it did a very good job of both shaving my head (keeping it bald) and, shaving my face. It is not quite as good as a blade when it comes to shaving your face, but it is much faster than the blade, and does an OK job. In addition, one of the selling points for me was that you don't have to bother cleaning the electric razor. You just place it in its cradle and press the cleaning button, and it will automatically clean the razor and set it up again for your next shave. Overall, it's a very good product. I recommend it for guys that want to keep their heads shaved. (Suggestion: Have your wife or girl friend help you with shaving the back of the head.   488. Using a razor has never been an option for me. I first began shaving as a kid when I joined the Army, and I quickly discovered the realities of pseudofolliculitis. A shaving profile and a decent beard trimmer soon became a part of my standard-issue toiletry kit.<br /><br />After leaving the military, I discovered electric shavers which cut closer, but still could not provide the professional kind of shave that I always wanted.<br /><br />Over the years I've used a number of brands until about 15 years ago when I discovered Braun and thought I was in heaven. Never has any electric shaver provided as close or as smooth a shave. But paying a premium price for their product was a tough call for me, so eventually I sacrificed close shaves in favor of economics and went back to using the \\"cheaper\\" brands--what a disappointment though!<br /><br />Then about a month ago, I bought the 790cc Pulsonic Shaver. It provides the best shave I've ever had. Almost as close as the razor shave I had on my first day of basic training. So close, in fact, that I truly don't believe Braun can improve on it. Right now, I can actually skip a day of shaving and get away with it, but I don't because I enjoy the feel of its ergonomic design, the efficiency of its \\"uber-high frequency\\" pulse and the high-tech \\"coolness\\" of the self-cleaning, self-sanitizing system. It's very 21st century.<br /><br />You're going to pay top dollar for this system, but it's well worth it because there is no closer or safer electric shaver on the market. And if your face is sensitive like mine then what are you waiting for?<br /><br />I am skeptical, however, of Braun's claim that the shaving block only has to be changed once every 18 months. I think once every six months is more realistic, but we'll see.<br /><br />As far as cleaning is concerned, I put the shaver back in the cradle at the end of each shave and use the automatic cleaning cycle that the system recommends. And why not? That way I know the blades will be sanitized, lubricated and ready for the next morning's session with a minimum of effort and thought on my part. Replacement cleaning/lubricating fluid cartridges are cheap (through Amazon.com), and they make maintaining your investment a piece of cake.<br /><br />UPDATE, Nov. 2013<br /><br />Until two weeks ago when I retired, I was still using this work horse. It continues to give the closes shaves of my life. I ultimately began changing the shaving blocks once each year.<br /><br />I noticed about 18 months ago that the red light indicating the status of the cleaning/lubricating fluid began to come on too soon. I finally put the recharger/cradle under the faucet and washed out the insides very thoroughly. I found a lot of hair shavings had clogged-up the workings which caused it to give premature readings. It worked like new once I had done this. I recommend you do the same every year, and you save on cleaning/lubricating fluid.he blades will be sanitized, lubricated and ready for the next morning's session with a minimum of effort and thought on my part. Replacement cleaning/lubricating fluid cartridges are cheap (through Amazon.com), and they make maintaining your investment a piece of cake.<br /><br />UPDATE, Nov. 2013<br /><br />Until two weeks ago when I retired, I was still using this work horse. It continues to give the closes shaves of my life. I ultimately began changing the shaving blocks once each year.<br /><br />I noticed about 18 months ago that the red light indicating the status of the cleaning/lubricating fluid began to come on too soon. I finally put the recharger/cradle under the faucet and washed out the insides very thoroughly. I found a lot of hair shavings had clogged-up the workings which caused it to give premature readings. It worked like new once I had done this. I recommend you do the same every year, and you save on cleaning/lubricating fluid.

  491. I was so excited to finally trade up my 7 year old workhorse the Braun 7505 to the latest Braun 7-790CC. But the 7-790CC is a complete joke! I end up looking like a homeless guy on crack every time I use it. Or at least feeling like one. My hair is very coarse, and the skin is extremely sensitive so if I go over the same area too many times, my skin breaks up. With my old Braun, I only needed to go over the same area twice - up and down, and that was it. With this one, I doesn't matter how many times I move it up and down, it will still leave spots of hair so I end up having to manually shave myself. I think it's due to the top middle section that is not getting close enough to the skin, instead it creates a space from the actual blades. And compared to my older one where the middle section sits lower than the outer sections. The trimmer works mainly to trim my sideburns but if I want to trim the area around from the Adams apple to the chin, it's hurts, and irritate the skin...just like one of those cheap $19 trimmers. Not sure why they made the trimmer blade much smaller than my older one. It's a breeze to trim the hair with the older Braun. Battery time compared to my older Braun is actually shorter!!! And my older Braun has a 7 year old battery. I bought it mainly because I trusted the brand, and read all of the reviews but I'm suspecting that these reviews are either made by people hired by Braun's marketing department, so called fake buyers. Or they are written by people with pretty much no facial hair (Leonardo Di Caprio, Johnny Depp types), and not for people like myself and Sean Connery, Pierce Brosnan, and Santa Clause when he is not working. I promise you that Braun will soon improve the 7-790 shaver since the only good thing with it is the design.
  492. I've been using razors for years now but my skin had started to get sensitive along my neck so I decided I'd give an electric razor a go again. I felt there wasn't any point in cutting corners, if it's something good it's something you'll be using every day for years - get the best. That's what I thought I was getting for one of the highest rated electric razors on Amazon, one of the most expensive too. What I'm left with is a razor that looks pretty but just does a terrible job. It can't seem to cut the hair on my neck, especially around my adam's apple but it had no problem cutting my face twice during my three weeks of use. And I've tried moving it every which way and pulling on the skin and everything else. End result is that moving it at a 90 degree angle against the skin with the skin pulled tight and moving against the grain, exactly like the manual says, the hair just stays there. So I'm left to either have hairs still on my neck or pull out my old razor to finish the job. What's the point? To make matters worse it seems to leave my neck feeling worse than a regular blade. Pros: - It looks pretty - Trimmer works pretty darn good Cons: - Doesn't seem to cut hair well - Cuts my face - Irritates the heck out of my neck All in all this is a terrible product and when you couple it with the price of $200 it's just a darn shame. Here's to hoping I can get my money back somehow. EDIT: As a side note, bravo to Amazon for refunding me the money on this purchase. At least, in the end, I didn't have to pay for this horrible machine.
  493. Still a little pricey but well worth the money! It's also a big improvement over it's original design. Very Happy with it!
  494. I purchased this shaver in early January and waited to get a good feel for the product before reviewing. I've almost always used Norelco shavers with a couple of exceptions and have not been happy with most electrics. I do prefer a standard non-elecrtic razor, but early morning rushes sometimes call for the time-saving of an electric razor. This is by far the best electric that I've owned. Performance is my standard, not ergonomics or style or ease of cleaning. A close shave is what is most important (to me) and the Braun delivers better than I've ever experienced from an electric AND has great style, ease of cleaning etc.. I seriously can't find a 'con' in this product. Some may say price but if this is what it cost to get results, I say fair enough. I haven't thrown away my shave cream yet, but... note:(FEB. $50 off on future purchase)

  498. I've had this thing for over 2 years now and I love it. The replacement cartridge for the shaver is a bit pricey but I could never imagine myself going back to razors or other electric shavers that don't do as good a job as this.
  499. My wife bought a pretty nice rotary razor for me a long time ago which we ended up returning. It would leave my face all red and full with rashes. I felt bad that I had to return her gift so kept looking for a razor and thought to give this a try. I have used this razor for over two months now. This razor is excellent, no rashes, no burning (well a little around neck). Excellent close shave. If you don't clean it everyday, it does drop hair out of the razor. I have noticed less or no hair if the razor is clean. The razor holds charge very well and charges fast. The self clean system is very nice but noisy. I don't mind the noise, just don't turn on when everyone is sleeping. I have a very pronounced chin and was worried about this razor not doing a good job. No problem at all, it does a very good job. Overall a very positive experience. Amazon as usual was prompt in delivery and the item was as described. Also best price at the time.

  501. I have had the Braun 790cc shaver for over a month now. I have always had to use an electric shaver because I would get horrible rashes and bumps on my neck. The first Braun and some other foil shaver were horrible. I used Norelco for the longest time. I had two previous Norelco's that last me about 6 years each. They were OK and did the job. I decided to try this one with the 30-day return policy from a local retailer. The shave was smooth, quick, and perfect for my sensitive skin. It is a bit noisy and the base cleaner is noisy. Other than that, there are no real negatives. Pros: 1. Close shave 2. Quick shave 3. Does not iritate my sensitive skin 4. Feels comfortable and sturdy in my hand Cons: 1. Noisy base, but who cares about that. Hit clean when you leave the bathroom 2. A little noisy to use, but not that bad 3. Causes some ingrown whiskers 4. Expensive, but worth it.

I have an old norelco rotary that shaves almost as well as this. Also, it seems to go through the cleaning solution pretty fast.   505. I have owned Braun shavers before and have been fairly happy. This one works quite well also. However, the cleaning base is defective. After 4 months of use it could no longer recognize the refill cartridge sometimes and other times started cleaning without the razor inserted. It was unusable. I cleaned it to no avail. Here's the rub. When I contacted Proctor & Gamble, the rep for Braun, I was basically told I had to jump through a thousand hoops to get it fixed. I'm left with buying another charger and never buying a Braun product again. See their email to me below. Thanks for contacting Braun. We're disappointed you had this experience with your cleaning stand since we make every effort to produce the finest products possible. We monitor every phase of production and continually re-evaluate and upgrade our systems to ensure we maintain our high quality standards. Please be assured your comments will be shared with the quality department. You will need to take your cleaning stand to any authorized Braun Service Center for repair. Unfortunately there is no service center located in your area you will to mail it to the service center listed below. C.S.E. Covina 612 South Shoppers Lane Covina, CA 91723 (626) 915-4935 Mart's Appliance Service Ctr. 743 E. Valley Parkway Escondido, CA 92025 (760) 745-7711 C.E.S. - Lake Forest 22500 Muirlands Blvd. Suite B Lake Forest, CA 92630 (949) 586-9440 We recommend you call the service center first to discuss your repair issue prior to mailing it there. You will need to find out from the service center if you will need to send the shaver as well as we recommend that you do send it in to them. Please include all system components originally packed with the unit at the time of purchase such as charging bases, cords, or cleaning centers. Do not include fluids of any type such as shaver cleaner cartridges. A note should accompany your product containing the following information: -Complete Name -Mailing Address including apt number or suite if applicable (no post office boxes please) -Contact phone number required -A brief explanation of the problem you're experiencing with the product. - You also need to send a copy of your original sales receipt for proof of warranty. Please allow the Service Center two weeks to complete the repair, and also please take shipping time into consideration. Hope this information will be helpful Thank you for taking the time to contact us. Kenesha G. Braun Team.
  506. I upgraded to the 790cc over a year ago, and am currently on my third unit. But first the good points. Shaving is a dream, and even with my coarse, heavy stubble I get a nice smooth shave with no irritation and no stray hairs. On the cleaning side of things, however, this model has been nothing but a problem. I get flawless operation for about 4 - 6 months, and then the cleaning base mysteriously starts leaking whenever it is used. Given the cost of the cleaning cartridges, this is just unacceptable. Yes, it is on a flat, level surface. My latest unit just started leaking last week, which is what prompted this review. Fortunately, my wife works at a major home retailer for bedrooms, bathrooms, and other stuff (hint, hint), so we've been able to exchange it without problems. I suppose I could just keep doing so, but considering the cleaning unit is a major feature (and, presumably, justification for the expense) it's frustrating to have such a short life expectancy. So, although the shaver works great, the cleaning unit is a complete disappointment.
  507. ***WARNING, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT*** I have had this for 2+ years, and as with what others said the shaver will lose contact with the base due to the contacts on the base being cheap. The metal wears away in just a short few months of use from the vibration of cleaning. Braun needs to redesign those contacts better. I had to pull mine apart and solder the front contacts so that it would charge/clean again. That is POOR design for such an expensive setup. Also, after your face has adjusted to the shaver, it makes the blade/shaver not cut as close as it used to, even with a brand new replacement blade, it just doesnt cut like it used to. Instead, the Braun Series 7- 790cc scatters the stubble all over your shirt. All my Norelco rotary razors always collected all of my whiskers internally to be put in the trash.
  509. This is the best electric shaver bar none for a former razor user! It is the best value I have come across for an electric shaver. It provides a very close shave without the added hassle of dealing with a razor and shaving gel. It took me about 2 weeks to get use to the change (the manual states it could take up to a month). I get a very comfortable shave without a burning sensation like other electric shavers I have used. Plus, no occasional cuts like I got from my razor. I have been a life long razor user (>40 years). For the closest shave with the occasional cut, I used Gillette's Fusion razor and shaving gel. But I have been appalled by the blade cost and the need to clean out my sink drain every 6 months due to shaving gel build-up. My payout for the Braun Series 7 system versus Gillette's Fusion system is about 12-14 months. I have used cheaper electric shavers (<$100) in the past with poor results. Invariably, I gave up since they never gave a close shave and resulted in a burning sensation on my face. I could never get use to the electric shaver and always went back to a razor within a month of use. A nice benefit of this Braun electric shaver is the cleaning system. I do not have to deal with the messy cleaning of blade head. Just stick it in the charging / cleaning console and I have a fresh shaver ready for use the next morning. To date, I have used the cleaning cartridge for over a month and the console indicator still indicates it is good to go. So it is lasting longer for me than the manual prediction of about 1 month. Overall, I highly recommend this Braun electric shaver to razor users. I spent about a week looking at reviews and recommendations on electric shavers. This Braun electric shaver was consistently highly recommended by most of the reviews I read. So I took a chance and am very impressed with the results I have had.

No one appears to have any recollection of saying 3 years ... pretty amazing.   512. I've been using this shaver for the past 6 years, and for the most part its been great. You do need to do occasional maintenance to keep it running well, such as replacing the blade once a year and replacing the cleaning fluid every couple of months, but for the most part its just worked. The cleaning stand did stop working once when some fluid got inside of it, and that cost about 80 dollars to replace, but the shaver itself has had no problems.<br /><br />Things I've liked:<br />- It gives a nice shave, not amazing, but pretty good. If my hair is longer than a day or two, I usually have to first trim it down with the flip out trimmers.<br />- The battery seems to last a long time. I usually keep it in the stand, which means it's always charging, but when taking it on trips, it has lasted a week or two shaving every other day with 50% battery or more.<br />- I love the fact that it has a stand to clean the blade. Having a clean foil and blade helps against breaking out after shaving.<br /><br />Things I haven't liked:<br />- The indicator of when you should clean it is based on the amount of time shaver has run vs how dirty or full the shaver is. I was hoping when I bought it, it was smart enough to only want to it clean it when it actually needed cleaning, but since it's time based, if I am mainly using the shaver to trim a beard, it says it is past due to clean, even though I've used the actual shaver very little. Most of the time I ignore the indicator and clean based on actual usage.<br />- The power comb to lift and remove long hairs doesn't work as well as I had hoped. If I have a hair that is slightly longer and laying flat, I need to flip out the trimmer to remove it.<br />- If you want a really close shave, you have to first use the flip out trimmer if you haven't shaved in more than two days. You also must go over the areas several times to remove all traces of hair. Granted this is an electric shaver and not a razor, but I was hoping that if I bought thetop of the line at the time, it would provide a shave much closer to a razor. It still shaves quickly and fairly decent if you use it fast, but to remove all traces of the hair takes several passes.<br /><br />While the things I haven't liked may seem longer, they are minor compared to the things I have liked. Its been a great shaver and is still working 6 years later without problems. I see no reason to buy another shaver until this one actually dies.
  513. this is my fourth braun shaver and this time they have really outdone themselves. Much closer shave than usual with the whole sonic thing and much quicker as well. Expensive but worth it.
  514. I love this shaver!!! It replaced a Braun Activator 8595. The Pulsonic shaver is quieter, smoother and definitely gives a closer shave than the 8595. I don't know if it's because the blades are moving so fast or the vibrating action or both, but the shave is very smooth with no sense of the beard hairs being pulled or disturbed in any way. It definitely cuts faster and closer on the neck, which was always a problem with the 8595. I also seem to have less skin irritation after shaving. The unit is well made and fits nicely in your hand. Also, the shaver head seems to be larger than the old Braun and swivels more to better follow the contours of your face. I know this shaver is a little pricey, but I think it is well worth it.
  515. Ok here we go for my first and probably only review on Amazon. I am 50 years old and have tried pretty much every electric shaver known to mankind. Each time giving up due to the pinching,non close shave and pain in the butt cleaning. In the end, I was going back to razor blades and the frequent cuts. I went to Braun's website and read about this shaver and came to Amazon to see the reviews here. I decided after reading the reviews to splurge on another electric shaver. What a find! This in my humble opinion is the greatest invention EVER! It's the first electric razor I've used which doesn't get hot after a couple minutes of use.Hot razor means sweaty face which trips up razor and adds to pinching. Braun recommends you shave before you shower or wash your face, while you still have a little protective barrier of oil on your skin. A big no-no with regular shaving, this worked well with the Pulsonic. They also recommend you shave against the grain. Again, not recommended for regular shaving. For electric shaving, works great. I must say I Absolutely LOVE shaving now.(I would let my beard grow for days because I HATED shaving with razors and cutting myself). The Pulsonic is the closest shave ever by an electric razor(IMHO shaves as close as a razor once you master it) and more importantly it does not pinch or burn at all. Even better is the self cleaning which make life easier. My wife laughs every morning as she now sees me shaving daily with this god send! if you are reading bad reviews on this product it must be I just don't get it. Bottom line: BUY THIS NOW! I just ordered another one for my son! I am telling all who read this if you hate shaving GET THIS PRODUCT you will love it.

Almost every electric I've used till now has left tons of stubble and I end up doing a quick dry shave with a razor to clean up missed areas. After who knows how many electric purchases I finally gave up and went back to a razor.<br />I've been using only a razor (Mach 3) for about 3-4 years now.<br />Problem with the razors is that I'm usually in a hurry, nature of my job, and I dont have time to wash, lather, shave, rinse, dry and aftershave.<br />Sometimes I just need to clean up real quick, so I gave this one a try after reading some reviews and seeing that it had the vibration thing going on I figured I give one last go.<br />Well, it works. It works great as a matter of fact.<br />I have a couple trouble areas on my neck where my hair grows kinda sideways and flat but with a bit of persistence and stretching my skin tight I can even get those areas.<br />And the kicker was that it cleaned my face on the first try. I've been told that I just needed to stick with my electrics and my face would adapt... Bull. I didnt have to wait for any adapting or [...] like that, this thing just shaved my face.<br />It takes down my cheeks and chin with out any fuss at all and gets it as close to a razor as Ive ever seen.<br />You can wash the whole thing off in water which makes me happy since I bring it to work with me and cant always have the base around.   517. Here is a breakdown of my evaluation of the Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD Screen:<br /><br />** Pros **<br /><br />>> Construction<br />The constuction of this shaver is superb. The body of the shaver is made from plastic but it has a very refined metallic look. The LCD screen seems to be made of glass and looks to be fairly scratch resistant. The shaver itself is made in Germany and has the look and feel of quality construction. The shaver is fairly weighty (but not too heavy) which adds to the overall impression of a solid build.<br /><br />>> Function/Performance<br />The shave is just about as close as that from a shaving blade. Maybe there is something to this \\"Pulsonic\\" technology after all (10,000 Micro-Vibrations per minute) which is supposed to help lift hair to provide a closer cut. I was unable to see or feel any stuble after a shave. The shaved area actually feels silky smooth! Thanks to the new and improved screen foil and cutterblock for the Pulsonic 9595CC.<br /><br />The Pulsonic has a flexing/pivoting head to help the shaver conform to the contour of your face. I personally don't really care very much for it as I'm accustomed to flexing my wrist to angle the shaver to my face. The pivoting head can also be locked in place to tackle the hard to reach area under the nose.<br /><br />The pop-up trimmer is very functional and does as good a job as a dedicated trimmer.<br /><br />>> Features<br />Cleaning Convenience: The Clean & Renew system automatically cleans, lubricates, and dries the saver at the touch of a button. It also has a 25-second quick cleaning cycle for when you have to use your shaver in a hurry (This feature is only available on the Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD Screen, not on the lesser equipped Braun Pulsonic System 9585CC with LED Lights). After each cleaning, the shaver smells clean and lemony.<br /><br />The shaver can be washed under tap water but with this method of cleaning, the manual states that the shaver head needs to be lubed with a few drops of lubricant every week or so.<br /><br />The shaver sports an LCD screen which has a \\"hygiene\\" and a \\"battery\\" indicator each of which has six graduations/levels arranged in a semi-circular fashion and occupies half of the screen. The hygiene indicator shows when the shaver needs to be cleaned. The battery indicator, of course, indicates how much power is left.<br /><br />No time to wait around for the shaver to recharge? No problem. The power cord can be hooked up directly to the shaver.<br /><br />>> Warranty<br />The shaver has a 2-year warranty (excludes the Cutter and Foil part - you're advised to replace this every 18 months).<br /><br />>> Ergonomics<br />The back and sides of the shaver are rubberized to help you to maintain a firm and comfortable grip while shaving.<br /><br />>> Aesthetics<br />The Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC exudes elegance, class and sophistication with its sleek lines and its beautifully crafted elements that convey a work of intricate and robust engineering.<br /><br />** Cons **<br />I have only one. Here it is for completeness sake:<br /><br />>> Price<br />The real gripe I have about this shaver is not so much its price because it's a one-time expense but the price of the Clean & Renew cartridges. Talk about \\"giving away razors to sell razor blades\\" except in this case the razor is, patently, not free. Braun advises that the cartridge be replaced after 30 cleaning cycles or 6-8 weeks WCF.<br /><br />** Additional Points **<br /><br />>> Economic Considerations<br />Some economically-conscious people have suggested using isopropyl alcohol mixed with a lubricant to refill the cartridge. The factory cleaning fluid actually contains a highly volatile alcohol and a lubricant component, which is apparent after each cleaning because the residual lubricant can be felt if you run your finger through the sides of the shaver head. They further suggest removing the cartridge and capping it after each cleaning to prevent the loss of the highly volatile fluid. That's too much of a hassle and I don't see it as a necessity because once the cartridge is in place, the openings of the cartridge form a watertight seal with the cleaning component and the loss of the solution through evaporation is very minimal. At least one individual suggested changing the cartridge every 6-months.<br /><br />** Conclusion **<br /><br />The Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD is pricey but it is worth every penny. Don't let the price of the Clean & Renew cartridges deter you from getting this little gem because you can always forego the automated cleaning option and simply use running tap water. I personally have no regrets about getting this shaver and I highly recommend it. Go on, get it and see for yourself how the Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD lives up to its hype.enings of the cartridge form a watertight seal with the cleaning component and the loss of the solution through evaporation is very minimal. At least one individual suggested changing the cartridge every 6-months. ** Conclusion ** The Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD is pricey but it is worth every penny. Don't let the price of the Clean & Renew cartridges deter you from getting this little gem because you can always forego the automated cleaning option and simply use running tap water. I personally have no regrets about getting this shaver and I highly recommend it. Go on, get it and see for yourself how the Braun Pulsonic System 9595CC with LCD lives up to its hype.

  525. I have a very heavy and fast growing beard while also having a very sensitive neck and under-lip area, so I am always on a quest for a razor that can somehow cut down my crazy facial hair and not leave me with horrible razor burn. My first razor was a norelco rotary which is actually quite good at cutting very long hairs but not at getting a close shave, particularly around the chin and neck. The second was one of the first generation Braun synchro shavers with the cleaning system. I found that foil shavers, at least on my face, did a much better job getting in close than the rotary shavers. However this razor was not as good at cutting longer hairs or my neck area. I have also used a Mach 3 and the Fusion wet razors. These give the closest shave but leave me with razor burn the next day that is just brutal to re-shave. That and when you nick yourself with the fusion you end up with 5 little cuts all bleeding, not so much fun. Also the cost of the cartridges and shaving creams add up very quickly when I am lucky to get a week out of a single blade cartridge. Finally, we come to the Pulsonic. This is an electric shaver that actually leaves my face and neck smooth in every area, yet does not leave me with horrible razor burn. The head glides over my face easily and does not pull or tug or get horribly warm. For those areas where the head moves too easily, the lock switch will fix the head into position allowing for precision control. There is of course a pop-up trimmer for getting long hairs down to size. The cleaning base on this model is MUCH improved over the original synchro, which had an arm that had to be pushed into the back of the razor (this eventually failed, making the base useless). Instead this one just has two metal contacts that the razor rests against for charging. No moving parts. Cleaning is quick and efficient due to the more intelligent cleaning system that will do light cleanings when the razor has not been used as much.Also, this base uses gentle heating to dry the razor instead of a noisy fan like the old models. The plastic carrying case is very nice as it will keep the razor safe from crushing while in your luggage and it holds the brush for cleaning while traveling (the head is also washable). While some complain that it does not hold the charger, this is a moot point to me as the charger just goes in with other electronic chargers or in my toiletry bag. All in all, I am extremely impressed with this razor. It seems to fix the design flaws with the original synchro models as well as greatly improving shaving performance. While the price is steep, finally getting a close shave while not suffering from razor burn makes it worth every penny. It looks like my quest for a razor that can give me near wet razor closeness without the irritation is finally finished.
  526. I have shaved my entire adult life using shaving cream and a razor. I was always happy with how close of a shave I got, but a razor sometmes leaves my skin irritated. I would shave one day, and not the next in order to give my face some healing time. When I saw the commercial for this product, I became really excited at the prospect of being able to shave every day while getting great results with every shave. BOY WAS I DISSAPOINTED! This razor not only irritated my face WORSE than with a manual razor, it was the worst shave I ever had in my life. I follwed the instructions, and waited 2 weeks to allow my face to acclimate to the shave. It never happened. Thank goodness they have a 30 day money-back guarantee. If you think $250 is going to buy you a great shave with less irritation, think again.
  527. Shaving is OK when it works but not as close as my previous Braun. When on the road, not using the cleaning system, the razor gets hot and auto shut-off after half shaving. I contacted Braun customer service (e-mail and phone) and got no support at all except the \\"we are sorry you don't enjoy ...\\" There is a real technical problem and Braun refuses to even acknowledge it.Too late to return. I wasted $250 and Braun does not care at all. After 20 years of using Braun, I will switch to another brand.
  528. After all the electric shavers he has used over the years, this one was by far the best!!!!
  529. As advertised, it is the best electric shave I have ever had. It provides a closer shave and does a better job on my neck. It also doesn't cause irritation. However, it still leaves a few stubborn areas untouched on my neck. This shaver didn't give me the \\"perfect\\" shave, but it was a nice upgrade from my 3-head rotary Norelco.
  530. I bought this Braun Pulsonic Razor for my husband and after two weeks I asked him his opinion. He is a previous Braun 7000 Series user and fan. He said that the Pulsonic offers a very close shave. As he keeps his head bald, he also uses it for in between razor shaves for his head. Again, it provides a close shave and seldom misses hairs. Downside: Trimmer is in an awkward spot (middle of the body of the Pulsonic) and he does not like it versus the older 7000 Series.
  531. I used to have one of those Norelco's with the shave \\"goo\\". Sometimes it would give a great shave but mostly it left my neck looking like I shaved with a putty knife. I tried using it before a shower, in the shower, after a shower, nothing proved consistent. Eventually one of the recharge prongs broke and out the razor went. I've used Mach 3's for a few years and they are great razors but after 3 or 4 days I get razor burn on my neck where it cuts and hairs that lay along my skin where it doesn't. I thought about getting another electric for awhile and I saw the reviews on here and finally decided that many positive reviews couldn't be wrong and I got myself a Christmas present. I know it's supposed to take 2-4 weeks to get used to an electric razor. But my 1st shave was almost as good as a Mach 3 and minimal razor burn on my neck. My shave's gotten slightly better every day I've used the pulsonic and my razor burn is almost gone. This is definitely a great, intelligently designed razor and I'm glad I bought it. Some points to mention: +Some people have said that the razor is loud and it vibrates. The Pulsonic name should tip you off that maybe the razor vibrates, and it vibrates quickly to... Well, I don't quite know why, but it shaves pretty well. Yes, the razor is loud but just start the cleaning cycle as you leave for work and you'll never hear it... +The razor itself feels heavy for it's size, which probably speaks for the quality of it's construction. However the base is just white I/M plastic but it works. +The razor will give you a little message when it thinks you should buy a new head cartridge (the manual says they last about 18 months). This is a nice feature to remind you that probably need a new head cartridge and Braun could probably use your money (j/k). The only real gripe I have is $$$ (initial and recurring). Mach 3's are cheaper but I prefer to eat hamburger, not feel like it and you get what you pay for. If you're thinking about buying this, I definitely recommend it both as a good shaver and as a cool, geeky gadget. Make sure you follow instructions and DON\\"T shave right after a shower. This makes your skin & hairs swell and rinses the natural oils off your skin. This makes shaving your face like trying to peel fibers off a carpet! Also a little \\"'Lectric Shave\\" lotion doesn't hurt.
  532. After purchasing the shaver I expected a new quality close shave that also makes shaving easier when it comes to those stubbern little hair that just refuse to yield. The unit is very large (had to fit into my case), does not have a blade protection cover other then the one covering the entire unit making transportation even bulkier. The shave took some time to get used to, but I feel it is no better then the one of units half this price. The power cable is a non standard cable, which means you cannot rely on your friends if you are on a longer trip. Time will tell how the cleaning process will maintain the unit.
  533. my husband wanted an electric razor for christmas, and after doing some research I ordered him this one. he loves it, and it really works great. i love that it cleans itself as well - there is a lot less mess in the sink than from his previous electric razor! happy customer all around!!!
  534. I've used several shavers over my lifetime. I would rate this one among the best I had. The thing that amazes me most is how quickly it works. It shaves as quickly as a rotary razor while keeping the closeness of a foil shaver. I also like the fact that it's not too loud like many foil shavers. I have a Panasonic wet/dry foil shaver as well. The Braun shaves as closely as it, but you get the job done in about 20% of the time. Don't judge it by the first shave it gives you as it takes time to break-in. It took about two weeks before it shaved as close as the Panasonic.
  535. Over the past ten years I have owned two top of the line Braun shavers and now own the Series 7-790. I was expecting marginal improvements but I was very pleasantly surprised. Pro: The shave is extremely close, as about as close a shave as a hand-held razor but without any worries about cutting my skin nor any of the mess or clean-up. The noise level of the 7-790 is much quieter than previous models. The ergonomics of the shaver provides a comfortable fit in the hand, much more so than my previous bulkier Braun models. The cleaning cycle is much quieter, quite noticeably quieter in fact. Finally, for the first time with a Braum I can shave very comfortably without washing or putting pre-shave on my beard. The 7-790 instructions were quite emphatic that the shave should be done before washing the face and they are right. I was skeptical but no longer. Con: The travel case is a soft, transparent plastic case that seems less sturdy than the earlier Braun model plastic travel cases I have owned but this complaint is a very minor issue. I am very pleased with the 7-790, a shaver that went beyond my expectations of an electric shaver.
  536. Are you tired of buying a different kind of razor each time you need a replacement -- just hoping that you'll finally find one that works the way you need it to work? Then look no farther. This is the razor that all of us have been waiting for. * It connects with the whiskers growing out of every crevice of your face, chin, and neck. * It's self cleaning cycle just makes sense and gives it a nice, clean scent too. * It doesn't get too hot while using it. * It feels good in your hand, is easy to grip at different angles, and doesn't get slippery if it gets a bit wet. I know that the price of this razor makes is a purchase that has to be thought out. But when adding up how much I usually spend on lousy manual razors, shave cream, and replacement blades/cartridges, I'll pay for this electric razor in a couple of years ... and people are always writing here and elsewhere about how long the higher end Braun products last. So that's what I'm counting on. The last time I tried an electric razor (about 20 years ago now), my face broke out and got all bumpy. Bummer. But after using this razor for a week, I'm sold. Thanks Braun. I know have a smile on my face before having my morning coffee. Gregg

  541. I have been an Amazon customer for over 10 years and seldom write reviews. I think I've written two. I have to comment on this razor. My beard is difficult to shave without a blade razor due to the graininess of my neck. I was shaving with a Norelco for many years. It would almost always leave hair on my neck that I had to shave off with a razor blade to get a good shave. I've gone back and forth from blade to Norelco trying but failing to get a good electric shave. After reading many reviews on Amazon and other places I decided to buy the Braun Series 7-790cc Pulsonic Shaver. When it arrived I thought I must have received the wrong thing. The package was far larger than I would have expected leading me to feel that $10 of my purchase was probably for packaging alone. If you are into \\"Green\\" you wouldn't like it. Once I got the razor out and set up the cleaning mechanism I was ready to go. The shave was incredible for an electric razor. The swivel head made shaving all parts of my face easy. Those tough grainy spots on my neck were easily shaved off. I did learn I need to shave against the grain to get the best shave. The razor is large and noisy, but I found it easier to handle than my Norelco. The trimmer works nicely as well. The cleaning system is quite interesting. You insert a liquid cleaning cartridge in the bottom of the cleaning/charging station. When you are done shaving you set the razor in the cleaning/charging station and press clean. You can hear liquid being dispensed then it runs the razor for a while. I think it cleans for 20 to 30 minutes - not quite sure. Most of the time it is just sitting there. It adjusts depending on the amount of dirt in the razor. They say to clean it daily, but I have gone up to 4 days without cleaning it as a result of taking it on a business trip (comes with a carrying case). You also have the option of just cleaning it manually but it is not as fun (I am a gadget geek). They say the cleaning cartridges will last a month, but I've been able to get mine to last 7 or 8 weeks. I would recommend buying this razor if you want to get a high quality electric shave. I would purchase this razor again.
  542. This is one of my first Amazon reviews. I love Amazon and spend a ton of money and get packages every day. However, this purchase was a BIG disappointment. I found this thing to either really do a terrible job or my face is different then everyone else's. My shave wasn't nearly as close after 3+ weeks of use and I spent much more time trying (but never succeeding) in getting a close neck shave. I cleaned daily and still ended up with pimples. Best of all, when they mean there are shipping restrictions for this product, it really means you can't send it back to Amazon. IF you are going to try this product, try it from a local retailer that will let you return the product when you don't like it. Maybe my wife can use it on her legs because I went back to my mach4 razor.
  543. I replaced an old Braun 7505 with the 9595 and waited two weeks to comment, so here goes. I have never had it so good with a shaver. This is the closest electric shave I've ever had but I'll have to admit, if you want to go to the trouble to lather up and use a regular razor, you'll get a closer shave still. One thing I don't understand is why my 5 o'clock shadow is not as noticeable as it was with all other shavers I've used. It doesn't really get rough until the next morning. I feel guilty as I watch it go through the cycle of cleaning itself. I only clean mine every other shave and that should extend the life of the fluid. I shied away from buying one initially due to the price but I finally rationalized it was only the equivilent of 4 tanks of gasoline. Didn't get a brush as mentioned by other reviewers.   554. Normally electric shavers leave my face looking like I fell off a motorcycle onto pavement face first. Plus, they always leave hairs, full hairs not even cut, in random places. My hairs are quite tough, and I go through razor blades extremely fast, so I don't blame the electric razors, they simply wouldn't work for me.<br /><br />So, I took quite a chance in getting this electric razor. I wanted to try the new sound pulse system, and the self cleaning really appealed to me as a way to keep the razor fresh and ready to go each day.<br /><br />Well, I got the razor and hooked everything up and let it charge. The next morning I shaved against the grain before I showered (both are recommended by Braun for this razor). It seemed to do pretty well. It missed a couple of random hairs no matter how many times I went over them, but not as many as other razors. I also know that you have to \\"train\\" your face to use an electric razor so I was okay with that. The problem with other razors was that I could never use them long enough to get to that point, the irritation and damage they did as they pulled the hairs out of my face were too much to handle.<br />Well, I was very happy with this Braun 9595cc, it didn't pull out hairs, it cut them very close (on the upper part of my face closer than my quad blade razors did), and it did not irritate as much as previous razors. On the lower part of my face (under the jawline and down the neck) it doesn't cut quite as close. I assume this is do to the fact that it's not as flat and regular there, as well as the fact that the hairs grow multiple directions there.<br /><br />Now I have used it for almost a month. I am very happy with the ease of use, and the self cleaning system. On the upper part of my face it still does very well and cuts very close. On the lower part it is getting more and more on the first pass. Also, it is leaving less and less completely missed hairs, and sometimes even gets them eventually with multiple passes. I really feel that eventually I will not have to take out my blade at all to catch these misses.<br /><br />Overall I am very pleased with this razor. I don't give it 5 stars due to the fact that I still have to use my blade on my neck on occasion. I can say that I haven't found an electric razor that does better than this one yet.eventually I will not have to take out my blade at all to catch these misses. Overall I am very pleased with this razor. I don't give it 5 stars due to the fact that I still have to use my blade on my neck on occasion. I can say that I haven't found an electric razor that does better than this one yet.
  555. I bought this razor for my husband and he absolutely loves it! He's in the military so a cleanly shaved face is a must.   557. Still not sure what the difference is between the Series 7 and the 9000 series (maybe US/European?), but the shavers look identical. I've used the 9595 for about a year and it is definitely the best electric shaver I've used, and I've used a lot (Panasonic, Norelco, Remington). The one con I would submit is that (on the 9595) the silver paint on the plastic back above the rubber handle just below the head seems to dissolve over time in the cleaning solution (less than a year of daily use). Really inexcusable by Braun on a shaver this price, but I didn't subtract from the score because functionally it does everything advertised; they just need to get engineering to add a metal strip to this vulnerable area and nix the cheap plastic.<br /><br />Addendum to above after a year of use:<br /><br />Good:<br /><br />- Quick shave, new \\"Pulsonic\\" action of head does provide a quicker, cleaner shave.<br />- Cleaning unit probably the best of a not very good lot to clean and sanitize shaver<br />- Good ergonomics and easy to use<br /><br />Worse:<br /><br />- Very cheaply made, as others have observed; I would guess more than 80% plastic<br />- Some features very poorly engineered; case in point, the head \\"Lock\\" button is held on by I would guess a plastic cylinder less than 1 mm thick, and mine recently fell off, as other have reported. This design could not possibly last much longer than the warranty period without breaking, and it appears to be built with that thought in mind.<br />- Speaking of warranty, other customers are right - Braun customer service is non-existant; you will be referred to your nearest \\"customer service center\\" to negotiate a repair or replacement on your own. I live in a major metropolitan area, and mine is located in a small town more than an hour away, and appears to be a Mom & Pop operation not much interested in repairing Braun's mistakes.<br /><br />I would change my rating to no higher than a 3 based on my extended experience, but I am unable to modify the original rating*.   558. I normally wear a beard, but periodically I need to shave either for a job or for personal preference. I am a blade man, using a Gillette Mach 3 and keeping an old Norelco Triple Header for quick back-up.<br /><br />I get tired of lathering-up every day that I shave, but have always been dissatisfied with electrics when I use them. I invariably get really bad razor burn and a poor, uneven shave. I've experienced this even with brand new rotary type razors.<br /><br />All of this ended with my purchase of this razor. Although the instructions say that it takes 3 weeks to get used to the razor, I had the best electric shave of my life with my first shave. I have used this razor several times now, and it is great! I get a shave so close to the blade that I really can't tell any difference; indeed for some parts of my face it is even closer than a blade. Razor burn is absolutely ZERO, I can apply aftershave with no burn at all. This is very important to me, as I perspire a lot and don't want to be irritated all day. I couldn't be more impressed or pleased with the shave I get from this shaver.<br /><br />My only gripe is that I wish the cleaning system was refillable, rather than having to buy and discard a bunch of plastic gizmos. Not very environmentally friendly. I intend to clean the shaver manually and only use the cleaning system every 3rd shave to prolong the life of the cartrages. Its nice that you get instructions for 2 manual cleaning methods - hot water and brush.<br /><br />You know, sometimes you get what you pay for. I would never have expected to pay $200+ for an electric razor, but I have to say that I feel like I am getting a $200+ shave every morning. It is worth the money. But in time things fall apart.<br /><br />The construction is VERY flimsy. In the first week that I owned it, the lock that keeps the swivel head in place broke, permanently. Yes, it was under warranty and I could have exchanged it then, but I needed to travel, and it didn't seem \\"that\\" big of a deal. It's been annoying, but it doesn't affect the shave.<br /><br />Now, a year on, the trimmer, which is meant to pop up when needed, and then snap back into place when you are not using it, is in a permanent \\"up\\" position and will not close. This means that the blades are vibrating and eating up more battery juice, causing users to charge more often.<br /><br />I hate it when plastic is made to look like metal and doesn't perform in even the simplest manner! I think the entire device will likely begin to disintegrate in a few more months.<br /><br />Braun should take care with the construction and give it the same attention that they give to the actual cutting edges.<br /><br />Final analysis: shaves well, but destined to break apart, bit by bit. Not what one expects when paying this much money. I'm going back to Panasonic for my next purchase.

  566. Amazon.com should be ASHAMED. I'm sorry. I was a huge amazon.com fan until I needed to return this Braun Series 7 Top-of-the-line shaver \\"new and unopened\\" due to receiving an identical one as a gift. The invoice says \\"Returns are easy\\". When I bring up the purchase on the website it says \\"Click here for returns\\". BUT you CAN'T return it. No matter what. You trustingly click that purchase button and you're STUCK WITH IT! Certainly, used personal items can't be returned for obvious health reasons. But a new, unopened product this expensive with tamper proof packaging what has never been used that they won't even acknowledge is shameful and unacceptable. No warning on the invoice. No notice on your confirmation page before you purchase. Just a big fat expensive suprise! Anywhere else I checked said they'd gladly accept the return. Amazon won't. No reasoning, no explanation. Just sorry you're out of luck. Thow it out or give it away, but don't look at us. Unless you are brave or omniscient and know that you will never ever need to return it to amazon, buy it ANYWHERE ELSE BUT here at Amazon.com. Sorry Braun for the 1 star. I wish I could have given even less stars but it's not your fault. Your Braun Series 7 - 790cc Pulsonic Shaver is fantastic and deserves 3.5 - 4 stars (the is no razor that shaves as close as a blade so none are perfect and none deserve 5 stars--plus your alcohol based cleaning system that will run at least $75/year to use is overpriced and a rip off. Make it cheaper, especially after charging $290 for the razor. At least printer manufacturers realize they are ripping you off for the ink cartridges and practically give away their printers to rope you into spending money endlessly on their refills. The shaver works amazingly well compared to many others I've used, it's built well so far, and is easy to use. The cleaner does keep it clean and hygenic. It deserves 4 stars, minus 1/2 to 1 for the cleaner refill ripoff ($6-7/mosfor $0.50 worth of rubbing alcohol?, which evaporates even if you don't use it daily) with it's unsitely cleaning unit that has to sit on your countertop forever due to the evaporating rubbing alcohol. The shaver is terrific though. Buy one, enjoy it, just DON'T BUY IT FROM AMAZON no matter what you do because they WILL NOT have anything to do with returning it for ANY reason, whatsoever, no matter what! The web site actually (literally) tells you to throw it away if you try to return it and when you email amazon.com they tell you to give it to someone else as a gift (verbatim). So when you're about to drop $200-$300 dollars on this razor, spend it elsewhere where there is actual service and respect for you. Any other store will gladly accept it new and unopened (just as amazon promises but won't) if you decide you don't want it, don't need it, have two, etc. and refund you in full. Amazon WON'T. You are STUCK WITH IT no matter what happens. It's too expensive of an item to take the risk with amazon...unless you have friends who are used to $250 gifts or a deserving trash man. Caveat Emptor: BUYER BEWARE!!!!! Don't say I didn't warn you. Update 12/13/08: After a second email to Amazon.com I received a suprising email back that they were going to fully refund my money for the item and did apologize. I can't tell you how suprised I am or how appreciative but don't count on this in the future. Don't expect to be able to return the shaver, but thank you Amazon for making right. My faith is restored, but future buyers beware and be sure before purchasing. Thank you amazon.
  567. I have a Braun 5760 and after three bases going bad(defective lock), I decided to upgrade even though I was very satisfied with the 5760 shaver itsself. There is a tremendous difference between the two. The shaver is very quite. It is smoother, closer and very comfortable. The base, with its cleaning and automation on it including the shaver is very impressive and useful. My first thought was this is rather expensive, but after receiving and using it, it is well worth the money, Top of the line product and no lock to go bad!!
  568. [[ASIN:B000IWFU3W Braun 790CC Series 7 Men's Cordless Shaver]] I have been using electric shavers for close to 60 years, starting with the Schick, Remington and at least half a dozen Norelco shavers over the years, the last being the Spectra. My 4 shaves with the Braun Series 7 have been the closest I have ever gotten with an electric shaver and my face has never been as smooth since I started shaving. It is fast, easy to use and, at this point of my using it, would recommend it highly.
  569. I have tried numerous electic razor this new one by Braun is a work of art ,it's very quiet and works better than any razor I ever had.I recomend this product wholr heartly,you will be very happy.It's worth the price because it's state of the art and works fast,smooth and quiet.
  570. It shaves like any other razor, except, it doesn't give you a rash, which is a big plus for me. Doesn't do that great of a job on my neck or above the lip, have to go over it many times, but it does it without giving me a rash, and my face comes out smooth. I have been using it now for about 2 months without any problems. It cleans itself very good, and its a nice looking shaver. I just hope the longevity is good.

  574. I have had it for about 2 months and what a GREAT product...was kind of hesitant with the price, but it's well worth it.
  575. I had been using Norelco Razors for over 6 years, and was never fully satisfied with them. When I waited more than 2 days to shave, it was a painful experience caused by pulling hairs. My neck would never be clean, even after trying to spend more than five minutes on it. Also, by the end of the work week, the shave would barely be passable as clean. I decided to get the Braun 790cc for Christmas. My morning experience is completely different! The shaver comes out of the cleaning system (which is less intrusive than I imagined) smelling great. The shave itself takes under a minute, with all hairs easily being removed. There is no irritation, whether at the start or end of the week. And in addition, the shave is always cleaner than with the Norelco! It's an expensive product, but I am completely satisfied.
  576. I got my unit to replace a Norelco shaver. Due to my job I have to shave 5 or even 6 times a week so few years back I had to get an electric shaver because the blade just messes up my face after two consecutive shaves. Back then it was a choice between the Norelco and Braun and I went with Norelco which now I know was a mistake. This is not even the same league. This by far the cleanest shave I have ever had. Still not as clean as a blade but nothing compares to the blade especially if you shave against the direction of hair. But how many of us can do that two days in a row? I can't my face blows up! The charging unit in my opinion is a gimmick but it is cool. It is there to provide additional income for Braun. You can just put the head under flowing water and wash it like that and then use the unit once in a while or never if you want to. Btw the charging unit broke for me as well hence the 4 stars. However Amazon got me a new one and it is on its way. I also could not return my existing unit but I will definitely not complain about that. There is also a 10% off coupon somewhere on the net for this shaver. I definitely recommend this product especially if you can't handle the blade.
  577. Honestly, I was a bit skeptic about buying yet another electric razor... but was happily surprised by the outcome! Yes indeed, I was almost extatic that this razor was not only as good as rated by others, but exceeded my expectations by a strong degree! I've been shaving with the top of line models by Panasonic, Norelco, among others and this is by far the closest any have come on my face. Indeed the Braun \\"Series 7-7900cc Pulsonic\\" was indeed \\"almost\\" as close to a razor cut as I could have expected. Indeed, if it wasn't a true electric, I would have thought it was a hard physical razor, as it shaves \\"almost\\" as close. I stated \\"almost\\", because while it's shave was as good as I have found in an electric, my blade often does get a bit closer, but only a \\"bit\\" and only if I give the shaving effort extra care. Simply put, if you're looking for an electric, this is the one to buy depending on your beard type and growth!!! It's shave is simply beautiful and gets almost as close as the most recetnly released five blade hard razor (such as the \\"Gillette Mach 3 Turbo\\") if you take your time with it. Now the bladed razor is still a \\"fraction of a bit\\" better, but for the extra effort and money spent, I would strongly suggest you try this out before deciding. As for keeping it clean, I suggest you take the cleaning fluid out of the base and only put it in weekly for an occasional cleaning and fresh renewal, please re-seal it up with the original removed cleaning fluid cover. other than that, it's good to go from there... The reason I gave it only a four out of five star rating is that while it's close to a perfect shave, it's not quite perfect and as a rule I'm a bit tough of a judge anyway. You decide for yourself, as you might just consider it a five star product for yourself! I almost did... but there's always room for improvement. Cheers mate! P.S. As for the after-shave comfort with this razor, it's without any equal on the market, \\"at least to my current knowledge and experience\\"! Even after shaving and then showering right after, my skin doesn't hurt one bit and that's a true blessing indeed! Also, while I do expect it to lose \\"some\\" of its quality in shaving over time and with ongoing repeated use, I suspect that I will enjoy this razor for quite some time to come and look forward to it! I think that depending on your face and beard type, that you will as well...

Was debating holding out for the 790cc2 with 3 speeds like canada has (see braun website). that one has a slightly different foil too that i understand will work on this one. No clue when that will be out here though and went with this instead. Very happy with it. Blows my Norelco Speed XL out of the water.

  590. For many years I have used a blade to shave and as a result, I didn't shave every day. Many times I would only shave once a week, for church, since it was so hard on my face. Nearing my 50th birthday, however, I woke up one morning and decided I wanted to shave daily and always be clean shaven. Yikes... My face stayed raw and red. I decided I needed to do something different. My wife convinced me to try an electric. I wanted the Braun but balked at the price... as usual, she won the argument. And I'm glad she did! The 7-790cc is an amazing product. After a short, easy break-in period, my face is now used to me shaving every day without any redness or other problems. The closeness rivals a blade, something I didn't expect. I love the cleaning system as it keeps the shaver fresh and clean after each use. I can't recommend this product enough. I'm a very satisfied customer!
  591. This is my second Braun shaver. It works like it should and shaves about the same as my older one.
