  593. There are over 800 reviews at the time of writing -I'll attempt succinctness. Background: This is my first Braun. I've owned several electric shavers (a couple Norelcos, a few Remingtons). I have a thick beard (Gillette Fusion razor heads last ~3 shaves on my face). Results: Against Norelco and Remington, the 790cc provides a quieter shave than any foil I've heard, but louder than any rotary I've heard -as can be expected. It brings a more smooth (cleaner and less irritation) and fast shave (even on my 2-day growth, out-of-box test). To see it in action, search \\"Braun Pulsonic Review\\" on youtube there are at least 2 reviews with close-up demonstrations of the actual shave (though one is Russian). My results, however, were better than both of these. Considerations: The unit doesn't include a protective foil cover, consumers are expected to either store the unit the stand or the plastic coffin it comes with. For those, like me, who are hesitant toward the price: It is an excellent shave that will pay for itself in ~1 year, compared to manual shaving. (1 pack of razors every month ~$264 annual & 1 Braun cleaning contridge every month ~$50-$60 annual) -it was worth it to me.
  594. 10 months into owning this shaver it stopped being able to charge or clean in the stand. This because the shaver would move around during the cleaning process, tricking the stand into thinking it wasn't in the stand at all. I called Braun and was told that I had to ship the unit, at my expense, a few hundred miles to the nearest service center. I also had to call the service center myself to set this up. They would provide no time frame for resolution of the problem. They wouldn't guarantee that it was covered by the warranty, so once the service center got it, I could face charges for getting it fixed. And in the meantime I had to buy another shaver. Check around. This is a common problem with this shaver. For this much money, Braun should treat its customers better. I won't be buying from them again, and I suggest you not either.

  602. I bought the first \\"self-cleaning\\" Braun shaver when it hit the market back in 2000. It was the Braun Syncro 7570. I loved that shaver - easily the best I'd ever used in my life. It lasted almost 10 years before the trimmer finally got jammed and I had to replace it. I had all those spare, blue \\"Clean & Renew\\" cartridges lying around, so of course I was going to buy another Braun. I've been using the Series 7 - 790cc model for about a month now. It's not bad. It does give a very close shave. I can see four big downgrades from the Syncro model though: 1) This new Braun hurts my neck hair when I first start shaving - it feels like it's yanking my hair like an Epilady womens' razor or something. 2) The battery life meter on the old Syncro 7570 told me exactly how many minutes of battery life I had remaining so I could manage my last shave accordingly (move faster or slower to finish the shave just as the battery was dying). This new model just shows 6 battery-life boxes. If you're on the last box, that could mean anywhere from 1-10 minutes remaning. I dunno. 3) The little pop out trimmer on this Braun sticks out at an odd 90-degree angle. The old Syncro trimmer stuck out stright-up, parallel with the shaver. I have a hard time trimming my own neck hair in the back with this new design because it's much harder to see over the bulky head of the shaver. 4) Every time I want to clean the 790cc using the base and the cleaning solution, I have to charge the shaver at the same time. I don't like charging batteries until they are completely dead. The old Syncro gave me the option to clean and/or charge. This new model just gives you different cleaning settings, but as far as I can tell, they all charge the unit at the same time. Big design flaw, in my opinion. So, in conclusion, the Braun shavers are still the best. I think this newest model gives the closest shave yet. But given the 4 issues I listed above, I have to give this shaver 4 outof 5 stars. The old Braun Syncro model was still the king. That one gets 5-of-5 stars from me.
  603. I've had the Braun 790cc for over a year now. The shaver is OK, it does not shave ANY better than the cheapest Braun on the market, or a Philips for that matter. Absolutely no reason to buy. Way too expensive - the shaver as well as the replacement foil.
  604. I can understand the glowing reviews of the Braun Pulsonic shaver because I had the same feelings when it was new. It shaves close, and provides a comfortable shave. I also like the cleaning and charging system (that I've had with previous Braun models). But the problem is, like the previous Braun products I've owned, it just doesn't hold up to daily use. After 4 months of use the trimmer had to be held down by tape, because it would not fully retract. At least it was operational during this period. Then after about a year, part of the trimmer mechanism fell out, and it ceased to function altogether. In addition, the head-lock function no longer works... Also, the quality of shave has decreased with time, and although changing the head was an improvement, it is still not as smooth as when it waas new. I'm still using it, but now I have to use a different device for trimming my sideburns, which is disappointing for an electric razor that cost over $300 with tax.
  605. After a few weeks your hair will adjust making this the most comfortable shave ever. Plus it only takes 5 minutes compaired to 10 to 15 and the mess in the sink and razor burn. No more razor bumps or cuts. Self cleaning works great too.
  606. I have been on a very long quest to find an electric razor that I can use with satisfaction. This is the first electric razor that did not irritate my neck. The shaver is not as close as a blade, but perfectly acceptable. The convenience and cool gadgetry of this razor has made me very happy!
  607. Let me preface this review by stating that I am a loyal Braun fan and customer and have been for nearly twenty years. This electric razor is my fourth Braun in two decades of shaving with nothing else. This shaver was a \\"To:Me, From:Me\\" gift meant to replace my old Braun, the former TOL Activator Series. The old shaver still did a good job, but after five years , the battery life was markedly less than previous years and the clean & renew base charger unit needed to be replaced due to a broken latch (common repair complaint). Instead of getting the shaver re-fitted with a new battery and replacing the broken base charger, I figured I'd put that money towards the new \\"upgraded\\" TOL Pulsonic Model 790 instead. The Amazon \\"rebate\\", as well as double-triple points on the new Amazon/Chase Visa made the choice a no-brainer, or so I thought. I must say that, along with fairly constant price hikes, the quality of the shavers has declined drastically. My first two Braun's were high-line models and were priced around the $70 and $100 ranges, respectively. They were both clad in mostly stainless steel with only some plastic. My Activator model was mostly plastic with some stainless. The new Pulsonic has ZERO stainless: it is ALL plastic. For a nearly $300(!) MSRP shaver, this is inexcusable. In addition, the new clean & renew charger base may have been simplified over the years in comparison with that of the Activator series bases, with the removal of the tower/latch design that was so problematic, but the aesthetics are lousy. The old \\"metalflake\\" black/dark grey thick plastic of the old base has been replaced by the cheapest el crappo dingy grey paper-thin plastic...it always looks dusty-dirty! It really looks and feels cheap and the color of it matches nothing on the shaver (or nothing else in my bathroom for that matter, LOL!). The shaver case quality has nosedived as well. My first two Brauns had padded hard zipppered nicely-lined cases covered in leatherette (\\"pleather\\") with a built in shaving mirror, cleaning supplies and clear hard plastic foil cover. The Activator, at nearly double the MSRP got by with a pleather soft pouch, cheapo cleaning brush and foil cover. The new Pulsonic clear hard-plastic clamshell cover (with no room for anything else excepting a cheap cleaning brush) that looks like something the repair dept. puts on a shaver that came in with no case or on a refurbished unit. INEXCUSABLE for $300! Have you ck'ed the price for the new foil/cutter head replacement? It's nearly DOUBLE that of the prior TOL series's! Since they need replacement often (depending on beard toughness, shave frequency and whether or not the foil tears), add that to your operating bill along with the clean & renew cartridge refills. It's slightly quieter than the older models duing shaving despite the new vibratory motion, but noiser during cleaning. The LCD Hygiene and Battery monitors (Model 790) are nice, as is the chrome foil/cutterblock combo plating, but the rest of the shaver is plastic and looks cheap. If you were expecting a \\"statement\\" shaver to set off your expensive stately Master Bath, this ain't it (unless the statement you wanted to make is \\"Hey look, I spent a fortune on an overpriced plastic POS! LOL!). Frankly, I don't see an appreciable difference in shave closeness compared to my last Braun with both the original Activator foil/cutterblock or the \\"updated\\" 360 foil/cutterblock combo that I \\"upgraded\\" from. The shave is slightly more comfortable as the new foil design presents slightly less friction on your beard, but that's it. Additionally, the new trimmer is awkward to use (it now sticks-out perpendicularly from the mid point of the shaver front instead of inline with the cutter head as with all previous Braun models. It is cheaply made with longevity not, apparently, a major design goal. Finally, I don't know when Gillette bought Braun, but it's apparent to me that the resultant product of their parentage is to make the most expensive and best shavers on the market just the most expensive. Quality is out, while pricing is up. Do what you wish...it's your money...but, having been there/done that/paid for it, I'd seek-out a cheaper Braun Model and save the exorbitant cost of this very gimmicky shaver. This is truly a case of \\"Style Over Substance\\". I'm sure this review won't be appreciated (my negative comments usually aren't), but I calls 'em as I sees 'em! For my money, I want to know if a product is less-than what it is portrayed as in an advertisement. Hopefully, you do too. Addendum: If you like your razor sanitary, you will be disappointed. With past self-cleaning Braun's i.e., those with a separate foil and cutterblock, the clean and charge cartridge did a decent job of cleaning and lubing the cutting system. With the Pulsonic models, the combo one-piece foil/cutterblock allows detritus to be trapped within itself. Understand that I daily dissassemble and tap-out the excess whiskers and rinse the cutter under the sink BEFORE I use the clean and charge base auto clean. Despite this, the cutter (with it's myriad of nooks and crannies) remains filthy...a poor design! Update (7/22/09): FYI, the \\"Clean & Charge\\" base station disemboweled itself this morning. While I use the auto clean function every day, I noticed my shaver was damp and didn't smell of the cleaning fluid like it normally does. I shaved, then put the shaver in the base and pressed the \\"clean\\" button. After less than a minute, a big puddle appeared under the unit. I picked it up and found it was the fluid from the cleaning cartridge. I cleaned everything up and tried again...this time it emptied the cartridge (it was replaced this past week, so it was fresh)! I also noticed that the LED that signals \\"empty\\" doesn't work either. Braun's answer: \\"We're really sorry sir, take the unit and drive or ship it to the nearest service center (30-60mi away) for REPAIR\\"...notice I didn't say that they were sending me a NEW (or re-man unit, for that matter) REPLACMENT! \\"You can use the power cord to charge the (dirty and getting dirtier) shaver in the meanwhile, Sir\\"! WOW! Great customer service on a $300 shaver! I'll update the sorry saga as it unfolds. On another note, the \\"rebate\\" that Amazon promised would be issued never came. I have to call them and get aggravated some more. I AM TRULY SORRY THAT I EVER PURCHASED THIS THING. Buyer BEWARE!
  608. This is not meant to be an elaborate review, but here are my thoughts on the shaver:<br /><br />The Cleaning station:<br /><br />The Good: Very useful and gets everything cleaned up for the most part. One still needs to use the brush to take care of the small hair, but that's easy to do.<br />The Bad: Can get a little bit expensive with time.<br /><br />The Trimmer:<br /><br />Only Good: The trimmer on this shaver is extremely powerful. I used it fairly often to shape my beard and it did an amazing job. It made it seem as if I actually shaved my neck and the areas I cleaned up! Still impresses me every single time I use it.<br /><br />The shaver:<br /><br />The Good: Very Strong and really good for sensitive skin. I have tried every shaver possible and razors prior to using this shaver, and I have an awful response to anything that shaves my neck. This was the only thing that prevented me of getting the burns and going through the regular pains I used to go through whenever I tried to shave in the past. The only thing about this though is that I had to shave every day or every other day to not get the irritation. I had to shave more often to get rid of the irritation.<br /><br />The Bad: I sometimes don't get the close shave I would like to get. I get a good shave, but again nothing like a razor. This might change later on with time.<br /><br />I've had this shaver for 4 years and it has been in very good shape, so although it might be expensive. It is definitely worth the money if you struggle to shave on a daily basis --this is for the sensitive skin guys.<br /><br />Notes:<br />1. Give the shaver around a month for your skin to get used to it.<br />2.Change the head every year or year and a half depending on how many times you use it.<br />3. Close the lead for the cleaning liquid thingy after you use it so the alcohol doesn't evaporate. That will save you a lot of money!
  609. Excellent shaver. Best I have ever used! I'll never buy another brand.
  610. I used this for about two years. It was fine for a while, and then the charger went on the fritz. While I was waiting for a replacement, I went back to using old-school blades and cream and haven't looked back. I hadn't used a non-electric razor since 1997, but things have really changed. The Gillette Fushion Proglide is excellent, permitting a much closer shave (than this Braun or any electric razor) and not nicking your skin as the old razors did.

  612. The best razor I have ever had. A little loud especially on cleaning cycles but overall the best. Regular cleaning and lubrication is a great idea and feature.
  613. I have used this shaver for six months now, and it works great! Shaves very closely especially under the nose, where most 3-circle rotary shavers cannot even touch (i.e Norelco)! My only complaint is that the cleaning fluid (contained in the charger/cleaner base) can be tasted on your lips after shaving.   615. Good shaver. Made in Germany. Very close shaving, but lock broke down very first day.It does not affect shaving, but it is bad, not reliable design. I read some reviews before about broken locks, but could never imagine it would happen to me and it did as I said at very first day. After I found that actually plastic pin broke on that lock I did very stupid thing trying to fix it. I glued this pin by \\"Crazy glue\\" to lock and it was ok. But after first cleaning, I guess, glue melted ( because of heat and alcohol in cleaning liquid) and now lock slider sticks forever to shaving head. I will say again, it does not affect shaving and it still perfect, just be careful with lock.
  616. I have never used a foil type head before. It does a very good job but takes a bit longer than the rotary head shavers I have had for the past 35 years. It takes some time to get used to this unit. I have no disappointments other than the price. Operationally, the unit is excellent. I don't like the cleaning feature because it is not needed. Having it doesn't affect performance, it is just a wonderment that is not necessary. Overall, I rate this unit as very good. I didn't give it 5 stars due to price and the unnecessary cleaning feature. Otherwise the unit is excellent.
  617. I have used Norelco rotaries for 10 years (850RX and 975RX) and they did a decent job. Then I switched to the manual blade razors (Gillette mach 3 and the Fusion) for the past 12 years mainly for the close shave. My manual shave took me 20-25 minutes for a full clean shave. Stage one: with the grain,stage 2: against the grain, stage 3: touchups at different angles to make sure that the skin is silky smooth. This is the perfect shave and for a scale of reference be considered a 10. Because of how long this took,I wanted something a lot quicker. SO I read all the so called positive reviews on the Braun 790cc and its high ratings and tried it for 3 weeks. First off, you cannot compare it to a manual blade. I do not think any electric can compare. For the $200 plus I spent on this product, I thought it would do a lot better. Folks it does a very average job of shaving. Yes, its cleaning system works perfectly but that's not what I look for in a electric shaver...I buy it for its shaving performance, not its cleaning abilities. I had to spend over 15 minutes going over the same areas, ESPECIALLY the neck/chin areas several times and it still did not clean it up and left stubble. Then I pressed into my skin and basically having to apply pressure and repeat so many times, caused much greater skin irritation and bumps than a manual blade. My wife asked me what I did to my face and neck...it was red and bumpy. And YES, it did draw blood frequently with cuts. My hand would be tired with all the physical exertion. A blade could have given me a perfect shave in just a few strokes. sure a blade will have a few nicks and minor cuts, but that goes away after a quick shower. I decided to try my 20 YEAR OLD NORELCO 850RX that was sitting in my drawer with its old original blades. I shaved half of my face with the Norelco and the other half with the Braun. The Norelco was FASTER and the results were identical!! The old norelco actually shavedsome areas closer than the Braun. This to me is not worth the $250 you might pay for the Braun. Conclusion: Over half the cost of the Braun is for the cleaning system. then the other 20% is for all the marketing hype. You are left with a razor that's really only worth $35!! You may as well get a $10 no-name rotary and it will give you the same performance. I am stunned at the hundreds of \\" 5 star reviews\\". Just do a google on\\"Amazon fake Reviews\\". Especially when a lot of these reviewers list \\"the motor is too loud\\" as the con for this product, it makes me wonder how real this is. You have to list some 'con' for the product, why not just list something as harmless as 'too loud'...please!!! Braun has big bucks. it does not cost them too much to hire employees or writers to post favorable reviews on this product. Also, do a search on reviews on any competing shaver and you will see all of them with reviews that are mostly 5 star heavy. How can all of these shaver reviews state \\"the best shaver I've ever had'??? unbelievable. I'm not giving up on electrics yet. I just picked up a Panasonic Arc IV Nano. I'll let you know how that compares in a few weeks. I did return my over priced Braun though.
  618. Outstanding item! Best shaver that I have EVER owned! I can't say enough good things about this machine! --Steve Gilbert Denver
  619. I've tried different razors and this one really works well. I was a little worried about spending the money and it not working good. I did read the reviews and I guess it just depends on your face. Like everything else out there one thing works better for some than for others. I would recommend at least trying it, if it doesn't work for you then send it back.
  620. Pros:<br /><br />Faster shaving time.<br />Closer shave than previous razors. (The only closer shave I have had is from a straight edge)<br />Less passes and subsequently less irritation.<br />Trimmer is easy to keep clean.<br />Excellent battery so far. (only have been using it a few months.)<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />Harder to clean trimmer head than previous models.<br /><br />I purchased this razor after the cleaning station of my last one died. I'm now using my old Braun foil razor for travel and just washing it with water. I obviously liked my last one enough to get the newer model. I have a few extremely coarse whiskers from time to time and this razor can handle them. I have used several electric razors in the past (foil and rotary) and would get frustrated after a dozen passes and end up pulling thick hairs with a tweezer. This one will cut them! One thing about this model that I don't know how I feel about is the cutting blades come off when you remove the head. It was easier to dump out clippings with the older models. I thought the Pulsonic technology was gimmicky when I was reading up on the latest models but there must be something to it as this does a quicker cleaner job. I like the pop out trimmer on this model better than the older models as it is easier to clean. People complain about having to replace the cartridges but what I do is wash them out once they have been used and fill them half way with 80% isopropyl alcohol then the other half with water. This way you can get a few months out of it. It may not be factory recommended but it seems to work fine. Over all, I am very happy with this razor and have recommended to several people.
  621. This is the third electric shaver I have had. My very first shaver was a cheap Braun foil shaver, and it served me well for years, and would not give up. But then I \\"upgraded\\" to the Norelco three oscillating blade type - that was an expensive piece of junk. About a year ago, I bought this Braun 7-790cc.<br /><br />The shaver works great and gives me a really close shave just like Braun is known for. The foil flexes well to really adapt to your skin - really much better than those oscillating heads on competing models. The shaver is light and well proportioned to easily control, and the grip edges are good if you happen to be shaving with slightly wet hands. The trimmer works well and is convenient to engage (albeit a bit too easy).<br /><br />The shaver display, controls, and cleaning system are great displaying both the battery life as well as the hygiene of the shaver. About once a week, I stick the shaver into its box and push the big button. It does it's own thing, and within about an hour it is all clean, charged up and ready to go. The kit comes with a holder for the shaver to take it on trips, and I have gone two weeks on a single charge.<br /><br />The only issue I have had is that sometimes, when I re-handle the shaver, sometimes I inadvertently switch on the trimmer, but this is a minor thing and has no bearing on the performance of the shaver. This is an excellent shaver, and even though I never thought I would spend over $200 for a shaver, this one was a good investment. I am sure it will serve me well for years to come.
  622. My husband loves this shaver. He's had it for 2.5 year when the base suddenly would't charge the shaver anymore. I removed the cleaning solution and tried cleaning the base thinking that maybe dirt or something had gotten stuck inside. No such luck. The base unit lights up but won't charge. Finally unplugged it from the base and plugged it directly into the shaver so he could use it.<br /><br />The base is expensive to replace. Like at least $70. Search ebay and other sites for a replacement base and found a place in Virginia Beach, VA called Commonwealth Electric Shavers. Purchased it online for $57 including tax and shipping. For a shaver that almost $300 it should definitely last longer.

  625. Did a lot of research on this shaver and it seemed great. At first it was everything they promised. Great shaver with a good cleaning system. Mind you, I purchased this model specifically for the cleaning functionality. Fast forward 1 year later and everything turned bad. First, the cleaner. It would never go through an entire cleaning cycle, instead it would start cleaning by pumping the fluid into the chamber. Then after 5 minutes of activity it would stop making any noisy even though the LED clearly said cleaning. This process used to take longer than that. Worst of all when it was done cleaning there was still fluid and hair in the chamber.... gross. I sent it in 3 times under warranty (paying shipping one way each time) and it was never fully fixed. Then the shaver wasn't cutting as well as it used to; it pulled out more hairs than it cut which was really painful. I went ahead and purchased a new cassette thinking the blades were dull, but it still didn't work well. If you read some of the reviews on the cassettes you can see plenty of users complaining of the shaver pulling hairs. Finally I tried contacting Braun customer service for help/replacement/anything, all they would say is to send it in. I'm sorry but for a $250+ shaver I expect much more than that. Now I've turned to the excellent Philips Norelco 1250 shaving system and it is great. No pulling hairs. Much better simpler cleaning system (it doesn't use a pump) which hopefully means more reliability. I chose Philips because I have been using their sonicare toothbrushes for years and I trust the brand. [[ASIN:B003V37Z9W Philips Norelco 1250xcc/42 SensoTouch 3d Electric Shaver with Jet Clean System, Black]]
  626. so i bought one of these from amazon, very early adopter. it is very similar in general to earlier clean and charge foil shavers from braun, of which my last one was unceramoniously dumped in the garbage after a year for a rotary from phillips, which was used for about another year and then dumped for the 4-blade gillette razor. but now i'm back to trying electric for no particular reason other than it is tiresome buying razor blade that have been specially engineered to need replacing after a week of use. plus, while no matter what the manufacturers will tell you, there is no electric razor that shaves as close as a blade, though sometimes the blade shaves a little too close...causing cuts, razor burn, ingrown hairs, etc. it's enough to make a guy want to grow a beard. enter the braun pulsonic. this is basically a very well-made, high end \\"activator\\" or \\"complete 360\\" with the added feature that it vibrates. i suppose this is the same technology in the gillette \\"power\\" series and other regular razors that use a AAA battery to vibrate as they shave...it does result in a ever-so-slightly better shave. so this foil, which uses the nice almost-random pattern of differently-sized holes for diffent hairs (which was avail. only in germany for a long time, for some reason, then appeared in the u.s. with the braun 360) has a nice pivoting head, standard little pop-out trimmer, and vibrates like a sonicare toothbrush while you shave. the vibration is not really noticable over the regular noise and vibration present in a regular electric razor, but the results seem to speak for themselves. it seems to be a much gentler, more effective electric razor than i have used in a long time. the only thing is, it isn't a blade. after spending several passes with it over my cheek, for example, i can still run my hand against the growth and feel a little stubble there, which is never the case with the razor blade. on the other hand, i expect that over time there will be less shaving irritation, so it's not a bad trade off. the thing to note is that it's really made to be used with the little \\"charge and clean\\" cartridges, which according to braun last for 30 shaves, so each one lasts a month. at $4 per cartridge, it's not too great an expense. word of warning though: if you take the razor out of the charger before it's finished the cleaning cycle (easy to do since much of it is silent, if you don't wait for the 'clean' light to come on) and sometimes even if you wait for it to be clean, and just start shaving, you may experience the unique and painful feeling of shaving with a small amount of rubbing alcohol on the razor foil. i recommend making sure it's quite dry before use, shake it a little or blow on th foil or something. the clean and charge flud is a lemon-scented alcohol and lubricant solution that you don't want touching newly-shaven skin. overall, it seems to be a good investment. the razor is well-made for sure, very solid, with a rubber grip handle on the back that is pretty comfortable to hold. it moves very easily over the face, even with 3-day stubble, and is noticably more comfortable than other electrics i've used. i think it will take about 2 weeks for the skin/hair to get used to it again, but...good-bye razor blades! hello pulsonic!
  627. I have been shaving with an electric razor for most of my adult life. Being 48 years old, that is a lot of shaving. I gave up the blade shortly after college as I grew tired of cutting myself. At the time I could not afford a Braun razor (nor do I even know if they existed) so I went with something my father had - a Norelco 3 head rotary shaver. This actually worked well with no irritation, but did not really get close enough and had trouble with areas around chin, etc. After about 10 years the razor up and died. Having gotten my money's worth I then decided to buy another similar Norelco. Was very happy with that one until about 2 months ago when it started to \\"die\\". It would stop shaving in the middle of a shave, but then come back on. I knew it would not be long until it died. This time out I did more research and raised my budget. Reading all the reviews (and consumer reports) I knew I would go with the Braun. I loved the idea that it cleans itself too. Having many models to choose from, I stumbled upon this one which seemed to be getting rave reviews. Placed my order, received it quickly, and had it in the charging base that night. The next morning I shaved and did notice a slight discomfort. It was a very close shave and perhaps this was why. I also know that it takes time for your face to \\"get used to\\" a new razor. I think the real thing is that my beard/face/throat was a mess because I was shaving with that old electric that would stop in the middle and go off and on. Over a few days it got better and better. I love the feel of this razor and the self cleaning feature. The only thing I do not fully understand is why the unit has never told me to clean it. I use it daily and it only takes a few minutes to shave - 5 minutes tops. When I put it back in the charger it still says it is clean. I guess I do not have that much of a beard and that is why. I just go ahead and use the quick clean button as the instructions say to clean daily. All in all, a great razor. A bit on the expensive side, but I figure it will last many years, so well worth the money.

  630. The Braun Pulsonic is the best shaving system I've ever used. It's not perfect, but it is far and away superior to the Philishaves and Panasonics that have proven lacking for me over my past ten years of electric shaving. Philishave always gave me a neck rash, and Panasonic didn't shave the neck cleanly at all, ever, wet or dry. Blade shaves have always left me with a neck rash, so I persisted with electric systems. Yes, the Braun is expensive, and as I said, it's not perfect, but with a bit of practice you can achieve a great shave which lasts a good 24 hours, for me. The most thorough shave is achieved 'wet', however I can understand why the manufacturer doesn't promote this. It would be easy to clog the blade heads with too much foam, so you need to apply this sparingly, ( I use soap-free), and keep rubbing water into your beard until you have more water than soap. If you can master this, you will agree this shaver is a major step forward to shaving nirvana. And I would like to leave a plug for Amazon. My order was processed with lightning efficiency, and arrived in Australia speedily, and in one piece. Thank you!
  631. [[ASIN:B000XTGOIA Braun 9595 Pulsonic Series Shaver]]<br />This is a by-far better electric razor than the one I had been using. I'm generally not too impressed by electric razors. They just don't do the job a blade razor does. However, I have to say that the Braun 9595 does shave as well as a blade. The self-cleaning feature is nice, too. I'd often let my previous razor go too long without cleaning but with the Braun you can see how dirty it is and decide to clean it based upon the sensors in the docking device. I'm sure that helps keep the shaves close and comfortable as well. Not cheap but for my money well worth it.

  634. I HOPE YOU WILL GET SOME GOOD SOLID INFO FROM MY REVIEW. FIRST, I WOULD LIKE TO SAY THAT I HAVE TRIED MANY ELECTRIC SHAVERS OVER THE PAST FEW WEEKS. I HATE SHAVING WITH A BLADE SO I WANTED TO FIND THE BEST SHAVER. I DO NOT WORK FOR PANASONIC NOR BRAUN. MY REVIEW IS HONEST AND I HAVE PUT ALOT OF TIME AND RESEARCH INTO THESE PRODUCTS, LOOKING FOR THE BEST SHAVER. I TESTED THE BRAUN PULSONIC 9595 SHAVER, AND ALSO THE PANASONIC VORTEX NANO ES 8109S FOR 30 DAYS. THE BRAUN I BOUGHT FOR 250 DOLLARS, THE PANASONIC VORTEX WAS ABOUT 130 DOLLARS. I ALSO USED THE PANASONIC 8077, WHICH IS DISCONTINUED AND ABOUT 40 DOLLARS ON THE INTERNET OR EBAY. I BOUGHT IT FROM SHARPER IMAGE FOR 99 DOLLARS MONTHS AGO. AGAIN, NOW WORTH ABOUT 40 BUCKS. THE BRAUN DOES TONS OF MARKETING, MAKING BELIEVE THE PULSONIC MUST BE THE BEST SHAVER ON THE MARKET. IT IS A GREAT SHAVER AND REALLY WORKED PRETTY WELL. BUT THERE IS NO CONTEST. THE PANASONIC MODELS SHAVED MUCH CLOSER AND FOR ABOUT HALF THE PRICE. THE BRAUN DID OK ON THE NECK AREA BUT THE PANASONIC WON THE CONTEST. THE BRUAN WANTS YOU TO CLEAN THE UNIT EVERY FEW SHAVES, THAT GETS EXPENSIVE WHILE YOU MUST USE ITS CLEANING CARTRIDGE/SYSTEM. THE PANASONIC GIVES YOU THE SAME CLEANING SYSTEM BUT ALSO ALLOWS YOU TO USE THE WATER FROM YOUR SINK. ITS A WET AND DRY UNIT. THE PANASONIC BY FAR IS THE BETTER SHAVER AND MUCH CHEAPER PRICE WISE. I GUESS BRAUN CHARGES ALOT BECAUSE OF THERE EXPENSIVE MARKETING CAMPAIGN. IF I COMPARED THE PANASONIC 8077 TO THE MORE EXPENSIVE 8109, I MUST ADMIT, THEY SHAVE THE SAME. THE 8109 HAS NEWER TECHNOLOGY, FANCIER BUTTONS AND A CLEANING SYSTEM, BUT JUST COMPARING THE ACUAL SHAVE, THEY PERFORM THE SAME. YOU PAY MORE FOR THE 8109 BECAUSE IT HAS MORE BELLS AND WHISTLES. I HOPE THIS REVIEW HELPS. IN CONCLUSION, DO NOT FALL PREY TO ALL THE MARKETING HYPE BY BRAUN OR PANASONIC. JUST BECAUSE THE RAZORS GET FANCIER AND HAVE MORE BELLS AND WHISTLES, DOES NO MEAN THEY SHAVE BETTER. AGAIN, I WOULD CERTAINLYGO FOR THE PANASONIC MODELS OVER THE BRAUN. BEST WISHES WITH YOUR NEW SHAVER. I AM VERY HAPPY, MY RESEARCH IS OVER, I AM STICKING WITH THE ES 8077E, AND 8109E. IT OUT PERFORMS THE 250 DOLLAR EXPENSIVE MODEL BY BRAUN CALLED THE PULSONIC. HOPE THIS HELPS.

Then recently i was at Costco and they had a great price on an 8000 series / 360. I was amazed at how much better it was. But i didn't know about the Pulsonic. Needing the latest and greatest, i bought the Pulsonic from Amazon. The first couple days i was not too impressed - i did not think it was any better than the 8000. But then i realized the next mornings that my face was much closer than it had ever been with the previous models (I used the 8000 for 2 weeks). However, i do not think that the Pulsonic does a better job on my neck than the 8000 did - maybe even a little worse. I think that the beard / sideburn trimmer on the Pulsonic is LOUSY compared to that of the 7/8000. I like the grip on the Pulsonic better than the 7/8000. I like the fact that there is a quick clean cycle. I hate the fact that the cartridges are more expensive (from $18 for the 7000 to $30 for the pulsonic). The pulsonic feels a little rougher during the shave than the 8000, but that is probably because of the pulsations. I use remington shave powder sticks. So i'll keep the Pulsonic. POSITIVE speak for themselves NEGATIVES are higher cost, more expensive cartridges, no hard plastic cover for the shave heads (only a large case for the whole thing), the machines desire to tell you to clean it every day. and most importantly (and the reason for losing a star) the LOUSY beard/sideburn trimmer. I'll keep it, and I hope it give me a good 5 years.

  644. I' ve shaved all my life using razor blades. I had a lot of irritations and cuts after a shave, not always but most of the time. Than I shave with my Pulsonic. 5 mins later I have a smooth and clean shaved face. Tap the cutting head on the sink to get rid of most of the hairs in it, stick it in the recharging/cleaning unit and hit a button.   650. I LOVE THIS RAZOR. It is about 30% - 50% faster than the Norelco 9160 XL. It also shaves closer and more consistently. The cleaning system is a little bulky, but it works very well and offers several different cleaning options, which is nice. And, the razor can be cleaned wet, if necessary. However, it is noisier and has a lot more vibration than the Norelco. Even though it has rubber grips, it does vibrate, but not enough to downgrade the razor. I have tried just about every type/brand/kind of electric razor over the past 25 years (I have never used a blade) and this is the best so far. The razor is expensive, and it's WORTH EVERY PENNY.
  651. My shaver arrived with a torn foil and a broken blade. Amazon refused to accept a return or send a replacement shaver head \\"because the shaver is shipped with a dangerous liquid\\" (one cartridge of cleaning fluid). This is the lamest and stupidest excuse I have ever heard for a company to refuse to replace a defective part. I could not get through the Amazon system to get any resolution. In fact, I could not even get a human being to respond . I ended up having to contact Braun directly. It took 7 calls and over 3 weeks to get a head replacement from them. In the process I lost the opportunity for the 30-day return trial period, let alone wasting hours of my valuable time, and one less month of warranty protection. Amazon's attitude and complete lack of customer support for a defective product is unconscionable. Amazon SUCKS and so do all their links for shavers. My advice to you is DO NOT BUY A SHAVER THROUGH AMAZON. Purchase it from someone else.
  652. I have a very heavy beard. I have to shave every other day. My best shaving results come from a soap (Van Der Hagen Hypo Allergenic Shave Soap), brush (Maison Person Super Badger) and the Schick Quattro razor. The Braun Pulsonic System 9595 is the next best thing. This is truly a fantastic shaver. Well designed and well built, it does the job better than any other electric shaver I've ever used. I upgraded from another Braun electric shaver (the 6550) which I enjoyed using (for almost 7 years) but was never totally satisfied with the shaving results. It was also well made and well constructed with great user friendly features. The shave (on the 6550) was good but never that close. Also, it required careful cleaning (after each use) and regular replacement of the cutter block and screen to obtain optimum results. The 9595 is another matter altogether! It's truly revolutionary. Not as close a blade but very, very good. It has excellent features (such as a compact travel case), a novel cleaning system (which you can select to use or not to use), a well written and easy to understand instruction manual and is not as loud as my previous Braun. Also, you can clean it under the tap. I'm very satisfied with my purchase especially because the price on Amazon was exceptional.
  653. I bought a Norelco last time and it lasted a year and gave out. I went back to a regular razor using the Gillette Mach III. My wife did some reseach online and purchased the Braun Pulsonic 9585. This has given me the best shave I've ever had which is far superior to the Mach III razor or Norelco. I have a very dark beard and this leaves me smooth as silk and I can go longer between shaves. I've had the Braun since Christmas 2007 and it's great. I can go a little over a month before I need a new cleaning cartridge. I'm glad my wife did the research and it's been the best shaver I've ever owned and I think of her everytime I use it. Thank you honey. :)
  654. It is the best. Even though it is very costly, it has given me the closest shave ever. It was a bit tough to get the hairs on the neck, but after some repetitions, it got all of it.
  655. So far the best shaver I've ever had. Less passes to get a close shave, no need to stretch my skin. A couple gotchas that could have been made clearer. The head is totally enclosed which means that you cannot clean the blades with the normal brush. You must use the auto-cleaner to clean the razor which means you are locked into buying the Braun cleaner refills. Luckily they are not very expensive and you can get them her for about $15 for a 3 pack. Also, instead of replacing the foil and/or blades separately you must replace the entire head assembly after about 18 months. Again, not expensive (about 35 bucks) but that can 'end of life' the shaver if Braun stops making the replacements. Either way, other than the above, once I shaved with it I forgot everything else. IMHO, the inconveniences of having the big table stand, the refills and the very sensitive 'hygienic' mode (faking you into cleaning it more often) are far out-weighed by the best shaver that Braun, or anyone else, has developed so far!
  656. This shaver only does a good job if I literally shave every day. If I skip a day or two (which I often do), then forget it... it will miss half of the hair it goes over with each pass meaning I have to make 10+ passes with my skin pulled taut on every part of my face making sure I try passing in different directions and with the razor held just right before there's even a chance that I'll have gotten everything. Even then I'll find some missed hairs that I have to go back with the beard trimmer or my manual razor and tackle. It ends up taking twice as long to shave with this than with my Mach 3, and again often times I just end up doing a touch up with the Mach 3 after spending way too long with the Pulsonic 9595. So really this razor only conveniences me in the least when I'm shaving daily which I don't really care to do since my beard comes in pretty light and slow and I can pass the light scruff look for a day or two between shaves. Oh, also the stupid cleaning fluid sensor has been telling me it's 'low' since about the second time I cleaned it, and has told me a few times now that it's empty despite the fact that when I remove the fluid canister, it's still over half full. It will not self-clean when it thinks it's empty so I have to tilt it forward to fool the sensor, then hit the button while it's fooled, and then put it back on the counter. What a waste of money this was!
  657. First, let me say that I am previous owner of an Braun 8000 series system and I decided to upgrade to the 9595 model. I've now had the 9595 for about three months. Is it the best electric shaver yet? Most likely. Can it still be improved? Yes. Let me explain. This shaver gives me the closest shave I've ever had with an electric shaver. I don't expect it to be a razor, but it could still use some improvement. It is definitely improved upon the 8000 series. I still have problems with the neck area and I have to go over the same area multiple times (this is where a rotary version helps, I know). The rest of the face gets a perfect shave. I have not gotten razor burn or any cuts while using this razor. The cleaning system has also been improved, but in typical Braun fashion in can be a bit loud. The noise level has improved over older models though. The same cleaning solution from the 8000 series works in this system as well. Now, for $200 I think they could have produced a better feel and finish. It feels a bit cheap in some areas and after paying that for a shaver I wasn't real happy. It has been holding up very well though, it's just that the 8000 series felt more sturdy. I also don't like the white finish on the base, it just seems cheap. The LCD is great. It is very responsive and informative. Overall, I would recommend this shaver. It does improve upon the 8000 series and other generations. I am pleased that I upgraded. If you are willing to spend this much on a shaver you won't be disappointed.
  658. Bought this razor as a gift for my husband, he loves it says it is the best he's ever used. Loves the automatic cleaning.
  659. This is one of the best purchases of the year. My brother bought one and convinced me to give it a try too. I was a little skeptical at first, I've grown up with the norelco system (three round blades) and always felt that the bar shaped shavers were somehow inferior. Boy was I wrong. With the norelco (even with new blades) I always had to shave with the grain first and THEN, with gritted teeth, go against the grain. I STILL got reasonably bad razor burn and always felt I must have sensitive skin. Now, with the braun, I go directly against the grain, right off the bat, and have had NO RAZOR BURN at all for the last couple of weeks. It's unbelievable, dramatic improvement. I would say the only downside is that you have to buy refills for the auto-cleaner. A three pack is $[...] on amazon.com which should last minimum three months so for this level of comfort, I would say $[...] a month is worth it.

  664. I have been using electric razors for about 20 years. I have always stuck with the Norelco razors up until this purchase. Prior to this I had the top of the line Norelco. There is no comparison. This razor blasts through anything even after not shaving for several days. It is easy to clean, also a step up from the Norelco. The shave is much closer and it requires fewer passes. The only negatives to this razor are the noise and the trimmer which is just plain bad. I keep my Norelco around still just for the trimmer. The one on this razor is essentially a useless afterthought. Fortunately, that is not why I bought it.
  665. THe handiest thing about this shaver is the self cleaning function. The shave is good, not quite as good as my old Norelco but still not bad. If you are used to a foil shaver, this thing is great. Don't forget to give it a couple weeks if you are new to foil shavers to let your skin adjust.
  666. For the last five years I used a Panasonic wet/dry shaver; it was excellent for all but the last year (got noisy and did not shave as well as it did, even with new blades), so I searched for a replacement. The Braun is a dry shaver but it's really very good. It's relatively quiet (even though it uses a vibration technology to raise whiskers), shaves close and is very comfortable to use. I was surprised that I don't need any pre-shave to get a good shave and although fast, I don't get any razor burn from shaving longer when I want a really close shave. The pop-up trimmer is the best I have ever used and the cleaning station (which I had doubts about) works very well. It's somewhat expensive but worth the cost. Whereas I don't know how well less expensive razors work, my Braun works well on my heavy beard and boney jawline.

  668. I have three other Braun shavers. The newest is 360 complete, and the other two are a couple years older. All are self-cleaning. I like to have my primary shaver at home (face and shaved head), and backup shavers in the office. In buying this new shaver, I knew I would be putting my oldest two shavers out to pasture, if this purchase worked out. This is by far the closest, most comfortable shave I have ever had. Braun has upgraded the whole system, with the Series 7. Everything is better...ergonomic feel of the shaver in the hand, charger station, and the shave itself. I know Braun is not cheap. But if you can afford it, buy it. The shave is really that good, compared with all previous Braun models. And when other shavers dream, they are Braun. Edit: I have (just now) read the reviews back through Aug-2008, and I was surprised to see the complaints. Most of the issues don't apply to me. The 9595 shaver and charger are indeed louder than my earlier models, but I don't care about that. Whenever I have bought a new model Braun shaver, I have always thought the shave was an significant improvement over the previous model. Even with a new foil/cutter block on the old model. That is true with the 9595. My three older Braun shavers still work without any trouble. They are just old technology, by my definition. And these rechargeable batteries don't last forever. I would be surprised, as some have opined, if Braun has taken a nosedive with the 9595, compared with their older models. But if I have trouble with this shaver, I will certainly report here. Edit1: I just noticed the price of this shaver has dropped to $200. So those of us who bought in the last week or two now realize we should have waited. I always assumed amazon would credit the difference, if a recent purchaser brought it to their attention. A CSR just told me, \\"that is not our policy, sir\\".

  673. I will add my praise to the chorus of (mostly) ecstatic users. This shaver is worth every one of the many pennies it costs. I am a long-term user of Noreleco Rotary electric razors, always buying the top of that line. Unfortunately, my new Norelco purchases have been coming every two years or so because something about the head mechanism always seems to break in a way which a new comb and cutter set would not fix. Some plastic part always breaks or cracks, usually allowing the cutter assemblies to fly out of the head. Once that happens, repair gets more expensive and time consuming and I usually just got a new one. Even more unfortunately with each new Norelco model the battery seems weaker and the head speed slower, meaning that for best shaves the shaver must be operated in plugged in mode. The last straw, however, was the relatively poor reviews the new Arcitec razor has been getting from users. I decided the time had come for something different. I did hesitate, however, having previously owned a Braun and having been underwhelmed with its heavy feel, high noise level, and huge amount of vibration. However, given the hundreds of very positive reviews here for this latest-and-greatest model, I decided to take the plunge. From the very first shave, I knew I would not be going back to the Norelcos. Yes, the Braun still vibrates my hand and face more than the Norelco and is somewhat noisier. However, the vibration now feels more like a massage and the noise was not so loud that I didn't accommodate to it within a couple of shaves. But the speed of the shave, the closeness of the shave, and the lack of skin irritation during and after the shave was what immediately won me over. These are all quite superior to anything any top-of-the-line Norelco ever gave me, and they were the best electric shavers I'd ever used before. With this Braun, I can rub may face any way I like after a shave and not feel any residual stubble. That just wasn't possible with any other electric shaver I've ever owned before. There is no facial redness following the shave, and I can wash my face with soap immediately after the shave without any irritation from the soap. Now we'll see how long it lasts. I've only had it for a couple of months. It looks sturdy, with far fewer thin plastic parts than a Norelco, so I have high hopes. The cleaning vat works as advertised, but I seem to get just as good if not better results in terms of speed, comfort, and closeness by taking the razor head off after each shave and rinsing the top of the razor and the head in a vigorous stream of very warm tap water, patting dry, air drying for awhile and then reassembling. That process surely is quicker than using the machine. I do smear a drop of the Braun oil across the heads once a week as recommended in the instructions if you are not constantly using the cleaning vat, which has both alcohol and an oil in the cleaning solution.

  681. I have now used all types of razors. The closest shave ever comes from a true razor blade. However; I have sensitive skin that irritates easily. The neck bumps are horrible and unsightly. I most recently replaced a rotory type electric razor due to the fact that when they hit marble tile from six feet plus...they break. I paid approximately 80.00 dollars for my old electric and was not looking forward to spending 200.00 on a new one. After getting this new gadget home and using it, I have to say that I am impressed. The shave is so close I have to tell myself I did not use a razor blade. The sides of my face and jaw are very very smooth. My neck is a little tougher to shave and takes some working and streching but still comes clean. I am able to shave 3 or 4 days then have to clean. I have been using this razor for a couple of months and the indicator still shows full for the cleaning solution. I don't know why so many people complained about having to buy the liquid and replacement razor heads. If you use a Mach however many Turbo razor, you will spend a boat load of money on new razors every year. They are not cheap even if you buy them in bulk. Bottom line. This razor rocks and is pretty quiet too. The only complaint I have is the monsterous power cord. They should make it at a right angle so it does not stick out 3 to 4 inches from the wall. Shop around on Amazon to find the best deal for this razor. My wife was able to score mine for under 200.00 dollars. If you are on the fence...jump off and buy this razor.

  686. I just upgraded from the 8995 to the 9595 and in a word it's fabulous! I converted from Norelco rotary razors about a year ago to Braun and at the time I was very impressed with the build quality and how close the shave was compared to the Norelco. For the record I had the top of the line Norelco 9190XL.<br /><br />When Braun redesigned their flagship razor they started with a clean slate. This isn't a simple upgrade of the 8995, it goes beyond that. They reduced the size of the overall unit making it slimmer and more comfortable to hold. The head now has a greater range of pivoting and the cutters now float individually. Overall it allows the shaver to more closely follow the contours of your face while maintaining contact with the skin it is trying to shave. Also this model doesn't seem to drop or shed the cut stubble all over the counter top as easily as the old model. The way the new screen and blades are designed they seem to trap and hold the cut hair in the head until it's time to be cleaned. The old model would dust my counter top with cut stubble as if I were using a pepper shaker on my counter top. Two thumbs up for the new head design. :)<br /><br />The new Pulsonic motor is in my opinion much quieter than the model it replaces. The sonic pulses are supposed to vibrate the head causing the screen to catch more hair with less passes over the same spot. The result is truly outstanding! I have a patch of hair just over my adams apple that I have to really spend a lot of time trying to shave by stretching the skin . The new razor nearly eliminates all the work and makes shaving more comfortable and FASTER than ever before.<br /><br />The LCD display is smaller than the outgoing model but it displays the same amount of information. It tells me the remaining charge and the current hygiene state of the shaver.<br /><br />The Clean & Renew base station has also been redesigned. It is now an off white color and matches my tile counter top. Also the start button has been redesigned and it no longer locks the razor in place while it's cleaning. The instructions state that the Clean & Renew station will \\"dry \\" the razor using heat. I'm not sure if the old model did this or not but it is a welcome feature nonetheless.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this razor to anyone looking to buy an electric razor. It's quiet, fast and close shaves are as good as you're going to get. The build quality is top notch and the company stands behind their products. What more could you want?er locks the razor in place while it's cleaning. The instructions state that the Clean & Renew station will \\"dry \\" the razor using heat. I'm not sure if the old model did this or not but it is a welcome feature nonetheless. I would highly recommend this razor to anyone looking to buy an electric razor. It's quiet, fast and close shaves are as good as you're going to get. The build quality is top notch and the company stands behind their products. What more could you want?
  687. like most men over the years I have had almost every brand of razor. always promised the closest shave ever and of course it never was.until now. this new razor by braun is light years ahead of any other brand.it's not cheap but what a pleasure to shave without pull or irritation. pre-shave is uneccassary.It is fairly quiet. it cuts the hairs on your face effortlessly and when you splash on after shave there is no burning sensation because there is no irritation.   688. After shaving with a Mach3 for the past 8 years (with a brief electric shaving trial in between) I decided to switch over to the dark side. I was not disappointed! After unpacking the beautifully packed box, I plugged in the base station and put the shaver in it. The shaver fits snugly and the lights on the base station light up to confirm that the shaver is being charged. It was clean since it had never been used so I turned it on and went to work on three day old stubble. One minute later, my face was completely smooth and -- to my surprise -- not irritated. The shave was extremely close, though maybe just barely less close than a blade. Still, I ran my hand down my cheek and there was absolutely no resistance. While it wasn't my main reason for buying the Pulsonic, the base station is amazing. After shaving, I replaced the shaver in the base station and pressed the standard clean button. It sucked up some liquid, ran it through, and then dried the shaver off for a while. I love anything that cleans itself! The main reason I got the Braun Pulsonic is because my beard doesn't grow quickly enough to allow me to shave daily with blade without irritating my skin. The Braun fixed my problem there. My only complaint, a very small one, is that the base station feels a little flimsy. It doesn't seal completely at the bottom with or without a cleaning cartridge in. However, the gap is about 2 millimeters and does not effect the cleaning or anything at all really so I'll just forget about it. In fact it's not even visible unless you duck down and stare on eye level. Overall an amazing product: the shaver is clearly well made and it does a superb job.

  695. That's the word to describe this razor.I have always looked to braun for the cutting edge in technology and this time they out did themselves.I have been shaving with an electric shaver for many years and have tried all types and brands truthfully this product is in a class by itself.The results the difference in closeness between the pulsonic and a blade shave is negligible.You can't even feel it when you shave it glides over your face it's really quite remarkable you have to experience it for yourself you won't beleive it either.Tho other negative comments about noise are greatly exagerated I have owned many other braun razors and this is no louder than the others if anything it might be slightly quiter. Build quality is excellent as well as ergonomics cleaner works flawlessly shave is unequalled in the industry I rarely get excited about a new product I beleive this product will be the standard for many years to come if you want a great piece of art get a norelco arcitec if you want a blade close shave with no missed spots ther is only one choice it's the Pulsonic by Braun.
  696. This is the best shaver I've ever had. Very smooth shave. My 5 o'clock shadow is equivalent to the best shave I could get with a Norelco.
  697. I have owned two Braun electric shavers before this (the 7000 series and then the 8000 series). I just replaced the blades/foil on my 8595 (every 9 months, it is just too worn by then) and the new one was not working well at all. They have changed to the \\"360 complete\\" heads (blue strip with different sized holes), and that did not work well for me on the 8595. So, I was wary of getting this Pulsonic since it uses the same new head. I bought it anyway after seeing the reviews. I am very impressed and amazed. Where I used to have to take 10-20 passes over the same place to get reasonable smoothness, this new one was smoother after just 2 passes. It shaved the hairs at my Adams apple extremely well, where the other ones never did (they curl this way and that). Since the 8595 had brand new blades/foil, it has to be the new shaver that made the difference. Like others, I am 1st to state that electric shavers will never shave as smooth as a multi-blade razor, but this comes closer than any electric I have had before. It also seems to avoid heat buildup on the head. Note that you really should only shave before a shower and at least 15 minutes after you wake up - your skin is puffy when you 1st awake, and your hair and skin absorb a lot of water when you shower (good for a razor but bad for an electric; the razor does well because wet and puffed up skin is less likely to get snagged/cut and wet hair catches the 1st blade better, allowing it to be pulled out more). One good thing about the 9595 is that it has a narrower body (normal sized head) and is much easier to hold.
  698. My husband saw this advertised on TV and wanted to try it, so we stepped up to make the purchase. He is finally satisfied with a razor. HE LOVES IT! No more complaining about his razor's performance or the heads falling off. He's a Braun Pulsonic believer!
  699. I bought this shaver from Amazon in November, 2009. Today it died. When I turn it on, the switch light is on, but the shaver doesn't come on. I bought it because I saw so many positive reviews here! It does give a decent shave (except under my chin), but it makes a big mess with hairs everywhere. have to shave above the sink all the time!<br /><br />Edit (June 28, 2013): I fixed it for free more than two years ago because the warranty was still valid. Today it finally gave up. It makes noises, but it doesn't shave.. the side cutter stops working totally.. I don't know how much it costs to fix it. Maybe I need change to another brand. Braun no more.
  700. If your looking for a serious electronic shaver, not one for occasional use, this is the one to get. If you are looking for something just for travel or sparse use, look at some cheaper options. I have been a long time Norelco user, but my last unit got old, and it was time to upgrade. I decided to go with this shaver because of the positive reviews, and they have proved to be true. This shaver performs very well. The cleaning system is really great, no more manual cleaning. Also it delivers a clean and close shave. Be wary though, getting a decent shave required more time than using my previous Norelco, but the results were better. So I guess this is a good trade off. Pros: Close, and clean shave. Cleaning system works perfectly. The base unit won't over charge the shaver, unlike a Norelco. So this means the battery quality will not diminish over time. Cons: Can't get good results while trying to pull off a 'quick shave', so expect to take that extra 2 - 3 mins. Price is not a con, since it is worth it for the overall package that you get.

Over these many years I've tried other shavers but always went back to a Braun. A few weeks ago I purchased the Model 9595 and WOW!! The best yet! It gives a close shave and the self cleaning feature makes shaving a breese.

  703. EDIT<br />I originally gave this razor 5 stars<br />Review added July 11, 2008<br /><br />Pros:<br />1. I was very impressed with the closeness of the shave, better than Norelco.<br />2. I could shave in half the time than before. A real plus.<br />3. Cleaning was more convenient.<br /><br />If I scored the shaver on closeness and speed, it would get 5 stars.<br /><br />Cons:<br />1. If I let my beard grow more than a couple of days, the Braun can't cut longer whiskers. Have to trim using my wife's razor.<br />2. The cleaning system is not as thorough as I first reported. Getting the head clean is a real chore as it can't be disassembled. The cleaning system still leaves every crick & cranny full of soggy whisker powder. Washing with hot water and even 409 can't dislodge the stuff. The cleaning cartridges last about 2 months and cost $11 for two. And yes, I have used them as they reportedly have a lubricant, which seems justified. That's about $30/year.<br />3. The Foil broke after 8 months! Braun states the foil and cutter cassette should be good for about 18 months. The break was inside the cassette not the shaving surface. I'm not a rambunctious shaver.<br />4. The original cost plus cleaner divided by 8 (months) is about $30 a month so far!! This is damned costly shaving and I still have to buy a foil/cutter cassette to keep using the pulsonic!<br />5. Replacing the cassette is $37 through Amazon, $40+ locally if you can find one!<br /><br />Had I known how expensive this shaver would be to use and maintain, I would have stuck with the Norelco, regardless how close and fast the shave.<br /><br />Original Review<br />I've used Norelco shavers for 25 years and never really had an issue with them. I had read somewhere that foil shavers irritate some people. Razor blade shavers leave my face a bloody mess no matter how careful I am. So, I just stuck with Norelco as they did an adequate job. Shaving is something I have to do, not want to do. An autopilot, ho hum, every morning, chore.<br /><br />However, when the batteries started dying on my last Norelco after only 5 years, the other models have lasted much longer, I decided to try something else. My sons have been telling me for years how much they liked the Braun and they didn't find them irritating.<br /><br />When I started looking at Braun, I discovered the Pulsonic uses the same technology as the Sonicare toothbrush, which I like. The ratings looked good but yikes, the cost! I debated with myself about this a couple of days then decided, hey, Christmas was right around the corner, and I have been a good boy, plus Amazon would keep me out of the Christmas crowds and shipping was free. My time has to be worth something, right?<br /><br />Less than a week later, I shaved one side of my face with the Norelco (the blades are only a couple of months old) and the other with the Pulsonic and asked my wife which side was smoother. She chose the Pulsonic side, which didn't surprise me because it felt much closer to me also. I've also been pleasantly surprised to find shaving doesn't take as long as it did with the Norelco! After three weeks, I couldn't be more pleased. The Pulsonic shaves much closer than the Norelco AND shaves faster. I can't speak for other Braun models, but I would certainly recommend the Pulsonic. OK, maybe I'm still trying to justify the cost, but cleaning is thorough and couldn't be more easy; something I often neglected with the Norelco.

The price is more than most shavers, but BRAUN is known for building a quality product, and this is just one of many. At times, one pays more for quality. I have used Norelco and Remington shavers, and recommend this model of Braun as a replacement. I am far from being disappointed.

  712. I read the reviews, I've had 4 or 5 electric razors over the years, and I was ready to pay for the best razor out there. This isn't it. I have an ultrasonic toothbrush and I really liked it. That's why I tried this out. It still takes several passes to catch hairs, no different than my cheap electric razor and maybe not any better at all. The clipper on the side is at a 90 degree angle, meaning it's hard to trim eyebrows or beards with it, or get under hairs that the razor misses. The LCD is nice for showing the battery level, but the hygiene one is B.S. It just goes by the run time. I'm sure they make money on the refills and that's why it goes down so fast. I just rinse it with water and do the auto clean in the base once a week or so. I really wanted to like this thing, but I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.
  713. I have used Braun shavers as my sole form of shaving for 20 odd years. This is without doubt the best shaver I have ever used. I purchased it through Amazon a few months ago as it wasn't available in Australia (amazingly it still isn't) and after about two weeks of getting use to it, I am a convert. The shave is as quick and smooth as you would ever want and best of all it picks up those difficult hairs under your chin with ease. As for the rest of my face, it feels as smooth as a baby's bottom (excuse the pun) after a couple of minutes. This is something no previous electric shaver I have used could achieve. The cleaning system is excellent and the carry case is a welcome addition for travelling. My only complaint is that it doesn't come with a plastic protector for the head. I am forced to either put the shaver in the carry case or have it upside down in the cleaner when I'm not using it. It's a pity Braun ditched the plastic head protector. That aside, overall the closest shave you will get to a hand razor without all the headaches associated with manual shavers.(cutting yourself, time it takes, replacing blades/shaving cream etc) My only other small gripe is that I was charged US$75 in P&H to ship the shaver to Australia. It cost the seller US $10 as the stamps on the postage indicated - a tidy profit! My one tip would be to use a pre-shaver lotion prior to shaving, it makes the shave even closer and reduces the risk of inflammation that some people get with shaving.
  714. I tried electric shavers about 8 years ago and didn't like them. Since that time I have suffered shaving rash and shaving bumps on my neck from using conventional safty razors. My girlfriend gave me this shaver for my birthday and it rocks. I now shave comfortably everyday, without any bleeding, bumps or rashes. It's light weight, easy to clean (automatic mostly) and it actually cuts the hair (doesn't feel like it's ripping them out of my face). This razor is worth the price. Buy this razor and don't accept cheap knock offs!
  715. I read all the reviews here and on other sites prior to purchasing this product, and I have to say, it is very good. However, it is not as perfect as I thought it would be. 2 things that I think were major Cons: It misses its fair share of hair, and no matter how many times I go over a certain spot, the \\"hair comb\\" won't pick up some hairs. The other thing is that unless you shave on a daily basis, you have to pre-trim (of course this depends on how fast your beard grows). Advantages: If you have sensitive skin like I do, this electric is definitely for you--it is great for my sensitive skin, even if you don't use a pre-shave balm/lotion (has to be dry before you shave). It you don't have difficult hairs, this electric is awesome. Just know this, it gets close, but not as close as an actual razor. Overall, its very good, and better than anything else I have tried.

  719. I've owned several Braun razors, but this one is definitely the best shave. It's my favorite razor I've ever owned.
  720. I had an electric shaver years ago and it was one of those three head types. I was never satisfied with the shave so I eventually went back to a razor. When I bought this shaver, I was hoping that technology had improved as well as that this was a quality shaver. Both I think are true. The shaver works great with very few exceptions. I find the shaver gives a very close shave on all parts of my face. The technology doesn't make it possible to simply swipe the shaver over a check and that's it; you have to pass the saver a number of times for a really close shave. A razor gets to the point quicker but also nicks and scrapes a WHOLE lot more. I have a bit of trouble getting a close shave on the part of my neck just below the jawbone. I guess this is because that's a fleshy part of anyone's neck and skin gives too much, but you learn how to adjust your pressure and passes. The device can't get that spot close to your nose. It's just logical. a razor's cross section is like a 1/4 inch where the electric razor head is more than an inch. So, for those who have a whisker or two nearer the nose, you may have to still cut that with a razor if yo want to get all the nasty little beggars. The razor does not provide a way to make that clear straight cut at the end of sideburns either. So every once in awhile i cut that with a razor too. Over all I am pleased. The readout showing shaver state tells you when it needs to be cleaned. If I follow the little dial readout exactly, I get three shaves before it tells me the razor needs to be cleaned. I usually go four or five before cleaning. It doesn;t seem to make a big difference to subsequent shaves. The cleaning process is fully automated so you just push the button and walk away. I bought my son a Panasonic that uses water as the solvent for cleaning. The Braun requires a cartridge with it's own solution formula. The cartridges last a long time so it isn't a bother to me but my son seems to like the Panasonic just fine so there is an alternative if you don't want to buy special cleaner cartridges. The battery holds a pretty substantial charge and I have no problem taking it on a week-long business trip with no worry that I need to charge it while on travel.
  721. I like the self-cleaning & charging although I do pop off the head and tap out the loose stuff before I run it through the auto cleaner. It gives a good shave and holds a charge well when I take it out of town for a couple of days w/o the charger. It works really great on all my camping trips since it never leaves my truck (Who shaves on a camping trip?) but it does keeps my wife's hope up... Buy it, you won't regret it.
  722. This is a really good razor with a very fine cleaning system. The initial cost is high but worth it. The cost would be prohibitive if you bought replacement cleaning cartriges every month but the cartriges can be refilled with rubbing alcohol containing oil of wintergreen with good results.
  723. Seriously this is the best shaver of ALL TIME, I own the old Braun 7000 and the head broke after a few years so I was not sure about getting another Braun but IT IS AWESOME. The best, fastest, closest shave ever for me and I chew up and spit out razors.
  724. As an amazon prime customer who makes purchases weekly I felt compelled to write this as my first ever product review / comparison. The primary reason for my purchase of the Braun 9595 was that I decided to start shaving my head. In the past I have never had success with any razor for facial shaving. At least of the many electric razors that I have tried in the past never got all the hair and made me feel as if I still needed to go over it with a regular razor to get everything. This 9595 has had rave reviews and is highly rated so I purchased it and have used it for 4 months. After using the razor for about a month it was doing a better job than any electric razor that I had ever used. I was totally impressed based on that comparison. However for my face I would still feel that I would need to go over it with a regular razor to get the stuff that the braun could not. Also after having shaved my head now for several months it seemed like it would take a long time for the braun 9595 to get everything. In fact my head and face started feeling sensitive because I was having to vigorously go over all areas again and again. So this got me thinking that I would get another electric razor as a supplement that I could use while in the shower. I figured between the two of them I could maintain my head and face between the mirror and the shower. So after much research I landed on the Panasonic ES8243. It was half the price of the braun and I figured well how bad could it be as a supplement and backup to the braun. Now having used the Panasonic for a month all I can say is wow! It is not my supplement it is the only one that i want to use. It is better than the braun in every way! Compared side by side it is totally obvious. The Panasonic gets MUCH closer in far less time and most is done with one pass. It can be used wet or dry in the shower and does equally well in both situations. I can shave with the braun and then follow up with the Panasonicand easily see how much the braun missed. The truth is these two razors are not even close to being in the same league. I still have both but have no idea where the braun even fits into my shaving any longer. I did not expect this to be the case.

  726. First electric shaver ever. Researched and went for the best out there according to the critics. Paid good price for new technology and hoped for the best. My beard is average? One thing for sure If I let a day go by it becomes a pain in the arse. Used fussion blades and gillette shaving cream and after several minutes and if the blades are relatively new I would end up, with what is known, as a close shave. Hard to beat and regretfully the Braun Series 7- 790cc (9595) Pulsonic Shaver does not come even as close or better still, is unable to perform as well. Regardless of how many approaches to shaving with this machine I use I do not end up with a smooth surface. Yes, a little steep priced the liquid but, hey, when you spend over $200 for a shaver you are supposedly able and willing to dish out for the additional convenience and comfort. Every time I finish shaving and I check for smoothness I find there is none, it is not a perfect shave but it does shave enough where for that day you can put a check-mark on the calendar. Manual replacement blades, which cost big money, definitely last very little time before they become dull. So I got an amazing razor, the best they make for $150.00 since I'm def going to be using the gift certificates for stuff I need at the already lowest price. I no longer have to buy a new pack of blades every 4 weeks (only have to replace the blade set once a year now for $25.00) and no shave cream ever (have to buy cleaning and lubrication packs though) and I never get irritated skin anymore. So now I've spent $150.00 + $25.00 + $50.00 = $225.00 for the first year and a half I've used this razor instead of $25.00 x 18 months (what I had been paying every 4 weeks for blades) + $100.00 (18 months of shave cream) + $15 for stupid razor handle-thing= $565.00 The manual blade system cost me roughly 2.5 times what I now pay, and as a plus I no longer get irritated skin ever.
