  730. I've been using this shaver for about 2 months now. It is a very good shaver (as it should be for the price), but it is not perfect, nor is it as close as a blade. I have primarily used a combination of electric foil shavers and straight blade razors (Gillette Mach 3 Turbo) my whole life. I have a moderately tough/thick beard and the rotary shavers that I've tried do not operate at a high enough RPM, resulting in the hair being pulled out rather than cut (ouch). Like most people, the toughest area for me to shave closely is around my neck. This shaver certainly doesn't do any worse than any other electric I've ever used, but still leaves some rough areas there. On my face itself, the Braun 790cc does a pretty good job of shaving, although it seems to have a little trouble leaving super smooth results in my mustache area, even when I use the locking feature on the shaver's head. I will say that this is by far the most comfortable foil shaver I have ever used and does not leave my skin feeling raw and irritated like some previous shavers have done. In addition to using it to shave my face, I also have a shaved head and use this razor on a daily basis for that purpose as well. This, by far, gives me the best and closest shave on my head of any electric I've ever used and I would highly recommend it for anyone who is thinking of using it for that purpose as well. Overall, this is a very good shaver and I would definitely recommend it, but it still won't give you a shave that is as close as you can get from a blade (nor will any electric that I've ever used). If you buy this shaver, I would definitely recommend using the cleaning station and buying the cleaning solution refill cartridges. I'm always skeptical of products that require \\"add-on's\\" after you buy the main product, but in this case, using the cleaning station on a regular basis definitely helps to give you a better shave, rather than just cleaning the razor with water all the time. The cleaning solution has lubricants in it that help the razor to give you a smoother, more comfortable shave. Although Braun recommends using the cleaning station daily, I've found that using it twice a week seems to be sufficient. I clean my razor daily with just water and use the cleaning station once every 3 or 4 days. That way, I can get at least a couple months out of each cleaning cartridge and I still get a good shave.

I have a goatee so the trimmer is important and it works well, though it takes a bit of getting used to the new sight line because it extends from the front of the razor (as opposed to the top).   743. I have had several shavers in my life. Norelco and most recently the [[ASIN:B000G1EQ1W Braun Series 5 (8995) Men's Shaver]]. When Braun went to the the Gillette screen for the Series 5, things started to work much slower. I found that the shaver was binding a lot more on the longer thicker hairs on my chin. Naturally I was a little upset that a cross promo had screwed up my Shaver. My assumption is the shaver has an older motor and does not have the adequate power to handle the new screen.<br /><br />So, I thought to punish Braun by not buying their product again. But then I read the reviews of the 790cc. I had to buy it. I have shaved twice since getting it from Amazon. The first was a 5 day beard, the 2nd was a 2 day beard. This shaver means business. Not only did it not skip a beat with the long hairs, it shaved closer than anything I have ever used (including razors).<br /><br />Yes it is expensive, but I think for something you have to do daily, it is worth every penny. Nothing looks worse than razor burn or missed hairs first thing in the morning and this shaver takes care of both with ease.
  744. This shaver is the best I've ever owned. It gives me a closeness in shaving I didn't think was possible. I couldn't be happier.
  745. I purchased the 790cc Pulsonic Shaver about 1 month ago and I can confirm what other users have found -- it is by far the best shaver that I have ever purchased and gives me the closest shave for an electric shaver.
  746. It doesn't get any better than this system. Thoughtfully designed and beautifully executed. Excellent quality shaving results time after time. If you prefer an electric shaver, you owe it to yourself to consider the Series 7 790cc shaving system. Save time and aggravation by letting the shaver maintain itself. You get the benefit of time savings, and a fresh shaver each time you reach for it. An occasional use of the supplied cleaning brush, and a quick rinse under the tap will extend the life of the cleaning solution beyond the advertised 30 day average replacement cycle.
  747. C'è poco da dire anzi pochissimo nessun rasoio elettrico può competere con un rasoio Braun punto ! Ho posseduto un Philips per un'anno e poi ho comprato un Braun serie 7 e lo posseduto per ben 15 anni,ho cambiato come previsto solo il coltello e la lama ma il resto è intatto, veramente un prodotto fatto come si deve...per questo per il mio nuovo rasoio sono andato sul sicuro ;-)
  748. Pros: Probably the best electric razor you can buy. Foil/cutterblock mechanism truly conforms to your face. Finally using lithium ion batteries. Cons: Charge and \\"hygeine\\" indicators are gimmicky. Not sure what the plus/minus buttons do. No hard case. Beard trimmer has regressed from older versions. Expensive. The magic behind the 790 is the independently-moving shaver heads. Slide your finger across the top and you'll see that the movement mimics the independent suspension of a car. The foil/cutterblock follows the same general design Braun has been using for years now -- a trimmer for longer hairs sandwiched between two bar-shaped shaver heads -- but the independent rocking motion is new (at least to me). The shaver heads are spring-loaded and have just the right amount of give to them. Between that and the improved foil hole pattern, it now takes less strokes over my troublesome neck area to get all the weird hairs growing in different directions. Also new is some kind of vibrational intensity adjustment, controlled by plus and minus buttons on either side of the power button. The general idea is that if the whole thing vibrates harder, it can jar those hard-to-shave hairs around and get them into the holes in the foil. This makes sense in theory but all it seems to do is make more noise. At the lowest intensity, the 790 sounds like most other Braun razors but turns into an annoying rattle at the higher setting. I've been using it for about ten days now, some days doing my whole shave on low, some days on high, sometimes alternating. Other than the sound, it doesn't seem to make one bit of difference. As you could probably guess, the two indicators on the bottom of the handle are over-designed, weird looking, and largely useless. I don't need a battery indicator with more granularity than my cell phone; all I need to know is if it's close to dying. And the hygiene indicator? Total gimmick. If you sprang for the deluxe model with the cleaning base, you're probably going to follow their suggestion and drop it in every time you're done shaving. I've been using Braun's since long before the Clean & Renew system and I never once thought, \\"Gee, I wonder how much crap is stuck inside my shaver.\\" Still, I suppose it's not hurting anything being there. My biggest complaint with the 790 is that for some reason they decided to swap out their usual slide-up beard trimmer for one that flips out perpendicular to the handle. It's clumsy, difficult to open, and just doesn't work as well. My old shaving routine involved a lot of back-and-forth between the shaving head and the beard trimmer as I would constantly switch to trimmer mode to cut long hairs that couldn't be coaxed into the foil holes. It's such a pain in the ass to flip up the trimmer now that I avoid it and end up more aggressively rubbing the shaver head into my neck to get these unruly stragglers. Another dumb little thing is that they stopped making hard cases for their razors years ago. The new cases are semi-rigid plastic covered with a neoprene-like fabric. I usually bury it in my suitcase between clothes because I'm afraid that it'll get smashed. The old hard cases could withstand getting run over by a truck. They also don't make the little plastic shield to go over the top like they used to. The 790 is another incremental update in the 7-Series. If you've never used a Braun before, you'll definitely be in for a treat. If you're switching from a Norelco or a Remington, you'll never go back.
  749. In the case of this shaver, the hype really does match reality. The shaver is by far the best electric I've ever used, and it's very nicely engineered--from the ergonomics of the shaving unit to the self-cleaning/lubricating mechanism that comes with the shaver. It's a bit pricey, but you get your money's worth out of this one. ---------------------- After nearly two years of using this shaver I can update my original review (above) as follow: (1) Have replaced the head once, which is right on schedule (2) I stil love the shaves I get from this shaver. (3) The trimmer works, but will no longer stay closed (cheap mechanism here). (4) I'm surprised by the number of people who try to save cleaning fluid by only cleaning the head once in a while. The fact is that you can get as many cleanings as you want until evaporation requires a new cartridge. By not cleaning, you're not saving anything. Still give it 5-stars.
  750. Too expensive for what you get as a product. This shaver doesn't shave that well. For one thing it is too loud and doesn't shave neck hair. I bought a norelco shaver and I like that one better but I guess its a personal choice.
  751. Although a bit steep in price, it performs as advertised. I have owned a 7000 series Braun and was getting fed up with the amount of times it took going over my chin, neck and area below the ear on the jawbone. This razor did an excellent job in a minimal amount of time with a close shave I haven't experienced in years. I highly recommend this shaver if you can handle the price.
  752. This was a birthday gift for my husband so it's not a firsthand review. However, he has raved about it. I last got him a shaver about six or seven years ago and it was starting to peeter out. It was also a Braun and seeing as it took so long to finally go, after being dropped on the tile floor a couple of times, it's obviously well made. My husband has sensitive skin and he's had no problem with it. It's a little queiter than his previous model as well. I also like that you don't have to lock it into the stand to get it to charge and clean because that was sometimes a pain with his other one. And the razor itself does all the cleaning and charging automatically without having to be set. So, overall, very cool razor. :)
  753. I purchased the Braun Pulsonic System shaver to see how it performed and have found it to exceed my expectations. It does a fine job with my beard and trimming of mustache, etc. and the cleaning and charging mechanisims are excellent. I plan to travel with it out of the country and the atomatic adjustable power supply makes it a \\"no brainer.\\" I highly recommend it to everyone who is looking for a comfortable shaver that is well made and lives up to the hipe!
  754. I've been using Norelco models, which include the 6885XL, for over 20 years. By and large, they were all very disappointing. By comparison, the Braun Pulsonic 9595CC with LCD is orders of magnitude better. Shaving with 6885XL, I'd often end up with fair-sized sections of wholly uncut hair and of the hair it did cut, it wasn't terribly close. It almost looked as if I didn't shave! The Braun just wipes my face with the Norelco, so to speak. It doesn't leave spots, period. And it's close across my entire face. So close, I just feel skin on my cheeks. Yes, for the first time, I think I can say that electric shaving \\"is there\\". It's reached the point of doing the job it's set out to do. I think one of the reasons why Norelco models fail so miserably is that while their lift and cut system was patented, what actually happens is that the metal foil over the razor mats some of the hair down and the blades never get to see it. The Braun takes a different approach. The centerpiece vibrates like a little jack hammer and I'm surmising this causes the hairs to jump up tall, and the trailing half of the razor reaches them before they can bend back down. This means it does most of the work as opposed to the leading half (until you move in the other direction and their roles reverse). I don't know if this is true, but it's my guess behind the engineering logic. But I do know that it works! The Braun also has another nice feature. The Norelcos store cut hair behind the foil assembly and it has to be emptied periodically. I do this over the toilet bowl and one time, the entire assembly fell into the toilet. You won't have to worry about the Braun doing that. It comes with its own razor-washing gizmo. I haven't had it long enough to know how it will work out long-term, but so far as I can tell, it completely cleans the razor out and it does this after every use, so long as you remember to put it back and press the clean button. The only downside is that it's expensive andsomewhat noisy. But it is so good otherwise, that this is almost nitpicking. Basically, I'd say if ever other electric razor were to be discontinued tomorrow, I wouldn't care. The Braun 9595CC stands alone as the best electric razor in the industry.
  755. I have had this razor for about 6 weeks and I can honestly say that it is the best electric shaver I have ever owned. I had a Braun razor previously which was quite good but the cleaning system failed - at least this system does not have an 'over the top' connector setup which failed early on. The only downside of this unit is the loud noise during operation and the price. Other than that, it gives a good, fast shave.
  756. I have both the Braun 9595 Pulsonic electric razors and the Norelco Arcitec 1090X. So I am qualified to compare the two. The Braun is the hands down better shaver and the best shaver I have ever used. The shaver hugs your face and the vibration system is comfortable almost massage like. Shaving with this shaver actually feels good. The Norelco takes TWICE as long to shave my face and with poorer results. The Norelco requires much more do-over work than the Braun and because it is so light it is difficult to control with precision. The Norelco missed hairs even after lengthy shaves. Also, the Braun comes with the nifty base station that cleans the shaver and charges it. Take my word for it the Braun is a hands down winner when you compare these two shavers.
  757. This is my first review of a product ever, only because I feel so disappointed with this product. I've been using a Braun Synchro electric for about 4 years and have been looking to upgrade. After reading the positive reviews for the Pulsonic (and ignoring the negatives) I went out and put down the almost $200 for this razor. Here's are the pro's and con's, at least in my experience: Pro's: Great looking razor, comfortable fit in your hand, and the base unit is smaller and cleaner in appearance than older models (the base is also somewhat smaller, if you're tight on room). Yes, it is loud but no louder than other Braun's - it is definitely louder than a Norelco I've used but unless you live around light sleepers it's not a big deal. It is very responsive to your face, as the head has multiple moving/adjusting parts to it so it does hug the contours of your neck and face well, which is great for sensitive faces. The cleaning system is also much improved, meaning it doesn't clean for 20+ minutes and go through fluid as quickly if the razor doesn't require a heavy cleaning, which is something I liked. Con's: I think Braun sacrificed comfort and sensitivity for closeness of shave on this one. I was REALLY excited when I first got this, thinking it would be the best shave I've had. After the first shave I was a little disappointed, but thought I'd give it another shot. After a week, I quickly realized it wasn't as close as my older Braun Synchro. To test it, I shaved immediately following with my Synchro and it picked up a lot more hair quite easily. I was shocked, and sad that I had to return this. Since all the blades on the head move so easily, it's just hard to get in there and get that close stubble - it always looked like I had a day's growth after finishing with this shaver, which isn't good enough - especially given the high price. If you are just looking for a fancy shaver that gives a decent cut and is sensitize to your face, this is a great choice. If, however, you're looking for a very close shave - this is not for you. Whatever you do, make sure you can return it to where you purchased it so you can try it out - I'd hate to have not been able to return this after my test run with it. I really wanted this to be my Christmas present for myself this year - instead I'll just stick with my Synchro until something else comes along.
  758. I have had several Braun shavers and this seems to be the best.   759. I used electrics in the past - mostly Norelco style - used them since I didn't know any better... that's what I started shaving with. I can't explain how well and how painless this shaver really is. Quick - saves me time. Painless - no after burn, no pulling hairs, gets the thickest patches of hair (my chin) without any ache (something my old electrics would tear me up so I'd have to go real slow to get it all)... Clean - self cleaning makes it like new everytime - just look at it after it's done - it's brand spanking new! Sure the heads probably wear, but I've had it for over a month now and the thing is just like new. I've read that the heads are supposed to be changed out every 18 months... what a savings in razors alone!! Someone else on here said it made shaving fun - it really has. I used to shave every other day since it took so long and I hated all the mess and hassle... now I want to shave twice a day :) Sometimes I have... it really is great and comes with a nice travel container too. Charge lasts a long time even on my thick stubbly face. I'm overly impressed with what this thing does to the basics of shaving... Can't recommend it enough!!

The pulsonic shaves much faster and more comfortably than any of the other's I've used. I hate shaving, period, but it's not so bad with this one! The price is the highest I've ever paid for a shaver, but I don't mind spending the money to get a good product, so I'm very happy! Plus Amazon has by far the lowest price - even on the better model, which has the LCD screen. It's nice being able to see battery strength and cleaning level display graphically. Braun's cleaning system is also by far the best I've seen and it's nice that they've stayed with the same refill cartridge design over the years, so I didn't have to throw the ones I already had away when my old shaver died - they work with this one too. This is a purchase that I'm very happy with and would highly recomend this product, especially if you don't enjoy shaving.

  767. I read some of the other reviews and was a little skeptical, but I'm foolish, so I bought the $250 shaver anyway. Turns out it is great. I've had it for two months and I've largely stopped razor shaving since I got this thing. That's not to say it's the same as razor shaving, but it's very, very, close. It is, hands down, the best electric shave I've ever gotten. After shaving it feels like a razor shave, but the 5 o'clock shadow seems to come sooner than with the razor. I can't tell if the pulsing or all the other super-gadgetry is doing the trick, but it is great. The cleaning system is nice too. It is kinda loud, but you don't have to run it at 5 in the morning and wake up your wife. It is comforting to see the ridiculous amount of shaved hair and what not in the cleaner cartridge when you swap it out. All in all, I am very happy with it; it gives a great shave and the cleaning system seems to keep it very clean (and lemon-fresh too!). If you're happy with your shaver or don't have to shave every day (I'm in the military, so I have to), stick with what you have or the razor. If you're looking for a new one and need something that gives a close shave and you don't have to spend an hour disassembling and cleaning it once a week, get this thing. Caveat: all I can say about reliability is that I've had this thing for two months and it hasn't given me any trouble at all.

  777. As a longtime Norelco user (the last a 9160XL), I finally grew tired of their product breaking like clockwork every two-plus years just after the warranty period had passed. Also, the frequent pinching & razor burn was getting me down. Time to switch. I remember many, many years ago when I was buying my first razor that I pined for a Braun, but lacked deep enough pockets to make up the difference (at that time) between the two. Times change and prices have balanced, but now the product differential is very significant! The Braun flat whoops Norelco! I've had the Braun for about 6 or 8 weeks now, and must say that the shave is closer, it is quicker, and most amazingly to me, it is far more consistent than I ever experienced with Norelco. With the latter, I would always note that a random area of my face or neck would have been missed - not so with the Braun, as it gets all areas of my face and neck baby smooth. My young daughters have both commented on Daddy's face not being rough anymore. That in itself gets the Braun 5 stars!!! And whether or not the \\"Pulsonic\\" system is helping the shaver shave closer, I don't care, it just feels terrific on my face. ;-) The cleaning system is great - yes it adds expense, but at the price point of the razor, I can afford it. And I have found that not having to deal with cleaning stubble out of the razor, and from the sink makes it worth every penny. From a transparency standpoint, like every razor before, I did have an early learning curve to determine how to best shave with this new machine, which did result in a few early bouts of razor burn at points, but once I figured it out, it has been smooth sailing ever since! Braun has won me over, and if they continue to deliver, I will never go back! Do yourself a favor, and pick up one of these for yourself, and anyone else you know who needs a razor. It rocks! One consideration - this is a \\"Ground Ship Only\\" item as the box contains one cleaning cartridgethat is considered a hazardous material to shippers. So if that matters, take note! Good luck!

  779. I purchased the Braun Pulsonic System 9595 in March 2008, and within the past week I've had issues with the cleaning system. The shaver does not charge or clean, leading me to assume that the contact points the cleaning system uses to detect the razor are not working properly. If I leave the shaver stored in the cleaning system, it seems that the battery is drained. When I attempted to use the shaver this morning, it was completely dead, even though I only used it for approximately 5-10 minutes after the last complete charge. I also found that the shaver charges when the AC adaptor is plugged directly into the shaver. I decided to call Braun customer service, and they will very apologetic about my issue. They logged my issue in their system and asked me a few questions to better understand my problem. I was informed that I would have to send the shaver out for repairs at a local licensed service station. I was a little disappointed that I needed to involve a third party, but it seemed to be the only option. My next call was to local service center (only licensed repair shop; not related to Braun), and they informed me that they are only open 9-5 on Monday - Friday. Since I work full-time, it will be difficult to get to the service center. The service center also told me that normal repairs take about 4-5 days. What am I supposed to do without my shaver for about a week (if I'm lucky)? If I could use a regular razor, I'd use that all of the time. Please keep in mind that I have been using Braun shavers for about 10 years, and this is the first issue that I have had with their products. I am disappointed that a $200 shaver does not work after 5 months of use. Other than this issue, I can not complain about the product. The shave is great compared to my older Braun model.

  781. As a satisfied owner of the Braun Activator series I was eager to try the new Pulsonic after I read the mostly rave reviews about it from other users. I reasoned that if the Activator shave was very, very good, the Pulsonic would be excellent, so I choked down my revulsion to the astronomical price ($253 incl. tax even at Wal-Mart!) and gave it a try. The shave it gave was good, but as far as I could tell it was no real improvement over the Activator in terms of its closeness or the time it took to achieve good results. (In fact, it may have taken me longer to shave as I found that the noise was so loud from the Pulsonic vibrations that I couldn't really hear the sound of the hairs being shaved and so probably went over the same area several times just to make sure!) The only real plus I saw vs. the Activator was that it seemed to cause a little less irritation. Ultimately, I decided that I had paid too much in proportion to the benefit received and returned the razor.

  785. I have had the Braun 9595 since last Christmas and other than the trimmer part breaking, it still works. I have had all their other models prior to this one and found all to be of high quality. I shave every day on my way into the office and never had an issue with any of their products other than the trimmer breaking prematurely on the 9595. I don't even use that thing and why and how it broke- I don't know. One day I found it protruding off the shaver body and it would not reseat. The side trimmer broke on the new one and seems very flimsy as compared to the 8995. I am super careful with all my devices and handle them with care as well as always using the case. One day I went to use it and the trimmer was protruding off the shaver body. What and why it did that, I don't know and, I did not take it apart to see what failed. But, for what they cost, I don't think that these seven series are built like the 8995 or the one before that. I still have / own both of the predecessors to the 9595 and both still work perfectly. They are built like tanks. Ergonimics: One thing that I didn't like was the ergonomic design of the 7 series vs. the 8995. I found the older model easier to hold and that it had a beefier/ better build quality to it. It feels more solid to me and I can hold it from any direction and it feels great. The 9595 is contoured a bit and makes holding it from the end or upside down feel awkward. Cleaning: THe older model is a bit quieter when cleaning and I liked the grey stand with Blue LEDs vs. the white stand. The white shows dirt and grime more and, the white one doesn't always indicate when it's clean as the LEDs go out after it's been sitting for a period of time whereas the 8995 cleaning system maintains a constant \\"always on\\" status so you know whether it's clean or not. I have had issues with the 9595 where it did not clean and I had no way of knowing it due to all the LEDs were out on the base. Even though I pressed the \\"start cleaning\\" button, and it lit up, it did not clean the shaver. This is due to how Braun designed it to be less power consuming. Whether they changed this part of the design since I got mine last season- I don't know. It should be noted that the reason it would not clean or charge was due to the two metal electrical contacts on the base were not making good contact with the shaver. I had to use IPA to clean the contacts from oxidation and press them in and let them pop out of the shaver base as well as checking the contacts on the shaver. That part was fine. IT's the base contacts that were the issue. Shave quality: Both perform just as good in my experience with the newer one providing a quicker, faster cut due to higher cutting speeds but, it comes at the expense of more heat due to friction and higher vibration in the handle and cutter head. I used to cease shaving for minutes to allow it to cool down before continuing on. I used to use a light machine oil on my shaver to help prevent friction build up but, I went back to the 8995 as it works better for me. I can keep shaving with that and not get friction burned, it cleans up better, charge lasts longer, is more ergo friendly as you can hold it any direction and it feels better, there's less vibration, the side trimmer is stronger built and is lined up directly with the cutter head to help pop lay down hairs up better than the 9595. The 9595 protrudes at an angle off the body and is not lined up with the cutter head. I find with the 8995 that I can go sideways or along the length of the cutter head to get in extremely close. I can't do that on the newer style 9595 cutterhead. However, for long beards or, when I haven't shaved in a month, the 9595 does not pull. The 8995 does grab in that case. But, for everyday use, I find that both provide a very close shave. Summary: The 9595 and the 8995 perform equally as shavers good based on my every day use with both for about a year. The cleaning base on the 9595 is notas good as the older base and the build quality doesn't seem as good as the 8995 based on my experience with the trimmer breaking. I also found the 9595 to become hot due to friction of the foil. Even when new, I found this to be irritating to my face. The older one runs slower cutting speeds and is cooler / less irritating.
  786. I got this to replace my 5 year old 7680 whose battery was starting to run dry. This new one's okay, but the old model cost $50 less, cuts closer, has a better trimmer and has a more solid \\"built-in-Germany\\" feel to it. The new one does not look or feel like a $200 shaver. I'd recommend saving $50 and getting the superior 7680...
  787. This is easily the best electric shaver that I have ever used and the first that I have used outside of the Philips Norelco product line. I started with electric shavers years ago when I purchased a Norelco foil shaver. I quickly switched to a Norelco rotary shaver and used that for some time. I've been using this shaver for about a week and am thoroughly impressed. The pop-up trimmer has \\"Made in Germany\\" written on it and you can definitely tell German engineering went into it. The shaver feels very solid and well built. Don't get confused with the customer shot above in that the Series 7 - 790cc (9595) has an LCD display on the base to display \\"battery\\" and \\"hygiene\\" status - not a series of LEDs. The operating controls are very simple. There is an on/off button that glows blue when the shaver is on, a tiny recessed reset button that can be pressed with a paperclip that resets the blade change counter, a button labeled \\"release\\" that allows the blade cartridge to be removed, and a button labeled \\"lock\\" that locks the shaving portion of the razor at an angle for shaving the neck. On the back of the shaver are two metal contacts for charging the unit through the supplied base and a receptacle for plugging in cord in case the battery is dead and you can't wait for it to recharge through the base. The battery in the shaver is lithium ion (Li-ion) instead of nickel cadmium (NiCd) making battery \\"memory\\" problems obsolete and is advertised to run for 50 minutes before being fully discharged. One of the biggest selling points for me on this razor was the inclusion of the self-cleaning base station. This thing is nice! When you finish shaving you simply insert the shaver into the base and the base analyzes the \\"hygiene\\" condition of the shaver and selects a cleaning program ranging from \\"eco\\" to \\"intensive\\" and dries the razor. The advertised cleaning time is 32 to 43 minutes depending upon the cleaning program selected and I found this to be accurate. The cleaning cartridges must be purchased separately (although one is included) and replaced every 30 days with daily use. If you're not shaving every day it is recommended that the cleaning cartridges be replaced every eight weeks as the alcohol based cleaning solution in them evaporates over time. The base station has indicator lights on it to advise when to change the cleaning cartridges. A two pack of cleaning cartridges cost me approximately $8.00 at a local store. The only other ongoing cost associated with this shaver is the replacement of the cutter cassette that is recommended every 18 months and run approximately $30.00. Compared to the high cost of disposable razors that must be purchased constantly and the convenience of not having to clean this razor it is a steal! The only problem I have run into with this unit is that it does leave some stubble on the neck area especially around the Adam's Apple but as I have continued to learn how to best use this shaver it has gotten much better. I have serious problems shaving irritating my skin after shaving and I have thus has to wait several days between shaves. With this shaver I can now shave every other day with absolutely no problems. It also gives me the closest shave that I have ever had with an electric shaver and it rivals regular disposable razors. Overall, I highly recommend this shaver to anyone new to electric shavers or looking for a replacement.
  788. The Braun 790cc Pulsonic Shaver completely eradicated my opinion that it is impossible to get a close shave with an electric shaver. I've had electric shavers in the past, Norelco rotaries and Panasonic wet/dry shavers, and none of them ever gave me a satisfyingly close shave. They would also irritate my skin, because I'd end up going back over and over my beard, trying to get the darn thing to shave closer. This Braun however, shaves me closer than I ever thought was possible without using a blade. It shaves close with just a couple of passes, even under my chin and on my neck, which have always been my problem areas. It does so without pulling and yanking the hairs too (another lovely characteristic of my past shavers). No, it's not as close as a blade, but it almost is; and it won't leave your skin chaffed or knicked as can happen when using a blade. Bottom line is, you can't get a closer more comfortable shave with any other electric shaver. And the self-cleaning function leaves this baby feeling brand new every time you use it. It's worth it's price!
  789. I bought this razor for my husband for Christmas. This was the best gift. He doesn't say much about it, but he uses it every day. This is his first electric razor in all of his 62 years. It has to be good for him to use it!
  790. I am new to using an electric shaver after 30 years of using MachIII type razors. I recently tried a Norelco shaver (approx $80.00 unit) that had belonged to my father-in-law, liked it, and started using it daily. Then I decided to get the \\"best there is\\" and bought this Braun. It works just as well, and I like it just as well, as the $80.00 Norelco. I find it no better and no worse, but definitely a LOT more expensive. What I really don't like is buying the 30 day cleaning cartridges.
  791. I received a Braun Series 7 for Xmas 08, and it is a great gift! I had been wanting to try a Braun, but a little leery since owning a Norelco years ago and not having the best experience. I can't testify to the present Norelco, but this Braun does the job! It feels good in your hand, it doesn't pull as others have stated, and it gets about as close a shave as I believe is possible with an electric razor. The pulsonic technology does not rattle your jaw like the battery powered Fusion. Of course there's the requirement of continuous purchases for the clean & renew solution, but I've been shaving a full month now with regular cleanings and I'm still showing that I have a \\"high\\" quantity of solution remaining. It's a cheaper option than the repeat straight razor purchases we all make. The only negative, and this is stretching it, is if you have a light sleeping partner and you're a morning shaver (who isn't, right?). The Braun has a distinctive high humming sound to it (not annoying to me) which could make for a grumpy awakening to those not expecting it. That goes for the cleaning function as well.
  792. I wanted to buy my husband the very best shaver available, and at more than $200 this was supposed to be it. I read all the reviews and most of them were positive. I gave it to him for Christmas and we found that it just doesn't give the kind of close shave one would expect. His $10 Mach III razor shaves closer. Plus the cleaning function is LOUD.
  793. This is the first review I've ever submitted online and it's because this is the best product I have bought in years. First some background: My face has always disliked shaving immensely. I have never used an electric shaver on a regular basis - tried a few times in the past but my face would breakout badly each time. With a razor I have never been able to shave correctly, against the grain, because my face would breakout that way as well. Shaving with the grain I would still end up with zits daily as a direct result of shaving (I am now 50 years old). In fact it had gotten to the point where I couldn't shave daily and ended up using the razor every other day. I have been looking for another option, even considered laser hair removal. So after seeing something about the Braun Pulsonic I was intrigued and after some investigation, incluiding reading all the reviews I could find, I decided to take the plunge and buy one, hoping that it would work as advertised. All I can say is WOW! After reading all the comments about giving your face 2-4 weeks to adjust I was prepared for the worst. The first day I tried it I took it easy not getting too close and my face felt good afterward and no breakouts like anticipated. I then tried shaving the next day, haven't shaved two days in a row in a few years, and it felt better as I got used to it and again my face felt fine throughout the day with no breakouts. The real EUREKA! moment came on day 3 when I decided to really go at it to get the closest shave I could. I worked it every which way and the result was, BY FAR, the closest shave I have ever had. Again, my face felt great afterward. I have used the Pulsonic for 3 weeks now (5-6 days/week) and not only does my face love it but my girlfriend REALLY likes the difference. When I asked her about it last week she said \\"It's great, no more sandpaper!\\" I know it's not cheap and may not give you as close a shave if you're able to use a blade razor as it's meant to be be used, but for me and my face IT'S WORTH EVERY PENNY!! I will NEVER go back blades. Thanks Braun!
  794. This is the first review I have ever written, being basically a retired, lazy 65 yr. old man. I used electric shaves through my college years, and suffered many uncomfortable days. I switched to a blade in my early 20's for both the comfort and closeness. Unfortunately, I have developed peripheral nueropathy besides having to take Coumadin. The two combined made me not want to shave very frequently. I started reading reviews on the latest electrics. I decided to take the plunge on the Pulsonic. WOW!!! Although there are many more great reviews than bad ones, I was still amazed at the closeness and comfort of this shaver. No red splotches, no burn, just a very close shave. I could not be happier with this purchase! Also, when I travel, I take just the shaver and cord, and clean it as directed under warm, running tap water. I have not had to use the cord yet! The battery has gotten me through a ten day trip with no problem. I would reccomend this shaver to anyone, and have! I hope this review is helpful to someone considering this purchase.
  795. this razor was a dissapointment. commercials...reviwes.....stats all sounded good. truth is the base in smelly and noisy, shaver heats up fast and kinda bruns your skin. the floating head was nice the shave was no good. i use to have a panasonic and replaced it with this....not good. i went back and bought a new panasonic model. so i shaved with the braun and still had stubble in some areas....went over the stubble with my new panasonic and wooosh....GONE!!! so please do yourself a favor...buy a panasonic!!
  796. The razor's pretty expensive, but overall, it performs fairly well. If you go to long and let your hair grow to long, though, it has a hard time picking up on those hairs and then you have to use the trimmer to bring the length of the hair down first. The cleaner solution and mechanism works well, but the solution runs out too quickly and can get expensive too. I don't even buy cleaner solution anymore. I just brush out the stubble as best as I can after each shave and keep on truckin'. Still shaves well that way. I've had this shaver for well over a year and I haven't had to change the head yet, so that's good because those can be expensive too. I shave maybe every other day, but sometimes only once a week too, so that could add to the longevity of the heads, but I do still think it's lasted quite a while. The foil top of the head seems pretty tough too. I remember having a Remington shaver and the screen on that would get worn through so easily and then cut me. That hasn't been a problem with this at all. I like the pivoting head. It has worked out really well for me. The charge lasts a long time. Don't leave it plugged in all the time. Let the battery run down before charging. I do wish that it had a button that allowed you to decide when to charge and when not to charge so that you could leave it plugged in, but it doesn't, so I just unplug it until it's drained all the way down and then I plug it in to charge up and then unplug it again. A nice razor overall.

He LOVES this razor and said its the best one he has ever owned. I have to say his skin looks and feels fantastic every time he shaves.   799. This shaver performs like it's worth 20 but costs over 200. That's funny because the PocketGo should be worth 100 but is under 20 It takes 7 min to shave a 3/5 with the Pulsonic.   800. Good razor, great razor for thick neck hair growth. A little on the heavy side. Like it a lot.
  801. Product did not work as directed. This shaver did not give a good, close shave. The Norelco $40 shaver is a better deal.
  802. I bought this Braun shaver because I have never owned a really nice, high end electric shaver before. I have always used a Remington with good luck; they are durable, reliable, inexpensive, and provide a good but not great shave. I bought this Braun exactly two years ago. I was thrilled with it. I cleaned it every week and did everything the manufacturer asked me to do to keep it in fine working order. I don't even use it all that much (M-Th only for about 5 minutes at a time)<br /><br />Low-and-behold I went to use it this past Monday morning and it was DEAD as a doornail. The charge station is working fine, but the motor inside the shaver is not functioning -not even a click. I expect something this expensive (I paid well over 250 for it) to last for many years. Two years!!!! I could have purchased a new Remington every six months and still saved a bundle. Now I have to struggle with sending this to a repair center so THEY can rip me off too. It worked great while it worked. I think I will just throw it out and go buy a Remington instead. Save your money and look elsewhere this shaver is a POS!
  803. I got the Braun 9595 as a present for Christmas 2009, so I've used it for about 30 mo. It works (worked) very well. It gave me a close shave without irritation. I would rinse the head of the shaver under the tap to clean most days and use the base to charge and clean about 2 times a week. After about 12 months I started to notice a fog would happen inside the clear window of the meter. I thought nothing of it because the razor was still working normally. After 18 months, the meter stopped working but again, it didn't effect the performance of the shaving so I stuck it out. Right around the same time a spring in the flip up trimmer became dislodged and it would not stay shut. Again, I did not use this feature often, so I wrapped some electric tape around it and continued use. Then this past week it stopped working all together. I assumed the battery had gone dead. I did some research online and thought I might be able to replace the battery with relative ease and not have to buy a new $200+ shaver. So I decided to open the casing and did not like what I saw. The entire inside was corroded and rusty. One battery connector on the back of the unit broke free where it was corroded through. The black backing was stained green from the corrosion and the screws that hold the casing together were rusted. When I opened the case, I found many of the metal parts on the inside were rusted and circuit board had an area that was fried from corrosion. I have pictures I have shared to show you what it looks like. I contacted Braun via e-mail and have not heard a response after 5 days. It is no longer under warrantee, however it does claim to be \\"waterproof\\" and I had higher expectations for a $200+, top of line, best money can buy shaver.
  804. There is nothing exception about the shaver that merits a $200+ price. Very disappointed with Braun. At $35+ per replacement screen not including the cleaning fluid this is the most expensive ordinary shave you will ever have. I bought it to replace my old Braun electric shaver and was very disappointed to find it wasn't any better. Save your money this shaver is for the guy who has to have... ... well you all know that guy. Pros Lots of features like; plastic case to store while traveling, only shaver I know that removes curled set in hair, very ergonomically comfortable, LCD screen to view charge time and cleaning. This great when travelling and need to know if needs a charge. It also helps to keep the battery from developing a memory. Partially drained batteries recharged half way down too many times will no longer discharge past the half way point. You can drain it as far you want and recharge from there. Cons The cutting screens are too far apart allowing the whisker cutter to sometimes scrape (not scratch) across your skin. But then it wouldn't remove the curled set in hair. The scraping could be mostly my fault since I like to dig in and get a close a shave as possible. but then I never had this problem with my other Braun, lost it. Almost wish the whisker rake was separate. Heats up because of its high speed motor (the motor is that strong) but nothing uncomfortable.
  805. This thing rocks. I love everything about this shaver. I have always used Braun shavers...and this is pretty close to the perfect shaver. Very quiet also as a bonus. I love the cleaning process and the LCD status for both hygiene and battery. The CCR cartridges seem to last a long time. You get what you pay for with this shaver.
  806. It's a system therefore it is bulky. You have to shave opposite direction to get a smoothe shave. Blades are easy to glide. cleaning can be done maually ot auto. This is only for dry shaving.
  807. I've had this razor for about 2 weeks and could not be happier. It provides a close and comfortable shave. The self-cleaning feature is terrific - it leaves a lemon-fresh smell. The razer is also significantly quieter than my last razor.
  808. This is an excellent shaver that surpasses previous shavers I have used in terms of ease of use, comfort and quality of shave. Although it is expensive, I am happy with my purchase. It has been in the repair shop twice since I purchased it in November 2007 (it is now February 2008). The first time the repair was done quickly because no parts were involved. The second repair required parts. After waiting a month for the part(s) to arrive, I decided that since the shaver was still operable, I would pick it up from the repair shop and check back periodically to see if the part has arrived.
  809. I have been shaving MANY years and this is the best razor I have ever used - both electric and blade. The shaver is comfortable to use. It gives a great shave and the cleaning system requires no effort. I actually look forward to shaving every morning!!
  810. Without doubt, this is the best electronic razer currently on the market. In the past, I have had three problems with electronic shaver systems: 1. Cleaning 2. Failing to shave close enough/missing hair 3. Pinching As far as cleaning, this product is top notch. It requires next to no maintenance except exchanging a cleaning pack (which will run you less than $5.00 a month). I shave every day and run my model on ECO clean and my pack last right at two months. They have definitely improved on how close the razor shaves to your skin and how much hair the razor misses. I hair on my neck grows in random directions and is not consistent. Out of my whole neck, there are probably 4-5 hairs that grow in such a way that prevent this shaver from being able to shave them... but this is easily taken care of with 1-cleanup-swipe from a Mach 3. Overall, I'd say there is room for improvement, but under no circumstances should that prevent you from purchasing this awesome shaver. As far as pinching, this shaver has yet to pinch me, pull my hair or cut my in anyway. Overall, I'd say this joker is top notch. Hopefully soon, a private company will be smart enough to come out and sell the special alcohol that goes in the refill stations, so you can recycle them and spend a lot less on maintenance.
  811. Just got this shaver as a Christmas gift from my wife, and I must say it is awesome! The shave I am getting after initial use is on par with what I get with a Fusion razor. I have sensitive skin and get painful razor burn after every shave with regular razors - Mach 3, Sensor, Fusion - did not matter, shaving was a painful experience. Which is why I never shaved everyday. Just hated it. Not to mention putting on cold shaving gel early in the morning during the winters. With the razor and because of razor burn, I could not shave closely along my jawline and on my neck for fear of getting sensitivity, rashes, redness and cuts in that area. No such problem with the Pulsonic. As such, I can potentially get a better shave with an electric shaver than a razor. I am still trying the Pulsonic out, and they say it takes a good three weeks for your face to get adjusted to a new shaver. Good thing Braun provides a 30-day guarantee - though I do not anticipate taking them up on that offer. Even with a couple of shaves, I am getting as close a shave as my razor. And the razor burn is gone! My previous experience with an electric shaver was 8 years ago, when I purchased a then-topline Norelco rotary model (6000-series, if I remember correctly). I wanted to switch to electrics back then for the same reason I want to switch now: painful razor burn and messy shaving creams/gels. Unfortunately, the Norelco rotary system gave me lots of in-grown hairs, especially on my neck and near the jaw line. Also, the shaver never properly captured all the shaved hairs, leaving a mess on the sink for me to clean, as well having to clean the shaver itself - double work and an annoyance. Each person's face and hair is different and they react differently to rotary versus foil electric shavers. I gave up on the Norelco because of the hassles and grudgingly went back to old fashioned razors. I guess I should have tried the Braun shavers first instead. I had been keeping an eye out for the newBraun models, especially when they came out with the cleaning systems few years ago. Minimalist industrial design and generally built like tanks at a slightly premium price - that was my general impression of the Braun shavers. But having spent money on the Norelco and being burned, I did not risk making another purchase then and wasting more money. Well, I am glad I waited till they introduced the Pulsonic model and my wife got me the 9595. The Pulsonic 9595 deals with nearly all the complaints I had with electric shavers, and based on my brief usage, I believe it will give me a great shave as well. The cleaning system is pure genius in my opinion: makes daily use of the shaver as simple as taking it off the cleaning station, turning on the shaver and shaving, followed by simply placing the shaver back in its resting spot and pressing the \\"start cleaning\\" button. The station literally takes care of everything else - from analyzing the level of cleaning needed, to cleaning and lubricating the shaver head and blades, to drying out the shaver head for the next shave and keeping the shaver fully charged. This is really a fool-proof system they have developed. Curiously, the shaver comes out smelling like lemon pledge because the alcohol bath has a lemon scent. Only down side is that the cleaning solution needs to be replaced about once per month, but the cost is reasonable (especially with the Amazon subscription) compared to the wonderful job the cleaning system does keeping the shaver cleaned and ready every time. Nice of Braun to continue using the same cartridge design across all their models - in sharp contrast to their cousins in the Gillette division. Compared to previous Braun shavers, the Pulsonic has a lithium battery, so keeping the shaver in the cleaning base plugged in all the time is not an issue. Plus the base is smart enough to turn itself off after 10 minutes of inactivity so that it does not continuously juice the lithium battery (overnight, forexample). Like I said, Braun has developed an incredibly smart system of shaver maintenance. I am very impressed. The only complaint I have is the quality of the plastic used in the outer shell of the cleaning station - feels very cheap and fragile. Especially for the price one pays for the whole package, they should have used better materials. The shaver itself thankfully suffers from no such faults. While it is plastic, the quality of the materials used in the body is top notch, and the shaver exudes a sturdy feel to it. And despite what the product images on the packaging and on web sites may indicate, most of the body is covered in a quality rubber like material that helps maintain a good grip while shaving. The LCD display at the bottom is nice, showing battery level and how dirty the shaver is since the last cleaning. Given the ~$40 MSRP difference between the 9595 and 9585, the extra cost is not worth it since the only difference between the two models is level of information shown for battery and cleaning needs on the shaver. However, most online stores are selling both models at almost the same prices - so might as well purchase the topline model. The shaver has lithium ion batteries - generally believed to have better performance compared to the Ni-Cad batteries all other previous Braun shavers had. Another very nice feature is the ability to use the shaver while plugged in with the auto-detect wall charging plug, and not having to wait for the shaver to recharge before you start using it. The shaver also has a 5-minute quick charge feature. There have been some complaints about the travel case. While I do not have the previous Braun model's travel cases for comparison, I like the hard plastic tube that the Pulsonic can be stored in. It protects the whole shaver when it might get banged around in the luggage during travel. There is even a small space to store a cleaning brush in the case - makes sense since you will need it to clean the shaverwhen away from home and not have access to the cleaning base. People have also mentioned that there is no plastic clip to protect the shaving head, unlike other shavers that include such a thing. I don't think it is necessary: I store the shaver in the cleaning base when at home, and in the travel case when traveling, and don't feel the need to have a plastic clip for the head. I can see now why the reviews on this model have been almost universally stellar - and why this shaver is sold out almost every where. Sure there are some detractors - understandable since not every man's face and beard is the same. There is that 30-day guarantee, just in case. But I do not hesitate in recommending this shaver. Braun really as produced a great shaver - both in terms of shaving and ease of use.
  812. This is a replacement for my Braun 7505. I've had it for 2-1/2 months now and overall I like it. For the record, I get heavy dark stubble which is a challenge for electrics.<br />Pros:<br />1. It excels at cutting neck area compared to other electrics including the 7505.<br />2. Excellent battery life.<br />3. It even works well if you miss a few days and have longer growth. It doesn't pull long hairs.<br />4. No skin irritation.<br />5. Shaving takes less time.<br />Cons:<br />1. The trimmer is awful. It is does a very poor job on nose hair and sideburns. The trimmer location and angle make it difficult to navigate. The 7505's trimmer was far superior.<br />2. The cleaning unit is ugly, very large, slow and very noisy while cleaning.<br />3. The cleaning fluid is an expensive sales gimmick.<br />4. The hygiene monitor basically just counts how many uses since cleaning. If you manually clean the razor the hygiene monitor will still show dirty. This is bad because the cleaning unit uses more fluid based on the hygiene monitor. I thought I could save money by cleaning every other day, but it uses about the same amount of fluid.<br />5. It doesn't shave as close as other electrics. It definitely looks like an electric shave. On the 7505 I could get a very close shave if I took my time. Extra time and several passes does not seem to improve the closeness on the 9595.<br />6. The plastic travel holder is bulky. A blade cover like the 7505 would be preferable.
  813. This is easily the best electric shaver I have ever used. I've tried other foil and 3-head electrics in the past with mixed results, but none have shaved as close or as comfortably as the 9595. I have also used 3 and 5 blade traditional and vibrating razors. These work for a couple of weeks, but after that they start irritating the skin on my neck resulting in a rash. I have experienced no discomfort with the 9595 and it shaves almost as close as a blade. It certainly shaves close enough for my purposes, and I wear a suit and tie every work day. The automatic cleaning is a God-send! Just shave, put the unit into the base, push the cleaning button, and walk away. Repeat next morning. Fast, efficient, and effective. What more could one ask for?
  814. As far as electric shavers go, this is one of the best I've used, if not THE best yet. Before I got this one, I used a Norelco Spectra 8894XL for three years with almost no problems (the battery went wonky, but I got a warranty replacement. No problems since.). There's nothing technically wrong with my Norelco, but I'd have to go back over my face with a dry manual razor to get the spots that it just can't do (neck, adam's apple, chin). After reading some reviews of the Pulsonic, I decided to give it a go. Upon my first use, I noticed I got a closer shave than with the Norelco, and in less time. I still have a little difficulty with my problem areas (see above), but there is a marked improvement. That, and the self-cleaning charger is cool. So while no electric shaver can match a manual, the Braun Pulsonic 9595 is about as close as you're going to get right now. If you're in the market for a new electric shaver, or considering switching from rotary to foil shavers (and the price doesn't scare you away), give this one a shot.
  815. I finally replaced my Braun shaver after about 15 years. While this one is very pricey the quality is impressive. I get a closer shave in about 1/2 the time. The cleaner is noisy, but not really an issue for me.
  816. I bought the Braun Pulsonic for my 83 year old husband whose skin is not as flexible as in his younger days, and he has had some minor skin cancer removals (because of his love of the sun). He likes the shaver as its shaving mechanism is easy on his skin and leaves the skin feeling smooth. He highly recommends this product.
  817. I purchased both this razor and the Norelco 1060. While I kept this razor since it shaves a bit closer than the Norelco, it feels like a oversized pickle in your hand as opposed to the Norelco 1060 which is easily maneuvered and feels great on your face. The major advantage of the Braun is the lithium ion battery which does not require a complete discharge before recharging. Further, the Braun does not travel well, given its size and weight. I purchased a cheap Norelco (8140XL) for this purpose. In summary, this razor shaves close (although no electric razor shaves as close as a blade). The lithium ion battery is a major plus. However, its size and weight are a negative factor for those who travel a great deal.
  818. After 8yrs with my Norelco i decided to try an upgrade. This razor was not as advertised for me. Foil does not get as close a shave as lift & cut for me. Nothing was indicated when finalizing the sale either. Buyer beware.
  819. This razor is very good. My husband has trouble getting a real close shave and this razor gets the closest he has used in a long time. Very comfortable to hold.

  821. I am posting this for my boyfriend who has &#34;extreme&#34; sensitive skin on his face and neck. He is so happy about this shaver, which doesn't turn his face red and irritate his face after shaving. And, the shaving is effortless with this shaver. He doesn't need to keep going back to the missed areas. This is the best shaver he has ever had. It's the most expensive model he looked online, but worth every penny of it.
  822. This product is actually quite astounding. It has lasted for 6 years without a problem. The battery has always lasted around 7 days, it still shaves like it did when it was brand new with replacement cartridges every 8 months or so and the cleaning solution once per week. (To preserve solution, I keep it out of the holder with the lid on it and that prevents evaporation, making each cartridge last around 4 months for me!)<br /><br />Pros:<br />+ Great, close shave every day for an every-day shaver like me (or sometimes twice a day shaver)<br />+ Battery lasts for week-long trips and the included case, brush, and oil are fantastic for trips to keep it clean<br />+ Replacement cartridges and cleaning solution are both readily available on Amazon for cheap, easy re-ordering<br />+ Never nicks, cuts, or damages face<br />+ Great for trimming beard, mustache, eyebrows, sideburns, neck, or basically hair anywhere!<br />+ Shave easily on the go, without any solutions<br />+ Very easy to clean even just with water, but using the included oil helps maintain the blades without the solution<br /><br />Cons:<br />+ Rough pulling for infrequent shavers who like to go a few days in between shaving<br />+ Shave poorly around facial irregularities in smoothness such as a cleft chin or moles<br />+ Aggravates acne during breakouts (as most shaving will) [Though using Nivea Post-Shave Balm helps greatly and is also available on Amazon]
  823. This shaver is great. Replaced my Syncro 7540 and is far better. Admittedly, it is not a fair comparison, since I never spent the money to replace the foil or cutterblock, nor did I have a clean and charge stand for the 7540. However, the shave with the 9595 is considerably closer, smoother, and less irritating that I remember a shave with the 7540 ever being. A good bit more money than replacing the foil and cutterblock, but well worth it. I use the pop-up trimmer to keep my beard close-cropped. (What I shave is my neck, which is by far the heaviest growth.) The trimmer on the 7540 was better for this, being wider and positioned such that I could see much better to trim around my moustache; however, the trimmer on the 9595 still works fine for this. And yes, the cleaning system does make a little noise, but certainly not enough to be bothersome, unless you were to turn it on at bedtime, right next to your bedroom, when the house was otherwise still and quiet, rather than right after shaving in the morning, when it makes sense to do it.
  824. I've used Remington and Norelco electric shavers in the past and have been disappointed with their performance compared to a blade (Gillette Fusion). I decided to try the Braun based on the positive reviews and the shaver did not disappoint. The Braun shaves just about as close as a blade with much less irritation. With the use of Williams Lectric shave, I think the result is better than a blade. The Braun clean & renew system automatically tells you the level of cleaning you need. I use the system every other shave or so. I've used the Braun for about a month, and I actually enjoy shaving with it - all in all, if you're looking for an electric razor, I highly recommend the Braun 9595.
  825. I hate shaving and did a lot of research before buying this razor. I have a very thick beard that looks like I have not shaved by noon. With conventional razors, I cannot shave against the grain due to my very coarse beard and sensitive skin. I love this razor. Since buying the razor I have gotten the closest shave ever without razor burn like most electric razors. I shave after taking a shower, but have used it both ways. I have found it is a bit closer when shaving after getting out of the shower, but both ways are very comfortable on your face. Believe me when I say this thing is a hidden gem in the razor world. My life of shaving has become 100 percent easier and it is actually enjoyable to shave now, versus the conventional way that I have used my entire life. I hope this helps someone looking for a razor that is in my situation, coarse beard, sensitive skin, best razor ever. The only con to the razor which I have found with all electric razors is that the area around your neck is hard to shave and may require a conventional razor about once a week even if you do a great job shaving....
  826. Ever since I saw \\"How It's Made\\" on TV several weeks ago featuring the the building of the Braun Pulsonic, I've wanted one. But, like many, the price was daunting. For a very long time I have preferred my electric (Norelco) over a blade because the blade just takes too darn long. I only had to make one concession: the blade shaves closer. Then, just days ago, I \\"bit the bullet\\" so to speak, and ordered the Braun. The sheer weight of favorable reviews outweighed the price for me. To make a long story somewhat shorter, the Braun is like no other shaver on earth. It does, indeed, rival a blade shave, and it does it eons more quickly and comfortably. On top of that, it's built like a fine watch, and has enough bells and whistles to keep even the most jaded user happy. It is only a small tad \\"noisier\\" than my Norelco, but the comparison ends there. The Braun makes the Norelco hang it's shaver head in shame. I find myself wanting to shave more often, but the efficiency of the Braun would mean I would be shaving mostly-bare skin. If you want the razor of all razors, forget cost and get this one. There's no way in the world that you will end up sorry to did it.

  829. I bought the latest model of Braun 9595 razor for my boyfriend's Christmas's present. He wanted a new electric razor so I did some investigations. If you haven't visited Braun's website to see their video advertisment on the 9595, check it out. It's worth the time investment. As for the razor, there is a significant difference is smoothness. I'm really happy I purchased the Braun 9595, I love the feel of his face against my skin. The only downfall of the product is the design of liquid reservoir in the base unit. If you pack the base or tilt it, the liquid will spill. The work around is, just take the razor and not the base unit if you're leaving out of town for a few days. Other than that small design flaw, I highly recommend this razor over the other designs available today.
  830. That Shaver is just wonderful. it doesn´t irrited the skin and let it like a \\"Culito de bebe\\" (baby pompis).
  831. I got the Pulsonic 9595 for Christmas this year. For the last year or so, I experimented with many types of blades, The Sensor Extra, Mach 3, the Quattro 4, etc. They all shaved well, but I did not enjoy the nicks, and inevitable irritation and the fact that I virtually HAD to shower immediately after to reduce irritation from the blades. I read lots of reviews on the Pulsonic and thought I'd give it a try. I must say that I am impressed. It goes accross the face, neck and lip areas very smoothly. The Face/Cheek areas get sheared after just two light passes, the chin takes a few extras, the upper lip takes a little while and the neck takes the longest, but the whole process is still much more efficient over the blade useage. After a few weeks, I have learned that to catch the neck hairs and some of the odd jawbone area hairs, you have to be creative with which direction you pass the head over your face. I kind of go sideways first, then I Invert the razor (power button down) and drag it upwards to finish it off. The cleaning system is quite effortless, you just pop the razor back into the stand and it will charge the razor and allow you to clean it if you want to. The razor has a meter which keeps track of the \\"hygiene\\" of the razor head. I think it is actually a glorified usage timer, but at any rate, the more tick marks that are missing, the more intense the cleaning it recommends. I have cleaned mine every day on eco mode and the fluid is still on the \\"high\\" mark meaning I still have a lot of fluid left after 25 days of use. I also like the fact that it comes with a hard carrying case that you can put the shaver into when travelling. When travelling, you just take the plug from the base and plug it into the razor for charging. If you are only going for a day or 2, the plug would not even be needed, as the battery life would be plenty for a short trip. When travelling, you can just take the head off the unit and rinse the razor to clean. I would definately recommend this razor for someone wanting to get an electric.
  832. This is an excellant electric shaver, but is not as close as a razor. The cleaning system is great and very convienant. Battery life is good, I was on a 7 day trip and the battery had several more days left in it. Overall, if you like the convienance of an electric, this is the best to buy
  833. I got this shaver for a Christmas gift from my fiance. I read all the reviews online and on Men's Health and decided to get this instead of the Phillips. Let me start by saying that I have VERY sensitive skin. This razor did nothing like all the ads states. It was a rough shave. Had to go over my face numerous times and even dig the razor into the the neck to get at some whiskers. It left my face red and bumpy and my skins burned for hours after the shave. I ultimately returned it to Braun being very disappointed and now am searching for a new razor and looking at the new Phillips. I would NOT recommend this shaver to anyone-especially if you have a soft sensitive face and skin. Sorry Braun....Sorry Amazon but I am just being very honest to try and help the other consumers who may look at this. Hope this helps......
  834. I've been using Norelco Shavers for almost 40 years because they tend not to irritate the skin. I was hesitant about using the Braun, but all the positive feedback led me to buy the Braun 9595 from Amazon. I've been using the Braun 9595 for the past 6 weeks and it gives, without a doubt, the closest shave (and it does not pull or irritate the skin). TIP - I keep the cleaning fluid in the large cleaning system casing with the system open (lifted upwards) and the lid on the cleaning liquid to prevent evaporation. I only uncap the liquid when I am ready to clean the shaver. I have been cleaning the Braun after every 4th shave and the fluid, after 6 weeks, is still 2/3 full. It should last at least 2 months that way.
  835. I typically don't write reviews, even on products that give extraordinary results. So, you know this is an atypical review from the outset. First, you need to know that I've used several Braun shave systems in the past, the most recent being the Activator 8585 system. While that system did a fairly adequate job, there were areas under my chin and on my neck (Adam's apple in particular) that were frequently irritated. I've also tried several Norelco shavers with the floating heads and lift-and-cut cutters, but they took too much work and way too long to give an adequate shave. After reading well over 100 reviews about many different makes and models of shavers, I decided to give the Braun Pulsonic System 9595 a try. I was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews, but I made up my mind to give it several weeks for my skin to adjust to the newly designed shave head, even though I had been using a Braun up until that time. From the very first shave I knew this was a unique shaver. It is much quieter than my previous Braun, and it's as though I'm getting a face and neck massage as I'm shaving each morning. As I've learned over the past month or so, the key to getting a consistent, close shave is holding the shaver at a 90 degree angle to the area you're shaving. It also helps to pull the skin tight and shave against the growth grain. I've read some complaints about the trimmer but have found it to be both precise and effective. I also like the fact that it protrudes at a 90 degree angle so you can be very precise with it in tight areas. Overall, I am well pleased with this shaver and highly recommend it. Not only does it give a close, smooth, irritation-free shave, it's a pleasure to use. Oh, I almost forgot about the lock on the shaver head. I've read where some have had problems getting it to lock. However, the key to it is to allow the head to tilt back as the lock is being pushed into the locked position. Once it's locked, the head is actually tilted forward, so it's much easier to maintain a 90 degree angle in some of the hard to reach spots. Then, to remove the lock, simply push it in the opposite direction to allow the shaver head to glide freely. Finally, while the shaver is not inexpensive, I feel it's well worth the investment. I also like the cleaning system, which I use daily to keep the shaver head clean and lubricated. I can definitely tell a difference in the closeness of the shave and how more easily it glides along the face and neck areas. Happy shaving! Jim
  836. There is no perfect foil razor. This is no perfect blade razor. All will have drawbacks. So a 5 means it's as good as anyone has ever done. This razor replaced a previous Syncro and it's a better razor. Shave is much closer. The thing about foils is that they do better with 2 days growth than 1. On a daily basis, it still can't get every spot (I have a TOUGH face). But if I take a day off of shaving, the pulsonic makes my face as smooth as a babies butt. Except for two spots on my neck. Still, it's the closest razor shave I have ever had, and it doesn't ever irritate the skin. The cleaning and charging system is much, much, MUCH improved over the old razor. Fluid lasts longer, charging is now digitally controlled user transparent, and the white color of the base blends in much more with most bathrooms. I know some men complained that the white is \\"feminine\\" but let's face it, bathrooms are usually white and I imagine a major complaint about the black bases was that \\"wives and girlfriends thought it was ugly.\\" Problem solved, and now they can't complain so much about the large speakers in your living room, right? ;) I would recommend this razor to anyone. I keep my old razor at my vacation house now, and I used it all week and it just wasn't the same. I missed the new one. I've never missed a razor before... :)

  845. I bought this product a couple of months ago, and it is definitely a really great product. This was my first electrical razor and I have always heard that electricals do not shave as close as a blade. When I first used it, I was really impressed by how close it shaved; it wasn't as close as a blade, but pretty darn close and I was happy with it.
