  853. This shaver is as close on most areas as when I use my Gillette Fusion Power (5 blades). There are a few areas on my neck that the hairs lay so close to the skin, it takes probably five strokes, or a twisting action to get it close. But, there is NO discomfort with the Braun Pulsonic as there is with a blade. Some people say the cleaning system is not as good as the razor, being expensive, noisy, etc. I agree that it is rather noisy, but if you think about the ease of use factor, it's not that expensive. The cleaning system cleans, lubricates, and dries the shaver, and very well at that. You don't have to worry about leaving it open to dry after rinsing it clean, or lubricating it once a week, since the water doesn't lubricate it. The solution has a semi-pleasant, citrus smell. The unit remembers how much it's been run since the last cleaning, and the base adjusts the cleaning cycle to that.<br /><br />Pros:<br />easy to use<br />comfortable on your face<br />ergonomical (for me anyway)<br />close (let your face get used to it for a while before you judge)<br />built very solid<br />cartridges of solution make for easy changing (no bottles to mess with)<br />base is reasonably sized, especially compared to a cleaning base for a rotary shaver, which doesn't heat dry it<br />has a lcd to remind you when to change the foil and cutter<br /><br />Cons:<br />Cleaning cycles are reasonably noisy<br />cleaning cartridges represent additional expense (although only about $5.50 a cartridge, which should last almost two months if you clean every other shave, {get it down so there's two bars left in the hygiene meter, so it'll stay on the normal clean cycle.})<br /><br />Final Thoughts:<br />I paid $130 two years ago for a self cleaning rotary shaver. this is not even twice the price, and is MUCH more than twice as good. I will never go back to a rotary. Reasonably priced, although it could be a little cheaper, maybe around $180 would be the price at which I wouldn't go with ANYTHING else.
  854. My older Braun 8595 needed $30 worth of new cutting blades and foils, so being a typical dumb male, I decided to buy a new $215 Braun 9595 instead. Well, turns out that the 9595 provides the exact same shave quality as the 8595, but is a bit noisier, with somewhat lower build quality, and with a goofier LCD display than the 8595 has. And the 9595's packaging is an embarrassment -- it reminds me of Apple's original iPod packaging, simply a terrible waste of paper and plastic. The 9595's \\"Pulsonic\\" quality claims are meaningless. Believe me, it doesn't provide any better or closer shave than its predecessor, the 8595. I was foolish to purchase it. Its only improvement seems to be a \\"quick clean\\" setting on the cleaning base -- which seems to be the normal \\"economical clean\\" without the drying cycle. Big deal! Braun really relied on its marketing department for this 9595 design, instead of its engineering department. Bad Braun!! Buy the 8595 instead, save $100!! Don't get 'suckered' by Braun's advertising.
  855. I'm giving this a one-star due to the fact that I didn't like it enough to return it. Here are some of the positives/negatives to help you decide: Positive: 1. Good, fast shave on hairs all going in one direction (the hairs on my neck swirl a bit and it shaved this very poorly because you have to hit the hairs at the correct upstream angle). 2. Unit does not get hot while working 3. Good battery life (true of all new electrics) 4. Head swivels so it is easy to keep unit in contact with face Negatives: 1. HUGE footprint of the cleaning/recharging unit--it is so large that unless you have a 200 sq foot bathroom with tons of counter space, you will not want it on your counter. 2. No better shave than any other norelco or braun, which can be purchased at a significantly lower price 3. Pulsonic in my opinion is a gimmick--probably does nothing to improve the shave 4. Cleaning solution is expensive--one of the major advantages (besides comfort) of an electric is the cost over time, but with having to buy the cleaning solution, this is eliminated, plus it is one more \\"thing\\" to buy. I've used norelco and braun and have just rinsed them in the sink which is sufficient--my current norelco is over 5 yrs old. Why does a shaver have to be perfectly clean?? I think a quick rinse is fine with me. 5. The small cut hairs fall all over the counter...as opposed to my norelco where most of the hairs are inside the unit until I rinse them out. So the Braun was much messier.
  856. Great product great shave. I would recomend replacing the cleaning fluid and foil shaver heads every other month instead of every third month. Seems to work better that way.
  857. I have owned electric shavers on and off over the years. Usually, I just fall back to using the blade as the electric shaver gets frustrating to use. With this Braun, I am having a very good experience and much better than any electric shaver I have used in the past. So far, no desire to go back to blade because of frustrations of dealing with an bad electric razor. This Braun was expensive, but worth the cost from a convenience and quality of shave stand point. The only question I have is long term use - will I feel the same 12-24 months from now. Here are some key things to keep in mind if you are going to buy it or you have it, to get the most of of it: -Keep it clean. The automatic cleaner makes a huge difference. I find if I clean it every 2-3 days with the auto-cleaner and the blue liquid it comes with, my shave is 10 times better. Keeping it clean is key. -Although not always needed, Electroshave splashed on the faces helps the shave go a bit smoother. Also, if you have not shaved in a few days, Electroshave or something like it + this Braun makes shaving a piece of cake. -Give it a few weeks for your face to get used to the electric shaver. It gets easier and better each week you use it. Also, they shave will never be as close as a razer, but this Braun gives you a shave that looks very good and very smooth. -The convenience of this Braun makes it all worth it when compared to the normal cream and razor. For me, the trade offs are now worth it since the Braun is the first electric to give me a great shave.
  858. Over the years, I have owned several electric shavers from all of the major companies. Unfortunately, I was always a little disappointed in the product's performance. Thankfully, that is not the case this time. This shaver is amazing. It does a fantastic job. I also love the self cleaning feature which also works surprisingly well and keeps the the hair form going everywhere when you are trying to clean the shaver. In fact, there is really no need to manually the shaver anymore. All you have to do is place the shaver in the base and it does all the work for you. The quality of the shave and the added bonus of automatic cleaning make this item a must have. So, please do not be scared away by the higher price. If you are in the market for an electric shaver, give this item some serious consideration. You will be glad you did.
  859. I have gone through three different Braun 7526 shavers over the past seven years, that said, I recently purchased a 9595 and Braun has made it more difficult to use the shaver without the cleaning system. I hardly used the cleaning system on the 7526, it was too much of a hassle not to mention not cost-efficient. On the 9595, Braun suggests you can use hot water and some soap to manually clean the shaver. However, Braun has made it difficult to clean with a brush because on the 9595 unlike the 7526, the foil and cutterblock are connected, so it's impossible to clean the cutterblock with the supplied brush. Add to that the annoying \\"hygiene\\" meter on the bottom of the shaver that keeps blinking \\"-\\" to signify low hygiene even after I have used soap and water to clean the shaver.<br /><br />The bottom line for me is the shaver works better than the 7526, but the cleaning system is very annoying. Braun is banking on customers using the cleaning system and purchasing refills, and has created the product in a way that it becomes somewhat of a hassle to clean manually. You can still clean manually, but from my experience it won't be as clean as it would have been had the cutterblock and foil not been attached (which would allow for brush cleaning). And yes, I followed all the directions and ran the water the way the instructions said, with the shaver on, but the low hygiene sign keeps blinking. I am seriously considering returning the shaver because I don't need the cleaning system and because of the way Braun has created the product to dissuade people from manual cleaning. It's not even likely Braun will release a 9595 without the cleaning system, because the inherent problem in my opinion is the foil and cutterblock being attached, thus preventing brush cleaning of each segment of the cutterblock.
  860. I have used Braun for over 35 years but this product coming out at 21st Century is the WORST! I am very disappointed with this product which comes with a big price tag. I have a sensitive skin and after each use my skin gets extremely irritated and bumpy that I have to apply Hydrocortisone cream to soothe it. The trimmer is worthless and does not do the job. I have decided to go back to razors because I can shave with one stroke and I do not have to pass the shaver on and on many times and burn my skin with the heat. Adding salt to injury I have to use the Braun liquid to clean it each time with additional cost. I would NOT recommend this shaver to anyone. If you are able to test it before buying do it otherwise, either buy a cheaper one or just use the razor.

The razor is more expensive than most, but worth every penny.

  866. I've been shaving with the Braun Syncro 7680, and can honestly tell you that it's provided the best shave ever. The new system seems to shave a bit quicker, but would irritate a lot more and shave no where near as close. I could go two days with the old shaver before \\"needing\\" to shave again. With the new Pulsonic, I would need to shave everyday- bummer. After hoping for the best and allowing my face to adjust for 4 weeks, nothing changed.   867. Over the years I have tried numerous electric shavers and was always disappointed that they didn't come close to shaving with a wet razor. It is comfortable in your hand, not as loud as some other razors, and you can lock the moving head to get into places like under your nose. I was a little sceptical of the cleaning accessory but that actually seems to work really well too. Overall, I am very happy with this razor.

He'll tell anyone who'll listen that it is the best shaving experience, best technology in the world. He has actually had skeptical friends and family members sit down while HE shaved them with it, all the while raving of how incredible it is. Scarey I know, but perfectly true and they've all loved the results. He says he gets a smoother shave with it and the auto cleaning feature is wonderful as well as the flip out trimmer. If you're looking to buy an electric shaver, this is the one to get. You won't be sorry.

  870. I have used Braun electric shavers for over ten years. I recommend it highly. Yes, it is an investment but when you consider that I had my last Braun shaver for 8 years without a problem, the cost is neglible when you consider the recurring cost of purchasing disposable razors and shaving cream.
  871. This shaver is just ridiculous. I'd say it gets 95% as close as a straight blade and it doesn't even feel like you're shaving! It just glides right across your face like a spoon. It's really amazing. I bought this to replace my 8 year old Braun 7680 Clean & Renew. I used that one daily for the past 8 years and it still works like new, I just wanted a change (this is truly a testament to Braun's craftsmanship and durability). I'm happy that Braun hasn't decided to cut costs on their products by cheapening the brand and outsourcing to China like all American manufacturers do. This is made in Germany and you can tell. It just exudes class. This is probably one reason for the high price, but it's worth it. I'd rather pay higher prices for quality goods that will last than something cheap that will either break down or need to be replaced in a year. People complain about the price, but when you take into consideration how long these things last, the price really is not that much. A $50 shaver every two years is more costly than a $220 shaver every 10 years. In any case, putting costs aside, this shaver has to be the best on the market. It is a huge upgrade from Braun's previous flagship, the old Series 7. Don't be hesitant to buy this thing, it's worth its weight in gold.

  884. After reading some of the reviews I got excited and started to think this might be the holy grail of electric shavers. That wonderful piece of machinery that will free me from the shackles of the morning showers necessary to shave with a blade. Alas, I was mislead.   885. Ok, so after reading the reviews of others let me summarize. All but the occasional outlier agree that this is an excellent razor. The dispute largely comes from the majority who are completely pleased with their purchase, and a significant minority who think the razor is overpriced. I'm with the minority. As to the quality issue--no issue there. Excellent razor, smoother and a bit quicker in shave than my old Remington Titanium 5520, probably a bit closer shaver, too. Perhaps it is most accurate to focus on the \\"quicker\\" rather than \\"closer.\\" That is, it gets to where it's going a LITTLE faster than my older, cheaper shaver. However (updating this review after months of use, when the blades are no longer quite as new...), areas that the Remington was not perfect on, the Braun doesn't do significantly better either. That's my face-- and that's the state of electric razor technology. There's been no magic bullet. This is not an amazing new technology, Braun's marketing success with \\"pulsonic\\" notwithstanding. If you now feel compelled to touch up on important days with a blade--you still will after buying this. Another performance related issue deserves comment--the oft-mentioned noise issue. I don't get that complaint. This is quieter than the Remington, nothing more than a significant hum. On the whole I'm very pleased with it. But all that said--is it worth the price? That's the real issue. I got this at the discounted price, including cleaning base system, of $219 and free shipping. The Remington, which used to be pricier, is available now for about $50 these days. Is the Braun 400%+ better? Not hardly. Over four times the price (even with new discounts) and not even 50% better is more like it. And 50% would be high. Play with the math, but you get the idea: the difference is evolutionary, not revolutionary, and those who wax poetic about getting what you pay for are perhaps overly defensive over their spending habits. :) This is an improvement over the lower endrazors--but neither indispensable nor magical. (A lot of the price hike goes to bells and whistles, of course. Having a \\"hygiene meter\\" hardly gives you a closer shave, for instance.) My ultimate decision: keep it. It's classy and excellent. It is used every day. And will last years. Under those circumstances, spending extra for some modest improvement is worth it to me as the cost is amortized by both frequency of use and the time it is likely to last. A lot of that decision to keep it is centered around inertia, however. It is a hassle to send it back and start looking again, and I might be no happier in Round 2. It is not worth the effort for the $75 or whatever that I perhaps overpaid. I probably won't buy a similarly priced model next time around. You'll be pleased. You'll see some improvement (smoothness, in particular). But as with most luxury products, when you troll for \\"best ofs,\\" the hideous price spike rarely makes you think you are getting value for the extra money, even if it is better.
  886. This is my first shaver and i definitely love this product. The problem is, no matter how hard i try i cannot get a clean shave around my neck region, especially the side lower neck regions. Apart from that you will never find a difference from blade in the other regions. Another set back is the cleaning process. Once you shave, the hygiene indicator comes down and no matter how hard you clean with water ( which they say we can do ) it will never show complete hydiene bar. The hygiene bar is complete only when you use the cleaning system which is very odd. If you leave the cleaning catride in the system, you will not be able to use it more than twice or thrice since all the liquid will evaporate. For this reason, you will have to pull the cleaning catridge from the cleaning system and put the lid back on every time. So, do not throw the small lid for the cleaning catridges. Though it works fine, personally i feel the cleaning system is very expensive as three catridges cost you around 20 dollars. You can get cheaper ones (other than Braun) which would cost you 50 bucks for a 12 pack. I am still adapting to an electronic shaver and hope this review is helpful. Overall the shaver is expensive but worth every penny if something is done to the cleaning system or if the cleaning liquids are a bit cheaper.

  889. I have always hate hate HATED shaving. I have used every new razor to hit the market in the hopes of finding a close comfortable shave that wouldn't irritate my sensitive skin. Every few years I would try the hot new electric shaver (Panasonic, Braun, Norelco) and be sorely disappointed, literally. I had decided that electrics are junk. I would always buy the latest and greatest razors on the market as soon as they came out hoping against hope that I could use them comfortably every day. I have used the Gillette Sensor, Mach Three (Power), Schick Quattro, and now the Gillette Fusion (power). I also use a very high quality shaving cream and a shaving brush. I also shave 99% of the time in the shower. Even with all of this, I couldn't shave every day without irritating my face terribly. I would avoid shaving at all costs and I would look like a vagrant! After seeing a show about how this razor is made and all of the technology that went in to it, I decided to give it a try. All I can say is WOW! My first shave with this shaver was smooth and comfortable. Everyone (including the Braun instruction booklet) says that it will take 2-3 weeks of using it for your face to adjust, but even from the first shave I love this shaver. It is like no other shaver I have ever used. The ultrasonic pulses make the experience really smooth, and the foil feels great against my skin. Add in the fact that it cleans itself, and this thing is a modern miracle. I can actually shave every day in comfort. Now for the big question, does it shave as close as a blade? The answer is that it depends on the blade. It doesn't shave as close as my fusion power with my good shave cream and brush in the shower. But it does shave as close as ANY 2 bladed razor out there and possibly as close as the Mach 3. Basically if you shave very close with a razor and wait about 1/2 hour and feel your face, that is how close this shaver shaves (and that is pretty darn close). And my face hasn't even adjusted yet. I'll try to update this review after 3 weeks, but I am totally happy with it right now, it can only get better as my face adjusts. This shaver is DEFINITELY worth every penny. Don't skimp on a lower model to save a few bucks, you'll be happy you didn't. That said, I don't know how the top of the line models from Norelco or Panasonic are... They are probably very good too, but I cannot imagine that they could be any better. UPDATE 2/23/10: I've been using this shaver for 1.5 months now and I have to say I love it more than I did when I first wrote this review. The shaver produces a close comfortable shave right out of the box the first time you use it, but after about a month, is is even better. From what I understand that is because your face adjusts. Whatever the reason, I am getting the absolute best shaves of my life, with little or no irritation!! I have thrown out all of my old razors and shave cream. I will NEVER go back to a blade! I am amazed to actually be saying this, but this shaver is that good. I also recommend using \\"Lectric Shave\\" pre-shave. I used to loathe shaving and avoid it at all costs, now I look forward to shaving. I cannot recommend this shaver enough.

  891. I replaced my Braun 8585 with this new model, and I am very satisfied with my purchase. This one is by far the best. The shave is very, very close, even compared to the excellent 8585. I can only assume and hope that this is the case. Maybe my beard has changed as rotary shavers have always worked better for me than foil however either this machine has changed this or it's me.   901. I have actually purchased two of these in the past two years, and here are my summary conclusions:<br />Pros:<br />Very close shave, the best of any electric to date<br /><br />Cons:<br />The first unit had a nasty habit of turning my face blue after use...the center foil is blue, and it consistently bled onto my skin meaning I always had to use it pre-shower.<br />If you let your beard get longer, it will pull some of the hairs out rather than cut (painful). I am not up for shaving and having lubricating oil all over my face, so I am tossing this one and won't be coming back to the Pulsonic.<br /><br />Anyway, got a few nice shaves but overall felt it was a waste of money.
  902. My third Braun. Well made, excellent shave.
  903. The good: - This shaver is relatively quiet. - The cleaning/charging system is very nice. The bad: - The price ($186.00). With a high price comes high expectations. - The shave. On my face, the shave is no better than the shave I got from my Remington MS 280 (about $40.00). It didn't seem like the \\"pulsonic\\" feature helped at all. On my neck, there were spots that I just could not get. I tried shaving in all sorts of directions, but I just could not get all of my neck closely shaved. Generally, it was good enough, but if I wanted to get a really close shave on my neck, I had to bust out the Remington. I saved the best for last: This shaver pulled my hairs. Talk about frustrating and painful. This thing won't be pulling my hairs anymore since I smashed it against the sink in frustration ... embarrassing, I know. But, at least I won't be using this shaver anymore.

Frustrated I gave up on it and began using a handheld razor. My wife was kind enough to purchase a series 7 for me at a cost of $220.00. Though I had bad luck with Braun I gave it a try. It was a really nice razor that did a decent job of shaving. But after only 4 months it stopped working completely. I contacted Braun who again had me send it to a service center. After paying shipping and insurance my razor returned still not functioning. I contacted Braun who said I need to send it in again and that they could do nothing for me. How many times do I have to send a razor into a service center to get one that works more than 4 months. After insurance, shippin and all those expensive cartridges I have had to waste each time I send it in, I have spent over $400 to still have a Braun razor that does not work. If I had written a review within 2 months of getting this razor, as most of the reviewers of this product probably did, I would have given it 4-5 stars. But Braun products just don't work, and their customoer service is horrible. Do yourself a favor and go with a different company because you will get this product and be happy for a few months but then the frustration begins.
  907. I bought this very expensive [[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]] because of reviews like \\"closest thing to a blade\\" type hype. Don't believe it. You dang sure aren't paying for a close shave. Sure, it's self-cleaning, which means you have to fork out even more money per month to change the fluid cartridge, which makes it perpetually expensive. And I couldn't believe their instructions: Pull your skin tight and shave against the grain for best results. Even with that, it just doesn't cut it.....literally!   908. Best razor I have owned. This one replace a 5 year old Braun with the battery giving out. Rather than replace the battery, I purchased the new razor. It was a great decision.
  909. Okay, I have had this razor for about 5 months. I got it for Father's Day 2010. I have had electric razors before, my old Braun died after about 4yrs and I had been using the Gillette Fusion for about 6 months. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS Braun! The only time you really get a close shave is when you wake up first thing in the morning and shave before anything else. It's true, I did not believe Braun when they suggested it in their manual, but it is true. Even then the shave is not as close as a blade. The biggest problem is the cleaning unit base. It is poorly made and the contacts in the unit get depressed and stuck. The posts on the razor are supposed to touch these and activate the cleaning. Well the springs wear out after a short time and they do not make contact, and the unit will not charge or clean the razor. So this means you have to manually charge and clean the razor again. Do yourself a favor, don't waste your money on the cleaning unit and learn to clean it manually every couple of days. Personally, save your money and just use the Gillette Fusion with the battery operated vibrating handle; a much better unit and closer shave.
  910. I have been using this shaver for a month now and absolutely love it. I am 40 and have been shaving electrically my whole life. This is the best shaver I have ever owned. Before I had to have 2 shavers, one for my neck(a Braun) and the other for my face(a Norelco). I just couldn't use a rotary shaver on my neck because it would leave shaver burn badly. So I decided to get this shaver cause I use a Braun for my neck already and the lower end model I have now wasn't fast enough for my face. This one is fast and I can use it on both my neck and face. Nicely built and the head on this thing pivots very nicely. The side burn trimmer cuts very close as well, the only thing is that when you have it popped out, the shaver and your hand is in the way to see where you are shaving on your side burns. Not a big deal though. Well worth the money. I only use the cleaning feature a couple times a week. Still on the same cleaning cartridge, should last a while yet.

The cleaning/charging base does an excellent job so the shaver is always ready without a lot of hassle.   918. I've used this razor for 7 months now and realize that I could of spent my money a little more wisely. I used some Christmas money to purchase this as well as a promotion from [...]. I had high expectations as would anyone because of all the reviews here at amazon. I have a average beard with fairly thick hair. As other reviewers have stated this razor does have trouble where the neck meets the jaw. I'll keep it simple by listing the pros and cons with a brief description. Pros: It is one of the quietest razors I have used. Been using electric for about 14 years. I can use this on my face with no preping ie. creams or pretreatment and it doesn't irritate at all. It holds a charge for long time. I've actually went 14 days straight just to see if it would and it did. about 10 mins a day. I open and knock out the clippings when I'm done but I use the charging/cleaning station every 3 days or so It's cool to put it up to your face and it smell nice and clean. Cons: What I consider the worst thing about it, is that it takes almost TWICE as long to shave as my previous razor. I think it is because the holes in the foil are triangular in shape as opposed to circular and a lot smaller than my other razor a Remington 390 series. This results in MULTIPLE passes to pick up hair that should of been cut on the first pass. I've had this razor tug and pinch me if you move it too quickly over your face. I thought that that would be eliminated with the Pulsar technology but it's still an issue. At $12 a pop with every refill the refill station adds an expense that would normally not be there. The trimmer works ok on the side burns but that is it. Unlike the competition ie. remington with its trimmer set at 90 degrees, you can't drag it across your face to catch those errant hairs. And lastly, as I stated earlier, the inside corner between your jaw and neck is difficult for most razors and this one isno exception. Multiple passes and circles and differing directions to try and catch every hair....It's time consuming. And Yes, this is where my remington excelled and saved me a lot of time and MONEY. In conclusion, I have bought this razor to replace my remmington $[...] and even though it hasn't worn out yet I will buy another remmington to replace this $[...] braun.
  919. I bought a series 7 Braun almost 2 years ago. I'd like to say it was the best razor I've ever owned,but there are a few things you should know before buying one. The shave overall, with a preshave product(with out preshave it gets very warm from friction) is great, fastest of any shaver. The negatives: 1. this is a very noisy shaver. To the point of actually being uncomfortable, my ears ring after use. 2. The pop up trimer broke about 5 months after I bought it, the trimmer is not placed well or a very good trimmer anyway so I never tried to get it repaired. 3. The head lock stopped latching at about the one year mark. 4. the cleaning unit is very noisy, but I felt it was doing a good job... I was wrong! I replaced the head assembly at the one year mark. After about 7 months with the new head I got some razor burn and a slight infection. I cleaned the razor with a new cleaning cartidge about 7 times just to make sure it was clean. I removed the shaver head and tapped it on my sink, I could not believe all the black junk that kept coming out! The head assembly is sealed and cannot be taken apart. So if you buy a Series 7 be aware that there are parts not made well enough to stand up in some normal use respects. As I said the trimmer is basically all but useless and breaks easily. Most of all be aware that the cleaning cartidge does not clean the head assembly completely. I would suggest buying a new head assembyly every 6 months and soaking in alcohol then shaking and tapping on a hard surface to dislodge anything stuck inside at least once a week.
  920. I have used the 790cc for about a week. I used the Norelco Arcitec 1090 before. It was taking a long time to shave with the Arcitec. I was having to finish up with a razor under my ears and neck. The 790cc has been much quicker and closer shaving than the Arcitec. I do not think it is loud at all. Walmart sells the cleaner refill for $11.95 for two. This unit is a little warmer to the skin than the Arcitec. The 790cc will shave much closer. I have not had the \\"baby\\" feel in years. This will do it. I do take the heads off and rinse them before I put unit in the cleaner. I actually enjoy shaving in the morning now and have to know when to stop shaving because this unit will just keep going (well below the skin). I don't want to go too low to avoid ingrown hairs issues. Overall, I am pleased with the Braun 790cc. I actually wake up looking forward to shaving with the 790cc. I used to dread my time with the Norelco Arcitec 1090. And this considering I used Norelco for 35 years. For me, this really beats the Norelco Arcitec.

  925. works great, and is self cleaning, easy to use. what more can you ask for. it is expensive, and i don't know that any razor is worth as much as this one costs, but i don't regret the purchase a bit.
  926. I sacrified my face for you! I've owned at least 7 electric razors, that I can recall, and I wasn't really pleased with any of them. I always do research, before I buy an item, but I hadn't done that with electric shavers. My research showed that this shaver was the best.<br /><br />The research was correct. This is the best electric razor that I have ever owned! Even more impressive is that this shaver gives a shave that is much better than I ever thought was possible with an electric razor. I've tried going 3 days without shaving, then using this electric razor. It shaved perfectly, which wasn't possible with my other electric razors. They would have yanked at the stubble and it would have been uncomfortable to shave with them.<br /><br />Can it shave as close as a blade razor? YES! If you follow the instructions and shave before you wash your face and stretch the skin, as you shave, then you can get a close shave. Even using very mild pressure, you can get an acceptable looking shave. To get a shave comparable to a blade razor, I found that you need to press it harder against your face and shave against the direction of the beard growth. It took awhile, but I actually got a closer shave than was possible with a blade razor - without any bleeding involved! I've tried pressing this shaver against my face really hard and there was no discomfort or razor burns. This wouldn't have been possible with any of my other electric razors. Of course, there is no need to press it that hard - I was just curious.<br /><br />This shaver comes with a charging base that can also automatically clean the razor. You insert the cleaning solution container into the base and it determines the level of cleaning that the razor needs, then you press the button if you want it to clean the razor for you. The cleaning solution contains alcohol, a lubricant and a nice fragrance. You can also clean it using the included brush or by running water over the shaving head, but youwill need to add oil if you use that method. I will use the automatic method as the cleaning cartridges are reasonably priced and should last a month, or more. Although my Walmart didn't carry any Braun shavers, they do carry the cleaning cartridges, as does amazon.<br /><br />The shaver price seems high, but when compared to all the other electric shavers that I have bought, I've spent much more on all of them and I wasn't happy with any of them. I also considered how much I've probably spent on razors and shaving cream over a period of several years. Now I don't have to run to the store when I find I'm out of razor blades or shaving cream! I expect this shaver will last me many years, so I will actually save money over time.<br /><br />The shaver has a LCD display that shows the battery level and the hygiene level. How the shaver computes the latter, is a mystery to me. I tried just leaving the shaver running, without shaving, and it shows the razor is still clean; So it is truly sensing the hygiene of the razor.<br /><br />The only possible negative is there is not a nice leather carrying case included. The shaver does comes in a hard plastic case. After thinking about it, I realized that the plastic case will protect the razor better than a leather one. There isn't room for the charging cord in the case.<br /><br />The charging cord, or rather the plug end, is my only real complaint. The plug is very large and is a problem as with the plug in outlet multiplier, that I use, the plug is too wide and it takes up the space of two outlets. But that is my only complaint, and it is a minor complaint.<br /><br />If you buy this shaver, I feel certain that you will be very pleased with it.<br /><br />UPDATE: To add to an already long review, I must tell you that I still use this same razor. It has worked flawlessly, I've never had to have it sharpened, replace a battery or anything! It is the absolute best electric razor known to man! One tip: I highly recommend using the fluid that the base uses to clean this razor. I personally have never cleaned it with a brush and it is still as clean as when I bought it. A PERFECT gift! (No, I do NOT own their stock!). Oh, I've also never once received a razor burn!
  927. Simply put - its a new generation - no more irretation or any kind of pain even with the longest hairs.<br />Awesome prodcut.<br /><br />Long Hair cutter is way smaller..<br /><br />Bottom Line. The best shaver I ever had in 20 years.<br /><br />Joachim Grafe

  933. in the 60s, during my college years, I used a rotary shaver with mixed results. Since I am on blood thinning medication I can't risk the probability of shaving nicks using a blade. This shaver solved that problem. It is very comfortable with no skin irritation. This shaver is extremely easy to use, fast, and clean up is a breeze with the self-cleaning charger/cleaning stand. It shaves much closer than I expected and was used to with my old rotary shaver. However, if you are expecting this or any other electric shaver to shave as close as a blade you are not being realistic. It just won't happen. But if you are looking for a shaver that shaves closer than any electric I have tried, is fast, easy to handle, and cleans itself you will love this shaver, even though it may be a little pricey.   934. I have had a few Braun razors. The most recent one lasted nearly 12 years, so the 790 will have a hard act to follow. The old one (I don't remember what model) was the first with the clean & renew system and while I thought it might be a gimmick, it proved to be really great at keeping the unit clean (and shaving better as a result). The 790 instantly won me over with the fact that it doesn't feel like it is doing anything. At the end the hair is gone, but the old one (probably quite dull and the batteries certainly didn't have their original vigour) seemed to chew the hair off my face in comparison. The small display on the bottom of the shaver has a series of blocks; one half tells you the charge status and the other half the \\"hygiene\\" status (how dirty it is). Apparently there is a central icon that reminds you to change the cutting head. I miss the more informative display of the old model - it had a multi-dot screen that displayed text messages (such as clean!) and icons (a happy face when all was well) as well as graphically displaying charge/discharge and more. Ultimately a shaver is about shaving and this one seems to do the job with good power, a gentle touch and a minimum of time. I wonder if the LiIon batteries in this one can be persuaded to keep running for a decade like the NiMH batteries in the prior model? I have my doubts.

  943. Over the past 25-30 years, I have had numerous electric shavers of the typical brands (Sunbeam, Remington, Norelco) - all of them disappointments causing me to return to the nicks and scratches that come with getting a close shave with a razor blade. At first, I was reluctant to spend the money for this top of the line Braun...it was a risky investment given its price. But I saw it as my last attempt at electric shaving. This shaver is worth every penney. The features, specially the self-cleaning, are great. The self-cleaning really works and leaves the shaver spotless without the usual hassle of having to brush the heads clean or rinsing the heads underwater and setting the shaver to dry. The close shave from this Braun is the best you will ever get with an electric shaver and comparable with traditional razor blades (but without nicks and cuts)! The only \\"negatives\\" with the Braun are price and the fact that the cutting surface operates at such high RPMs, that it warms up a bit during shaving (but not uncomfortably hot). On the positive side, the shave is great and the design of the head cuts through both \\"longer\\" standing hairs and the usual stubble. The heads need only be replaced every 18 months and the cleaning agent that comes in the cartridge is both easy to install and lasts longer than I thought. In short, this is truly a hassle-free appliance and the only electric shaver to have!
  944. First electric shaver that i can use with comfort. Prior shavers have been very irritating to my skin,and in some cases have pulled rather than cut face hair. The self cleaning feature is outstanding.
  945. I wish I had read before I did. The shaver is not worth the money you spend if you have a tough beard. I do and I thought with the new \\"technology\\" promised, I would get a better shave than with my older electric shavers. I did not. Actually, my older Braun series 3 cuts closer and in much less time than this one does. The cleaning feature is very nice but not worth the extra $130 you spend on it from a lower series Braun. The main reason I wrote this review is to warn people that if you buy it and have a poor experience like I did YOU CANNOT RETURN IT THROUGH AMAZON. Because this shaver comes with the cleaning fluid which is flamable, Amazon will not allow you to return it. You can return it to Braun within 60 days but you have to ship it to them in either GERMANY or AUSTRAILIA. The shipping charges are really high. So just be warned before you purchase.
  946. I am 54 years old, and got sick to death of scraping my face with a razor every day. I had tried a rotary shaver several years ago, and was not pleased with the results. I decided to try a foil one, as I had used one many years ago, when they first came out. What a differance! Foil technology has certainly come a long way! This thing comes very close to shaving as close as a blade. The shaver fits well in the hand, and the pivoting head and blades adapt to the contours of the face very well. The cleaning / charging base works very well, and the lubrication makes for a much cooler shave. Braun says that the cleaning cartridge should last about a month, but I have been using it daily for 6 weeks, now, and the 'full' LED is still on. Comes with a nifty plastic travel case, that is very well designed. On the down side, it takes several weeks for your face to get used to a foil razor. Braun says to shave before washing your face, as the skin oils help lubricate your skin. It is very important to hold your skin taut while shaving, to keep stray hairs from being plucked by the razor. Some consider the razor pricey, but if you shop around, any electric razor with a cleaning base falls into this price range. I am quite satisfied with this purchase.

  950. The Braum 7-790cc does a great job for a heavy beard. I tried several of the Norelco shavers and they didn't have the cutting ability as the Braum. I am very pleased with the Braum 7-790cc and would recommend this shaver if you have a heavy beard and need some real cutting power.
  951. Great shaver but all the shavings fall out and little stays in the shaving head area.
  952. After many, many years using rotary shavers, I was happy to find the 7- 790cc. It has made it much easier for this 88 year old to shave thru all the wrinkles and around the mouth. Also it does a much better job shaving my head bald. So far the cleaning system does great. The whole experience has caused me to be more interested in keeping myself well groomed.
  953. This is My 3rd Shaver and I Love it. It is very smooth and when you clean it, it is much nicer.<br />Highly recommend this if you want to get the new Braun.
  954. This razor is an excellent quality product. I suspect it will last a loooong time. The blades need changing at about the 18 month time. It has a good internal 3.8V LiOn battery and does a decent job shaving. The only issue I've had in two years use is the board containing the battery can move slightly if the shaver is accidentally dropped or jarred (maybe in the clean up cycle?}. The springy contacts from the battery control board to the motor housing don't make contact causing the shaver to stop. It is an easy fix by prying on the sides of the rubber housing with a thin blade screwdriver to remove it exposing the second cover. Undoing the 4 screws and removing the second cover exposes the battery compartment and control board. The copper contact pins from the battery board need to be stretched out slightly so they contact the motor housing firmly. Reassemble and you are ready to go. All in all this is a well made shaver and does a good job for me.
  955. It keeps my wife happy, because without this thing she would be married to Santa Claus, The Hatfields or The McCoys.<br />I still manage to grow a short beard during the winter until she complaints too loudly. This thing will NOT cut beards and it not suppose to.
  956. Head lock not working after first shave. For this price I would expect better quality. Closeness of shave is just the same as a $50 rotary Norelco. Not satisfied with this purchase since I now have doubts about the quality of this shaver. If a simple mechanism breaks without having been abused, I have serious doubts that all the rest of fancy and cheap plastic perks will last enough to justify the price paid. Do not recommend this shaver.
  957. Very good product!!! I bought this for my husband about 2 weeks ago and he loves it!! He would deffinetly reccomend this product to anyone. The price is pretty exspensive but the quality is worth it. =)
  958. I've had the Braun 790 for over a year now and it's performed flawlessly and gives a great shave. Others will perhaps write long and exhaustive reviews but I'm just going to say that my sensative skin appreciates this shaver every day. Just great.

  960. I like this product, I have been using it for almost a year now. It shaves well, and there is no irritation. I used to get little cuts every so often with a razor, but that's a thing of the past. It also helps keep sideburns nice between haircuts. I will say that the shave is not super close to the skin, but it's good enough that I'd take the lack of irritation as a good tradeoff. Also, I find it does shave better when you clean it after each use. When I'm on trips, I just run it under water and it does clean a bit too, but the cleaning solution works best.
  961. Since 1999 I've only had two electric shavers, both were Braun. I got this one in 2007 as a birthday gift from my wife. I was satisfied with the performance...then the real test occurred. I took the shaver with me on my 12 month deployment to Iraq. I didn't have it as bad as some guys, but we spent a lot of time in the field living with the Iraqis, sleeping on the deck, no showers etc. The shaver held up well, still shaving in poor/dirty conditions. It even held it's charge for 1-2 weeks at a time when I was unable to charge it. I had to change out the cartridges a bit more often than normal, but this was a small price to pay. The whole year I just charged it with the cord and cleaned it by tapping the cartridge against something hard or just using water because I didn't bring the holder/cleaner. I'm sure I could go into a lot more detail about how impressed I am, but all in all I am very satisfied. It still works at damn near 100% except for the trimmer which broke during a hard fall (it still works, I just have to hold it with my finger, which I don't mind). Considering the thing survived two IED explosions I'm extremely impressed. I came on to see if there was a new model out..maybe one that makes coffee or something by now, but it looks like it's relatively the same so I'll just stick with this one. Hey, if ain't broke don't fix it I guess. So if you're a low maintenance guy like me with nothing but a toothbrush and a bar of soap in your bathroom, then this is the shaver for you. Easy shave, easy clean, easy day.
  962. iv had a braun series 5 for 4 years new series 7 is a masterpiece. it shaves as good as a razor
  963. I guess, it is too late to review now, but I will review it anyway. I didn't extensively use this as I do shave once per week.   964. I have been using the Braun Series 7 790 Pulsonic for about 5 months now. I previously owned a Braun 360 and hated it because it ALWAYS pulled at my hairs, I actually dreaded shaving for the discomfort I knew I was going to be subjected to (And yes I did change the blades and foil to no resolution). One day I was so irritated by it I finally just threw it in the trash. I was very hesitant to purchase another Braun razor for obvious reasons, but after looking at some of the reviews and knowing I had a 60 day try out period with Braun I figured I would give them a shot again. At first glance, the 790 looks very close to the 360 including the blade pattern. However, the performance is completely different. This one is actually comfortable to use without pulling at my whiskers while it shaves. I am pleased that I purchased the Braun 790 because it is pretty quick at shaving, but more importantly it does not pull at my hairs, and you still get a close shave. I would gladly sacrifice speed for better comfort, but with the 790 you don't have to give up one for the other. I would recommend that if you have similar experiences with electric razors pulling at hairs, as I did, give the Braun series 7 790 Pulsonic a try.
  965. [[VIDEOID:moWAVJ1CKNV5LP]]Here is my review of the Braun Series 7 - 790cc. You can find my full written review at Electric-Shaver-Guide.com.
  966. I bought this shaver in 2009 and imagine I can give a pretty thorough review at this point.<br /><br />First of all, let's address the question of electric shavers. Will it shave as close as a blade? Absolutely not. And it is not designed to do that. Will you LOOK like it shaved as close as a blade? Yes you will, if you take the time to let your face get used to it and stop using a blade you will look like you spend a lot more time shaving than you actually do.<br /><br />I'll start with the Pros to buying/using this shaver. The design is great and it does not feel 'cheap'. it offers a good shave early in the morning when I am less than awake and it cleans itself so I don't have to remember to take it apart and clean it. The battery lasts forever (even after two years) so if you go on a business trip, you don't have to take the cleaning base with you. Also, if you need to be away for a really long time, like more than a week, the same cord that plugs into the cleaning base plugs into the shaver itself so you can recharge it on the go. The cleaning fluid is nice for people who are prone to bad complexion because it sterilizes the razor after every use and an electric shaver is less harsh on your skin after your face gets used to it. Also, I cannot prove that the pulsonic aspect of this shaver is \\"better\\" than other shavers but I definitely shave faster with this one than any other one I have owned before. It is also much faster than using a traditional razor and shaving creme.<br /><br />Now for the Cons, such that they are. First and foremost, you have to remember to shave before you get in the shower and get your skin wet. It took me a while to change my routine. If you have not used an electric shaver before, you need to let your face have time to get used to it. Most people/companies say give it 30 days. I say give it a bit longer but that is only my personal opinion. I have a pretty rough beard and it took longer for my face to adapt to the waythis thing cuts.<br /><br />One design flaw, after about a year, the silver coloring near the pivot of the razor started to peel off a bit. Braun offered to replace it but I just never remembered/had the time to ship it back. I applaud their customer service but wish it had not happened to begin with. Still, it is only a cosmetic issue and does not affect the operation of the shaver (and in all honesty, I am NOT gentle with anything at 7am). This would not keep me from buying another of their products but feel it should be mentioned. I subtracted a star for this but it should really only be about a half star.<br /><br />As for cost: I have tried to estimate the cost of shaving with a traditional razor (mach 3 etc) and shaving cream vs using the Braun Plusonic and the cleaning fluid. Keep in mind that Braun recommends that you buy a new cutting head every 16 months which costs about $50. The cleaning refills cost about $16 for three (average, sometimes you can find them on sale for better) and last right at 30 days each. All in all, including cost of upfront purchase, it seems that the Braun may be a few dollars more but they are pretty close so cost really should not be a huge factor.<br /><br />My shaver is still working fine. I have used it every day for two years and see no reason why I wont for two more years. Overall, I am happy with the purchase. It does exactly what it says; shaves the fuzzy stuff off your face and cleans itself. If you are on the fence about electric shavers, give this one a try. They are not for everyone but I have not bought a traditional razor in two years. Take that for what it is worth.
  967. The title may seem melo-dramatic but there is no product in my life that has so altered my daily routine and been so satisfying as this electric shaver. I was a blade and shaving cream shaver for 20+ years using all of the different Mach 3, multiple blade, expensive disposable razors on the market. The few times I had tried cheaper electric razors I was disappointed or discouraged from ever trying an electric shaver. My wife got me the Braun 7 series for Christmas about 2 1/2 years ago and I have never gone back to disposable blades. This electric razor gives a close, smooth, and comfortable shave. Its cradle provides a very easy mechanism for cleaning (although you do have to buy the cleaning pods routinely), and maintains a charge for a long time. I do not believe any personal grooming product has been so useful -- in fact it is likely the best gift I've ever received (well, second to the Lego airport I got when I was 9). I would recommend this product with absolute praise. It is worth every penny and likely will pay for itself in a few months since you will never again purchase blades.
  968. Since I started shaving, somewhere around 17 years old, I've been looking for an electric razor that could come anywhere near a blade. I have a heavy beard and need to shave everyday. In 2008, at 52 years old, I found one and that is my Braun listed in the title above. This shaver comes closer to a blade than any other I have tried and I've wasted money on a lot of them over the years. I guess I'm one of the lucky ones because I've had no trouble with keeping the unit charged and am using all original parts. Granted, when I want a really close shave I'll go back to a blade but for day to day going to work, this is the best electric I have ever used period.<br />Pricey, yes but just look at the price of blades these days. And with a beard like mine, shaving cream out of a can is an invitation to cut the heck out of myself. So between a good Cream Shave like Clinque and new blades the cost of the shaver over time is probably less. I do agree getting replacement parts for this model is a pain in the neck. I'm still using the original foil head because I can never find a Series 7 in a store. After approx. 3 years and 6 months of almost daily use, my base unit is leaking the cleaning fluid so depending on how hard it is to fix this problem, I may be making comments on this initial review. All in all, it is just a good feeling to have FINALLY found an electric that actually comes close to their advertising. Lastly, no doubt about it, it is over priced but I think they can get away with this because the damned thing IS the best electric on the market. I'm talking as of 2008, I've only started looking again because of the leakage problem I'm having with my Braun which, I hope I can find at a reasonable price. The thing is just really cheap plastic housing. Just my opinion.

  970. I decided to compare the pulsonic and 360 complete by using the 30 day money back offer. So I bought both and tried them up for a few days each. While the 360 gave a good shave compared to the pulsonic it was like night and day. Suffice it to say that the 360 was shipped back to Braun today and won't be missed. I like the pulsonic better for a few reasons mostly because it gets me a better shave but also because the handle isn't as big and fits more comfortably in my hand. With the pulsonic I can wrap my hand around the handle and its shaped way better than the 360. The on/off button on the pulsonic is just that on/off while on the 360 it is also the lock switch and activates the trimmer. I guess overall I feel like the pulsonic is designed better than the 360 and is justified in the difference in price. UPDATE*** After a few weeks with this I can honestly say that I'll use this on a daily basis and with the exception of weddings or other special engagements I'll be using the Pulsonic. I've used other electrics before for about a week or so before I toss them in the drawer and forget about them, this is different. I can't wait to shave with it in the morning.

  972. I have used $200 Braun's and $300 Panasonics. I currently own seven late model, high-end shavers. (I also own a shaving museum from the 1930's to the 1950's). The Panasonic was very nice but no swiveling head. The new 9595CC is without flaw in any area: Closeness, comfort, smoothness, ease of use, ergonomics maintainance, and quietness. The German engineers really did their homework on this baby. To be honest, they outdid themselves! Plus, it maintains itself in four different areas. And it's Ultra-sexy!   973. Bought this shaver for my husband. He loves it!!! Here's my husband's review: If you haven't figured it out yet, the new Braun Pulsonic is even better as a wet shaver. Notice that it says WASHABLE in letters you can't miss on the front of the shaver. Simply wet your face, put on some Gillette Foamy shaving cream, and get ready for an incredibly close shave!! FIRST, shave with the shaving head in the UNLOCKED position, and then followup by shaving with the shaving head in the LOCKED position. Wow, what a shave!! This doesn't take long as the Pulsonic is fast and powerful and zips right through your beard. Take your fingers AGAINST the grain of your beard to see how close this shave is!! If you want an even closer shave, FIRST shave ONLY WITH THE GRAIN of your beard (NOT against the grain)using a typical Gillette double or triple blade. Then finish up with the Pulsonic. This seems to get the longer, flat lying hairs a little better. After all, it's the shaving AGAINST the grain of your beard with a blade that produces the nicks and iritation. Can't figure out why Braun doesn't advertise the Pulsonic as a WET shaver. Maybe it's because Braun had to cut a deal with Panasonic to use Panasonic's Linear motor in the Pulsonic. Maybe Panasonic still has a patent on its Linear motor. Anyway, I've used both the latest Panasonic wet/dry shaver as a wet shaver and the Braun Pulsonic as a wet shaver. The results are that the Pulsonic shaves much closer and without the irritation of the Panasonic. Give the Pulsonic a try as a WET shaver; it's the best wet shaver yet!!!
  974. Love it! The closest shave with an electric razor. Very convenient, in less than five minutes I can get a nice, close shave and not have to worry about cuts. The Clean & Renew system is also very convenient.

  976. I've been a very loyal Norelco (SmartTouch 9195XL) user for years, and always buy the top of the line Norelco's when they come out.   980. Okay folks - I have never written a review before, but always read them before I made any purchases. First, let me say that I have sensitive skin, and always hated shaving. I have used a Norelco shaver (top of the line models) for over 15 years and got what I would consider a fair/good shave. I wouldn't say that I loved the Norelcos, but they always did the job. After having my same shaver stolen twice by airport personnel from my suitcase over the past 3 months, I decided now was the time to try something new. My brother had just purchased this razor and RAVED about it. As with all shavers, there is an adjustment period which I dealth with. With each day, the shaving never got any better and I tried everything (holding it differently, locking the head, etc.) Every time I shaved, my face had more cuts than the last time, skin got red, and I barely removed any facial hair!!! Finally after 4 weeks of using this thing, I returned it to the store and went with a Norelco Artica shaver. Yes, the shaver looked great, and the cleaning chamber was a plus, etc....But it never did what it was supposed to.. It never shaved my face well! With that said, not every face is designed for this shaver. Again, my brother loves it, and I know my review won't persuade you, but I do want to give you a non-subjective piece of criticism - I travel often for periods of a week and found that this shaver does NOT keep as long of a charge as the Norelco's. In addition, within 4 days, the \\"Hygeine meter\\" was maxed out indicating it needed a cleaning. While you can clean it with regular water, it never resets itself until you put it back in the cleaning pod. I just found that to be annoying. Good luck with your shaving endeavors. While I was expecting a 'break in period' with the Artica, it never happened! I have never recieved a better shave with any previous Norelco razor and would compare the new shave to a straight edge!

  985. I have used electric shavers for over 50 years, and the Pulsonic 9595 is by far the finest shaver I have ever experienced. It shaves close, is quiet, and fast. It's not cheap, but based on my limited experience with it so far it is worth the money.
  986. First, a little background: I've been a loyal razor shaver for the last 4-5 years. My first electric shaver was a cheap Remington that didn't work back in 2002. That made me anti-electric razor for years. However, as the years have gone by I've realized I'm one of the lucky ones to have sensitive skin and ingrown neck hairs due to razor shaving. I did my research and everyone recommends electric shavers. After a lot of research I bought the Braun 9595. A lot of my friends were long time Braun users and highly recommended the brand as well. My friend even gave me a free 3 cleaning pack as a welcome into the Braun club. :) The Braun 9595 is a great shaver. It is a lot quieter than other electric shavers I've seen and it does cut a whole lot better as well. I really like the pivoting head as it makes for a really comfortable shave. However, I learned the hard way that you have to shave against the grain with Electric shavers (unlike razor blades). Although this shaver doesn't shave as close as my old 5 blade Razor - I've already seen noticeable decrease in razor burn (even on day 2). I definitely recommend this for you guys like me who have a problem with razor burn on their neck. The pop out trimmer is perfect for stubborn hair that doesn't want to pop out (ingrown hair). Just make sure to shave against the grain really slowly and not with it. The cleaning system is really amazing. After you get done shaving just stick the shaver into the base and it automatically detects the cleaning level. After you hit the center button the shaver turns on and you can hear the cleaning solution going through it. Just be aware that it takes a good set of minutes before the cleaning is done. The refills are supposed to last 30 days so I clean the shaver every 2 shaves (1 cleaning refill should last 2 months). After 2 shaves the shaver says it wants a Normal Clean (as I clean it with water anyway). After the automatic cleaning is done the shaver head has a nice lemon smellto it (not overpowering in the least bit). A big concern of mine was the ability to travel with this shaver. This shaver has a place to plug in the electrical cord directly (though you can normally recharge it through the base). I travel now and then so this was a big deal for me. I recommend this for people who do a lot of traveling. The cleaning solution is made in Ireland and the Braun Pulsonic 9595 itself is made in Germany. A FYI if you are interested in that sort of stuff like I am. Something to note: As a guy coming from razor blades into the electric shaver world - my face gets really dry after a shave now. You might want to have some lotion handy to relieve the dryness. Without a doubt I would highly recommend this shaver to anyone - especially for guys like me who get razor burn using razor blades. It sure is a nice feeling knowing I won't be buying $24 razor blade replacements every 2 months...
  987. There are many reviews of this product already, but few mention use on the road. Summary - Superb shave, great for traveling. Here are my experiences: 1) The shave is excellent, not quite a 'mach 3' equivalent, but far far better than any other electric razor I have ever owned. 2) Battery life is very good. A full charge lasts me way over a week on the road, could even be two weeks. 3) Cleaning is simple in a hotel room. I just stick the head under running water, and take the foil off and give it a good rinse when I have the time or inclination. 4) The hygiene meter will register on 'empty' after a few days indicating that the razor really wants to be cleaned in its own base. This does not stop it working or alter the fine performance. I just start the clean cycle when you get home. 5) You can charge the razor in your hotel if you bring the same cord that plugs into the base station. 6) The carrying case is semi-transparent clear/white plastic and the razor has some shiny chrome. The unit appears dense on x-ray of hand baggage and has invited secondary inspection on several occasions. But, the razor is clearly a razor so no worries there.

Man this thing is awesome I had about 3 days of stubble this thing went right through it like a hot knife to butter I can't believe it this thing it is a little pricey but you know you get what you pay for.   994. I purchased a Braun Pulsonic Shaver on 11-24-07. The shave it provided was equal to a non-pulsonic shaver. On 6-1-08 it broke. I called their Service Dept. and requested that they send me a new razor. They said that was not possible and to send it to their approved warranty service shop. I sent it in on 6-4-08. On 7-3-08 I called the shop and they said that they were still waiting for parts from Braun. I called Braun and they said that they were not responsible for the delivery of parts. BRAUN DOES NOT TAKE CARE OF THEIR CUSTOMERS. THE BRAUN PULSONIC IS A GOOD PRODUCT IF IT DOES NOT BREAK. BUY ONE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

I switched from a Norelco that I had since 2003 and am pretty disappointed. To be fair I've given the razor about two weeks to get used to my face, yet I still am not getting a close shave. If I shave at 5AM, I look like I need to shave again at 10AM and my beard isn't that thick. The best advice I can give is save the money and buy a 40-50 dollar shaver. I would return it, but it would be like returning a pair of underwear after wearing them.
  1001. I've had the unit about a year. My wall adapter just died this morning for no reason. I like the shaver, but am not looking forward to dealing with costumer service and 2-3 weeks to get a replacement that in the end (from what I've read) I'm going to have to pay for anyways. I might just use a 12v adapter I have for an old CD player. I don't get it, wall mount power transformers are nothing new and are supposed to last pretty long. My god, I can still find junkers from the 60's that still work fine and have been sitting outdoors for years. Braun should be ashamed for selling out to the cheapest bidder on very standard part...
  1002. I purchased the Braun Pulsonic model 9595 on Amazon for $199.99 a little over a week ago (it apppears the name has changed to 790cc in the interim). I am also an owner of the Braun model 7680 for comparison. I believe that the major improvement from my perspective (so far) is that the shaver operates more smoothly, resulting in less/no irritation compared to the 7680. My perception is that the shave is also nominally faster, closer and more comfortable ergonomically. It also may be a bit lighter in weight. To address some of the negative comments: The shaver is louder than my previous model, as is the cleaner, but not enough to bother me (and the cleaner seems to make noise for a shorter duration, at least in the eco mode, which is the only mode used to-date). As far as the cost of using the cleaner, I think it is worthwhile and have found that cleaning/tapping hairs out of the shaver head before using the cleaning system results in less contamination of the fluid and extends the life significantly. I expect that washing the head assembly under the faucet prior to using the cleaning system would result in a similar savings.
  1003. I have had a couple of other Braun razors but used them primarily for weekend shaving...they were good but not great. This Pulsonic is something I use every day...although it still does leave the occasional hair on my neck. I have sensitive skin and can get burn evven from an electric razor...not with the Pulsonic! It is a bit pricey but is by far and away the best electric razor I have ever owned. If you need an electric razor that you can use even if you are a three piece suit wearing professional this is it!
  1004. he isn't in love with it (yet anyway). He has been using it for about a month. It seems to take a little less time to shave but he doesn't think the money was worth it compared to this previous model, also a Braun. Maybe that's why; he has been using Braun all along.<br /><br />The cleaning is great, it does make a difference in how the shaver performs.
  1005. To start with, I will start with Amazon. This item cannot be returned because it has \\"flammable\\" material. Pretty lame considering I can empty the liquid and send it back. Will be _very_ careful from now on in buying anything from amazon. My local store takes it back, and I wish I had bought it there to try it out. Very disappointed. If you just want to \\"try\\" this shaver(which is probably 90% of the folks), do NOT, I repeat, do NOT buy from amazon. **Edit** I just remembered that I had searched the entire page for \\"return\\" and did not find it. Now there is a note which says it cannot be returned. Now I am even more pissed off with amazon. This is just clearly a way to make people pay. Shame on Amazon. Now onto the product. First off, I am an Indian guy, with a pretty hard beard and very quick growth.I HATE to shave, and I would pay anything to get a shaver that shaves my beard well and saves me the agony of shaving with a regular blade. I have tried 3 shavers before, but they ended not shaving correctly or having my skin peeling. I was hoping this is \\"the one\\", but unfortunately, not. I am writing this review to help out the folks who have a hard beard and skin which is a little sensitive. There were a lot of informative reviews, but I didnt find any reviews that gave me much information. Let me start with the positives. 1.Much better on my skin. I dont have too sensitive skin(a lil sensitive, all right but not too much), but other shavers I had tried tended to peel the top layer of my skin. I dont mean bleed, I mean just peel, but it was slightly painful and itchy. This one did not ever peel my skin, and I pushed hard. 2. Has the cleaning mechanism, which is AWESOME. I loved it, and I so wish I could use this shaver. Oh well, one day. I am allowed to hope. Maybe Braun will address the Asian/Persian hard beard market someday. 3. For what it did shave, it was closer than any blade I have shaved with. Felt awesome to have such a super close shave. Also better than the Panasonics and Norelco's I have tried before. Doesnt peel my skin, and cuts close. The bad 1. I have go go over the same areas multiple times. It is pretty clean in the end, but some hair is still left over on my cheeks and chin, one hair here, one hair there. I tried different techniques, but it just might be the direction of my growth which is kinda weird. Goes in all directions. So I have to finish up with a blade. Beats the purpose. Its only a \\"few\\" hair, but still.. 2. Neck hair. I dont understand why, with all the technology, none of the shavers can do neck hair. it is just painful going over the neck over and over again, and then doing it with the regular blade with my neck stubble. This was one of the deal breakers for me. My neck was red at the end of a shave and sensitive. And I had to do it with the blade in the end. Why is it so hard to do? 3. If you press too hard to get a close shave, you might get breakouts. I got it after every shave I did. Hope this helps everyone else. And again, if you want to \\"try\\" this shaver, do NOT, I repeat, do NOT buy from amazon.
  1006. I've only used the new shaver (Braun 9595)a short time but I find it a great shaver...shaves are really smooth...easy to use and clean. A really good shaver for anyone looking to purchase one. Highly recommended!!!
  1007. My goodness, this is the best razor I've ever owned. With my old razor, I would shave for a half hour or more and I'd have stubble by the end of the day. With this one, I shaved 3+ weeks of beard growth in 15 minutes and three days later I still have hardly any stubble! I used to hate shaving and always had somewhat of a beard, but I think that'll change with this new razor!<br /><br />It even has an electric display on it that tells you how dirty it is and comes with a cool charging/cleaning station. This is probably the best electric razor available today. When you look at it that way, the $260 price tag is a bargain!

  1009. I bought this shaver February 2008. I like the close shave, & the cleaning system. However, the shaver recently began to strain, & sometimes had difficulty starting, even though the battery was fully charged. I called Braun customer service, & was informed that repairs would be on me (& not under warranty) if damage resulted from my use of pre-shave (and I do in fact use pre-shave). This was quite a surprise, as there's nothing in the shaver's literature that warns against the use of pre-shave (I use Williams Ultra). Has anyone else had this experience with Braun?
