  1011. I've had Braun shavers for ever! Slurged for this one and wish I hadn't. The older ones actually shave closer and do that quicker. The HYPE got me! I thought they had actually improved their e-shaver, but they just got marketing-weinies to hype it up and that is all you are buying. Buy the cheaper Braun and you'll get a better shave.
  1012. After years of using a Norelco rotary shaver, I decided to \\"upgrade\\" to the new Pulsonic line. I received the 790cc as a Christmas present and have been mostly satisfied with its performance after using it for several weeks. All the Braun marketing hype surrounding their 7 series shavers is accurate, to a point. The 790cc beats my older Norelco hands-down. The shave is closer, quicker and gives my skin way less irritation. I hardly need to apply after shave to soothe my skin. While my old rotary was by no means a bad shaver, it often left my entire neck red. I hardly have that problem with the Norelco. This is the closest shave I've received with an electric shaver. The Pulsonic technology definitely helps stand your whiskers on edge. Provided you follow the customary electric shaver practice of stretching your skin, running the blades against the grain and holding the shaver at a 90-degree angle, you'll be more than happy with the results. That said, it still falls short of a manual wet shave. Even with the Pulsonic feature, the Power Comb and the locking head, I usually have to go over my neck two or three times for an ideal shave. The charging and cleaning base station uses a mixture of alcohol, lubricant and fragrance to clean your shaver. The status indicator on the bottom of the shaver indicates the battery life and hygiene level of the unit, letting you know when its time to cradle the shaver. The base station automatically selects the necessary cleaning cycle. Not only is the base station convenient, but it helps reduce skin irritation when you shave by keeping the blades clean, dry and well-lubricated. For such an expensive shaver, I would have preferred a better carrying case. The flimsy plastic case provided houses the shaver and a cleaning brush for the road, but no place to put the charger or bottle of appliance oil. As another reviewer mentioned, the shaver is built extremely well, but the aesthetic choices made by Braun are a little mish-mashed. The shaver, the base station and the charger are all different colors. Despite what product pictures may lead you to believe, the shaver's LCD display is not backlit, so it can be challenging to read under the direct glare of your bathroom's lights. All these issues are minor and hardly a deal-breaker. If you're looking to save some money, buy the 760cc instead of this particular model. The only difference is the shaver's display indicator (it's an LED instead of an LCD) and the base station's fast clean feature (there isn't one). I look forward to using my Braun as my primary shaver for years to come.
  1013. I am very pleased and impressed with this razor. I've used 5 different Norelcos during the past thirty years and none of them lived up to their claims of comfort and closeness. I must admit that I always regarded them as the best the market had to offer but the Braun is more than worth the price difference (about double). I have the dreaded double whammy of a wiry beard and sensitive skin. If I missed a day shaving, the Norelco would cause my skin, especially the throat, to burn all day. When I returned from a recent hunting trip with a week's worth of beard, I was amazed that the Braun shave was as comfortable as when I use it daily. The only thing that could make me more pleased would be if this razor gives me the same reliability and length of service as the previous brand.
  1014. The Braun Series 7 Pulsonic is a definite improvement in quality and in it's ability to give a better shave than my older Braun Series 8000 Activator. Time will tell if the new \\"all in one\\" blade and screen cartridge will hold up. That's the only thing that I don't like. Not being able to see or brush the blades directly make me wonder how clean I'm getting it when I sometimes run it under water to clean while traveling (new washable feature). Other than that performs well and much less bulky. I like it! Worth the investment after several years of my old Braun.
  1015. I bought this razor when my latest Norelco broke into many little pieces after hitting the floor. I've owned a few Norelco razors over the years and been pleased with them. This Braun has impressed, so far. The razor shaves closer with less effort and a little more comfort than any triple-head shaver I've used. Nothing is as good as a blade but, this one gets pretty close. The easy cleaner/charger seems to work as advertised...Its expensive, but I'd recommend it.
  1016. This is a complete waste of money. The razor started off \\"ok\\" but after a couple of months the dock began to not recognize that the shaver was in it so it would not clean or charge. With some careful maneuvering and propping it will recognize the shaver just long enough to start a cleaning cycle which of course causes it to vibrate and move out of its perfect location. If I forgo the cleaning and just charge the razor it makes a very high frequency buzz once its done charging that makes it rather uncomfortable to just be in the same room. This shaver is also big, its not heavy but volume wise its rather substantial for a razor. Next up is the base which has a few issues with it. We all know that these small electronics are not powered by 120V and so they are going to need a transformer in them somewhere unfortunately at this price it was unexpected to find it in the form of giant wall wart plug that sticks straight outward rather than 90ing down the wall. This then feeds into the base which unexpectedly clashes with the razors design. Now this may seem a bit nitpicky but the razor is a nice silver and black while the stand is solid white. Not white in a sleek and stylish way but like it looks like they forgot to paint it and shipped it out anyway. Lastly the only button on the thing is a big one in the middle to activate the cleaning cycles and it feels like a cheap plastic thing that will break the moment the warranty runs out. All in all a waste of money. I accidentally hit three stars and Amazon wont let me change it back to a ONE like this product deserves. Do not buy this razor.
  1017. This is definitely the the Rolls Royce of shavers. Let me first say that I hated shaving. I tried numerous electrics but always ended up with the latest \\"safety razor\\". Which ever one had the most blades and promised the most comfort. I never found any of them comfortable and I always broke out or got razor burn. I disliked shaving so much that I only shaved when I absolutely needed to. Now that I have the Series 7, I find myself shaving just for the hell of it. After about the first week or so I have very little, if any, irritation during or after shaving. It is very convenient being able to shave before showering and its even encouraged. Prior to using this, in order for me to shave I practically needed an aseptic surgical-like environment. Now I rub this thing on my face for a few minutes and I'm out the door. I think the LCD on the bottom of the razor is kind of overkill. The information it displays is very vague (just little boxes displaying how dirty the razor is and how much battery life is left) compared to the previous models LCD. The Series 5 razor had a scrolling text display that actually told you how minutes you had left before the battery died and other important information. If the LCD is part of your decision making between the 790cc and the 760cc then I would say go for the 760cc. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase and would recommend this product to anyone who absolutely dreaded shaving as much as I did. It takes a little bit longer for a full shave, but if you keep up with the growth its not bad at all. I would trade an extra 3 minutes off the morning routine for decreased irritability any day. There is certainly a high price tag but in this case I believe you get what you are paying for.
  1018. I have owned several Braun products now as I have come to appreciate the reliabilty and beauty in all their products. While I realize they are more expensive and replacement parts aren't cheap either, I am willing and in a position to pay that in return for a quality, German made product. I have owned two Braun razors as well as a Braun coffee pot and toothbrush. All have been top notch in terms of reliability, ease of operation, and aesthetic appeal. Ideally I would like to buy American made products and avoid buying products made in China, however I have come to realize that most if not all of our American manufacturers have opted for better margins and sent production overseas.
  1019. Shave decently, but I expect more from a shaver at this price. Just not worth the money it costs.
  1020. Very good product. A little pricey but it does a very good job of shaving. I would still purchase one.
  1021. One month in, everything with this razor has gone well so far. I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly my face adapted to using the razor (within a week). The shave is very comfortable! It's been several years since I've used an electric, so I'm having to relearn techniques. So far the shave is very close, but it isn't super close. I've found that you do not need to clean the razor every day on the base. I run the cleaning cycle after about 3 uses, and rinse the head under running water every other time without any noticeable difference. This will help the cleaning solution last longer. One tip, after you rinse the head, let it sit on the counter until it's completely dry - don't stick it in the base wet. There are two little things that I've found as small negatives, but all things considered, it's still 5 stars in my book. First is the noise - especially in the clean cycle. If you're using this early in the morning, it has the potential to wakeup a light sleeper in the next room. The cleaning cycle isn't any louder than normal use, but it reverberates through the counter, etc. The second thing is that I'm still having a little issue cutting as close on the neck-line - still working on the technique.
  1022. [[ASIN:B000Q6SU3C Braun Series 7- 790cc Pulsonic Shaver]]I purchased this product after using the older model for about five years. I had changed the head a couple of times and then decided to try the new model series 7 Pulsonic Shaver. I found that however good the old model was, this new one was even better. The shave it produces is as good as a wet razor shave. There is no drag or soreness afterwards and it is quick and cleans up in no time. I must recommend this product with as much strength as I can. I am most pleased with the purchase and the excellent price I obtained through Amazon.
  1023. Decent razor, but why too pricey for what you get. Everything about it is pricey. I prefer my more simple previous razor that didn't require cleaning pods.   1024. I have read some reviews, where the users say their shaver stops working after a while. Please note that the shaver has two electric contacts on the shaver itself and the cradle, that must be cleaned with a Q-Tip and alcohol monthly to keep grime off them. If these contacts gets oxidized, then the unit won't work. Sometimes you might have to clean the contacts with some light grit sandpaper or steel wool to get them shiny again...if they are not shiny, then they are not making good electrical contact. My shaver works great. It does not always get all the whiskers growing on my neck, so I just use a swipe of a regular razor to get those stray hairs.

  1033. I've had this shaver for five years, but let's be honest, it's mostly a vehicle for the replaceable shaver heads which last 6-8 months before they need to be replaced. Don't forget the cleaner packs that need to be replaced every month or two. It's probably over-priced considering how many add-ons you will need to buy over time. That being said, the LED read out is nice, the ability to easily clean the shaver makes me do it after every use, which makes it a better shaving experience versus the other electric shavers I've had in the past. As for the vibrations, I have no idea if it's that or the shave head itself, but it shaves very close.

  1035. Yep, that’s what one British reviewer said about the Braun Series 7 shaver, and he wasn’t kidding. I used to use a Norelco until my beard got just too tough for it. For a while I was at my wit’s end trying to get a close shave. Not even a new shaving head did anything. So I began to do some research on the web. I researched for almost three weeks until I finally discovered this shaver. Wow! Expensive — around $250 — but worth every penny. Incredible technology. It is built entirely on a robotic assembly line in Germany, every one is perfect. It shaves you blade-close, and with no skin irritation. I kid you not. Then, when you’re finished you put it upside down into a special base and press the button on the base. The shaver head starts vibrating and is then flooded by the base with an alcohol/lubricant solution that cleans and lubricates the head to pristine-clean, heat-dries it, and leaves it with a fresh lemon fragrance — wow! I recommend this shaver to everyone — even women, if they need it! ;-)
  1036. Have used the Braun Pulsonic razor for 4 years and love it. Still does a very good job. Quick and smoth. Have to change the cassette head about every 9 months, but that is easy and reasonable. Expensive razor, but will buy another one if this damaged or quits working.
  1037. I bought this product to replace a Philips shaver that I had used for 15 years before it died. I bought the Braun to give the foil heads a try (as opposed to rotary heads of the Philips). The shaver worked well for about 2 years. The part which I am most disappointed about is the cleaning system called 'Clean and Renew'. The unit is cheaply made and cleaning solution seems to evaporate rapidly as the seals are not that great. This means you have to replace the cleaning solution capsule too often. In addition, the power cord does not sit firmly in the socket on the cleaning unit and thus does not make good contact. Shaver itself works reasonably well although hair stubbles seem to leak from shaver chamber occasionally even after cleaning. For the price, the unit is a disappointment.

  1041. Just got my new 9595 Braun in the mail, and even though I have only used it twice I'm so far impressed. This shaver replaced my old Norelco James Bond series which the battery started to go after two years. The Braun 9595 cuts better than my old norelco, and does not pull and rip the hairs like the norelco. Another great thing about the Braun is that after several minutes of shaving it does not get hot on the skin, and the cleaning system is great, the shaver feels new after it goes through it's cleaning cycle. The price is a little steep, but it seems to be a good foil shaver so far, only time will tell, but I would at least refer this type of shaver to a friend.
  1042. I have been using electric razors for 17 years now and I typically buy a new one every two to three years, to see what advances have been made in the technology. I have been using norelco all my life, but my wife was complaining about leaving little hairs all around, so I decided to try the more established braun cleaning system. Big mistake. I got the razor and it seemed ok at first. It cleaned successfully a few times, but by the third or fourth time the cleaning system stopped responding to the razor altogether. If it doesn't light up with some status, there is no way to make the cleaning system turn on, so it is entirely wasted. I should have just returned the product within the 30 days that they allow you to, but I made the next mistake of trying to go through braun customer service. They told me to send just the cleaning system to a service center. I sent that in and waited around. Finally, after a bunch more phone calls, they said I had to send the razor in also, which I did. Eventually, the service center sent both back to me, saying they couldn't solve the problem. So I called braun again, and they said to send them just the cleaning system. I pointed out that clearly the problem could be with the razor, since the razor needs to make contact with the system, but they didn't care to listen to that. They sent me a new cleaning system, but it experienced exactly the same problem again. When I called back again, they refused to replace the razor. They said I would have to send it to a service center again. Having already paid shipping to send the products around 3 times, and bought more cleaning fluid to replace what had by now evaporated, I decided it was time to stop wasting my money. I'm just going back to norelco, which both makes good products and has good service. If you ignore the cleaning system, the braun razor itself seems basically ok, but there is no reason to prefer it to norelco.
  1043. I have been using this shaver for two months, and it does a reasonable job. I still have difficulty getting a close shave in certain trouble spots, but it does a better job in general than any other electric shaver I have used.
  1044. I found the pulsonic liberating. I am constantly looking forward to the next shave. Beard just melts away in a few minutes, without pain. Great.
  1045. To start off I am 41 years old and have been using electric shavers for 25 years. Blade shavers destroy my face and my beard is so tough and thick that they never worked for me. I have mainly owned Norelco's over this time. The only experience I have had with a foil electric was with cheap Panasonics I bought when I was younger (like $19.99). Back when I used these they worked very well but the foil would wear down or break too soon and cut me. From there I purely have been using each Norelco or other kinds of lift and cut systems. The 9595 is my first try at a foil in a long time. Unlike many reviews here you can look at my history and see my review for the top of the line Norelco that I've had for about 2 1/2 years. I can say that I was satisfied with the Norelco and if the Pulsonic had not had a good review at Gizmodo.com I would not have even looked at it. Once I came and started reading reviews I became very interested. I hate HATE shaving to the point where I usually shave about every 4 days. I work at home so I don't need the \\"office\\" look. Let me compare the two shavers for a true review of the advantages in the 9595. First of all when I opened the box and put in the cleaning cartridge I noticed that the cleaner system is about 1000% better and easier than the Norelco system. The Norelco system requires you to pull apart the case and pour the liquid into a tiny hole - and then screw it shut and put it back onto the base and let the liquid flow in. Also, when you add more liquid you must clean the dissolved hair from the cleaning system. It's messy and a pain in the ass. However I will say that the cleaning system did make each shave in effect seem like I was using a new razor which is what the purpose was. Another defect was that it takes forever to clean, and then you must take it out and lay it down to dry (or put it back in the system to rest but that takes longer). The Pulsonic is designed beautifully. You take the cartridge and put itin... that's the complete effort. Then when it's empty you get a new one. That alone may have convinced me to get a new shaver - the ease is terrific. Also unlike the Norleco where once it's done shaving and charging you have to take it out to get it to stop (make the charge and cleaning lights go off) the Pulsonic cleans and then blow dries it with heat! No need to ever take it out - it goes off when it's done - fantastic. The one noticable disadvantage of the Pulsonic cleaning system is that it's NOISY and it takes much longer. By noisy I mean SHUT THE DOOR noisy. The Noreclo wasn't quiet but this is just LOUD. So the conclusion for the cleaning system is that it's heads and tails better than the Norelco system. If not for the time and noise it would be 100%. Onto the shave. The Norelco was a fairly slow shaver to shave with. Yes, you could get a close shave with it after about 13-15 minutes but you had to keep going over areas. Also it was terrible on the neck - it just misses hairs until you go over and over them. I got so bored with it that I started shaving it with it while browsing on the computer and then finished off in front of a mirror. Did it do it's job? YES. Was the shave good? YES. But it was slow and took real effort to do a good job. The only part of my face that I noticed that the Norelco did a better job than the Pulsonic was my lower chin. And that's a review after only one use. I may learn to get that area better in the future. Onto the Pulsonic. Today was my first try with 4 days of beard growth. heavy and grey in many spots on the chin area. Let me make one thing clear to those comparing a blade to an electric shaver. You will ALWAYS get a faster closer shave with a blade. The blade is ON YOUR SKIN taking the hair and skin off as you shave. I don't know how anyone would think you can get closer than that. With ANY electric shaver you are going to have to go over areas more than once - it's a given and there is noway to avoid it. So stop saying the blade is closer etc.. of course it is. The Pulsonic took me about half the time that the Norelco did - about 6 or 7 minutes and this was just my first try. It does get FAR more hair off on every try and it is WAY faster. I found that I could shave most areas extremely quickly - I was amazed at how fast it was. I was blown away at the speed that it took the hair off compared to what I've been using. Now if I had just gone over my face once with this it would have been just an OK shave. But you can't do that with an electric shaver as I explained. I found that going over the areas fast a few times got me a very very close shave without missing anything. The tough areas were the chin and neck - but it still did my neck way way faster than the Norelco. The Pulsonic really takes the hair off - the power difference is extremely noticable - it's like replacing an old lawn mower with a turbo. There is one negative - and it's the same as the negative with the cleaning - it SOUNDS like it's powerful. The noise is about 10 times what my Norelco was making. It's LOUD. Not just a little loud - real loud - shut the door loud. As far as the form I found it fit in my hand just fine. I used it without the lock the first time and I will play with it as time goes on. Also I noticed that like any other new shaver you need to learn how to shave with it - there is a method. This should speed up the process and get my a closer shave faster. How close is the shave compared to the Norelco or any other shaver I've ever used? WAY closer. As I said above - just going over it once is not going to do it - go over it until you can feel with your hand that the shave is close. I asked my wife how my skin felt afterwards and she said it was incredibly close - much closer than anything I've ever used. In fact I am feeling my face now and I can tell that it's the closest shave I ever have had. Finally the Pulsonic 9595 is a beautiful piece of design and looks more like a small coffee maker than a shaver. It's white with bright blue lights and looks terrific. Way better than the Norelco system I had. I would recommend this for anyone who uses an electric shaver who wants a top notch designed system and about the closest shave I think an electric will give you. If you are considering moving from a blade to an electric then expect to have to put some more effort into getting close. The plastic carrying case is fine - sure it's ugly plastic but who really cares? The Norelco had a fancy black case but I found it bulky and hard to close. Ah one last bad thing about the design I just recalled. The plug on the Pulsonic does not stretch very far. You will need to put the base near the plug because it's one of those stretchy cords. My old Norelco had a standard cord and could be put anywhere on my sink area. Also the plug on this really sticks out FAR. I don't know the logic they used to make it not flush with the wall but it's not even close. Feel free to post questions. FYI - I don't work for Braun or Norelco. I am a founder and run Toldya.com... a website. UPDATE! After owning this since January of 2008 I am finding that it's breaking down. I just had to throw away the cleaning unit because it got clogged up and was leaking the cleaning solution all over the place. I attempted to clean it out and put a fresh cartridge in but it leaked again. It's not worth it for me to call and get a replacement so I threw it in the garbage. The shaver still works great but the head doesn't move as well and the lock mechanism is cheap and broken. Hopefully water will clean it well or I will need a new shaver.
  1046. I am one of the hardest people to please and am usually sceptical of other's reviews on products. That being said this shaver is by far the most superior shaver ever. I have tried a lot of other high-end shavers and can honestly say this is the closest shave I have ever got from an electric. Heck, it is pretty close to using a blade! You might be able to get closer with a blade, but it would be so minimally closer than with the Braun that you can't tell. The cleaning system is awesome too! No more cleaning the razor. Just hit the button and the system takes care of itself. No emptying cut hair from the razor... I love this Braun. It's expensive, but worth every single penny!
  1047. I like it, but not as much as my 7526 synchro that I had to replace. It is a little bulky compared to it. I'm not sure if the 10K vibes thing really does anything or not. The travel case is kind of a joke and is only for the shaver not the the shaver and the power cord. Was it worth the over $200 I paid, probably not so it better last me four to five years. I like that it can be rinsed out under the water and the battery and hygiene display that tells you when it needs a full clean. Also that you can do a short clean or a long clean is nice compared to my old syncro.
  1048. Best electric razor by far. This is the second Braun I have owned, very pleased with both, but this one is far superior.
  1049. I've never written a review before, but the reviews on this site helped me make an informed decision on this shaver, and other merchandise, and I want to return the favor. I am 46 years old and have been using razors my entire adult life. I've tried electric shavers a few times over the years (as recenltly as 6 years ago) and always returned to razors after a few days because the electrics were too unconfortable and didn't do an effective job. My hands have become less steady and I reluctantly needed to switch to electric. I did my research and based on the reviews on this site and Consumer Reports settled on the Braun Pulsonic. I received it quickly (Thanks Amazon!) and dreaded using it for the first time based on my previous experiences. I was pleasantly surprised that the shave was comfotable, close, and fast. As close as my razor and with no fear of nicks and cuts. I've been using it a week and so far the cleaning system has been keeping it that way. My expectations have been far exceeded. Jose
  1050. This razor is the best I have ever used during my sixty year of shaving..as you can see I have used quite a few. I must say that the Braun Pulsonic tops them all.

  1052. This is my first Braun and I am quite happy with the performance. Very smooth and close shave. Comes with a plastic travel case for the electric razor but the recharge/cleaner base is distinctly NOT easily portable: The alcohol cartridge would spill everywhere. It did hold a charge for a 7-day trip I went on so should not be a big worry. All in all remarkable technology in my opinion.
  1053. It works well so far, but I'm not happy with the cleaning system, I prefer to do it manually. It vibrates and makes more noise than the Norecol.
  1054. I've tried many different electric shavers,and this one is the most comfortable I've tried. I was using a Panasonic ES8077S Vortex which is a good wet shaver, but the Pulsonic 9595 was a dream to shave with dry. It was a super close, gentle shave. A word of advice, if you are a 'Cut and Lift Norelco' guy I doubt this Foil shaver will please you, but try it, there is a 30 money back guarantee. If 'Foil Shaving' works best for you, don't hesitate to drop the $200 ... it's well worth it.
  1055. After 20+ years of using Braun and, most recently, Panasonic electric shavers, I decided to take the plunge for the Braun Pulsonic. WOW!!! I'm glad I did. Because of the price, I had high expectations - it did not disappoint! I cannot believe how quickly I can now shave...I have tough stubble and it shaves it on first pass. It's quiet, self cleans, and is, without a doubt, the best electric shaver I have ever owned.
  1056. I read lots of great reviews for this razor and ordered it with high expectations. I've been using it for about three weeks now and I have to say that I'm not nearly as impressed as everyone else seems to be. Maybe I got a bad unit or something. It feels nice in the hand and it seems quite powerful and the pop-up trimmer works great. But I'm just not getting a very close shave at all with it. I have to go over all parts of my face and neck two or three times, stretching the skin in every way possible, and even then I still find areas that could have been closer. I really wanted to like this razor, especially because it's so expensive. I've had great Braun razors before, but this isn't one of them. I'm sorry that I can't agree with everyone else on this one. BTW, I'm sure that part of the reason this razor is so expensive is because Braun really overdid the packaging. You'd think the packaging was for some precious family heirloom or valuable jewels, not an electric razor.
  1057. I've owned many electric razors over the years, all rotory (Norelco). I stopped using them as they just couldn't get the job done giving me a close shave, especially in the tough areas such as the neck. I was skeptical at first, but after the rave reviews I read here on Amazon, and the consumer reports, I decided to give the Braun Pulsonic a try. In short, it is the best electric razor I have ever owned. It shaves every bit as close as the Gillette Fusion razor. I actually look forward to shaving. I usually don't shave during the weekend, but now my wife thinks somthings up because now I do. I wholeheartedly recommend this razor.

  1060. I am 77 years old and have been using electric shavers for over 50 years. This shaver is without a doubt the best of those I have owned. It gives a very close shave without irritation to my face which is a first for me and I highly recommend it without reservation.
  1061. After reading the glowing reviews I decided to go for one of these. As others mentioned it comes rather \\"overpackaged\\" but once removed from the box it seems like a nice unit in the hand. However my first shave was a disappointment - it shaved but it wasn't \\"amazing\\", just average. I was feeling like I had wasted my money but continued to use it over the next week and then the magic happened - as my beard got used to the shaver it shaved closer and closer. Now it is without a doubt the best shaver I have ever used - truly as close as a blade. So even if you are used to using Brauns (as I was) you need to give your face a little time to get used to this different shaver - the wait is worth it.
  1062. Got this shaver a couple of weeks ago, and love it. I had used the Braun Activator model up to now, which was good, but did leave my skin a bit sensitive at times when I was in a hurry. This Braun is totally different in that my skin is much happier after I shave with this Braun than with anything prior. I think that is because the pulses move the head so fast that there is no time for the shaver to \\"pull\\" the hairs and create the sensitivity. The shaver feels great in the hand with its smaller diameter and L-Ion battery that cuts the weight to less than my previous Braun. It just feels really great to hold and use. The LCD readout of the battery and hygiene status is also very helpful. I nearly always use alcohol-based after-shave and cologne after shaving, and in the past that stung sometimes a lot depending on the way I shaved, how fast, when I last shaved, etc. With this Pulsonic, to me it feels as if there is no alcohol in my post-shave liquids since my skin is so much less irritated after shaving with this. That alone is worth the upgrade! I love the \\"full suspension\\" of the heads as they float over the bumps and ridges of one's face and neck, and keep the head more gently pressed against my face when moving the shaver around my beard. I have always hated shaving and still do, but this Braun makes that chore about as painless as I've ever experienced to date. I still have my old Braun as a backup or emergency shaver, but after using this one it would be hard to go back even to that excellent shaver. This pulse thing takes shaving to a whole new level, and is truly a lot more than a marketing gimmick which is what I usually think of when I see the word \\"new.\\" This truly is a new way to shave that may be the standard for years to come. I will mention that it did take about a week before my face got used to the new Braun, even though I had used an older Braun up to that point. Now that my face and Braun have gotten well acquainted, my shave now is closer and faster than the first time I used it. Or maybe I'm just learning how to use it more effectively. I think that one needs to let their face and shaver get to \\"know\\" each other for a week or two before making a judgment as to quality of shave.
  1063. I recently purchased this new madel Braun razor. I have owned several Braun shavers before, most recently one of the 8000 series. The overall quality of this model is well below that of the 8000 series. The fit and finish is poor and the razor doesnt dock well with the base. It took three times for me to even get it to charge. I would suggest saving the extra $100 and going with the 8000 series.
  1064. Without a doubt the best foil electric razor on the market!!!! Super smooth mechanism and a relative quiet shave gives this unit high marks. Price is a bit on the steep side but if you prefer an electric over a blade, do yourself a favor and buy this. Cleaning system and charging base is 1st rate.
  1065. Switched from Norelco about 20 years ago and have been using Braun shavers ever since. Used safety and even straight razors before that. Was using a 5000 series before the Syncro and most recently the Activator. The Syncro was good, but the foil design of the Activator was more effective getting the stray hairs from my lower jaw and neck area. The Clean & Charge is a good feature of both the Syncro and Activator and, although I don't like the cost of the cartridges, is one reason I stayed with Braun when I purchased the Pulsonic. It's nice to have a clean and charged shaver every morning with such little effort. I expected good things from the Pulsonic, and have not been disappointed. I have to say it was not very impressive, compared to the Activator, for the first couple of days and I was thinking it was going back. I thought since I have been using Braun shavers for so long that there was not going to be a learning period for my beard. There was no transition period for me when switching from the Syncro to the Activator. Not so for the Pulsonic...I noticed much better performance on the third and fourth days. Even on the first day, I thought the Pulsonic provided a more comfortable shave than the Activator. The Activator never was uncomfortable or caused a rash or abrasion, but the design of the floating head on the Pulsonic is better. I could barely hear the whiskers being trimmed with the new cutter. But even after going over the same areas in different directions, for the first couple of days, I could not seem to get all the stubble. I could run my fingertips over those areas and still feel some of the uncut hairs. I followed up with the Activator for the first three days and got the smoother shave on the first two days. After that, I have not been using both shavers. Both shavers provide very close and smooth shaves in a reasonable amount of time, but already I will have to say the Pulsonic seems faster. Now, less than two weeks since I started using it, I'm planning on keeping the Pulsonic. Other shavers under consideration are new models from Norelco and Panasonic. Of the two brands, I was inclined toward the Panasonic because of the foil and cleaning system. The second model from the top in the Panasonic line (ES8109S) is made in China (not sure where the nearly identical ES8228S is made) and, although it boasts the fastest rpm, it sounds like it takes a long time to get a close shave according to the reviews I have read. The cheaper Panasonic may be an excellent value, but the top of the line is in the same price range as the Pulsonic (after discounts). I prefer the handling characteristics of the Pulsonic over the older Braun models. The grip is more contoured and the surface is more non-slip compared to the bulkiness of the Syncro and Activator. The trimmer of the Pulsonic is different than the excellent trimmers on the older models, but may be just as good once I get used to it. The noise from the Pulsonic is slightly louder and higher pitched from the slower Activator, but not objectionable. My best suggestion for those considering the purchase of this shaver is to follow the instructions. Shave before washing your face or showering and give the new shaver at least two weeks of daily use to see if it's right for you.
  1066. The 9595 Shaving system shaves better than any one I have had before. The Clean and Renew is a must, which gives your shaver a lemon scent every time you use it.
  1067. So i have been using the Norelco Speed XL shaver for over a year now and it is great. After seeing this fancy Braun pulsonic and reading all the great reviews on it i thought i should buy it and give it a try. So after a few days of using it i wasn't all that impressed with it. Don't get me wrong, i think the braun is a good product, but for those who have had the norelco experience they think that the braun is inadequate. If you check the reviewers that gave this thing a 1 or 2 star you see that they are displeased because they are all Norelco users. So the Pro for the Braun: --Holds a charge for a long time --attractive looking product with a beautiful LCD --cleans itself nicely Cons: --the pulsonic makes it much louder than the norelco --not a close shave compared to the norelco --much more expensive than the norelco speed xl Overall, the Braun does a good job compared to a lot of shavers out there, but definitely not a close shave compared to the Norelco speed-xl
  1068. I've been shaving with electric razors for over 20 years, and I've always had problems with razor-burn around my jaw and neckline despite trying several popular preshave products and razors. However, about a month ago, I've finally decided to spring for a Braun Pulsonic 9595, and I'm happy to report I no longer have any problems with razor-burn. This is a wonderfully close-shaving electric razor--it even has a special central strip in its head that will cut through a thick, multi-day shadow with no painful pulling or pinching. None of the other dozen or so electric razors I have tried over the years have ever managed to do this! The self-cleaning feature is also very useful and impeccably cleans the inside of the razor foil; the cleaning solution tanks are reasonably-priced if purchased as a three-pack, and my first tank is still mostly full after a month of use with daily cleanings. The razor also comes with a well-made plastic carrying case for travelling purposes, and this is the best-packaged razor I have ever seen. My only critique is the somewhat awkward location of the flip-up sideburn trimmer--if you're not careful, the active razor foil might give you an unintentional haircut while you're trimming your sideburns. If you have thick & rapidly-growing facial hair, problems with razor-burn, or desire a close shave, I believe you'd greatly benefit from this high-quality razor.
  1069. I am using the shaver now for 4 months. The shaver itself works very well. I like especially the cleaning station which leaves the shaver in top condition and completely clean from the inside. I am wondering however if the daily charging that comes with each cleaning is not draining the capacity of the battery more rapidly. I hope the charger is a trickle charger. The cleaning solution lasts for almost exactly one month, also as advertised. Ok, so why am I giving this unit only 1 star? Because the power adapter failed me after 4 months and the rigid service system Braun has behind its products is not acceptable by a long shot. The $215 shaver comes with a 2 year warranty that covers parts like these. Unlike many other companies who sent you a new replacement/exchange part in a matter of 2-3 business days after asking a few questions on the phone, Braun gives you the run-around. First you need to call the central service line, where your concern is simply noted. You are then forwarded to a local/regional service center that actually needs to looks at the unit. These are little shops to which Braun has outsourced the actual repair. No big thing I thought. By connecting the power adapter directly to the shaver it became clear right away that the power adapter was broken (no blinking of segments). In my case my closest service center was in Woodland Hills with the encouraging name \\"Speedy Appliances\\". Luckily I decided to not follow the advice of the central Braun service to send the entire unit including shaver to that location. Instead I drove the 15 miles down there on a sunny morning, hoping I could leave with a new adapter. Sure enough the staff there determined in 1 minute that the unit was indeed broken and that this would we a warranty case. Without looking anywhere in his store he said that he would need to order the adapter. It turned out that that it would take about 2-3 weeks and that the adapter would first need to be shipped to his store and then he would ship it to my address adding another few days to it. There was no way that the unit could be drop shipped directly to me. When calling the central Braun line the next business day asking them if this of-the-shelf adapter could not be shipped directly, I got the same \\"we are not flexible\\" approach. Any warranty part needs to go out to the service center first. Alternatively I could order the unit also directly from the parts center in which case it would ship directly to me, but I also would need to pay for everything. Afterwards I called the parts line directly to see out of curiosity what the power adapter costs and how long it takes them to ship to me: $21 plus $5 S&H, in stock, could be there in 5-7 business days. If Braun would use batteries that last 4-6 weeks I would give them all the time in the world to work in the archaic, snail-paced service world, but the battery lasts about 1.5 weeks if used daily. And daily use is the whole idea behind a shaver and many other Braun products isn't it... Luckily I still have my older high-end Norelco, who will serve me well while Braun gets my adapter mailed around the US. So, don't toss your old unit yet if you decide to buy this product. You might need it sooner rather than later.
  1070. The shaver is unreal as a dry shaver. I have a stiff hard to shave beard also fairly recently had voice box removed and have a stoma. Some tender areas on the neck as a result. This shaver is soft on my skin, shaves CLOSE, quick, and gets into hard to reach areas, (such as a dip I have above my Stoma). I have nothing but praise for it. I actually enjoy shaving with it. Cleaning unit is very good. I also have a Braun 360 Complete shaver which is good but I rate this one better. Cuts a bit faster and the head swivels smoother and further. Would I recommend it to a friend? Oh Yes. One of my better buys.

  1072. I was a norelco guy for the past 10 years, I'm asian american and my facial hair doesn't grow much so i can usually get away with shaving once a week. W/ the norelco even after changing out the blades it would sometimes 'pull' my hair. First time i used the Braun it felt like a facial massage, I did have to go over the same area a few times more w/ the braun but it was deff more comfortable. Also the hygiene and battery meter is great. I still open up the head and give it a nice brush after each shave. only down side to this is the continuous cost of buying the cleaning agent.   1073. I am one of those individuals who use an electric shaver out of necessity, rather than just personal preference. From time to time, I have used razor blades, disposable or high-end, only to have my face transformed into something looking like hamburger. Call me a baby face if you like, but electric shavers have been the only shaving device that have kept my morning shaving routine from resembling some sort of torture session. Consequently, I have gone through 25+ years of adulthood going from one electric shaver to the next; always with the hope for that perfect shave, but always left wanting. Having said that, Braun shavers have always been my default electric shaver. While I have occasionally tried other brands, I always found myself coming back to Braun and their reliable foil shavers; they always seemed to outperform all the others. While Braun shavers \\"got the job done\\", they too had their shortcomings: they always seemed to 1) leave me with that occasional razor burn, 2) be unable to closely shave those one or two awkward places on my face, and 3) take too long to get the job done - sometime requiring several passes across the same place to get an even reasonably close shave. But having tried multiple electric shavers, I had convinced myself that this was as good as it was going to get. However, I continued to hold out hope that something better might eventually come along... Enter the Braun Pulsonic 9595! After reading several of the reviews of this shaver, I was intrigued. However, to say that I suffered from sticker shock, would be an understatement. \\"Surely no electric shaver could possibly be worth that kind of money, could it?\\" Following several months of mental debate and calisthenics, I finally decided to take the plunge about three months ago. \\"Could this finally be the one?!\\" In short, yes, it could and it is! This shaver is different than anything else I have ever used. The pulsonic technology is not just a marketing gimmick, it really works. Here's been the impact: razor burns have been non-existent, my daily shaving time has been decreased by a third, and close shaves have become the norm, rather than the exception. Let me provide a few specifics and personal recommendations. The owner's manual, similar to most Brauns, recommend using the shaver before washing your face. That may work for some people, but not for me. Washing my face, then allowing at least 15 minutes for it to completely dry has provided the most comfortable and close shave. Second, pressing harder with this shaver actually makes it less effective. I know this is counter-intuitive, but it must have to do with the pulsonic technology. So, if you encounter a patch of whiskers or a certain part of your face that is particularly uncooperative, make a light pass across the area with the shaver. If your experience is like mine, you'll be amazed that the hair instantly disappears. Over time, I've gradually trained myself to shave, while applying less pressure with the shaver. This has resulted in quicker and closer shaves! This is the first time I have owned an electric shaver with a cleaning system. The LCD screen indicates the shaver needs to be cleaned after about every three shaves, even though the charge lasts for 5-6 shaves. Consequently, I usually wait until the battery needs to be charged before I clean it. However, I remove the foil screen head after each shave and tap-out the razor stubble. This routine has worked just fine, while extending the \\"life\\" of the cleaning fluid. After almost three months, the electronic level indicator still shows the fluid level as \\"high\\". If you're a clean freak, you can clean your shaver more frequently (I've read several reviews from people who do so after every shave), but I believe it's overkill. Besides, you'll buy considerably more cleaning fluid. Bottom-line: When it comes to my morning shaving routine, I feel like I have finally arrived! While I am not sure that shaving could ever become pleasurable, this shaver has at least removed the dread from this daily task. Moreover, I can't imagine there is another electric shaver on the market that provides a better, quicker and more comfortable shave. I know my wife is probably tired of hearing, \\"Have I told you how much I like this shaver?!\\" This electric shaver is simply the best!
  1074. I have tried every electric shaver there is, and none will compare to this one. I simply is the best there is. It will need the usual two to three weeks to get used to. It is worth the extra money in every respect.
  1075. I have had several different electric razors. This one beats them all for closeness and ease of care and cleaning.
  1076. Awesome razor - good buy for what you get. My face has never been this smooth and I'm a grandpa.
  1077. A great machine. Pros: - Pretty close shave - Great design, easy grip, pretty - Self-clearing feature works great. Cons: - Don't expect it to be as close as a manual razor.
  1078. This is my third braun shaver in the last 15 years. they just keep getting better. this one shaves very close and very fast. the only thing is, it seems to use the cleaning fluid a lot faster then the last model. You need to clean the unit every 3 or 4 shaves. I had to change the cartrige after a month and the old unit lasted twice as long... Waiting to see how long the cutter head lasts and costs to replace .... but its a AAA unit
  1079. Over the last 20 plus years I have owned at least 5 different Braun shavers and a couple of Norelcos. One or two in the bunch were noteworthy. All I used more than a year. I read these positive reviews with sceptisim to say the least. I bit the bullet and ordered this razor.<br /><br />Bar None this is the Best razor that I have ever used. It provides the closet, quickest shave of any of the Braun's I have owned in the past. In fact it gets so close that there is a spot under my nose that appears I waxed my face! That is a bit irritating and somewhat surprising. I have to stop shaving for a few days to let the hair grow back to even out my normal 5 O'clock shadow. Get this, I actually look forward to shaving now. Previously I needed to touch up my face with a blade (dry) to get those hard to shave spots under my jawline right by my ears and on my neck. This razor gets them all with no trouble. Simpy amazing.<br /><br />As with all electric razors daily use is critical to get them to work well. Second tip-Do not wash your face before shaving. Third tip-Do not shave first thing in the morning as the face is swollen from sleep and needs time to return to normal.<br /><br />If you use an electric shaver, even though this one is pricey it has been absolutley the best I have owned.
  1080. I had used a traditional 3 headed Norelco electric shaver for over 10 years and was used to the quality of shave it provided not knowing how close a real electric shaver could shave. Then I tried the Braun Series 7 shaver and my face has not felt so smooth since I was a kid! I have received a couple of complements on my smooth skin from girlfriends too which is an added bonus! I highly recommend this shaver and will not return to the Norelco!!
  1081. It worked fine for 11 months. Went to shave and it was dead even though it had been charging for most of the day. I researched and found other people had same problem. I am dreading the hassle I know awaits me of trying to get this fixed. Sorry Braun, for years I used your products but $200+ for 11 months can by me a lot of disposable razors. Before buying read the reviews (1 star and 2 star) to balance out the higher scores. I rated it highly too, at first.
  1082. I decided to upgrade from my 3-year old Braun Activator 8585, since that one missed occasional long hairs and stubble, particularly under the chin and around the jawline. Furthermore, it was never that close of a shave (you could still see/feel stubble), and it occasionally caused irritation, especially when I used the cleaning solution daily (instead I switched to monthly). Having used this 9595 top-of-the-line shaver for a couple of weeks now, I must say I am a little disappointed. The end result is not noticeably better than the Activator, yet I just spent about $200. On the other hand, the new design and feel of the shaver is nice, but probably not alone worth shelling out another $200. FYI, I ended up returning it directly to Braun (using their 60 day (?) money back guarantee), and I received a prompt full refund as promised, even though I had used it for almost 60 days.
  1083. The Positives: This shaver looks great, feels great and very solid in your hand(well built), and the battery seemingly lasts forever without needing a recharge. It also has a lot of power and never bogs down even the slightest bit no matter how fast you try to shave with it or how thick or long the hair is. I also like the fact that it cleans itself and always smells lemony fresh after a cleaning. If you take your time with the shave, you can get a decently close shave, although nothing like a real razor. I find I get the best shave with this razor if I go very slowly over each spot, and go over the same spot several times against the grain but at different angles. The Negatives: This razor will actually give you little cuts sometimes on the lower parts of your neck. It doesn't do it all the time, but it does it enough to make me be very careful of it when shaving near my adams apple. Surprisingly, despite it being able to cut you, it often manages to miss hairs right next to where it made the minor cut... which seems odd to me, since the hairs are raised up higher than the skin that it cut. The cleaning solution for this device is quite expensive and can really add up over the course of the year(if you shave every day, you'll go through a single cleaning cartridge once every 35 to 50 days). I generally have to put it into cleaning mode every other shave, and it takes quite a while to finish the cleaning cycle.. during which the thing turns on and off repeatedly while inside the cleaning base. This razor is extremely loud in general and is extremely loud throughout the approximate 15 minute duration of the cleaning. The cleaning is soo loud that I actually had a house guest get annoyed enough by it to go into the other room and stop it mid-cycle once because she couldn't sleep with it going on. There are some hairs on parts of the neck that this thing occasionally just will not pick up and cut. I find that if I do a shave with this razor and then pick up my old 3-circle Norelco razor and do a quick pass over the section where it missed those hairs... the Norelco one instantly cleans up all the missed hairs on the first pass. Considering how much this thing costs, It's not worth the money. My next razor will be another one of those razors with the 3-cutting circles on the head.
  1084. I have been a razor user most of my life but I find the Braun Series7-790cc Shaver an excellent product. It produces a shave as close as any razor I have used and requires no lather and wash. I do use a pre shave product which makes for a smoother and less irritating shave but even without that product the shaver performs well. One does have to replace the cleaning solution cartridges occasionally but this is very easily performed and not costly. I would buy this shaver again.
  1085. I periodically use electric shavers at home and when traveling and have owned many different brands. I now only purchase Braun shavers. This Series-7 is the best of the Braun models yet. I highly recommend this model.
  1086. Even better than advertised if you don't use the wasteful, expensive cleaning solution. Buy a 5 cent brush, pop off the shaver heads, and brush clean.
  1087. Lasted only 3 years and 3 months and then DEAD.<br />As a top of the range, leading edge shaver it did give a good shave. Bought it in March 2009, the initial foil lasted till August 2010 ( 17 months use) until the foil actually wore through and severely scratched my face without any warning. I replaced the foil with a Genuine Braun replacement head/foil at a cost of $AUD95. It then continued to work Ok.<br /><br />I found that the Braun Cleaning system clogs up and does not perform as you would expect. You have to regularly check that the hole that returns fluid back into the cleaner cartridge does not get blocked as mine did and there is no warning. This means that the Foil/head is not cleaned by the Braun Cleaning system and its expensive cleaning solution. I found I had to check if the foil/head is clean after using the Braun Cleaning system (after every 4 shaves) and found I had to manually clean/brush the foil more after completing the normal Cycle.<br /><br />The Shaver Display gave the warning that the Foil was due to be replaced soon after 18 months of use.<br /><br />Now after 3 years and 3 months of use, 39 Months (approx every 2-3 days) it has stopped working and will not operate on either Battery Mode or connected direct to AC power. The Display works and shows that the batteries are fully charged. Looks like it has gone to the \\"high tech, early obsolescence\\" graveyard.<br /><br />The previous shaver I had was also a Braun, lower in the product range and lasted 7 years but with only weekend use as I used blade razors during the week for a closer shave. The batteries stopped charging after about 5 years, but the razor still worked when connected direct to AC power.<br /><br />I have complained to Braun about the poor useful life of this product and am now waiting their response. I would not recommend this product to anyone unless Braun acknowledges they have a product reliability problem and replace it under a statutory \\"Fit for Purpose\\" warranty.<br /><br />If I do not get a satisfactory response from Braun and now have to purchase a new shaver after such a short product life, it will certainly not be a Braun due to this appalling service life.
  1088. Like others over 50 I had it with electric shavers was ready to go back to Mach5. Gave this a try and was the best and quickest shave ive ever had. Usually my neck is very sensative and I hate shaving it with my old electric tugging out the wiskers, well no more! Smooth as a babys butt! Now the down side... 790cc initial cost SALE price $200. Clean and renew SALE price $32.24 for 6 FREE shipping add after 18 month as they recommend changing the foil/shaver $40 SALE price. For those that dont know you can use the Clean and Renew which is alcohol with a lubricant in it and that will last 30 days and Braun says a max of 8 weeks before it would everapate from the air. Now you can use water to clean it and have the hassle of air drying it, Braun even gives you oil to oil your shaver if you use water to clean it then once a week needs oiling. The clean and renew recharger/cleaning station with clean and renew in it cant go on planes since it is so flamable they even have to ground ship it to you. LOVE the shave best ive ever had but I figure the cost of this is $12+ a month figuring a shaver life of 36 months and changing the Clean and Renew once a month. So thats it the BEST at a COST! Now you know the rest of the story!
  1089. In setting the rating (number of stars), I had a bit of a quandary: IF I were rating it against all the other electric razors I have ever had, I would give it all 5 stars. However, I am rating it against what I would like to see as an ideal razor, which I guess does not exist. The ideal razor would shave as close as a blade WITHOUT requiring multiple passes over one's skin. This one falls far short of that. However, I have had Remington and Norelco in the past, and this one beats them significantly, both in ability to handle a tough beard and in comfort.<br /><br />I have had this razor for only about 2 weeks now, so can't say anything about longevity. IF you have a wimpy beard, you may be happy with a much less expensive razor. If you have a tough beard and have been frustrated by other razors (and if you are not expecting perfection), I do highly recommend this razor.
  1090. As a point of comparison, my previous shaver was an ancient Norelco 6826XL. I've preferred rotary razors for years, but the battery in my Norelco was dying (and unlike, say, an iPod, when the battery in a shaver dies, you can't even get it replaced by the manufacturer) and I'd heard that linear shaver technology had advanced, so I thought I'd try the Braun. In terms of the quality of the shave, it's not as good as a manual razor. It doesn't even give me a better shave than my old Norelco, and it takes longer, requires more facial manipulation, and makes a lot more noise than the Norelco. I can't see any particular benefit from the touted vibrating head. Perhaps it's very slightly more effective at picking up difficult hairs, but I'm not even sure of that. Nevertheless, while it is slower and louder than my Norelco, I'm reasonably satisfied with my purchase, because the cleaning system really does work as advertised. Although the head of my Norelco could be rinsed under running water, to get a really good shave I nevertheless had to disassemble it every couple of weeks and clean the half-dozen fiddly little parts with a brush. The Braun, on the other hand, does indeed seem to give an \\"as new\\" shave consistently if I run the cleaning cycle regularly. That's a good thing, because while it still comes with a little brush, there's not much you can do with it--the cutters are part of a sealed monolithic head module (which probably means greater expense if it is damaged or worn out, but that hasn't happened yet). Moreover, I experience less facial irritation with the Braun, probably because the alcohol-based cleaning solution reduces bacterial contamination. The cleaning cycle is noisy, but actually less so than shaving, because it is muffled a bit by the stand--although it can be disconcerting to hear the thing buzzing away in the bathroom with nobody in there. Disadvantages are that the cleaning solution leaves a residue on the head that smells bad--and tastes even worse if I happen to get it on my lips. And of course you have to periodically replace the cleaning solution (which lasts about a month, as advertised). You can rinse it under running water, which is fine for a short trip. The battery charge is good for over a week--at least now while it's still fairly new--and all you need to recharge it is the wire; you can leave the base at home. But I find that running the cleaning cycle regularly gives the best shave.
  1091. Excellent razor!! This is my second purchase of this item. I bought one as a gift for my husband last year and we have absolutely no problems with it, the shaver has outperformed every razor my husband has ever used. It is easy to use, easy to clean and just does it's thing, flawlessly. My dad, visiting us this year, agreed, so we purchased another for him this holiday. Can't say much more about our satisfaction except you will NOT be disapointed - well worth the price!
  1092. Gave the Pulsonic to my son-in-law for Christmas. He says it has cut his shaving time in half.
  1093. The best Shaver that I have ever brought. It just amazed me at how great it could be
  1094. Today is day three shaving with my new Braun Series 7. I had been shaving with a top of the line Panasonic, using it with Foamy, and pretty well convinced that I couldn't get a better shave. What eventually made me want to try a different shaver (again) was that the Panasonic was so noisy that it really bothered me. I was using clipper oil to tone down the noise but it seemed to reach a point where it wasn't helping. This was not the first time I had tried a different shaver. The last time the Panasonic noise got to me I bought a Norelco. That was two years ago and I returned it after one day. I loved how quiet it was but it didn't give me a close shave (ah...but the quiet was nice). The Braun is almost unbelievable. It's quiet and I'm shaving in half the time, getting a shave that is so close it makes me almost look forward to shaving. I shave my neck with no problem...all whiskers gone. I can't get over this. I find myself checking my face during the day for stubble. None, as in none! Oh...and no break-in time. My expectations were so low going into this purchase that I called Braun just to verify that the \\"60-day return policy\\" was a fact. I'll tell you, my expectations were high for this Series 7 thing, but I would never have thought that a great shave could be gotten this comfortably. Oh, and about the replacement cartridges, I'm glad to buy a new one every single month for the rest of my life! If it's a con, so what. I'm still happy to make the monthly purchase. The only negative is the LCD at the bottom of the shaver. It could have used a backlight.
  1095. Had a 5 series that broke. New shaver does better in some areas and worse in others than the old one. Overall, I am happy with the purchase.
  1096. Here is my two cents: Nothing is as close or leaves skin as smooth as a razor. The Pulsonic is suppose to have a \\"new & improved\\" shaving head, but I can't tell. I have been shaving with the Pulsonic now for almost a month, in which Braun states it takes 2-3 weeks for your facial hair/skin to adjust, and is still does not do my neck area good. Before the Braun's, I used a Norelco for about a year and after getting use to it, it seemed to shave closer including the neck area. Considering the price (paid $180 for mine), I would recommend a cheaper Braun or Norelco.

  1099. I don't normally leave reviews for products on Amazon, but every once in a while there comes along a product that is so amazing that I want to shout about it from the mountaintops. I felt every one of them. The smoothness afterwards is unparalleled in the world of electric razors. With my old razor, shaving was a chore. Sometimes I would let my hair grow out a day or two. Now I shave at least once a day, just for that feeling aftewards. If you value the feeling of a close shave without the hassle of a regular razor the B7 is a MUST buy.

  1107. I've never been much of a fan of razors (I used Gillette Mach 3) due to the skin irritation, but used them throughout high school and college as I wasn't required to shave daily. Once I graduated college and started a job, I knew that my skin wouldn't be able to handle daily shaves with a razor. After reading reviews, it looked like the Braun Series 7 was the best option out there, so I went with the \\"best\\" model and hoped that it worked out. After 2 years of use, I can say without hesitation that this was the right choice. I shave every morning with no irritation, and the shaver is still in great shape.<br /><br />The initial cost of the product is somewhat steep, but not having to buy razor cartridges definitely offsets that initial purchase. I'm still on my original electric shaver head, but I'm considering replacing that soon (it still feels fine, but I'm starting to wonder if I don't know what I'm missing). I'm also able to stretch a clean and renew pack for about two months. I've found that a cleaning after 3 uses tends to be the right balance (this is generally how long it takes me to drain down the \\"Hygiene\\" gauge on the shaver). I also use Amazon's \\"Subscribe and Save\\" program to have the refill packs automatically sent to me every 6 months at a 15% discount. So with that in mind, I believe the month to month costs are lower than traditional razors.<br /><br />Overall, I'm very happy with this purchase, and I would recommend this product to anyone. I've had no regrets about going with the Braun Series 7.
  1108. Had this for several years now. Work great. Good quality shave. It all about the autocleaning. Keeps the razor fresh, sharp and ready. Braun has done a really great job with all design features. Sensing cleanliness levels, power, battery, charger, travel case, etc. - excellent design.
  1109. Cleaning station made to cheaply. After reading all the complaints, I find that the &#34;Cleaning Station&#34; will now become a nice place to place my razor, after I self-clean. Luckily, I can still charge the razor, which I am happy with.<br />Additional problem with the &#34;Cleaning Station&#34; 1) contacts don't always line up. 2) the return hole area gets plugged from the debris of shaving, 3) several times, I've found the solution has leaked onto the counter, during cleaning, when it was still cleaning. Next time, I'll just buy the Razor.

  1112. Fantastic shaver. Shaves close, stays clean. I have not been able to find an exact replacement Gillette head for it, however; the replacement head has rows of perfectly round holes rather than the complex pattern of the Gillette head. I find that shaving with the replacement head is faster, but less close. Put another way, after replacing the head, it becomes an excellent shaver rather than a fantastic one.<br /><br />Is it worth the money? Consider the ongoing cost of the cleaning supplies when making the purchase decision. Personally, after three years of daily use I still love this shaver, and I have no regrets whatsoever. It is by a large margin the best shaver I have ever used.
  1113. Purchased this Pulsonic, my first electric, way back in 2007 and not a single regret. I have a Cro Magnon Man beard when it comes to thickness and I often wonder mornings if the image in the mirror is indeed the missing link. My beard is so thick that I can't pull a fusion razor through it. So, for the last 5 years, I've taken a three prong approach using a single blade then a triple and a final pass with the Pulsonic. I transform from Cro Magnon Man to baby's butt in a handful of minutes. The pookie just loves it. She's a nibbler and I enjoy all the attention my shave attracts.<br /><br />Sadly, my trimmer went south today and the blades are beginning to cause burn. My Pulsonic is looking more and more like a Brighton Beach granny in a two piece swim suit so it's time to retire her. If your beard is thick like mine, I wouldn't recommend using this electric shaver as your primary. If you take a multiple approach to your beard as I do, then, I highly recommend the Pulsonic Series 7-790cc. It's the perfect world traveler and holds a charge for weeks on end.
